000000r 1               
000000r 1               .include "../../macros.s"
000000r 2               .macro  printascii   addr
000000r 2               .local @loop
000000r 2               .local @done
000000r 2                   phx
000000r 2                   ldx #0
000000r 2               @loop:
000000r 2                   lda addr,x
000000r 2                   beq @done
000000r 2                   jsr kernel_putc
000000r 2                   inx
000000r 2                   bra @loop
000000r 2               @done:
000000r 2                   plx
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro  cp16   src, dest
000000r 2                   lda src
000000r 2                   sta dest
000000r 2                   lda src + 1
000000r 2                   sta dest + 1
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro printstr addr, len
000000r 2               .repeat len, I
000000r 2               lda addr + I
000000r 2               jsr kernel_putc
000000r 2               .endrepeat
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro asl16 src
000000r 2                   asl src
000000r 2                   rol src + 1
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro asl32 src
000000r 2                   asl src
000000r 2                   rol src + 1
000000r 2                   rol src + 2
000000r 2                   rol src + 3
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro lsr16 src
000000r 2                   lsr src + 1
000000r 2                   ror src
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro inc16 src
000000r 2               .local @done
000000r 2                   inc src       ;Increment the LSB
000000r 2                   bne @done       ;If the result was not zero we're done
000000r 2                   inc src+1       ;Increment the MSB if LSB wrapped round
000000r 2               @done:
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro inc32 src
000000r 2               .local @done
000000r 2                   inc src       ;Increment the LSB
000000r 2                   bne @done       ;If the result was not zero we're done
000000r 2                   inc src+1       ;Increment next byte if LSB wrapped round
000000r 2                   bne @done
000000r 2                   inc src+2       ;Increment the next byte the previous wrapped round
000000r 2                   bne @done
000000r 2                   inc src+3       ;Increment the MSB if previous wrapped round
000000r 2               @done:
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro dec16 src
000000r 2               .local @skip
000000r 2               .local @end
000000r 2                   lda src             ; load low byte
000000r 2                   bne @skip           ; if it's not zero, just decrement it
000000r 2                   dec src + 1         ; if low byte is zero decrement high byte
000000r 2               @skip:
000000r 2                   dec src
000000r 2               @end:
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro dec16zero src
000000r 2               .local @skip
000000r 2               .local @end
000000r 2                   lda src             ; load low byte
000000r 2                   bne @skip           ; if it's not zero, decrement it
000000r 2                   dec src + 1         ; if low byte is zero decrement high byte
000000r 2                   beq @end            ; if high byte is also zero, we reached zero, exit now
000000r 2               @skip:
000000r 2                   dec src
000000r 2                   bne @end            ; if low byte is not zero exit now
000000r 2                   lda src + 1         ; if low byte was zero, load high byte to check if it's also zero
000000r 2               @end:
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro add16 first, second, result
000000r 2                   CLC             ;Ensure carry is clear
000000r 2                   LDA first+0       ;Add the two least significant bytes
000000r 2                   ADC second+0
000000r 2                   STA result+0       ;... and store the result
000000r 2                   LDA first+1       ;Add the two most significant bytes
000000r 2                   ADC second+1       ;... and any propagated carry bit
000000r 2                   STA result+1       ;... and store the result
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               ; compare data at two adresses for defined length
000000r 2               ; On exit, carry is set if there is a match
000000r 2               ; and unset if no match
000000r 2               ; length of data to check is in X
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro memcmp first, second
000000r 2               .local @exit
000000r 2               .local @loop
000000r 2               .local @exit_fail
000000r 2               @loop:
000000r 2                   lda first, x
000000r 2                   cmp second, x
000000r 2                   bne @exit_fail
000000r 2                   dex
000000r 2                   bne @loop
000000r 2                   lda first           ; check 0th element
000000r 2                   cmp second
000000r 2                   bne @exit_fail
000000r 2                   sec
000000r 2                   bra @exit
000000r 2               @exit_fail:
000000r 2                   clc
000000r 2               @exit:
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               ; copy data from one address to another for defined length
000000r 2               ; length of data to copy is in X
000000r 2               .macro memcp first, second
000000r 2               .local @exit
000000r 2               .local @loop
000000r 2               @loop:
000000r 2                   lda first, x
000000r 2                   sta second, x
000000r 2                   dex
000000r 2                   bne @loop
000000r 2                   lda first           ; copy zeroth item
000000r 2                   sta second
000000r 2               @exit:
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               
000000r 2               ; calculates length of zero terminated string
000000r 2               ; result is in x
000000r 2               .macro strlen address
000000r 2               .local @loop
000000r 2               .local @exit
000000r 2                   ldx #0
000000r 2               @loop:
000000r 2                   lda address, x
000000r 2                   beq @exit
000000r 2                   inx
000000r 2                   bra @loop
000000r 2               @exit:
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro push_axy
000000r 2               	pha		; push accumulator to stack
000000r 2               	phx
000000r 2                   phy
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro pull_axy
000000r 2               	ply		; pull y from stack
000000r 2               	plx		; pull x from stack
000000r 2               	pla		; pull a from stack
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro push_ax
000000r 2               	pha
000000r 2               	phx
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro pull_ax
000000r 2               	pla
000000r 2               	plx
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro push_ay
000000r 2               	pha
000000r 2               	phy
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro pull_ay
000000r 2               	pla
000000r 2               	ply
000000r 2               .endmacro
000000r 2               
000000r 2               
000000r 2               .macro mov32 SRC, DEST
000000r 2               	lda SRC
000000r 2               	sta DEST
000000r 2               	lda SRC+1
000000r 2               	sta DEST+1
000000r 2               	lda SRC+2
000000r 2               	sta DEST+2
000000r 2               	lda SRC+3
000000r 2               	sta DEST+3
000000r 2               .endmacro

000006r 1               .segment "CODE"
000000r 1               .include "drivers/delayroutines.s"
000000r 2               ; Copyright 2020 Jonathan Foucher
000000r 2               
000000r 2               ; Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software

000000r 2               
000000r 2               
000000r 2               ; this routine delays by 2304 * y + 23 cycles
000000r 2               delay:
000000r 2  DA             phx       ; 3 cycles
000001r 2  5A             phy       ; 3 cycles
000002r 2               two:
000002r 2  A2 FF          ldx #$ff  ; 2 cycles
000004r 2               one:
000004r 2  EA             nop       ; 2 cycles
000005r 2  EA             nop       ; 2 cycles
000006r 2  CA             dex       ; 2 cycles
000007r 2  D0 FB          bne one   ; 3 for all cycles, 2 for last
000009r 2  88             dey       ; 2 cycles
00000Ar 2  D0 F6          bne two   ; 3 for all cycles, 2 for last
00000Cr 2  7A             ply       ; 4 cycles
00000Dr 2  FA             plx       ; 4 cycles
00000Er 2  60             rts       ; 6 cycles
00000Fr 2               
00000Fr 2               ; delay is in Y register
00000Fr 2               delay_long:
00000Fr 2  48             pha
000010r 2  5A             phy
000011r 2  DA             phx
000012r 2  98             tya
000013r 2  AA             tax
000014r 2               delay_long_loop:
000014r 2  A0 FF          ldy #$ff
000016r 2  20 rr rr       jsr delay
000019r 2  CA             dex
00001Ar 2  D0 F8          bne delay_long_loop
00001Cr 2  FA             plx
00001Dr 2  7A             ply
00001Er 2  68             pla
00001Fr 2  60             rts
000020r 2               
000020r 2               delay_short:        ; delay Y * 19 cycles
000020r 2  5A             phy
000021r 2               delay_short_loop:
000021r 2  EA             nop               ; 2 cycles
000022r 2  EA             nop               ; 2 cycles
000023r 2  EA             nop               ; 2 cycles
000024r 2  EA             nop               ; 2 cycles
000025r 2  EA             nop               ; 2 cycles
000026r 2  EA             nop               ; 2 cycles
000027r 2  EA             nop               ; 2 cycles
000028r 2               
000028r 2               
000028r 2  88             dey               ; 2 cycles
000029r 2  D0 F6          bne delay_short_loop   ; 2 or 3 cycles
00002Br 2  7A             ply
00002Cr 2  60             rts
00002Dr 2               
00002Dr 1               
00002Dr 1               
00002Dr 1               .segment "STARTUP"
000000r 1               .import    copydata
000000r 1               .import zerobss
000000r 1               v_reset:
000000r 1               
000000r 1  20 rr rr         JSR     copydata
000003r 1  20 rr rr         jsr zerobss
000006r 1               
000006r 1  4C rr rr         jmp kernel_init
000009r 1               
000009r 1               
000009r 1               
000009r 1               .segment "DATA"
000000r 1  4C rr rr     jmp kernel_init
000003r 1               
000003r 1               
000003r 1               .ifdef VIA1_BASE
000003r 1               .include "drivers/timer.s"
000003r 2               
000003r 2               
000003r 2               COUNTER = CLOCK_SPEED/400        ; n/s
000003r 2               
000003r 2               timer_init:
000003r 2  AD 8E FF         lda IER
000006r 2  09 C0            ora #$C0        ;enable interrupt on timer1 timeout
000008r 2  8D 8E FF         sta IER
00000Br 2  A9 40            lda #$40        ; timer one free run mode
00000Dr 2  8D 8B FF         sta ACR
000010r 2  A9 60            lda #<COUNTER     ; set timer to low byte to calculated value from defined clock speed
000012r 2  8D 84 FF         sta T1CL
000015r 2  A9 EA            lda #>COUNTER       ; set timer to high byte to calculated value from defined clock speed
000017r 2               
000017r 2  8D 85 FF         sta T1CH
00001Ar 2  64 rr            stz time
00001Cr 2  64 rr            stz time+1
00001Er 2  64 rr            stz time+2
000020r 2  64 rr            stz time+3
000022r 2  58               cli
000023r 2  60               rts
000024r 2               
000024r 2               
000024r 2               timer_irq:
000024r 2  E6 rr            inc time
000026r 2  F0 01            beq @inc1
000028r 2               @exit1:
000028r 2                   ; this resets the PS/2 temp variables
000028r 2                   ;jsr reset_ps2
000028r 2  60               rts
000029r 2               @inc1:
000029r 2  E6 rr            inc time+1
00002Br 2  F0 02            beq @inc2
00002Dr 2  80 F9            bra @exit1
00002Fr 2               @inc2:
00002Fr 2  E6 rr            inc time+2
000031r 2  F0 02            beq @inc3
000033r 2  80 F3            bra @exit1
000035r 2               @inc3:
000035r 2  E6 rr            inc time+3
000037r 2  80 EF            bra @exit1
000039r 2  60               rts
00003Ar 2               
00003Ar 1               .include "drivers/spi.s"
00003Ar 2               ; SPI defines
00003Ar 2               .ifndef DATA
00003Ar 2               DATA = $80
00003Ar 2               .endif
00003Ar 2               SS = $07   ; Slave Select with lowest 3 bits
00003Ar 2               SCK = $08   ; Clock on bit 3
00003Ar 2               MISO = $10  ; MISO on bit 4
00003Ar 2               MOSI = $20  ; MOSI on bit 5
00003Ar 2               CONF = $40  ; CONF on bit 6
00003Ar 2               
00003Ar 2               .segment "BSS"
000006r 2  xx           spi_tmp: .res 1
000007r 2  xx           spi_tmp2: .res 1
000008r 2  xx           spi_slave: .res 1
000009r 2               
000009r 2               .segment "DATA"
00003Ar 2               
00003Ar 2               spi_init:
00003Ar 2  AD 80 FF         lda PORTB               ; load current port B
00003Dr 2  29 90            and #(DATA | MISO)      ; set everything to zero except for PS2 DATA and MISO
00003Fr 2  09 40            ora #CONF               ; set CONF high
000041r 2  8D 80 FF         sta PORTB               ; save to PORTB
000044r 2  AD 82 FF         lda DDRB                ; get current direction register
000047r 2  09 6F            ora #(MOSI | CONF | SCK | SS) ; set MOSI, CONF, SCK and SS as outputs
000049r 2  29 EF            and #($FF^MISO)                 ; set MISO as input
00004Br 2  8D 82 FF         sta DDRB
00004Er 2  A9 FF            lda #$FF                ; flash leds to see what is going on
000050r 2  8D 83 FF         sta DDRA
000053r 2  8D 81 FF         sta PORTA
000056r 2  60               rts
000057r 2               
000057r 2               spi_select:
000057r 2                   ; selected slave in A
000057r 2  29 07            and #SS                 ; mask slave select bits
000059r 2  8D 80 FF         sta PORTB               ; set everything low except for SS bits
00005Cr 2  8D rr rr         sta spi_slave
00005Fr 2  5A               phy
000060r 2  A0 01            ldy #$1
000062r 2  20 rr rr         jsr delay_short         ; slight delay
000065r 2  09 40            ora #CONF               ; set CONF high to latch address
000067r 2  8D 80 FF         sta PORTB               ; save to PORTB
00006Ar 2  7A               ply                     ; CONF MUST stay high for the duration of the transfer
00006Br 2  60               rts
00006Cr 2               
00006Cr 2               spi_clk_toggle:
00006Cr 2  60               rts
00006Dr 2               
00006Dr 2               spi_transceive:
00006Dr 2                   ; send data in A, received data will be in A
00006Dr 2  5A               phy
00006Er 2                   ; save data in RAM
00006Er 2  8D rr rr         sta spi_tmp
000071r 2                   ; reset X
000071r 2  DA               phx
000072r 2  A2 08            ldx #8
000074r 2                   ; reset result
000074r 2  9C rr rr         stz spi_tmp2
000077r 2               spi_send_loop:
000077r 2  0E rr rr         asl spi_tmp
00007Ar 2  90 08            bcc bit_unset
00007Cr 2               bit_set:
00007Cr 2  AD 80 FF         lda PORTB
00007Fr 2  09 60            ora #(MOSI | CONF)
000081r 2  4C rr rr         jmp clock_on
000084r 2               bit_unset:
000084r 2  AD 80 FF         lda PORTB
000087r 2  29 DF            and #(($FF^MOSI) | CONF)
000089r 2               clock_on:
000089r 2                   ; set data bit
000089r 2  0D rr rr         ora spi_slave
00008Cr 2  8D 80 FF         sta PORTB
00008Fr 2               
00008Fr 2                   ; set clock on
00008Fr 2  09 48            ora #(SCK | CONF)
000091r 2  0D rr rr         ora spi_slave
000094r 2  8D 80 FF         sta PORTB
000097r 2               
000097r 2                   ; read bit from slave, maybe add slight delay here ?
000097r 2  AD 80 FF         lda PORTB
00009Ar 2  29 10            and #MISO           ; mask miso bit
00009Cr 2  D0 07            bne spi_bit_set      ; bit is set
00009Er 2                   ; bit is unset
00009Er 2  18               clc
00009Fr 2  2E rr rr         rol spi_tmp2
0000A2r 2  4C rr rr         jmp clock_off
0000A5r 2               
0000A5r 2               spi_bit_set:
0000A5r 2  38               sec
0000A6r 2  2E rr rr         rol spi_tmp2
0000A9r 2               
0000A9r 2               
0000A9r 2               clock_off:
0000A9r 2  AD 80 FF         lda PORTB
0000ACr 2  29 F7            and #(($FF^SCK) | CONF)
0000AEr 2  0D rr rr         ora spi_slave
0000B1r 2  8D 80 FF         sta PORTB
0000B4r 2               end_loop:
0000B4r 2  CA               dex
0000B5r 2  D0 C0            bne spi_send_loop
0000B7r 2                   ; set data low
0000B7r 2  A0 01            ldy #$1
0000B9r 2  20 rr rr         jsr delay_short
0000BCr 2  AD 80 FF         lda PORTB
0000BFr 2  0D rr rr         ora spi_slave
0000C2r 2  29 DF            and #(($FF^MOSI) | CONF)
0000C4r 2  8D 80 FF         sta PORTB
0000C7r 2  FA               plx
0000C8r 2  7A               ply
0000C9r 2  AD rr rr         lda spi_tmp2
0000CCr 2  60               rts
0000CDr 2               
0000CDr 1               .endif
0000CDr 1               
0000CDr 1               
0000CDr 1               .ifdef ACIA_BASE
0000CDr 1               .include "drivers/acia.s"
0000CDr 2               ACIA_DELAY = CLOCK_SPEED / 500000
0000CDr 2               
0000CDr 2               acia_init:
0000CDr 2  8D E1 FF         sta ACIA_STATUS        ; soft reset (value not important)
0000D0r 2                                           ; set specific modes and functions
0000D0r 2  9C rr rr         stz has_acia
0000D3r 2  A9 0B            lda #$0B                ; no parity, no echo, no Tx interrupt, NO Rx interrupt, enable Tx/Rx
0000D5r 2                   ;lda #$09               ; no parity, no echo, no Tx interrupt, Rx interrupt, enable Tx/Rx
0000D5r 2  8D E2 FF         sta ACIA_CMD        ; store to the command register
0000D8r 2  AD E2 FF         lda ACIA_CMD        ; load command register again
0000DBr 2  C9 0B            cmp #$0B                ; if not the same
0000DDr 2  D0 11            bne acia_absent         ; then it means the ACIA is not connected
0000DFr 2  AD E1 FF         lda ACIA_STATUS         ; Read the ACAI status to
0000E2r 2  29 60            and #$60                ; check if present or absent
0000E4r 2  D0 0A            bne acia_absent
0000E6r 2  A9 01            lda #1
0000E8r 2  8D rr rr         sta has_acia           ; remember that ACIA is here
0000EBr 2  A9 10            lda #$10               ; 1 stop bits, 8 bit word length, internal clock, 115.200k baud rate
0000EDr 2                   ;lda #$10               ; 1 stop bits, 8 bit word length, internal clock, 1200 baud rate
0000EDr 2  8D E3 FF         sta ACIA_CTRL          ; program the ctl register
0000F0r 2               
0000F0r 2               acia_absent:
0000F0r 2  A0 14                ldy #20
0000F2r 2               aa_loop:
0000F2r 2  20 rr rr             jsr delay_short
0000F5r 2  AD E1 FF             lda ACIA_STATUS         ; Read ACIA data a few times
0000F8r 2  AD E0 FF             lda ACIA_DATA           ; to try and prevent spurious characters
0000FBr 2  88                   dey
0000FCr 2  D0 F4                bne aa_loop
0000FEr 2               aa_end:
0000FEr 2  60                   rts
0000FFr 2               
0000FFr 2               acia_out:
0000FFr 2  48               pha
000100r 2  5A               phy
000101r 2  8D E0 FF         sta ACIA_DATA
000104r 2  A0 30            ldy #ACIA_DELAY            ;minimal delay is $02
000106r 2  20 rr rr         jsr delay_short
000109r 2  7A               ply
00010Ar 2  68               pla
00010Br 2  60               rts
00010Cr 2               
00010Cr 2               acia_getc:
00010Cr 2  AD E1 FF         lda ACIA_STATUS                 ; Read the ACIA status to
00010Fr 2  29 08            and #$08                        ; Check if there is character in the receiver
000111r 2  F0 05            beq @no_char      ; Exit now if we don't get one.
000113r 2  AD E0 FF         lda ACIA_DATA
000116r 2  38               sec
000117r 2  60               rts
000118r 2               @no_char:
000118r 2  18               clc
000119r 2  60               rts
00011Ar 2               
00011Ar 1               .endif
00011Ar 1               .ifdef KB_VIA_BASE
00011Ar 1               .include "drivers/keyboard.s"
00011Ar 1               .endif
00011Ar 1               .ifdef KB_INIT_STATE_RESET
00011Ar 1               .include "drivers/ps2.s"
00011Ar 1               .endif
00011Ar 1               
00011Ar 1               .ifdef LCD2_ENABLED
00011Ar 1               .include "drivers/4004.s"
00011Ar 1               .endif
00011Ar 1               .ifdef CF_ADDRESS
00011Ar 1               .include "drivers/cf.s"
00011Ar 2               .segment "BSS"
000009r 2  xx           cf_present: .res 1
00000Ar 2  xx xx xx xx  LBA_SIZE: .res 4
00000Er 2               
00000Er 2               .segment "CODE"
00002Dr 2               
00002Dr 2               cf_init:
00002Dr 2                   ; phy
00002Dr 2  AD D7 FF         lda CF_ADDRESS + 7  ; wait for RDY flag to become set
000030r 2  29 40            and #$40
000032r 2  F0 F9            beq cf_init
000034r 2  A9 04            lda #$4
000036r 2                   ; lda #$6         ; try disabling interrupts from card
000036r 2                   ; ldy #7
000036r 2                   ; sta (CF_ADDRESS),y
000036r 2  8D D7 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 7
000039r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
00003Cr 2  A9 E0            lda #$E0
00003Er 2  8D D6 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 6
000041r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
000044r 2  A9 01            lda #$1
000046r 2  8D D1 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 1
000049r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
00004Cr 2  A9 EF            lda #$EF
00004Er 2  8D D7 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 7
000051r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
000054r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_err
000057r 2               
000057r 2  A9 55            lda #$55
000059r 2  8D D3 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 3
00005Cr 2  AD D3 FF         lda CF_ADDRESS + 3
00005Fr 2  C9 55            cmp #$55
000061r 2  F0 04            beq @exit
000063r 2  9C rr rr         stz cf_present
000066r 2  60               rts
000067r 2               @exit:
000067r 2  8D rr rr         sta cf_present
00006Ar 2  60               rts
00006Br 2               
00006Br 2               
00006Br 2               
00006Br 2               
00006Br 2               cf_read:
00006Br 2  5A               phy
00006Cr 2  A0 00            ldy #0
00006Er 2               @loop:
00006Er 2  AD D0 FF         lda CF_ADDRESS
000071r 2  91 rr            sta (io_buffer_ptr), y
000073r 2  C8               iny
000074r 2  D0 F8            bne @loop
000076r 2  E6 rr            inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
000078r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
00007Br 2               @loop2:
00007Br 2  AD D0 FF         lda CF_ADDRESS
00007Er 2  91 rr            sta (io_buffer_ptr), y
000080r 2  C8               iny
000081r 2  D0 F8            bne @loop2
000083r 2  C6 rr            dec io_buffer_ptr + 1
000085r 2               @loop3:
000085r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
000088r 2  AD D7 FF         lda CF_ADDRESS + 7
00008Br 2  29 08            and #$08
00008Dr 2  F0 06            beq @exit
00008Fr 2  AD D0 FF         lda CF_ADDRESS
000092r 2  C8               iny
000093r 2  D0 F0            bne @loop3
000095r 2               @exit:
000095r 2  7A               ply
000096r 2  60               rts
000097r 2               
000097r 2               
000097r 2               ; number of sectors to read is in X
000097r 2               cf_read_sector:
000097r 2  78               sei
000098r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_set_lba
00009Br 2                   ; ldy #2
00009Br 2                   ; sta (CF_ADDRESS), y
00009Br 2  A9 01            lda #1
00009Dr 2  8D D2 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 2
0000A0r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
0000A3r 2  A9 20            lda #CF_READ_SECTOR_COMMAND
0000A5r 2                   ; ldy #7
0000A5r 2                   ; sta (CF_ADDRESS), y
0000A5r 2  8D D7 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 7
0000A8r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
0000ABr 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_read
0000AEr 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_err
0000B1r 2  58               cli
0000B2r 2  60               rts
0000B3r 2               
0000B3r 2               ; number of sectors to write is in X
0000B3r 2               cf_write_sector:
0000B3r 2                   ; sei
0000B3r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_set_lba
0000B6r 2  A9 01            lda #1
0000B8r 2                   ; ldy #2
0000B8r 2                   ; sta (CF_ADDRESS), y
0000B8r 2  8D D2 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 2
0000BBr 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
0000BEr 2  A9 30            lda #CF_WRITE_SECTOR_COMMAND
0000C0r 2                   ; ldy #7
0000C0r 2                   ; sta (CF_ADDRESS), y
0000C0r 2  8D D7 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 7
0000C3r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
0000C6r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_write
0000C9r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_err
0000CCr 2                   ; cli
0000CCr 2  60               rts
0000CDr 2               
0000CDr 2               
0000CDr 2               cf_write:
0000CDr 2  5A               phy
0000CEr 2  A0 00            ldy #0
0000D0r 2               @loop:
0000D0r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
0000D3r 2               
0000D3r 2  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
0000D5r 2  8D D0 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS
0000D8r 2  C8               iny
0000D9r 2  D0 F5            bne @loop
0000DBr 2  E6 rr            inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
0000DDr 2               @loop2:
0000DDr 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
0000E0r 2  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
0000E2r 2  8D D0 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS
0000E5r 2  C8               iny
0000E6r 2  D0 F5            bne @loop2
0000E8r 2  C6 rr            dec io_buffer_ptr + 1
0000EAr 2               @loop3:
0000EAr 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
0000EDr 2  AD D7 FF         lda CF_ADDRESS + 7
0000F0r 2  29 08            and #$08
0000F2r 2  F0 06            beq @exit
0000F4r 2  8D D0 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS
0000F7r 2  C8               iny
0000F8r 2  D0 F0            bne @loop3
0000FAr 2               @exit:
0000FAr 2  7A               ply
0000FBr 2  60               rts
0000FCr 2               
0000FCr 2               
0000FCr 2               
0000FCr 2               
0000FCr 2               
0000FCr 2               
0000FCr 2               cf_wait:
0000FCr 2               @wait_loop:
0000FCr 2  AD D7 FF         lda CF_ADDRESS + 7
0000FFr 2  30 FB            bmi @wait_loop
000101r 2  60               rts
000102r 2               
000102r 2               cf_set_lba:
000102r 2  AD rr rr         lda IO_SECTOR
000105r 2  8D D3 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 3
000108r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
00010Br 2  AD rr rr         lda IO_SECTOR + 1
00010Er 2  8D D4 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 4
000111r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
000114r 2  AD rr rr         lda IO_SECTOR + 2
000117r 2  8D D5 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 5
00011Ar 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
00011Dr 2  AD rr rr         lda IO_SECTOR + 3
000120r 2  29 0F            and #$0F
000122r 2  09 E0            ora #$E0
000124r 2  8D D6 FF         sta CF_ADDRESS + 6
000127r 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
00012Ar 2  60               rts
00012Br 2               
00012Br 2               cf_err:
00012Br 2                   ; phy
00012Br 2  20 rr rr         jsr cf_wait
00012Er 2                   ; ldy #7
00012Er 2                   ; lda (CF_ADDRESS), y
00012Er 2  AD D7 FF         lda CF_ADDRESS + 7
000131r 2  29 01            and #$01
000133r 2  F0 05            beq @exit
000135r 2               @exit_fail:
000135r 2  A9 21            lda #'!'
000137r 2  20 rr rr         jsr kernel_putc
00013Ar 2               @exit:
00013Ar 2                   ; ply
00013Ar 2  60               rts
00013Br 2               
00013Br 2               
00013Br 2  20 62 79 74  bytes_msg: .byte " bytes"
00013Fr 2  65 73        
000141r 2               cf_end:
000141r 2               
000141r 2               
000141r 1               io_read_sector_address = cf_read_sector
000141r 1               io_write_sector_address = cf_write_sector
000141r 1               .endif
000141r 1               .ifdef SD

000141r 1               .include "drivers/sd.s"
000141r 1               io_read_sector_address = sd_read_sector
000141r 1               
000141r 1               .endif
000141r 1               .include "../../utils.s"
000141r 2               ;  print a 16-bit integer
000141r 2               ; lsb in x, msb in a
000141r 2               
000141r 2               .segment "ZEROPAGE": zeropage
00000Ar 2  xx xx        util_tmp: .res 2
00000Cr 2               
00000Cr 2               .segment "BSS"
00000Er 2  xx xx        util_tmp_var: .res 2
000010r 2  xx xx xx xx  pad: .res 4
000014r 2               
000014r 2               .segment "DATA"
00011Ar 2               
00011Ar 2               print16:
00011Ar 2  8D rr rr         sta acc+1
00011Dr 2  8E rr rr         stx acc
000120r 2               
000120r 2  A2 04            ldx #4
000122r 2               nextdig:
000122r 2  20 rr rr         jsr div
000125r 2  AD rr rr         lda ext
000128r 2  9D rr rr         sta num,x
00012Br 2  CA               dex
00012Cr 2  10 F4            bpl nextdig
00012Er 2               
00012Er 2               firstdig:
00012Er 2  E8               inx
00012Fr 2  E0 05            cpx #5
000131r 2  F0 17            beq print0
000133r 2  BD rr rr         lda num,x
000136r 2  F0 F6            beq firstdig
000138r 2               
000138r 2               ptnxtdig:
000138r 2  18               clc
000139r 2  69 30            adc #'0'
00013Br 2  20 rr rr         jsr kernel_putc
00013Er 2  E8               inx
00013Fr 2  E0 05            cpx #5
000141r 2  F0 06            beq pt16done
000143r 2  BD rr rr         lda num,x
000146r 2  4C rr rr         jmp ptnxtdig
000149r 2               
000149r 2               pt16done:
000149r 2  60               rts
00014Ar 2               
00014Ar 2               print0:
00014Ar 2  A9 30            lda #'0'
00014Cr 2  20 rr rr         jsr kernel_putc
00014Fr 2  60               rts
000150r 2               
000150r 2  00 00 00 00  num: .byte 0,0,0,0,0
000154r 2  00           
000155r 2               
000155r 2               ; 16/16-bit division, from the fridge
000155r 2               ; acc/aux -> acc, remainder in ext
000155r 2               div:
000155r 2  A9 00            lda #0
000157r 2  8D rr rr         sta ext+1
00015Ar 2  A0 10            ldy #$10
00015Cr 2               dloop:
00015Cr 2  0E rr rr         asl acc
00015Fr 2  2E rr rr         rol acc+1
000162r 2  2A               rol
000163r 2  2E rr rr         rol ext+1
000166r 2  48               pha
000167r 2  CD rr rr         cmp aux
00016Ar 2  AD rr rr         lda ext+1
00016Dr 2  ED rr rr         sbc aux+1
000170r 2  90 0B            bcc div2
000172r 2  8D rr rr         sta ext+1
000175r 2  68               pla
000176r 2  ED rr rr         sbc aux
000179r 2  48               pha
00017Ar 2  EE rr rr         inc acc
00017Dr 2               div2:
00017Dr 2  68               pla
00017Er 2  88               dey
00017Fr 2  D0 DB            bne dloop
000181r 2  8D rr rr         sta ext
000184r 2  60               rts
000185r 2               
000185r 2  00 00        acc: .word 0
000187r 2  0A 00        aux: .word 10 ; constant
000189r 2  00 00        ext: .word 0
00018Br 2               
00018Br 2               
00018Br 2               
00018Br 2               calculate_free_mem:
00018Br 2                   ; load dictionary address
00018Br 2                   ; fill with $55 until ram_end
00018Br 2                   ; read and check same
00018Br 2                   ; fill again with zeroes
00018Br 2               
00018Br 2  9C rr rr         stz util_tmp_var
00018Er 2  9C rr rr         stz util_tmp_var + 1
000191r 2               
000191r 2  A0 00            ldy #0
000193r 2               @loop:
000193r 2  A9 55            lda #$55
000195r 2  91 rr            sta (util_tmp), y        ; store to mem address
000197r 2  D1 rr            cmp (util_tmp), y        ; compare to what is now there
000199r 2  D0 19            bne @exit               ; no equal, stop couting and exit
00019Br 2  A9 00            lda #0                  ; zero the memory again
00019Dr 2  91 rr            sta (util_tmp), y
00019Fr 2  EE rr rr         inc util_tmp_var
0001A2r 2  D0 03            bne @incok
0001A4r 2  EE rr rr         inc util_tmp_var + 1
0001A7r 2               @incok:
0001A7r 2  C8               iny
0001A8r 2  D0 E9            bne @loop
0001AAr 2  A5 rr            lda util_tmp + 1
0001ACr 2  C9 80            cmp #>ram_end
0001AEr 2  B0 04            bcs @exit
0001B0r 2  E6 rr            inc util_tmp + 1
0001B2r 2  80 DF            bra @loop
0001B4r 2               @exit:
0001B4r 2  60               rts
0001B5r 2               
0001B5r 2               
0001B5r 2               
0001B5r 2               print_message:
0001B5r 2  68           	pla					; get return address from stack
0001B6r 2  85 rr        	sta util_tmp
0001B8r 2  68           	pla
0001B9r 2  85 rr        	sta util_tmp + 1
0001BBr 2               
0001BBr 2  80 03        	bra @inc
0001BDr 2               @print:
0001BDr 2  20 rr rr     	jsr kernel_putc
0001C0r 2               
0001C0r 2               @inc:
0001C0r 2  E6 rr        	inc util_tmp
0001C2r 2  D0 02        	bne @inced
0001C4r 2  E6 rr        	inc util_tmp + 1
0001C6r 2               @inced:
0001C6r 2  B2 rr        	lda (util_tmp)
0001C8r 2  D0 F3        	bne @print
0001CAr 2  A5 rr        	lda util_tmp + 1
0001CCr 2  48           	pha
0001CDr 2  A5 rr        	lda util_tmp
0001CFr 2  48           	pha
0001D0r 2               print_message_end:
0001D0r 2  60           	rts
0001D1r 2               
0001D1r 2               
0001D1r 2               print_zp_index_string:
0001D1r 2               @loop:
0001D1r 2  B1 rr            lda (util_tmp), y
0001D3r 2  F0 06            beq @exit
0001D5r 2  20 rr rr         jsr kernel_putc
0001D8r 2  C8               iny
0001D9r 2  D0 F6            bne @loop
0001DBr 2               @exit:
0001DBr 2  60               rts
0001DCr 2               
0001DCr 2               
0001DCr 2               output_ascii:
0001DCr 2               ; """Convert byte in A to two ASCII hex digits and EMIT them"""
0001DCr 2  48               pha
0001DDr 2  4A               lsr             ; convert high nibble first
0001DEr 2  4A               lsr
0001DFr 2  4A               lsr
0001E0r 2  4A               lsr
0001E1r 2  20 rr rr         jsr output_ascii_nibble_to_ascii
0001E4r 2  68               pla
0001E5r 2               
0001E5r 2                   ; fall through to _nibble_to_ascii
0001E5r 2               
0001E5r 2               output_ascii_nibble_to_ascii:
0001E5r 2               ; """Private helper function for byte_to_ascii: Print lower nibble
0001E5r 2               ; of A and and EMIT it. This does the actual work.
0001E5r 2               ; """
0001E5r 2  29 0F            and #$0F
0001E7r 2  09 30            ora #'0'
0001E9r 2  C9 3A            cmp #$3A        ; '9+1
0001EBr 2  90 02            bcc @1
0001EDr 2  69 06            adc #$06
0001EFr 2               
0001EFr 2               @1:
0001EFr 2  20 rr rr         jsr kernel_putc
0001F2r 2  60               rts
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               ; .if .def(SD)
0001F3r 1               ; .include "../../fat16.s"
0001F3r 1               ; .elseif .def(CF_ADDRESS)
0001F3r 1               ; .include "../../fat16.s"
0001F3r 1               ; .endif
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               ; .include "drivers/spi.s"
0001F3r 1               ; .include "drivers/sd.s"
0001F3r 1               ; .include "drivers/vga.s"
0001F3r 1               ; .include "drivers/fat32.s"
0001F3r 1               ; .include "drivers/lcd.s"
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               ; .include "../../ed.s"
0001F3r 1               
0001F3r 1               .include "../../forth.s"
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; Definitions for Tali Forth 2
0001F3r 2               ; Scot W. Stevenson <scot.stevenson@gmail.com>
0001F3r 2               ; First version: 01. Apr 2016 (Liara Forth)
0001F3r 2               ; This version: 29. Jan 2020
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; This file is included by taliforth.asm. These are the general
0001F3r 2               ; definitions; platform-specific definitions such as the
0001F3r 2               ; memory map are kept in the platform folder.
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               stack0 =    $0100   ; location of the stack
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; User Variables:
0001F3r 2               ; Block variables
0001F3r 2               blk_offset =  0        ; BLK : UP + 0
0001F3r 2               scr_offset =  2        ; SCR : UP + 2
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; Wordlists
0001F3r 2               current_offset =  4    ; CURRENT (byte) : UP + 4 (Compilation wordlist)
0001F3r 2               num_wordlists_offset =  5
0001F3r 2                                          ; #WORDLISTS (byte) : UP + 5
0001F3r 2               wordlists_offset =  6  ; WORDLISTS (cells) : UP + 6 to UP + 29
0001F3r 2                                          ;          (FORTH, EDITOR, ASSEMBLER, ROOT, +8 more)
0001F3r 2               num_order_offset =  30 ; #ORDER (byte) : UP + 30
0001F3r 2                                          ;          (Number of wordlists in search order)
0001F3r 2               search_order_offset =  31
0001F3r 2                                          ; SEARCH-ORDER (bytes) : UP + 31 to UP + 39
0001F3r 2                                          ; Allowing for 9 to keep offsets even.
0001F3r 2               max_wordlists =  12    ; Maximum number of wordlists supported
0001F3r 2                                          ; 4 Tali built-ins + 8 user wordlists
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; Buffer variables
0001F3r 2               blkbuffer_offset =     40   ; Address of buffer
0001F3r 2               buffblocknum_offset =  42   ; Block number current in buffer
0001F3r 2               buffstatus_offset =    44   ; Status of buffer (bit 0 = used, bit 1 = dirty)
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; Block I/O vectors
0001F3r 2               blockread_offset =     46   ; Vector to block reading routine
0001F3r 2               blockwrite_offset =    48   ; Vector to block writing routine
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; ASCII CHARACTERS
0001F3r 2               AscCC =   $03  ; break (CTRL-c)
0001F3r 2               AscBELL = $07  ; bell sound
0001F3r 2               AscBS =   $08  ; backspace
0001F3r 2               AscLF =   $0a  ; line feed
0001F3r 2               AscCR =   $0d  ; carriage return
0001F3r 2               AscESC =  $1b  ; escape
0001F3r 2               AscSP =   $20  ; space
0001F3r 2               AscDEL =  $7f  ; delete (CTRL-h)
0001F3r 2               AscCP =   $10  ; CTRL-p (used to recall previous input history)
0001F3r 2               AscCN =   $0e  ; CTRL-n (used to recall next input history)
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; DICTIONARY FLAGS
0001F3r 2               ; The first three bits are currently unused
0001F3r 2               CO = 1  ; Compile Only
0001F3r 2               AN = 2  ; Always Native Compile
0001F3r 2               IM = 4  ; Immediate Word
0001F3r 2               NN = 8  ; Never Native Compile
0001F3r 2               UF = 16 ; Includes Underflow Check (RESERVED)
0001F3r 2               HC = 32 ; Word has Code Field Area (CFA)
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; VARIOUS
0001F3r 2               MAX_LINE_LENGTH =   79      ; assumes 80 character lines
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               ; END
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               .segment "ZEROPAGE": zeropage
00000Cr 2               ; ZERO PAGE ADDRESSES/VARIABLES
00000Cr 2               
00000Cr 2               ; These are kept at the top of Zero Page, with the most important variables at
00000Cr 2               ; the top because the Data Stack grows towards this area from dsp0: If there is
00000Cr 2               ; an overflow, the lower, less important variables will be clobbered first,
00000Cr 2               ; giving the system a chance to recover. In other words, they are part of the
00000Cr 2               ; floodplain.
00000Cr 2               
00000Cr 2               ; The four variables insrc, cib, ciblen, and toin must stay together in this
00000Cr 2               ; sequence for the words INPUT>R and R>INPUT to work correctly.
00000Cr 2               
00000Cr 2  xx xx        cp: .res 2   ; Compiler Pointer
00000Er 2  xx xx        dp: .res 2   ; Dictionary Pointer
000010r 2  xx xx        workword: .res 2   ; nt (not xt!) of word being compiled, except in
000012r 2                                          ; a :NONAME declared word (see status)
000012r 2  xx xx        insrc: .res 2   ; input Source for SOURCE-ID
000014r 2  xx xx        cib: .res 2   ; address of current input buffer
000016r 2  xx xx        ciblen: .res 2  ; length of current input buffer
000018r 2  xx xx        toin: .res 2  ; pointer to CIB (>IN in Forth)
00001Ar 2  xx xx        ip: .res 2  ; Instruction Pointer (current xt)
00001Cr 2  xx xx        output: .res 2  ; vector for EMIT
00001Er 2  xx xx        input: .res 2  ; vector for KEY
000020r 2  xx xx        havekey: .res 2  ; vector for KEY?
000022r 2  xx xx        state: .res 2  ; STATE: -1 compile, 0 interpret
000024r 2  xx xx        base: .res 2  ; number radix, default decimal
000026r 2  xx xx        nc_limit: .res 2  ; limit for Native Compile size
000028r 2  xx xx        uf_strip: .res 2  ; flag to strip underflow detection code
00002Ar 2  xx xx        up: .res 2  ; User Pointer (Address of user variables)
00002Cr 2  xx xx        status: .res 2  ; internal status information
00002Er 2                                          ; (used by : :NONAME ; ACCEPT)
00002Er 2                                          ; Bit 7 = Redefined word message postpone
00002Er 2                                          ;         When set before calling CREATE, it will
00002Er 2                                          ;         not print the "redefined xxxx" message if
00002Er 2                                          ;         the word exists. Instead, this bit will
00002Er 2                                          ;         be reused and after CREATE has run, it will
00002Er 2                                          ;         be set if the word was redefined and 0 if
00002Er 2                                          ;         not. This bit should be 0 when not in use.
00002Er 2                                          ; Bit 6 = 1 for normal ":" definitions
00002Er 2                                          ;         WORKWORD contains nt of word being compiled
00002Er 2                                          ;       = 0 for :NONAME definitions
00002Er 2                                          ;         WORKWORD contains xt of word being compiled
00002Er 2                                          ; Bit 5 = 1 for NUMBER returning a double word
00002Er 2                                          ;       = 0 for NUMBER returning a single word
00002Er 2                                          ; Bit 3 = 1 makes CTRL-n recall current history
00002Er 2                                          ;       = 0 CTRL-n recalls previous history
00002Er 2                                          ; Bit 2 = Current history buffer msb
00002Er 2                                          ; Bit 1 = Current history buffer (0-7, wraps)
00002Er 2                                          ; Bit 0 = Current history buffer lsb
00002Er 2                                          ; status+1 is used by ACCEPT to hold history lengths.
00002Er 2  xx xx        tmpbranch: .res 2  ; temporary storage for 0BRANCH, BRANCH only
000030r 2  xx xx        tmp1: .res 2  ; temporary storage
000032r 2  xx xx        tmp2: .res 2  ; temporary storage
000034r 2  xx xx        tmp3: .res 2  ; temporary storage (especially for print)
000036r 2  xx xx        tmpdsp: .res 2  ; temporary DSP (X) storage (two bytes)
000038r 2  xx xx        tmptos: .res 2  ; temporary TOS storage
00003Ar 2  xx xx        editor1: .res 2  ; temporary for editors
00003Cr 2  xx xx        editor2: .res 2  ; temporary for editors
00003Er 2  xx xx        editor3: .res 2  ; temporary for editors
000040r 2  xx xx        tohold: .res 2  ; pointer for formatted output
000042r 2  xx xx xx xx  scratch: .res 8  ; 8 byte scratchpad (see UM/MOD)
000046r 2  xx xx xx xx  
00004Ar 2               
00004Ar 2               .segment "DATASTACK": zeropage
000000r 2  xx xx xx xx  dsp_start: .res 127 ; reserve 128 bytes for data stack (64 16 bit cells)
000004r 2  xx xx xx xx  
000008r 2  xx xx xx xx  
00007Fr 2               dsp0:          ; first data stack location. Data stack grows down
00007Fr 2               rsp0:     ; starting stack pointer
00007Fr 2               
00007Fr 2               
00007Fr 2               
00007Fr 2               
00007Fr 2               .segment "BSS"
000014r 2  xx xx xx xx  hist_buff: .res $400
000018r 2  xx xx xx xx  
00001Cr 2  xx xx xx xx  
000414r 2  xx xx xx xx  buffer0: .res $100
000418r 2  xx xx xx xx  
00041Cr 2  xx xx xx xx  
000514r 2               
000514r 2               .segment "DICTIONARY"   ; the dictionary gets its own segment so that it uses all the space left in RAM
000000r 2  xx xx xx xx  dictionary: .res $1000
000004r 2  xx xx xx xx  
000008r 2  xx xx xx xx  
001000r 2               
001000r 2               cp_end = $7FFF          ; the dictionary ends at RAM end (everything else is before)
001000r 2               
001000r 2               cp0 = dictionary
001000r 2               bsize =     $ff
001000r 2               padoffset = $ff
001000r 2               
001000r 2               
001000r 2               
001000r 2               .segment "DATA"
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               
0001F3r 2               forth:
0001F3r 2                   .include "native_words.s"     ; Native Forth words. Starts with COLD
0001F3r 3               ; Low-level Forth word routines
0001F3r 3               ; Tali Forth 2 for the 65c02
0001F3r 3               ; Scot W. Stevenson <scot.stevenson@gmail.com>
0001F3r 3               ; First version: 19. Jan 2014
0001F3r 3               ; This version: 03. Jan 2018
0001F3r 3               
0001F3r 3               ; This list is ordered alphabetically by the names of the words, not their
0001F3r 3               ; strings (so "!" is sorted as "STORE"). However, we start off with COLD,
0001F3r 3               ; ABORT, and QUIT as the natural start sequence. Each word has two special
0001F3r 3               ; status lines that begins with "; ## ", which allows auto-generation of the
0001F3r 3               ; WORDLIST.md file and other entries in the docs folder. Status entries are:
0001F3r 3               
0001F3r 3               ;       TBA --> fragment --> coded --> tested --> auto
0001F3r 3               
0001F3r 3               ; "Auto" means that the word is automatically tested by the test suite (good),
0001F3r 3               ; "tested" means that it was tested by hand in some way (okay), "coded" means
0001F3r 3               ; it hasn't been tested at all (bad). See the test suite for more details.
0001F3r 3               
0001F3r 3               ; ## COLD ( -- ) "Reset the Forth system"
0001F3r 3               ; ## "cold"  tested  Tali Forth
0001F3r 3               ;       """Reset the Forth system. Does not restart the kernel,
0001F3r 3               ;       use the 65c02 reset for that. Flows into ABORT.
0001F3r 3               ;       """
0001F3r 3               xt_cold:
0001F3r 3  D8                           cld
0001F4r 3               
0001F4r 3                               ; Set the OUTPUT vector to the default kernel_putc
0001F4r 3                               ; We do this really early so we can print error messages
0001F4r 3                               ; during debugging
0001F4r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<kernel_putc
0001F6r 3  85 rr                        sta output
0001F8r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>kernel_putc
0001FAr 3  85 rr                        sta output+1
0001FCr 3               
0001FCr 3                               ; Load all of the important zero page variables from ROM
0001FCr 3  A2 21                        ldx #cold_zp_table_end-cold_zp_table-1
0001FEr 3               
0001FEr 3               @load_zp_loop:
0001FEr 3                               ; This loop loads them back to front. We can use X here
0001FEr 3                               ; because Tali hasn't started using the stack yet.
0001FEr 3  BD rr rr                     lda cold_zp_table,x
000201r 3  95 rr                        sta cp,x
000203r 3  CA                           dex
000204r 3  D0 F8                        bne @load_zp_loop
000206r 3               
000206r 3                               ; Copy the 0th element.
000206r 3  AD rr rr                     lda cold_zp_table
000209r 3  85 rr                        sta cp
00020Br 3                               ; Initialize 65c02 stack (Return Stack)
00020Br 3  A2 rr                        ldx #rsp0
00020Dr 3  9A                           txs
00020Er 3               
00020Er 3                               ; Clear Data Stack. This is repeated in ABORT, but this way we
00020Er 3                               ; can load high-level words with EVALUATE
00020Er 3  A2 rr                        ldx #dsp0
000210r 3               
000210r 3               
000210r 3                               ; Initialize the user variables.
000210r 3  A0 31                        ldy #cold_user_table_end-cold_user_table-1
000212r 3  A9 00                        lda #0
000214r 3               
000214r 3               @load_user_vars_loop:
000214r 3                               ; Like the zero page variables, these are initialized
000214r 3                               ; back to front.
000214r 3  B9 rr rr                     lda cold_user_table,y
000217r 3  91 rr                        sta (up),y
000219r 3  88                           dey
00021Ar 3  D0 F8                        bne @load_user_vars_loop
00021Cr 3               
00021Cr 3                               ; Copy the 0th element.
00021Cr 3  AD rr rr                     lda cold_user_table
00021Fr 3  92 rr                        sta (up)
000221r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
000224r 3               
000224r 3                               ; Define high-level words in forth_words.asm via EVALUATE. If
000224r 3                               ; you do not have any high-level words, this part can be
000224r 3                               ; commented out.
000224r 3  CA                           dex
000225r 3  CA                           dex
000226r 3  CA                           dex
000227r 3  CA                           dex
000228r 3               
000228r 3               
000228r 3                               ; start address goes NOS
000228r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<forth_words_start
00022Ar 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
00022Cr 3  A9 rr                        lda #>forth_words_start
00022Er 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
000230r 3               
000230r 3                               ; length goes TOS
000230r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<forth_words_end
000232r 3  38                           sec
000233r 3  E9 rr                        sbc #<forth_words_start
000235r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000237r 3               
000237r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>forth_words_end
000239r 3  E9 rr                        sbc #>forth_words_start
00023Br 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00023Dr 3               
00023Dr 3               
00023Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_evaluate
000240r 3               
000240r 3                               ; Now define any user words via EVALUATE. If you do not have
000240r 3                               ; any user-defined words, this part can be commented out as
000240r 3                               ; well.
000240r 3  CA                           dex
000241r 3  CA                           dex
000242r 3  CA                           dex
000243r 3  CA                           dex
000244r 3               
000244r 3               
000244r 3                               ; start address goes NOS
000244r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<user_words_start
000246r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
000248r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>user_words_start
00024Ar 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
00024Cr 3               
00024Cr 3                               ; length goes TOS
00024Cr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<user_words_end
00024Er 3  38                           sec
00024Fr 3  E9 rr                        sbc #<user_words_start
000251r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000253r 3               
000253r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>user_words_end
000255r 3  E9 rr                        sbc #>user_words_start
000257r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
000259r 3               
000259r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_evaluate
00025Cr 3               
00025Cr 3                               ; Initialize all of the history buffers by putting a zero in
00025Cr 3                               ; each length byte.
00025Cr 3  9C rr rr                     stz hist_buff
00025Fr 3  9C rr rr                     stz hist_buff+$80
000262r 3  9C rr rr                     stz hist_buff+$100
000265r 3  9C rr rr                     stz hist_buff+$180
000268r 3  9C rr rr                     stz hist_buff+$200
00026Br 3  9C rr rr                     stz hist_buff+$280
00026Er 3  9C rr rr                     stz hist_buff+$300
000271r 3  9C rr rr                     stz hist_buff+$380
000274r 3               
000274r 3               
000274r 3                               ; fall through to ABORT
000274r 3               
000274r 3               
000274r 3               ; ## ABORT ( -- ) "Reset the Data Stack and restart the CLI"
000274r 3               ; ## "abort"  tested  ANS core
000274r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/ABORT
000274r 3                       ; Clear Data Stack and continue into QUIT. We can jump here via
000274r 3                       ; subroutine if we want to because we are going to reset the 65c02's
000274r 3                       ; stack pointer (the Return Stack) anyway during QUIT. Note we don't
000274r 3                       ; actually delete the stuff on the Data Stack.
000274r 3                       ; """
000274r 3               xt_abort:
000274r 3  A2 rr                        ldx #dsp0
000276r 3               
000276r 3                               ; fall through to QUIT
000276r 3               
000276r 3               
000276r 3               ; ## QUIT ( -- ) "Reset the input and get new input"
000276r 3               ; ## "quit"  tested  ANS core
000276r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/QUIT
000276r 3                       ; Rest the input and start command loop
000276r 3                       ; """
000276r 3               
000276r 3               xt_quit:
000276r 3                               ; Clear the Return Stack. This is a little screwed up
000276r 3                               ; because the 65c02 can only set the Return Stack via X,
000276r 3                               ; which is our Data Stack pointer. The ANS specification
000276r 3                               ; demands, however, that ABORT reset the Data Stack pointer
000276r 3  8A                           txa             ; Save the DSP that we just defined
000277r 3  A2 rr                        ldx #rsp0
000279r 3  9A                           txs
00027Ar 3  AA                           tax             ; Restore the DSP. Dude, seriously.
00027Br 3               
00027Br 3                               ; make sure instruction pointer is empty
00027Br 3  64 rr                        stz ip
00027Dr 3  64 rr                        stz ip+1
00027Fr 3               
00027Fr 3                               ; SOURCE-ID is zero (keyboard input)
00027Fr 3  64 rr                        stz insrc
000281r 3  64 rr                        stz insrc+1
000283r 3               
000283r 3                               ; STATE is zero (interpret, not compile)
000283r 3  64 rr                        stz state
000285r 3  64 rr                        stz state+1
000287r 3               @get_line:
000287r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<buffer0   ; input buffer, this is paranoid
000289r 3  85 rr                        sta cib
00028Br 3  A9 rr                        lda #>buffer0
00028Dr 3  85 rr                        sta cib+1
00028Fr 3               
00028Fr 3                               ; Size of current input buffer (CIB) is zero
00028Fr 3  64 rr                        stz ciblen
000291r 3  64 rr                        stz ciblen+1
000293r 3               
000293r 3                               ; Accept a line from the current import source. This is how
000293r 3                               ; modern Forths to it.
000293r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_refill           ; ( -- f )
000296r 3               
000296r 3                               ; Test flag: LSB of TOS
000296r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000298r 3  D0 05                        bne @success
00029Ar 3               
00029Ar 3                               ; If REFILL returned a FALSE flag, something went wrong and we
00029Ar 3                               ; need to print an error message and reset the machine. We
00029Ar 3                               ; don't need to save TOS because we're going to clobber it
00029Ar 3                               ; anyway when we go back to ABORT.
00029Ar 3  A9 06                        lda #err_refill
00029Cr 3  4C rr rr                     jmp error
00029Fr 3               
00029Fr 3               @success:
00029Fr 3                               ; Assume we have successfully accepted a string of input from
00029Fr 3                               ; a source, with address cib and length of input in ciblen. We
00029Fr 3                               ; arrive here still with the TRUE flag from REFILL as TOS
00029Fr 3  E8                           inx                     ; drop
0002A0r 3  E8                           inx
0002A1r 3               
0002A1r 3                               ; Main compile/execute routine
0002A1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr interpret
0002A4r 3               
0002A4r 3                               ; Test for Data Stack underflow. Tali Forth does not check for
0002A4r 3                               ; overflow because it is so rare
0002A4r 3  E0 rr                        cpx #dsp0
0002A6r 3  F0 05                        beq @stack_ok
0002A8r 3  90 03                        bcc @stack_ok           ; DSP must always be smaller than DSP0
0002AAr 3               
0002AAr 3  4C rr rr                     jmp underflow_error
0002ADr 3               
0002ADr 3               @stack_ok:
0002ADr 3                               ; Display system prompt if all went well. If we're interpreting,
0002ADr 3                               ; this is " ok", if we're compiling, it's " compiled". Note
0002ADr 3                               ; space at beginning of the string.
0002ADr 3  A5 rr                        lda state
0002AFr 3  F0 02                        beq @print
0002B1r 3               
0002B1r 3  A9 01                        lda #1                  ; number for "compile" string
0002B3r 3               @print:
0002B3r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string
0002B6r 3               
0002B6r 3                               ; Awesome line, everybody! Now get the next one.
0002B6r 3  80 CF                        bra @get_line
0002B8r 3               
0002B8r 3               z_cold:
0002B8r 3               z_abort:
0002B8r 3               z_quit:         ; no RTS required
0002B8r 3               
0002B8r 3               
0002B8r 3               
0002B8r 3               ; This table holds all of the initial values for the variables in zero page.
0002B8r 3               ; This table is used by COLD.
0002B8r 3               cold_zp_table:
0002B8r 3  rr rr                .word cp0+256+1024      ; cp moved to make room for user vars and
0002BAr 3                                               ; block buffer
0002BAr 3  rr rr                .word dictionary_start  ; dp
0002BCr 3  00 00                .word 0                 ; workword
0002BEr 3  00 00                .word 0                 ; insrc (SOURCE-ID is 0 for keyboard)
0002C0r 3  rr rr                .word buffer0           ; cib
0002C2r 3  00 00                .word 0                 ; ciblen
0002C4r 3  00 00                .word 0                 ; toin
0002C6r 3  00 00                .word 0                 ; ip
0002C8r 3  rr rr                .word kernel_putc       ; output
0002CAr 3  rr rr                .word kernel_getc       ; input
0002CCr 3  00 00                .word 0                 ; havekey
0002CEr 3  00 00                .word 0                 ; state (0 = interpret)
0002D0r 3  0A 00                .word 10                ; base
0002D2r 3  14 00                .word 20                ; nc-limit
0002D4r 3  00 00                .word 0                 ; uf_strip (off by default)
0002D6r 3  rr rr                .word cp0               ; up (user vars put right at beginning of
0002D8r 3                                               ; available RAM)
0002D8r 3  00 00                .word 0                 ; status
0002DAr 3               cold_zp_table_end:
0002DAr 3               
0002DAr 3               ; No further ZP variables are initialized. The variables past this point are
0002DAr 3               ; all temporaries.
0002DAr 3               
0002DAr 3               ; This table holds the inital values for the user variables. This table is
0002DAr 3               ; used by COLD.
0002DAr 3               cold_user_table:
0002DAr 3  00 00                .word 0                         ; BLK
0002DCr 3  00 00                .word 0                         ; SCR
0002DEr 3  00                   .byte 0                         ; CURRENT = FORTH-WORDLIST
0002DFr 3  04                   .byte 4                         ; #WORDLISTS (FORTH EDITOR ASSEMBLER ROOT)
0002E0r 3  rr rr                .word dictionary_start          ; FORTH-WORDLIST
0002E2r 3  rr rr                .word editor_dictionary_start   ; EDITOR-WORDLIST
0002E4r 3               .ifdef TALI_OPTIONAL_ASSEMBLER
0002E4r 3  rr rr                .word assembler_dictionary_start ; ASSEMBLER-WORDLIST
0002E6r 3               .else
0002E6r 3                       .word 0
0002E6r 3               .endif
0002E6r 3  rr rr                .word root_dictionary_start     ; ROOT-WORDLIST
0002E8r 3  00 00 00 00          .word 0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0           ; User wordlists
0002ECr 3  00 00 00 00  
0002F0r 3  00 00 00 00  
0002F8r 3  01                   .byte 1                         ; #ORDER
0002F9r 3  00 00 00 00          .byte 0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0         ; search-order
0002FDr 3  00 00 00 00  
000301r 3  00           
000302r 3  rr rr                .word cp0+256                   ; Address of buffer (right after USER vars)
000304r 3  00 00                .word 0                         ; block in buffer
000306r 3  00 00                .word 0                         ; buffer status (not in use)
000308r 3  rr rr                .word xt_block_word_error       ; block-read vector
00030Ar 3  rr rr                .word xt_block_word_error       ; block-write vector
00030Cr 3               cold_user_table_end:
00030Cr 3               
00030Cr 3               
00030Cr 3               ; ## ABORT_QUOTE ( "string" -- ) "If flag TOS is true, ABORT with message"
00030Cr 3               ; ## "abort""  tested  ANS core
00030Cr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/ABORTq
00030Cr 3                       ; Abort and print a string.
00030Cr 3                       ; """
00030Cr 3               
00030Cr 3               xt_abort_quote:
00030Cr 3                               ; save the string
00030Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_s_quote          ; S"
00030Fr 3               
00030Fr 3                               ; compile run-time part
00030Fr 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>abort_quote_runtime
000311r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<abort_quote_runtime
000313r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine     ; may not be JMP as JSR/RTS
000316r 3               
000316r 3  60           z_abort_quote:  rts
000317r 3               
000317r 3               
000317r 3               abort_quote_runtime:
000317r 3                       ; """Runtime aspect of ABORT_QUOTE"""
000317r 3               
000317r 3                               ; We arrive here with ( f addr u )
000317r 3  B5 04                        lda 4,x
000319r 3  15 05                        ora 5,x
00031Br 3  F0 09                        beq @done       ; if FALSE, we're done
00031Dr 3               
00031Dr 3                               ; We're true, so print string and ABORT. We follow Gforth
00031Dr 3                               ; in going to a new line after the string
00031Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
000320r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
000323r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp xt_abort    ; not JSR, so never come back
000326r 3               @done:
000326r 3                               ; Drop three entries from the Data Stack
000326r 3  8A                           txa
000327r 3  18                           clc
000328r 3  69 06                        adc #6
00032Ar 3  AA                           tax
00032Br 3               
00032Br 3  60                           rts
00032Cr 3               
00032Cr 3               
00032Cr 3               
00032Cr 3               ; ## ABS ( n -- u ) "Return absolute value of a number"
00032Cr 3               ; ## "abs"  auto  ANS core
00032Cr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/ABS
00032Cr 3                       ; Return the absolute value of a number.
00032Cr 3                       ; """
00032Cr 3               
00032Cr 3               xt_abs:
00032Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
00032Fr 3               
00032Fr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
000331r 3  10 0D                        bpl @done       ; positive number, easy money!
000333r 3               
000333r 3                               ; negative: calculate 0 - n
000333r 3  38                           sec
000334r 3  A9 00                        lda #0
000336r 3  F5 00                        sbc 0,x         ; LSB
000338r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00033Ar 3               
00033Ar 3  A9 00                        lda #0          ; MSB
00033Cr 3  F5 01                        sbc 1,x
00033Er 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
000340r 3               
000340r 3               @done:
000340r 3  60           z_abs:          rts
000341r 3               
000341r 3               
000341r 3               
000341r 3               ; ## ACCEPT ( addr n -- n ) "Receive a string of characters from the keyboard"
000341r 3               ; ## "accept"  auto  ANS core
000341r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/ACCEPT
000341r 3                       ; Receive a string of at most n1 characters, placing them at
000341r 3                       ; addr. Return the actual number of characters as n2. Characters
000341r 3                       ; are echoed as they are received. ACCEPT is called by REFILL in
000341r 3                       ; modern Forths.
000341r 3                       ; """
000341r 3               
000341r 3               xt_accept:
000341r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
000344r 3               
000344r 3                               ; Abort if we were asked to receive 0 chars
000344r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000346r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
000348r 3  D0 09                        bne @not_zero
00034Ar 3               
00034Ar 3  E8                           inx
00034Br 3  E8                           inx
00034Cr 3  74 00                        stz 0,x
00034Er 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
000350r 3               
000350r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp accept_done
000353r 3               
000353r 3               @not_zero:
000353r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; number of chars to get in tmp2 ...
000355r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2
000357r 3  64 rr                        stz tmp2+1      ; ... but we only accept max 255 chars
000359r 3               
000359r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; address of buffer is NOS, to tmp1
00035Br 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
00035Dr 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
00035Fr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
000361r 3               
000361r 3  E8                           inx
000362r 3  E8                           inx
000363r 3               
000363r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
000365r 3               
000365r 3                               ; Select the next history buffer. Clear bit 3 first (so overflow
000365r 3                               ; from bit 2 to 3 is OK)
000365r 3  A5 rr                        lda status
000367r 3  29 F7                        and #$f7
000369r 3               
000369r 3                               ; Increment the buffer number (overflow from 7 to 0 OK)
000369r 3  1A                           inc
00036Ar 3               
00036Ar 3                               ; Set bit 3 for detecting if CTRL-n has been pressed the first
00036Ar 3                               ; time. This bit will be cleared on the first CTRL-n or CTRL-p
00036Ar 3                               ; received and won't be used to calculate the history buffer
00036Ar 3                               ; offset.
00036Ar 3  09 08                        ora #$08
00036Cr 3  85 rr                        sta status
00036Er 3               
00036Er 3               accept_loop:
00036Er 3                               ; Out of the box, py65mon catches some CTRL sequences such as
00036Er 3                               ; CTRL-c. We also don't need to check for CTRL-l because a
00036Er 3                               ; vt100 terminal clears the screen automatically.
00036Er 3               
00036Er 3                               ; This is the internal version of KEY without all the mucking
00036Er 3                               ; about with the Data Stack while still using the input vector
00036Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr key_a
000371r 3               
000371r 3                               ; We quit on both line feed and carriage return
000371r 3  C9 0A                        cmp #AscLF
000373r 3  F0 20                        beq @eol
000375r 3  C9 0D                        cmp #AscCR
000377r 3  F0 1C                        beq @eol
000379r 3               
000379r 3                               ; BACKSPACE and DEL do the same thing for the moment
000379r 3  C9 08                        cmp #AscBS
00037Br 3  F0 22                        beq @backspace
00037Dr 3  C9 7F                        cmp #AscDEL     ; (CTRL-h)
00037Fr 3  F0 1E                        beq @backspace
000381r 3               
000381r 3                               ; Check for CTRL-p and CTRL-n to recall input history
000381r 3  C9 10                        cmp #AscCP
000383r 3  F0 36                        beq @ctrl_p
000385r 3  C9 0E                        cmp #AscCN
000387r 3  F0 44                        beq @ctrl_n
000389r 3               
000389r 3                               ; That's enough for now. Save and echo character.
000389r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
00038Br 3  C8                           iny
00038Cr 3               
00038Cr 3                               ; EMIT_A sidesteps all the fooling around with the Data Stack
00038Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
00038Fr 3               
00038Fr 3  C4 rr                        cpy tmp2        ; reached character limit?
000391r 3  D0 DB                        bne accept_loop       ; fall through if buffer limit reached
000393r 3  80 03                        bra @buffer_full
000395r 3               
000395r 3               @eol:
000395r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space    ; print final space
000398r 3               
000398r 3               @buffer_full:
000398r 3                               ; REFILL updates ciblen and toin, we don't need to do it here
000398r 3  94 00                        sty 0,x         ; Y contains number of chars accepted already
00039Ar 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; we only accept 256 chars
00039Cr 3               
00039Cr 3  4C rr rr                     jmp accept_done
00039Fr 3               
00039Fr 3               @backspace:
00039Fr 3                               ; Handle backspace and delete kex, which currently do the same
00039Fr 3                               ; thing
00039Fr 3  C0 00                        cpy #0          ; buffer empty?
0003A1r 3  D0 06                        bne @1
0003A3r 3               
0003A3r 3  A9 07                        lda #AscBELL    ; complain and don't delete beyond the start of line
0003A5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0003A8r 3  C8                           iny
0003A9r 3               @1:
0003A9r 3  88                           dey
0003AAr 3  A9 08                        lda #AscBS      ; move back one
0003ACr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0003AFr 3  A9 20                        lda #AscSP      ; print a space (rubout)
0003B1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0003B4r 3  A9 08                        lda #AscBS      ; move back over space
0003B6r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0003B9r 3               
0003B9r 3  80 B3                        bra accept_loop
0003BBr 3               
0003BBr 3               @ctrl_p:
0003BBr 3                               ; CTRL-p was pressed. Recall the previous input buffer.
0003BBr 3               
0003BBr 3                               ; Select the previous buffer
0003BBr 3  A5 rr                        lda status
0003BDr 3               
0003BDr 3                               ; Check for 0 (need to wrap back to 7)
0003BDr 3  29 07                        and #7
0003BFr 3  D0 08                        bne @ctrl_p_dec
0003C1r 3               
0003C1r 3                               ; We need to wrap back to 7.
0003C1r 3  A5 rr                        lda status
0003C3r 3  09 07                        ora #7
0003C5r 3  85 rr                        sta status
0003C7r 3  80 11                        bra @recall_history
0003C9r 3               
0003C9r 3               @ctrl_p_dec:
0003C9r 3                               ; It's safe to decrement the buffer index directly.
0003C9r 3  C6 rr                        dec status
0003CBr 3  80 0D                        bra @recall_history
0003CDr 3               
0003CDr 3               @ctrl_n:
0003CDr 3                               ; CTRL-n was pressed. Recall the next input buffer. Select
0003CDr 3                               ; the next buffer Check bit 3. If it's set, this is the first
0003CDr 3                               ; time CTRL-n has been pressed and we should select the CURRENT
0003CDr 3                               ; history buffer.
0003CDr 3  A9 08                        lda #$8
0003CFr 3  24 rr                        bit status
0003D1r 3  D0 07                        bne @recall_history
0003D3r 3               
0003D3r 3                               ; This isn't the first time CTRL-n has been pressed, select the
0003D3r 3                               ; next history buffer. Clear bit 3 first (so overflow is OK)
0003D3r 3  A5 rr                        lda status
0003D5r 3  29 F7                        and #$f7
0003D7r 3               
0003D7r 3                               ; Increment the buffer number (overflow from 7 to 0 OK)
0003D7r 3  1A                           inc
0003D8r 3               
0003D8r 3                               ; Bit 3 (if it got set by going from buffer 7 to 0) will
0003D8r 3                               ; be cleared below.
0003D8r 3  85 rr                        sta status
0003DAr 3               
0003DAr 3                               ; Falls through to @recall_history
0003DAr 3               
0003DAr 3               @recall_history:
0003DAr 3                               ; Clear bit 3 (first time ctrl-n recall) bit in status
0003DAr 3  A9 08                        lda #%00001000
0003DCr 3  14 rr                        trb status
0003DEr 3               
0003DEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr total_recall
0003E1r 3               
0003E1r 3                               ; tmp3 now has the address of the previous history buffer.
0003E1r 3                               ; First byte of buffer is length. Clear the line by sending
0003E1r 3                               ; CR, Y spaces, then CR.
0003E1r 3  A9 0D                        lda #AscCR
0003E3r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0003E6r 3               
0003E6r 3               input_clear:
0003E6r 3  C0 00                        cpy #0
0003E8r 3  F0 08                        beq input_cleared
0003EAr 3               
0003EAr 3  A9 20                        lda #AscSP
0003ECr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0003EFr 3  88                           dey
0003F0r 3  80 F4                        bra input_clear
0003F2r 3               
0003F2r 3               input_cleared:
0003F2r 3  A9 0D                        lda #AscCR
0003F4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0003F7r 3               
0003F7r 3                               ; Save the history length byte into histinfo+1
