0009B6r 3               @less:
0009B6r 3                               ; Return -1
0009B6r 3  A9 FF                        lda #$FF
0009B8r 3  95 06                        sta 6,x
0009BAr 3  95 07                        sta 7,x
0009BCr 3  80 0C                        bra @done
0009BEr 3               @equal:
0009BEr 3                               ; Return 0
0009BEr 3  74 06                        stz 6,x
0009C0r 3  74 07                        stz 7,x
0009C2r 3  80 06                        bra @done
0009C4r 3               @greater:
0009C4r 3                               ; Return 1
0009C4r 3  A9 01                        lda #1
0009C6r 3  95 06                        sta 6,x
0009C8r 3  74 07                        stz 7,x
0009CAr 3                               ; Falls into @done
0009CAr 3               @done:
0009CAr 3                               ; Remove all but the result from the stack.
0009CAr 3  8A                           txa
0009CBr 3  18                           clc
0009CCr 3  69 06                        adc #6
0009CEr 3  AA                           tax
0009CFr 3               
0009CFr 3  60           z_compare:      rts
0009D0r 3               
0009D0r 3               
0009D0r 3               
0009D0r 3               ; ## COMPILE_COMMA ( xt -- ) "Compile xt"
0009D0r 3               ; ## "compile,"  auto  ANS core ext
0009D0r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/COMPILEComma
0009D0r 3                       ; Compile the given xt in the current word definition. It is an
0009D0r 3                       ; error if we are not in the compile state. Because we are using
0009D0r 3                       ; subroutine threading, we can't use , (COMMA) to compile new words
0009D0r 3                       ; the traditional way. By default, native compiled is allowed, unless
0009D0r 3                       ; there is a NN (Never Native) flag associated. If not, we use the
0009D0r 3                       ; value NC_LIMIT (from definitions.tasm) to decide if the code
0009D0r 3                       ; is too large to be natively coded: If the size is larger than
0009D0r 3                       ; NC_LIMIT, we silently use subroutine coding. If the AN (Always
0009D0r 3                       ; Native) flag is set, the word is always natively compiled.
0009D0r 3                       ; """
0009D0r 3               
0009D0r 3               xt_compile_comma:
0009D0r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0009D3r 3               
0009D3r 3                               ; See if this is an Always Native (AN) word by checking the
0009D3r 3                               ; AN flag. We need nt for this. First, save a copy of xt to
0009D3r 3                               ; the Return Stack
0009D3r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x                 ; MSB
0009D5r 3  48                           pha
0009D6r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0009D8r 3  48                           pha                     ; LSB
0009D9r 3               
0009D9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_int_to_name      ; ( xt -- nt )
0009DCr 3               
0009DCr 3                               ; See if this xt even has an nt.
0009DCr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0009DEr 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
0009E0r 3  D0 03                        bne @check_nt
0009E2r 3               
0009E2r 3                               ; No nt in dictionary. Just compile as a JSR.
0009E2r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp @compile_as_jump
0009E5r 3               
0009E5r 3               @check_nt:
0009E5r 3                               ; put nt away for safe keeping
0009E5r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0009E7r 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos
0009E9r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
0009EBr 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos+1
0009EDr 3               
0009EDr 3                               ; status byte is one further down
0009EDr 3  F6 00                        inc 0,x
0009EFr 3  D0 02                        bne @1
0009F1r 3  F6 01                        inc 1,x                 ; ( nt -- nt+1 )
0009F3r 3               @1:
0009F3r 3  A1 00                        lda (0,x)
0009F5r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3                ; keep copy of status byte for NN
0009F7r 3  29 02                        and #AN                 ; mask all but Always Native (AN) bit
0009F9r 3  F0 0D                        beq @compile_check
0009FBr 3               
0009FBr 3                               ; We're natively compiling no matter what. Get length and
0009FBr 3                               ; compile in code. Get the original nt back
0009FBr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmptos
0009FDr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0009FFr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmptos+1
000A01r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
000A03r 3               
000A03r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_wordsize         ; ( nt -- u )
000A06r 3               
000A06r 3  80 27                        bra @compile_as_code
000A08r 3               
000A08r 3               @compile_check:
000A08r 3                               ; See if Native Compile is even alowed by checking the NN
000A08r 3                               ; flag
000A08r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp3
000A0Ar 3  29 08                        and #NN
000A0Cr 3  F0 03                        beq @check_size_limit
000A0Er 3               
000A0Er 3  4C rr rr                     jmp @compile_as_jump    ; too far for BRA
000A11r 3               
000A11r 3               @check_size_limit:
000A11r 3                               ; Native compile is a legal option, but we need to see what
000A11r 3                               ; limit the user set for size (in nc_limit)
000A11r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmptos
000A13r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000A15r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmptos+1
000A17r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
000A19r 3               
000A19r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_wordsize         ; ( nt -- u )
000A1Cr 3               
000A1Cr 3                               ; Check the wordsize MSB against the user-defined limit.
000A1Cr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
000A1Er 3  C5 rr                        cmp nc_limit+1
000A20r 3  90 0D                        bcc @compile_as_code    ; user-defined limit MSB
000A22r 3  D0 08                        bne @jumpto_compile_as_jump
000A24r 3               
000A24r 3                               ; Check the wordsize LSB against the user-defined limit.
000A24r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000A26r 3  C5 rr                        cmp nc_limit            ; user-defined limit LSB
000A28r 3  90 05                        bcc @compile_as_code    ; Allow native compiling for less
000A2Ar 3  F0 03                        beq @compile_as_code    ; than or equal to the limit.
000A2Cr 3               
000A2Cr 3               @jumpto_compile_as_jump:
000A2Cr 3                               ; If the wordsize is greater than the user-defined
000A2Cr 3                               ; limit, it will be compiled as a subroutine jump.
000A2Cr 3  4C rr rr                     jmp @compile_as_jump    ; too far for BRA
000A2Fr 3               
000A2Fr 3               @compile_as_code:
000A2Fr 3                               ; We arrive here with the length of the word's code TOS and
000A2Fr 3                               ; xt on top of the Return Stack. MOVE will need ( xt cp u )
000A2Fr 3                               ; on the data stack
000A2Fr 3  CA                           dex
000A30r 3  CA                           dex                     ; ( -- u ? )
000A31r 3  CA                           dex
000A32r 3  CA                           dex                     ; ( -- u ? ? )
000A33r 3               
000A33r 3  B5 04                        lda 4,x
000A35r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x                 ; LSB of u
000A37r 3  B5 05                        lda 5,x
000A39r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x                 ; ( -- u ? u )
000A3Br 3               
000A3Br 3  68                           pla
000A3Cr 3  95 04                        sta 4,x                 ; LSB of xt
000A3Er 3  68                           pla
000A3Fr 3  95 05                        sta 5,x                 ; ( -- xt ? u )
000A41r 3               
000A41r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp                  ; LSB of cp
000A43r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
000A45r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
000A47r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x                 ; ( -- xt cp u )
000A49r 3               
000A49r 3                               ; --- SPECIAL CASE 1: PREVENT RETURN STACK THRASHINIG ---
000A49r 3               
000A49r 3                               ; Native compiling allows us to strip the stack antics off
000A49r 3                               ; a number of words that use the Return Stack such as >R, R>,
000A49r 3                               ; 2>R and 2R> (but not 2R@ in this version). We compare the
000A49r 3                               ; xt with the contents of the table
000A49r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
000A4Br 3               
000A4Br 3               @strip_loop:
000A4Br 3  B9 rr rr                     lda @strip_table,y      ; LSB of first word
000A4Er 3  D5 04                        cmp 4,x                 ; LSB of xt
000A50r 3  D0 07                        bne @next_entry
000A52r 3               
000A52r 3                               ; LSB is the same, test MSB
000A52r 3  B9 rr rr                     lda @strip_table+1,y
000A55r 3  D5 05                        cmp 5,x
000A57r 3  F0 0C                        beq @found_entry
000A59r 3               
000A59r 3                               ; MSB is not equal. Pretend though that we've come from LSB
000A59r 3                               ; so we can use the next step for both cases
000A59r 3               @next_entry:
000A59r 3                               ; Not a word that needs stripping, so check next entry in table
000A59r 3                               ; Let's see if we're done with the table (marked by zero entry)
000A59r 3  B9 rr rr                     lda @strip_table,y      ; pointing to LSB
000A5Cr 3  19 rr rr                     ora @strip_table+1,y    ; get MSB
000A5Fr 3  F0 22                        beq @underflow_strip    ; table done, let's get out of here
000A61r 3               
000A61r 3  C8                           iny
000A62r 3  C8                           iny
000A63r 3  80 E6                        bra @strip_loop
000A65r 3               @found_entry:
000A65r 3                               ; This word is one of the ones that needs to have its size
000A65r 3                               ; adjusted during native compile. We find the values in the
000A65r 3                               ; next table with the same index, which is Y. However, Y is
000A65r 3                               ; pointing to the MSB, so we need to go back to the LSB and
000A65r 3                               ; halve the index before we can use it.
000A65r 3  98                           tya
000A66r 3  4A                           lsr
000A67r 3  A8                           tay
000A68r 3               
000A68r 3                               ; Get the adjustment out of the size table. We were clever
000A68r 3                               ; enough to make sure the cut on both ends of the code is
000A68r 3                               ; is the same size.
000A68r 3  B9 rr rr                     lda @strip_size,y
000A6Br 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos              ; save a copy
000A6Dr 3               
000A6Dr 3                               ; Adjust xt: Start later
000A6Dr 3  18                           clc
000A6Er 3  75 04                        adc 4,x
000A70r 3  95 04                        sta 4,x
000A72r 3  90 02                        bcc @2
000A74r 3  F6 05                        inc 5,x                 ; we just care about the carry
000A76r 3               @2:
000A76r 3               
000A76r 3                               ; Adjust u: Quit earlier. Since we cut off the top and the
000A76r 3                               ; bottom of the code, we have to double the value
000A76r 3  06 rr                        asl tmptos
000A78r 3               
000A78r 3  38                           sec
000A79r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000A7Br 3  E5 rr                        sbc tmptos
000A7Dr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000A7Fr 3  B0 02                        bcs @3
000A81r 3  D6 01                        dec 1,x                 ; we just care about the borrow
000A83r 3               @3:
000A83r 3                               ; drop through to underflow check stripping
000A83r 3               
000A83r 3               @underflow_strip:
000A83r 3                               ; --- SPECIAL CASE 2: REMOVE UNDERFLOW CHECKING ---
000A83r 3               
000A83r 3                               ; The user can choose to remove the unterflow testing in those
000A83r 3                               ; words that have the UF flag. This shortens the word by
000A83r 3                               ; 3 bytes if there is no underflow.
000A83r 3               
000A83r 3                               ; See if the user wants underflow stripping turned on
000A83r 3  A5 rr                        lda uf_strip
000A85r 3  05 rr                        ora uf_strip+1
000A87r 3  F0 1C                        beq @specials_done
000A89r 3               
000A89r 3                               ; See if this word even contains underflow checking
000A89r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp3
000A8Br 3  29 10                        and #UF
000A8Dr 3  F0 16                        beq @specials_done
000A8Fr 3               
000A8Fr 3                               ; If we arrived here, underflow has to go. It's always 3 bytes
000A8Fr 3                               ; long. Note hat PICK is a special case.
000A8Fr 3               
000A8Fr 3                               ; Adjust xt: Start later
000A8Fr 3  18                           clc
000A90r 3  B5 04                        lda 4,x
000A92r 3  69 03                        adc #3
000A94r 3  95 04                        sta 4,x
000A96r 3  90 02                        bcc @4
000A98r 3  F6 05                        inc 5,x                  ; we just care about the carry
000A9Ar 3               @4:
000A9Ar 3                               ; Adjust u: End earlier
000A9Ar 3  38                           sec
000A9Br 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000A9Dr 3  E9 03                        sbc #3
000A9Fr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000AA1r 3  B0 02                        bcs @5
000AA3r 3  D6 01                        dec 1,x                  ; we just care about the borrow
000AA5r 3               @5:
000AA5r 3               
000AA5r 3                               ; --- END OF SPECIAL CASES ---
000AA5r 3               @specials_done:
000AA5r 3                               ; Store size of area to be copied for calculation of
000AA5r 3                               ; new CP. We have to do this after all of the special cases
000AA5r 3                               ; because they might change the size
000AA5r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x                 ; MSB
000AA7r 3  48                           pha
000AA8r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x                 ; LSB
000AAAr 3  48                           pha
000AABr 3               
000AABr 3                               ; Enough of this, let's move those bytes already! We have
000AABr 3                               ; ( xt cp u ) on the stack at this point
000AABr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_move
000AAEr 3               
000AAEr 3                               ; Update CP
000AAEr 3  18                           clc
000AAFr 3  68                           pla                     ; LSB
000AB0r 3  65 rr                        adc cp
000AB2r 3  85 rr                        sta cp
000AB4r 3               
000AB4r 3  68                           pla                     ; MSB
000AB5r 3  65 rr                        adc cp+1
000AB7r 3  85 rr                        sta cp+1
000AB9r 3               
000AB9r 3  80 2C                        bra @done
000ABBr 3               
000ABBr 3               @strip_table:
000ABBr 3                              ; List of words we strip the Return Stack antics from
000ABBr 3                              ; during native compile, zero terminated. The index here
000ABBr 3                              ; must be the same as for the sizes
000ABBr 3  rr rr rr rr                  .word xt_r_from, xt_r_fetch, xt_to_r    ; R>, R@, >R
000ABFr 3  rr rr        
000AC1r 3  rr rr rr rr                  .word xt_two_to_r, xt_two_r_from, 0000  ; 2>R, 2R>, EOL
000AC5r 3  00 00        
000AC7r 3               
000AC7r 3               @strip_size:
000AC7r 3                               ; List of bytes to be stripped from the words that get their
000AC7r 3                               ; Return Stack antics removed during native compile. Index must
000AC7r 3                               ; be the same as for the xts. Zero terminated.
000AC7r 3  04 04 04 06                  .byte 4, 4, 4, 6, 6, 0          ; R>, R@, >R, 2>R, 2R>, EOL
000ACBr 3  06 00        
000ACDr 3               
000ACDr 3               @compile_as_jump:
000ACDr 3                               ; Compile xt as a subroutine jump
000ACDr 3  A9 20                        lda #$20
000ACFr 3  92 rr                        sta (cp)
000AD1r 3               
000AD1r 3  A0 01                        ldy #1
000AD3r 3  68                           pla             ; LSB
000AD4r 3  91 rr                        sta (cp),y
000AD6r 3  C8                           iny
000AD7r 3  68                           pla             ; MSB
000AD8r 3  91 rr                        sta (cp),y
000ADAr 3               
000ADAr 3                               ; allot space we just used
000ADAr 3  A9 03                        lda #3
000ADCr 3  18                           clc
000ADDr 3  65 rr                        adc cp
000ADFr 3  85 rr                        sta cp
000AE1r 3  90 02                        bcc @6
000AE3r 3  E6 rr                        inc cp+1
000AE5r 3               @6:
000AE5r 3  E8                           inx             ; drop xt
000AE6r 3  E8                           inx
000AE7r 3               @done:
000AE7r 3               z_compile_comma:
000AE7r 3  60                           rts
000AE8r 3               
000AE8r 3               
000AE8r 3               
000AE8r 3               ; ## COMPILE_ONLY ( -- ) "Mark most recent word as COMPILE-ONLY"
000AE8r 3               ; ## "compile-only"  tested  Tali Forth
000AE8r 3                       ; """Set the Compile Only flag (CO) of the most recently defined
000AE8r 3                       ; word.
000AE8r 3                       ;
000AE8r 3                       ; The alternative way to do this is to define a word
000AE8r 3                       ; ?COMPILE that makes sure  we're in compile mode
000AE8r 3                       ; """
000AE8r 3               
000AE8r 3               xt_compile_only:
000AE8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr current_to_dp
000AEBr 3  A0 01                        ldy #1          ; offset for status byte
000AEDr 3  B1 rr                        lda (dp),y
000AEFr 3  09 01                        ora #CO        ; make sure bit 7 is set
000AF1r 3  91 rr                        sta (dp),y
000AF3r 3               
000AF3r 3  60           z_compile_only: rts
000AF4r 3               
000AF4r 3               
000AF4r 3               
000AF4r 3               ; ## CONSTANT ( n "name" -- ) "Define a constant"
000AF4r 3               ; ## "constant"  auto  ANS core
000AF4r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/CONSTANT
000AF4r 3                       ;
000AF4r 3                       ; Forth equivalent is  CREATE , DOES> @  but we do
000AF4r 3                       ; more in assembler and let CREATE do the heavy lifting.
000AF4r 3                       ; See http://www.bradrodriguez.com/papers/moving3.htm for
000AF4r 3                       ; a primer on how this works in various Forths. This is the
000AF4r 3                       ; same code as VALUE in our case.
000AF4r 3                       ; """
000AF4r 3               xt_value:
000AF4r 3               xt_constant:
000AF4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
000AF7r 3               
000AF7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_create
000AFAr 3               
000AFAr 3                           	; CREATE by default installs a subroutine jump to DOVAR,
000AFAr 3                               ; but we want DOCONST for constants. Go back two bytes and
000AFAr 3                               ; replace the subroutine jump target
000AFAr 3  38                           sec
000AFBr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
000AFDr 3  E9 02                        sbc #2
000AFFr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
000B01r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
000B03r 3  E9 00                        sbc #0
000B05r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
000B07r 3               
000B07r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<doconst           ; LSB of DOCONST
000B09r 3  92 rr                        sta (tmp1)
000B0Br 3  A0 01                        ldy #1
000B0Dr 3  A9 rr                        lda #>doconst           ; MSB of DOCONST
000B0Fr 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000B11r 3               
000B11r 3                               ; Now we save the constant number itself in the next cell
000B11r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_comma            ; drop through to adjust_z
000B14r 3               
000B14r 3               adjust_z:
000B14r 3                               ; Now the length of the complete word (z_word) has increased by
000B14r 3                               ; two. We need to update that number or else words such as SEE
000B14r 3                               ; will ignore the PFA. We use this same routine for VARIABLE,
000B14r 3                               ; VALUE and DEFER
000B14r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_latestnt         ; gives us ( -- nt )
000B17r 3               
000B17r 3                               ; z_word is six bytes further down
000B17r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000B19r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
000B1Br 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
000B1Dr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
000B1Fr 3               
000B1Fr 3  A0 06                        ldy #6
000B21r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
000B23r 3  18                           clc
000B24r 3  69 02                        adc #2
000B26r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000B28r 3  C8                           iny
000B29r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
000B2Br 3  69 00                        adc #0                  ; only need carry
000B2Dr 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000B2Fr 3               
000B2Fr 3  E8                           inx
000B30r 3  E8                           inx
000B31r 3               
000B31r 3               z_value:
000B31r 3  60           z_constant:     rts
000B32r 3               
000B32r 3               
000B32r 3               ; ## COUNT ( c-addr -- addr u ) "Convert character string to normal format"
000B32r 3               ; ## "count"  auto  ANS core
000B32r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/COUNT
000B32r 3                       ; Convert old-style character string to address-length pair. Note
000B32r 3                       ; that the length of the string c-addr is stored in character length
000B32r 3                       ; (8 bit), not cell length (16 bit). This is rarely used these days,
000B32r 3                       ; though COUNT can also be used to step through a string character by
000B32r 3                       ; character.
000B32r 3                       ; """
000B32r 3               xt_count:
000B32r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
000B35r 3               
000B35r 3  A1 00                        lda (0,x)       ; Get number of characters (255 max)
000B37r 3  A8                           tay
000B38r 3               
000B38r 3                               ; move start address up by one
000B38r 3  F6 00                        inc 0,x         ; LSB
000B3Ar 3  D0 02                        bne @1
000B3Cr 3  F6 01                        inc 1,x         ; MSB
000B3Er 3               
000B3Er 3                               ; save number of characters to stack
000B3Er 3               @1:
000B3Er 3  98                           tya
000B3Fr 3  CA                           dex
000B40r 3  CA                           dex
000B41r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; LSB
000B43r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; MSB, always zero
000B45r 3               
000B45r 3  60           z_count:        rts
000B46r 3               
000B46r 3               
000B46r 3               ; ## CR ( -- ) "Print a line feed"
000B46r 3               ; ## "cr"  auto  ANS core
000B46r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/CR"""
000B46r 3               xt_cr:
000B46r 3  A9 0A                        lda #AscLF
000B48r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
000B4Br 3  60           z_cr:           rts
000B4Cr 3               
000B4Cr 3               
000B4Cr 3               ; ## CREATE ( "name" -- ) "Create Dictionary entry for 'name'"
000B4Cr 3               ; ## "create"  auto  ANS core
000B4Cr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/CREATE
000B4Cr 3                       ;
000B4Cr 3                       ; See the drawing in headers.asm for details on the header
000B4Cr 3                       ; """
000B4Cr 3               
000B4Cr 3               xt_create:
000B4Cr 3                               ; get string
000B4Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_parse_name       ; ( addr u )
000B4Fr 3               
000B4Fr 3                               ; if we were given an empty string, we complain and quit
000B4Fr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000B51r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
000B53r 3  D0 05                        bne @got_name
000B55r 3               
000B55r 3  A9 05                        lda #err_noname
000B57r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp error
000B5Ar 3               
000B5Ar 3               @got_name:
000B5Ar 3                               ; Enforce maximal length of string by overwriting the MSB of
000B5Ar 3                               ; the length. There is a possible error here: If the string
000B5Ar 3                               ; is exactly 255 chars long, then a lot of the following
000B5Ar 3                               ; additions will fail because of wrapping
000B5Ar 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
000B5Cr 3               
000B5Cr 3                               ; Check to see if this name already exists.
000B5Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_dup          ; ( addr u addr u )
000B5Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_find_name        ; ( addr u flag ) (non-zero nt as flag)
000B62r 3               
000B62r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000B64r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
000B66r 3  F0 1E                        beq @new_name           ; We haven't seen this one before.
000B68r 3               
000B68r 3                               ; This name already exists.  See if we are supposed to print
000B68r 3                               ; the message for it.
000B68r 3  E8                           inx                     ; Drop flag (nt) from find-name.
000B69r 3  E8                           inx
000B6Ar 3               
000B6Ar 3                               ; Check bit 7
000B6Ar 3  24 rr                        bit status
000B6Cr 3  10 08                        bpl @redefined_name     ; Bit 7 is zero, so print the message.
000B6Er 3               
000B6Er 3                               ; We aren't supposed to print the redefined message ourselves,
000B6Er 3                               ; but we should indicate that it is redefined (for ; to print
000B6Er 3                               ; later).
000B6Er 3  A9 80                        lda #$80                ; Set bit 7 to indicate dup
000B70r 3  05 rr                        ora status
000B72r 3  85 rr                        sta status
000B74r 3  80 18                        bra @process_name
000B76r 3               
000B76r 3               @redefined_name:
000B76r 3                               ; Print the message that the name is redefined.
000B76r 3  A9 02                        lda #str_redefined
000B78r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string_no_lf
000B7Br 3               
000B7Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_dup           ; ( addr u addr u )
000B7Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
000B81r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
000B84r 3               
000B84r 3  80 08                        bra @process_name
000B86r 3               
000B86r 3               @new_name:
000B86r 3  E8                           inx                     ; Drop flag (0) from find-name.
000B87r 3  E8                           inx
000B88r 3  A9 7F                        lda #$7F                ; Clear bit 0 of status to indicate new word.
000B8Ar 3  25 rr                        and status
000B8Cr 3  85 rr                        sta status
000B8Er 3               
000B8Er 3               @process_name:
000B8Er 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000B90r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2                ; store length of string in tmp2
000B92r 3               
000B92r 3                               ; remember the first free byte of memory as the start of
000B92r 3                               ; the new word
000B92r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
000B94r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
000B96r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
000B98r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
000B9Ar 3               
000B9Ar 3                               ; We need 8 bytes plus the length of the string for our new header.
000B9Ar 3                               ; This is also the offset for the start of the code field (the
000B9Ar 3                               ; xt_ label) so we need to remember it. Otherwise, we could
000B9Ar 3                               ; just allot the space afterwards
000B9Ar 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000B9Cr 3  18                           clc
000B9Dr 3  69 08                        adc #8
000B9Fr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3                ; total header length
000BA1r 3               
000BA1r 3                               ; We need three more bytes for for the hardcoded code field
000BA1r 3                               ; area (CFA), the "payload" of the word which by default will
000BA1r 3                               ; be a subroutine jump to DOVAR
000BA1r 3  18                           clc
000BA2r 3  69 03                        adc #3
000BA4r 3               
000BA4r 3                               ; We overwrite the length of the string returned by PARSE-NAME
000BA4r 3                               ; and then call ALLOT
000BA4r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000BA6r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; max header size is 255 chars
000BA8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_allot    ; ( addr )
000BABr 3               
000BABr 3                               ; Get the CURRENT dictionary pointer.
000BABr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr current_to_dp
000BAEr 3               
000BAEr 3                               ; Now we walk through the header with Y as the index, adding
000BAEr 3                               ; information byte-by-byte
000BAEr 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
000BB0r 3               
000BB0r 3                               ; HEADER BYTE 0: Length of string
000BB0r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2
000BB2r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000BB4r 3               
000BB4r 3                               ; HEADER BYTE 1: Status byte. By default, we set all new words
000BB4r 3                               ; to "never native", user will have to decide if they should
000BB4r 3                               ; be inlined
000BB4r 3  A9 08                        lda #NN
000BB6r 3               
000BB6r 3                               ; Also, words defined by CREATE are marked in the header has
000BB6r 3                               ; having a Code Field Area (CFA), which is a bit tricky for
000BB6r 3                               ; Subroutine Threaded Code (STC). We do this so >BODY works
000BB6r 3                               ; correctly with DOES> and CREATE. See the discussion at
000BB6r 3                               ; http://forum.6502.org/viewtopic.php?f=9&t=5182 for details
000BB6r 3  09 20                        ora #HC
000BB8r 3  C8                           iny
000BB9r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000BBBr 3  C8                           iny
000BBCr 3               
000BBCr 3                               ; HEADER BYTE 2,3: Next header. This is the current last word
000BBCr 3                               ; in the Dictionary
000BBCr 3  A5 rr                        lda dp
000BBEr 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000BC0r 3  C8                           iny
000BC1r 3  A5 rr                        lda dp+1
000BC3r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000BC5r 3  C8                           iny
000BC6r 3               
000BC6r 3                               ; Interlude: Make old CP new DP (new start of Dictionary)
000BC6r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
000BC8r 3  85 rr                        sta dp+1
000BCAr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
000BCCr 3  85 rr                        sta dp
000BCEr 3               
000BCEr 3                               ; HEADER BYTE 4,5: Start of the code field ("xt_" of this word).
000BCEr 3                               ; This begins after the header so we take the length of the
000BCEr 3                               ; header, which we cleverly saved in tmp3, and use it as an
000BCEr 3                               ; offset to the address of the start of the word. We come here
000BCEr 3                               ; with tmp1 in A
000BCEr 3  18                           clc
000BCFr 3  65 rr                        adc tmp3        ; add total header length
000BD1r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000BD3r 3  48                           pha             ; we need this in the next step
000BD4r 3  C8                           iny
000BD5r 3               
000BD5r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
000BD7r 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; only need the carry
000BD9r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000BDBr 3  C8                           iny
000BDCr 3               
000BDCr 3                               ; HEADER BYTE 6,7: End of code ("z_" of this word). By default,
000BDCr 3                               ; we execute a jump to the DOVAR routine, so we need to move three
000BDCr 3                               ; bytes down, and then one more byte so that the z_ label points
000BDCr 3                               ; to the (still fictional) RTS instruction for correct compilation
000BDCr 3  68                           pla             ; LSB of "z_" address
000BDDr 3  18                           clc
000BDEr 3  69 03                        adc #3
000BE0r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000BE2r 3               
000BE2r 3  88                           dey             ; get the MSB of xt back
000BE3r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
000BE5r 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; only need the carry
000BE7r 3  C8                           iny
000BE8r 3  C8                           iny
000BE9r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000BEBr 3  C8                           iny
000BECr 3               
000BECr 3                               ; HEADER BYTE 8: Start of name string. The address is TOS, the
000BECr 3                               ; length in tmp2. We subtract 8 from the address so we can
000BECr 3                               ; use the same loop index, which is already 8 byte ahead at
000BECr 3                               ; this point
000BECr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000BEEr 3  38                           sec
000BEFr 3  E9 08                        sbc #8
000BF1r 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos
000BF3r 3               
000BF3r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
000BF5r 3  E9 00                        sbc #0          ; only need carry
000BF7r 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos+1
000BF9r 3               
000BF9r 3               @name_loop:
000BF9r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmptos),y
000BFBr 3               
000BFBr 3                               ; Make sure it goes into the dictionary in lower case.
000BFBr 3  C9 5B                        cmp #$5B         ; ASCII '[' (one past Z)
000BFDr 3  B0 07                        bcs @store_name
000BFFr 3  C9 41                        cmp #$41        ; ASCII 'A'
000C01r 3  90 03                        bcc @store_name
000C03r 3               
000C03r 3                               ; An uppercase letter has been located. Make it
000C03r 3                               ; lowercase.
000C03r 3  18                           clc
000C04r 3  69 20                        adc #$20
000C06r 3               
000C06r 3                               ; Fall into @store_name.
000C06r 3               
000C06r 3               @store_name:
000C06r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000C08r 3  C8                           iny
000C09r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmp2
000C0Br 3  D0 EC                        bne @name_loop
000C0Dr 3               
000C0Dr 3                               ; After thename string comes the code field, starting at the
000C0Dr 3                               ; current xt of this word, which is initially a jump to the
000C0Dr 3                               ; subroutine to DOVAR. We code this jump by hand
000C0Dr 3  A9 20                        lda #$20        ; opcode of JSR
000C0Fr 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000C11r 3  C8                           iny
000C12r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<dovar
000C14r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000C16r 3  C8                           iny
000C17r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>dovar
000C19r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000C1Br 3               
000C1Br 3                               ; Update the CURRENT wordlist with the new DP.
000C1Br 3                               ; We do this down here because this routine uses Y.
000C1Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr dp_to_current
000C1Er 3               
000C1Er 3                               ; And we're done. Restore stack
000C1Er 3  E8                           inx
000C1Fr 3  E8                           inx
000C20r 3               
000C20r 3  60           z_create:       rts
000C21r 3               
000C21r 3               
000C21r 3               
000C21r 3               ; ## D_MINUS ( d d -- d ) "Subtract two double-celled numbers"
000C21r 3               ; ## "d-"  auto  ANS double
000C21r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/double/DMinus"""
000C21r 3               
000C21r 3               xt_d_minus:
000C21r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_4 ; two double numbers
000C24r 3               
000C24r 3  38                           sec
000C25r 3               
000C25r 3  B5 06                        lda 6,x         ; LSB of lower word
000C27r 3  F5 02                        sbc 2,x
000C29r 3  95 06                        sta 6,x
000C2Br 3               
000C2Br 3  B5 07                        lda 7,x         ; MSB of lower word
000C2Dr 3  F5 03                        sbc 3,x
000C2Fr 3  95 07                        sta 7,x
000C31r 3               
000C31r 3  B5 04                        lda 4,x         ; LSB of upper word
000C33r 3  F5 00                        sbc 0,x
000C35r 3  95 04                        sta 4,x
000C37r 3               
000C37r 3  B5 05                        lda 5,x         ; MSB of upper word
000C39r 3  F5 01                        sbc 1,x
000C3Br 3  95 05                        sta 5,x
000C3Dr 3               
000C3Dr 3  E8                           inx
000C3Er 3  E8                           inx
000C3Fr 3  E8                           inx
000C40r 3  E8                           inx
000C41r 3               
000C41r 3  60           z_d_minus:      rts
000C42r 3               
000C42r 3               
000C42r 3               
000C42r 3               ; ## D_PLUS ( d d -- d ) "Add two double-celled numbers"
000C42r 3               ; ## "d+"  auto  ANS double
000C42r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/double/DPlus"""
000C42r 3               
000C42r 3               xt_d_plus:
000C42r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_4 ; two double numbers
000C45r 3               
000C45r 3  18                           clc
000C46r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; LSB of lower word
000C48r 3  75 06                        adc 6,x
000C4Ar 3  95 06                        sta 6,x
000C4Cr 3               
000C4Cr 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x         ; MSB of lower word
000C4Er 3  75 07                        adc 7,x
000C50r 3  95 07                        sta 7,x
000C52r 3               
000C52r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB of upper word
000C54r 3  75 04                        adc 4,x
000C56r 3  95 04                        sta 4,x
000C58r 3               
000C58r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB of upper word
000C5Ar 3  75 05                        adc 5,x
000C5Cr 3  95 05                        sta 5,x
000C5Er 3               
000C5Er 3  E8                           inx
000C5Fr 3  E8                           inx
000C60r 3  E8                           inx
000C61r 3  E8                           inx
000C62r 3               
000C62r 3  60           z_d_plus:       rts
000C63r 3               
000C63r 3               
000C63r 3               
000C63r 3               ; ## D_TO_S ( d -- n ) "Convert a double number to single"
000C63r 3               ; ## "d>s"  auto  ANS double
000C63r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/double/DtoS
000C63r 3                       ; Though this is basically just DROP, we keep it
000C63r 3                       ; separate so we can test for underflow
000C63r 3                       ; """
000C63r 3               
000C63r 3               xt_d_to_s:
000C63r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
000C66r 3               
000C66r 3  E8                           inx
000C67r 3  E8                           inx
000C68r 3               
000C68r 3  60           z_d_to_s:       rts
000C69r 3               
000C69r 3               
000C69r 3               
000C69r 3               ; ## DABS ( d -- d ) "Return the absolute value of a double"
000C69r 3               ; ## "dabs"  auto  ANS double
000C69r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/double/DABS"""
000C69r 3               
000C69r 3               xt_dabs:
000C69r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2 ; double number
000C6Cr 3               
000C6Cr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB of high cell
000C6Er 3  10 17                        bpl @done       ; positive, we get off light
000C70r 3               
000C70r 3                               ; negative, calculate 0 - d
000C70r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
000C72r 3  38                           sec
000C73r 3               
000C73r 3  98                           tya
000C74r 3  F5 02                        sbc 2,x         ; LSB of low cell
000C76r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
000C78r 3               
000C78r 3  98                           tya
000C79r 3  F5 03                        sbc 3,x         ; MSB of low cell
000C7Br 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
000C7Dr 3               
000C7Dr 3  98                           tya
000C7Er 3  F5 00                        sbc 0,x         ; LSB of high cell
000C80r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000C82r 3               
000C82r 3  98                           tya
000C83r 3  F5 01                        sbc 1,x         ; MSB of high cell
000C85r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
000C87r 3               @done:
000C87r 3  60           z_dabs:         rts
000C88r 3               
000C88r 3               
000C88r 3               
000C88r 3               ; ## DECIMAL ( -- ) "Change radix base to decimal"
000C88r 3               ; ## "decimal"  auto  ANS core
000C88r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/DECIMAL"""
000C88r 3               xt_decimal:
000C88r 3  A9 0A                        lda #10
000C8Ar 3  85 rr                        sta base
000C8Cr 3  64 rr                        stz base+1              ; paranoid
000C8Er 3               
000C8Er 3  60           z_decimal:      rts
000C8Fr 3               
000C8Fr 3               
000C8Fr 3               ; ## DEFER ( "name" -- ) "Create a placeholder for words by name"
000C8Fr 3               ; ## "defer"  auto  ANS core ext
000C8Fr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/DEFER
000C8Fr 3                       ; Reserve an name that can be linked to various xt by IS.
000C8Fr 3                       ;
000C8Fr 3                       ; The ANS reference implementation is
000C8Fr 3                       ;       CREATE ['] ABORT , DOES> @ EXECUTE ;
000C8Fr 3                       ; But we use this routine as a low-level word so things go faster
000C8Fr 3               
000C8Fr 3               xt_defer:
000C8Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_create
000C92r 3               
000C92r 3                               ; CREATE by default installs a subroutine jump to DOVAR,
000C92r 3                               ; but we actually want DODEFER this time. Go back two
000C92r 3                               ; bytes and repace the subroutine jump target
000C92r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp          ; LSB
000C94r 3  38                           sec
000C95r 3  E9 02                        sbc #2
000C97r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
000C99r 3               
000C99r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1        ; MSB
000C9Br 3  E9 00                        sbc #0          ; we only care about the borrow
000C9Dr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
000C9Fr 3               
000C9Fr 3                               ; Save the target address
000C9Fr 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
000CA1r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<dodefer   ; LSB
000CA3r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000CA5r 3  C8                           iny
000CA6r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>dodefer   ; MSB
000CA8r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
000CAAr 3               
000CAAr 3               
000CAAr 3                               ; DODEFER executes the next address it finds after
000CAAr 3                               ; its call. As default, we include the error
000CAAr 3                               ; "Defer not defined"
000CAAr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<defer_error
000CACr 3  92 rr                        sta (cp)
000CAEr 3  E6 rr                        inc cp
000CB0r 3  D0 02                        bne @1
000CB2r 3  E6 rr                        inc cp+1
000CB4r 3               @1:
000CB4r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>defer_error
000CB6r 3  92 rr                        sta (cp)
000CB8r 3  E6 rr                        inc cp
000CBAr 3  D0 02                        bne @2
000CBCr 3  E6 rr                        inc cp+1
000CBEr 3               @2:
000CBEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr adjust_z    ; adjust header to correct length
000CC1r 3               
000CC1r 3  60           z_defer:        rts
000CC2r 3               
000CC2r 3               
000CC2r 3               
000CC2r 3               ; ## DEFER_FETCH ( xt1 -- xt2 ) "Get the current XT for a deferred word"
000CC2r 3               ; ## "defer@"  auto  ANS core ext
000CC2r 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/DEFERFetch"""
000CC2r 3               
000CC2r 3               xt_defer_fetch:
000CC2r 3                               ; No underflow checking as >BODY does it.
000CC2r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_body
000CC5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch
000CC8r 3  60           z_defer_fetch:  rts
000CC9r 3               
000CC9r 3               
000CC9r 3               
000CC9r 3               ; ## DEFER_STORE ( xt2 x1 -- ) "Set xt1 to execute xt2"
000CC9r 3               ; ## "defer!"  auto  ANS core ext
000CC9r 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/DEFERStore"""
000CC9r 3               
000CC9r 3               xt_defer_store:
000CC9r 3                               ; No underflow checking as >BODY and ! do it.
000CC9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_body
000CCCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_store
000CCFr 3  60           z_defer_store:  rts
000CD0r 3               
000CD0r 3               
000CD0r 3               
000CD0r 3               ; ## DEFINITIONS ( -- ) "Make first wordlist in search order the current wordlist"
000CD0r 3               ; ## "definitions" auto ANS search
000CD0r 3               xt_definitions:
000CD0r 3  A0 1F                        ldy #search_order_offset    ; Transfer byte variable
000CD2r 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y                  ; SEARCH_ORDER[0] to
000CD4r 3  A0 04                        ldy #current_offset         ; byte variable CURRENT.
000CD6r 3  91 rr                        sta (up),y
000CD8r 3  60           z_definitions:  rts
000CD9r 3               
000CD9r 3               
000CD9r 3               ; ## DEPTH ( -- u ) "Get number of cells (not bytes) used by stack"
000CD9r 3               ; ## "depth"  auto  ANS core
000CD9r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/DEPTH"""
000CD9r 3               xt_depth:
000CD9r 3  A9 rr                        lda #dsp0
000CDBr 3  86 rr                        stx tmpdsp
000CDDr 3  38                           sec
000CDEr 3  E5 rr                        sbc tmpdsp
000CE0r 3               
000CE0r 3                               ; divide by two because each cell is two bytes
000CE0r 3  4A                           lsr
000CE1r 3               
000CE1r 3  CA                           dex
000CE2r 3  CA                           dex
000CE3r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000CE5r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
000CE7r 3               
000CE7r 3  60           z_depth:        rts
000CE8r 3               
000CE8r 3               
000CE8r 3               ; ## DIGIT_QUESTION ( char -- u f | char f ) "Convert ASCII char to number"
000CE8r 3               ; ## "digit?"  auto  Tali Forth
000CE8r 3                       ; """Inspired by the pForth instruction DIGIT, see
000CE8r 3                       ; https://github.com/philburk/pforth/blob/master/fth/numberio.fth
000CE8r 3                       ; Rewritten from DIGIT>NUMBER in Tali Forth. Note in contrast to
000CE8r 3                       ; pForth, we get the base (radix) ourselves instead of having the
000CE8r 3                       ; user provide it. There is no standard name for this routine, which
000CE8r 3                       ; itself is not ANS; we use DIGIT? following pForth and Gforth.
000CE8r 3                       ; """
000CE8r 3               
000CE8r 3               xt_digit_question:
000CE8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
000CEBr 3               
000CEBr 3                               ; one way or another, we're going to need room for the
000CEBr 3                               ; flag on the stack
000CEBr 3  CA                           dex
000CECr 3  CA                           dex
000CEDr 3  74 00                        stz 0,x                 ; default flag is failure
000CEFr 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
000CF1r 3  74 03                        stz 3,x                 ; paranoid
000CF3r 3               
000CF3r 3                               ; Check the character, now in the LSB of NOS. First, make
000CF3r 3                               ; sure we're not below the ASCII code for "0"
000CF3r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
000CF5r 3  C9 30                        cmp #'0'
000CF7r 3  90 23                        bcc @done               ; failure flag already set
000CF9r 3               
000CF9r 3                               ; Next, see if we are below "9", because that would make
000CF9r 3                               ; this a normal number
000CF9r 3  C9 3A                        cmp #'9'+1               ; this is actually ":"
000CFBr 3  90 12                        bcc @checkbase
000CFDr 3               
000CFDr 3                               ; Well, then let's see if this is the gap between "9" and "A"
000CFDr 3                               ; so we can treat the whole range as a number
000CFDr 3  C9 41                        cmp #'A'
000CFFr 3  90 1B                        bcc @done               ; failure flag is already set
000D01r 3               
000D01r 3                               ; probably a letter, so we make sure it is uppercase
000D01r 3  C9 61                        cmp #'a'
000D03r 3  90 07                        bcc @case_done          ; not lower case, too low
000D05r 3  C9 7B                        cmp #'z'+1
000D07r 3  B0 03                        bcs @case_done          ; not lower case, too high
000D09r 3               
000D09r 3  18                           clc                     ; just right
000D0Ar 3  69 E0                        adc #$e0                ; offset to upper case (wraps)
000D0Cr 3               
000D0Cr 3               @case_done:
000D0Cr 3                               ; get rid of the gap between "9" and "A" so we can treat
000D0Cr 3                               ; the whole range as one number
000D0Cr 3  38                           sec
000D0Dr 3  E9 07                        sbc #7                  ; fall through to @checkbase
000D0Fr 3               
000D0Fr 3               @checkbase:
000D0Fr 3                               ; we have a number, now see if it falls inside the range
000D0Fr 3                               ; provided by BASE
000D0Fr 3  38                           sec
000D10r 3  E9 30                        sbc #'0'                 ; this is also the conversion step
000D12r 3  C5 rr                        cmp base
000D14r 3  B0 06                        bcs @done               ; already have false flag
000D16r 3               
000D16r 3                               ; Found a legal number
000D16r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x                 ; put number in NOS
000D18r 3  D6 00                        dec 0,x                 ; set success flag
000D1Ar 3  D6 01                        dec 1,x
000D1Cr 3               
000D1Cr 3               @done:
000D1Cr 3               z_digit_question:
000D1Cr 3  60                           rts
000D1Dr 3               
000D1Dr 3               
000D1Dr 3               ; ## DISASM ( addr u -- ) "Disassemble a block of memory"
000D1Dr 3               ; ## "disasm"  tested  Tali Forth
000D1Dr 3                       ; """Convert a segment of memory to assembler output. This
000D1Dr 3                       ; word is vectored so people can add their own disassembler.
000D1Dr 3                       ; Natively, this produces Simpler Assembly Notation (SAN)
000D1Dr 3                       ; code, see the section on The Disassembler in the manual and
000D1Dr 3                       ; the file disassembler.asm for more details.
000D1Dr 3                       ; """
000D1Dr 3               xt_disasm:
000D1Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
000D20r 3                           .ifdef TALI_OPTIONAL_ASSEMBLER
000D20r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr disassembler
000D23r 3                           .endif
000D23r 3               
000D23r 3  60           z_disasm:       rts
000D24r 3               
000D24r 3               
000D24r 3               ; ## DNEGATE ( d -- d ) "Negate double cell number"
000D24r 3               ; ## "dnegate"  auto  ANS double
000D24r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/double/DNEGATE"""
000D24r 3               xt_dnegate:
000D24r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2 ; double number
000D27r 3               
000D27r 3  A0 00             		ldy #0
000D29r 3  38                           sec
000D2Ar 3               
000D2Ar 3  98                           tya
000D2Br 3  F5 02                        sbc 2,x         ; LSB of low cell
000D2Dr 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
000D2Fr 3               
000D2Fr 3  98                           tya
000D30r 3  F5 03                        sbc 3,x         ; MSB of low cell
000D32r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
000D34r 3               
000D34r 3  98                           tya
000D35r 3  F5 00                        sbc 0,x         ; LSB of high cell
000D37r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000D39r 3               
000D39r 3  98                           tya
000D3Ar 3  F5 01                        sbc 1,x         ; MSB of high cell
000D3Cr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
000D3Er 3               
000D3Er 3  60           z_dnegate:      rts
000D3Fr 3               
000D3Fr 3               
000D3Fr 3               ; ## QUESTION_DO ( limit start -- )(R: -- limit start) "Conditional loop start"
000D3Fr 3               ; ## "?do"  auto  ANS core ext
000D3Fr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/qDO"""
000D3Fr 3               xt_question_do:
000D3Fr 3                               ; ?DO shares most of its code with DO. We use the tmp1 flag
000D3Fr 3                               ; to mark which is which
000D3Fr 3  A9 FF                        lda #$ff                ; -1 is ?DO, jump to common code
000D41r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
000D43r 3  80 02                        bra do_common           ; skip flag for DO
000D45r 3               
000D45r 3               ; ## DO ( limit start -- )(R: -- limit start)  "Start a loop"
000D45r 3               ; ## "do"  auto  ANS core
000D45r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/DO
000D45r 3                       ;
000D45r 3                       ; Compile-time part of DO. Could be realized in Forth as
000D45r 3                       ;       : DO POSTPONE (DO) HERE ; IMMEDIATE COMPILE-ONLY
000D45r 3                       ; but we do it in assembler for speed. To work with LEAVE, we compile
000D45r 3                       ; a routine that pushes the end address to the Return Stack at run
000D45r 3                       ; time. This is based on a suggestion by Garth Wilson, see
000D45r 3                       ; the Control Flow section of the manual for details.
000D45r 3                       ;
000D45r 3                       ; This may not be native compile. Don't check for a stack underflow
000D45r 3                       ; """
000D45r 3               
000D45r 3               xt_do:
000D45r 3                               ; DO and ?DO share most of their code, use tmp1 as a flag.
000D45r 3  64 rr                        stz tmp1                ; 0 is DO, drop through to DO_COMMON
000D47r 3               do_common:
000D47r 3                               ; We push HERE to the Data Stack so LOOP/+LOOP knows where to
000D47r 3                               ; compile the address we need to LDA at runtime
000D47r 3  CA                           dex
000D48r 3  CA                           dex
000D49r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
000D4Br 3  95 00                        sta 0,x                 ; LSB
000D4Dr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
000D4Fr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x                 ; MSB   ( limit start here )
000D51r 3               
000D51r 3                               ; now we compile six dummy bytes that LOOP/+LOOP will
000D51r 3                               ; replace by the actual LDA/PHA instructions
000D51r 3  A9 05                        lda #5                  ; we don't really care about the value,
000D53r 3  A8                           tay                     ; so we use 5 to be tricky
000D54r 3               @loop:
000D54r 3  91 rr                        sta (cp),y
000D56r 3  88                           dey
000D57r 3  10 FB                        bpl @loop
000D59r 3               
000D59r 3                               ; update CP
000D59r 3  1A                           inc             ; we used 5 as a dummy value, this is why
000D5Ar 3  18                           clc
000D5Br 3  65 rr                        adc cp
000D5Dr 3  85 rr                        sta cp
000D5Fr 3  90 02                        bcc @1
000D61r 3  E6 rr                        inc cp+1
000D63r 3               @1:
000D63r 3                               ; compile the (?DO) portion of ?DO if appropriate
000D63r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
000D65r 3  F0 17                        beq @compile_do
000D67r 3               
000D67r 3                               ; We came from ?DO, so compile its runtime first. We do
000D67r 3                               ; this with a quick loop because we know it has to be
000D67r 3                               ; Always Native anyway
000D67r 3  A0 14                        ldy #question_do_runtime_end-question_do_runtime
000D69r 3  5A                           phy             ; save counter to calculate new CP
000D6Ar 3               @2:
000D6Ar 3  B9 rr rr                     lda question_do_runtime,y
000D6Dr 3  91 rr                        sta (cp),y
000D6Fr 3  88                           dey
000D70r 3  10 F8                        bpl @2
000D72r 3               
000D72r 3                               ; adjust CP
000D72r 3  68                           pla             ; retrieve counter
000D73r 3  18                           clc
000D74r 3  65 rr                        adc cp
000D76r 3  85 rr                        sta cp
000D78r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
000D7Ar 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; only care about carry
000D7Cr 3  85 rr                        sta cp+1        ; fall through to @compile_do
000D7Er 3               
000D7Er 3               @compile_do:
000D7Er 3                               ; compile runtime part of DO.
000D7Er 3  A0 24                        ldy #do_runtime_end-do_runtime  ; counter
000D80r 3  5A                           phy             ; save counter to calculate new CP
000D81r 3               @3:
000D81r 3  B9 rr rr                     lda do_runtime,y
000D84r 3  91 rr                        sta (cp),y
000D86r 3  88                           dey
000D87r 3  10 F8                        bpl @3
000D89r 3               
000D89r 3                               ; adjust CP
000D89r 3  68                           pla             ; retrieve counter
000D8Ar 3  18                           clc
000D8Br 3  65 rr                        adc cp
000D8Dr 3  85 rr                        sta cp
000D8Fr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
000D91r 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; only care about carry
000D93r 3  85 rr                        sta cp+1
000D95r 3               
000D95r 3                               ; HERE, hardcoded for speed. We put it on the Data Stack
000D95r 3                               ; where LOOP/+LOOP takes it from. Note this has nothing to
000D95r 3                               ; do with the HERE we're saving for LEAVE
000D95r 3  CA                           dex
000D96r 3  CA                           dex
000D97r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp          ; LSB
000D99r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000D9Br 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1        ; MSB
000D9Dr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
000D9Fr 3               z_question_do:
000D9Fr 3  60           z_do:           rts
000DA0r 3               
000DA0r 3               
000DA0r 3               do_runtime:
000DA0r 3                       ; """Runtime routine for DO loop. Note that ANS loops quit when the
000DA0r 3                       ; boundry of limit-1 and limit is reached, a different mechanism than
000DA0r 3                       ; the FIG Forth loop (you can see which version you have by running
000DA0r 3                       ; a loop with start and limit as the same value, for instance
000DA0r 3                       ; 0 0 DO -- these will walk through the number space). We use a
000DA0r 3                       ; "fudge factor" for the limit that makes the Overflow Flag trip when
000DA0r 3                       ; it is reached; see http://forum.6502.org/viewtopic.php?f=9&t=2026
000DA0r 3                       ; for further discussion of this. The source given there for
000DA0r 3                       ; this idea is Laxen & Perry F83. -- This routine is called (DO)
000DA0r 3                       ; in some Forths. Usually, we would define this as a separate word
000DA0r 3                       ; and compile it with COMPILE, and the Always Native (AN) flag.
000DA0r 3                       ; However, we can do it faster if we just copy the bytes
000DA0r 3                       ; of this routine with a simple loop in DO.
000DA0r 3                       ; """
000DA0r 3                               ; First step: create fudge factor (FUFA) by subtracting the
000DA0r 3                               ; limit from $8000, the number that will trip the overflow
000DA0r 3                               ; flag
000DA0r 3  38                           sec
000DA1r 3  A9 00                        lda #0
000DA3r 3  F5 02                        sbc 2,x         ; LSB of limit
000DA5r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x         ; save FUFA for later use
000DA7r 3               
000DA7r 3  A9 80                        lda #$80
000DA9r 3  F5 03                        sbc 3,x         ; MSB of limit
000DABr 3  95 03                        sta 3,x         ; save FUFA for later use
000DADr 3  48                           pha             ; FUFA replaces limit on R stack
000DAEr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; LSB of limit
000DB0r 3  48                           pha
000DB1r 3               
000DB1r 3                               ; Second step: index is FUFA plus original index
000DB1r 3  18                           clc
000DB2r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB of original index
000DB4r 3  75 02                        adc 2,x         ; add LSB of FUFA
000DB6r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000DB8r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB of orginal index
000DBAr 3  75 03                        adc 3,x         ; add MSB of FUFA
000DBCr 3  48                           pha
000DBDr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB of index
000DBFr 3  48                           pha
000DC0r 3               
000DC0r 3                               ; we've saved the FUFA on the NOS of the R stack, so we can
000DC0r 3                               ; use it later. Clean the Data Stack
000DC0r 3  E8                           inx
000DC1r 3  E8                           inx
000DC2r 3  E8                           inx
000DC3r 3  E8                           inx             ; no RTS because this is copied into code
000DC4r 3               do_runtime_end:
000DC4r 3               
000DC4r 3               question_do_runtime:
000DC4r 3               
000DC4r 3                       ; """This is called (?DO) in some Forths. See the explanation at
000DC4r 3                       ; do_runtime for the background on this design
000DC4r 3                       ; """
000DC4r 3                               ; see if TOS and NOS are equal. Change this to assembler
000DC4r 3                               ; for speed
000DC4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_dup          ; ( n1 n2 n1 n2 )
000DC7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_equal            ; ( -- n1 n2 f )
000DCAr 3               
000DCAr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
000DCCr 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
000DCEr 3  F0 06                        beq @do_do
000DD0r 3               
000DD0r 3                               ; We're equal, so dump everything and jump beyond the loop.
000DD0r 3                               ; But first, dump six entries off of the Data Stack
000DD0r 3  8A                           txa
000DD1r 3  18                           clc
000DD2r 3  69 06                        adc #6
000DD4r 3  AA                           tax
000DD5r 3               
000DD5r 3                               ; Then abort the whole loop
000DD5r 3  60                           rts
000DD6r 3               @do_do:
000DD6r 3  E8                           inx             ; clear flag from EQUAL off stack
000DD7r 3  E8                           inx             ; no RTS because this is copied into code
000DD8r 3               question_do_runtime_end:
000DD8r 3               
000DD8r 3               
000DD8r 3               
000DD8r 3               ; ## DOES ( -- ) "Add payload when defining new words"
000DD8r 3               ; ## "does>"  auto  ANS core
000DD8r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/DOES
000DD8r 3                       ; Create the payload for defining new defining words. See
000DD8r 3                       ; http://www.bradrodriguez.com/papers/moving3.htm and
000DD8r 3                       ; the Developer Guide in the manual for a discussion of
000DD8r 3                       ; DOES>'s internal workings. This uses tmp1 and tmp2.
000DD8r 3                       ; """
000DD8r 3               
000DD8r 3               xt_does:
000DD8r 3                               ; compile a subroutine jump to runtime of DOES>
000DD8r 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>does_runtime
000DDAr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<does_runtime
000DDCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
000DDFr 3               
000DDFr 3                               ; compile a subroutine jump to DODOES. In traditional
000DDFr 3                               ; terms, this is the Code Field Area (CFA) of the new
000DDFr 3                               ; word
000DDFr 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>dodoes
000DE1r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<dodoes
000DE3r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
000DE6r 3               
000DE6r 3  60           z_does:         rts
000DE7r 3               
000DE7r 3               
000DE7r 3               does_runtime:
000DE7r 3                       ; """Runtime portion of DOES>. This replaces the subroutine jump
000DE7r 3                       ; to DOVAR that CREATE automatically encodes by a jump to the
000DE7r 3                       ; address that contains a subroutine jump to DODOES. We don't
000DE7r 3                       ; jump to DODOES directly because we need to work our magic with
000DE7r 3                       ; the return addresses. This routine is also known as "(DOES)" in
000DE7r 3                       ; other Forths
000DE7r 3                       ; """
000DE7r 3               
000DE7r 3  7A                           ply             ; LSB
000DE8r 3  68                           pla             ; MSB
000DE9r 3               
000DE9r 3  C8                           iny
000DEAr 3  D0 01                        bne @1
000DECr 3  1A                           inc
000DEDr 3               @1:
000DEDr 3  84 rr                        sty tmp1
000DEFr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
000DF1r 3               
000DF1r 3                               ; CREATE has also already modified the DP to point to the new
000DF1r 3                               ; word. We have no idea which instructions followed the CREATE
000DF1r 3                               ; command if there is a DOES> so the CP could point anywhere
000DF1r 3                               ; by now. The address of the word's xt is four bytes down.
000DF1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr current_to_dp   ; Grab the DP from the CURRENT wordlist.
000DF4r 3  A5 rr                        lda dp
000DF6r 3  18                           clc
000DF7r 3  69 04                        adc #4
000DF9r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2
000DFBr 3  A5 rr                        lda dp+1
000DFDr 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; we only care about the carry
000DFFr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
000E01r 3               
000E01r 3                               ; Now we get that address and add one byte to skip over the JSR
000E01r 3                               ; opcode
000E01r 3  B2 rr                        lda (tmp2)
000E03r 3  18                           clc
000E04r 3  69 01                        adc #1
000E06r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3
000E08r 3  A0 01                        ldy #1
000E0Ar 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y
000E0Cr 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; we only care about the carry
000E0Er 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3+1
000E10r 3               
000E10r 3                               ; Replace the DOVAR address with our own
000E10r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1        ; LSB
000E12r 3  92 rr                        sta (tmp3)
000E14r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
000E16r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp3),y    ; Y is still 1
000E18r 3               
000E18r 3                               ; Since we removed the return address that brought us here, we
000E18r 3                               ; go back to whatever the main routine was. Otherwise, we we
000E18r 3                               ; smash into the subroutine jump to DODOES.
000E18r 3  60                           rts
000E19r 3               
000E19r 3               
000E19r 3               
000E19r 3               ; ## DOT ( u -- ) "Print TOS"
000E19r 3               ; ## "."  auto  ANS core
000E19r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/d"""
000E19r 3               
000E19r 3               xt_dot:
000E19r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
000E1Cr 3               
000E1Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup                      ; ( n n )
000E1Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_abs                      ; ( n u )
000E22r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero                     ; ( n u 0 )
000E25r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_less_number_sign         ; ( n u 0 )
000E28r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_s            ; ( n ud )
000E2Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_rot                      ; ( ud n )
000E2Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_sign                     ; ( ud )
000E31r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_greater      ; ( addr u )
000E34r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
000E37r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
000E3Ar 3               
000E3Ar 3  60           z_dot:          rts
000E3Br 3               
000E3Br 3               
000E3Br 3               
000E3Br 3               ; ## DOT_PAREN ( -- ) "Print input up to close paren .( comment )"
000E3Br 3               ; ## ".("  auto  ANS core
000E3Br 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Dotp"""
000E3Br 3               
000E3Br 3               xt_dot_paren:
000E3Br 3                               ; Put a right paren on the stack.
000E3Br 3  CA                           dex
000E3Cr 3  CA                           dex
000E3Dr 3  A9 29                        lda #41     ; Right parenthesis
000E3Fr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
000E41r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
000E43r 3               
000E43r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_parse
000E46r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
000E49r 3               
000E49r 3  60           z_dot_paren:    rts
000E4Ar 3               
000E4Ar 3               
000E4Ar 3               
000E4Ar 3               ; ## DOT_QUOTE ( "string" -- ) "Print string from compiled word"
000E4Ar 3               ; ## ".""  auto  ANS core ext
000E4Ar 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Dotq
000E4Ar 3                       ; Compile string that is printed during run time. ANS Forth wants
000E4Ar 3                       ; this to be compile-only, even though everybody and their friend
000E4Ar 3                       ; uses it for everything. We follow the book here, and recommend
000E4Ar 3                       ; `.(` for general printing.
000E4Ar 3                       ; """
000E4Ar 3               
000E4Ar 3               xt_dot_quote:
000E4Ar 3                               ; we let S" do the heavy lifting. Since we're in
000E4Ar 3                               ; compile mode, it will save the string and reproduce it
000E4Ar 3                               ; during runtime
000E4Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_s_quote
000E4Dr 3               
000E4Dr 3                               ; We then let TYPE do the actual printing
000E4Dr 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>xt_type
000E4Fr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<xt_type
000E51r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
000E54r 3               
000E54r 3  60           z_dot_quote:    rts
000E55r 3               
000E55r 3               
000E55r 3               
000E55r 3               ; ## DOT_R ( n u -- ) "Print NOS as unsigned number with TOS with"
000E55r 3               ; ## ".r"  tested  ANS core ext
000E55r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/DotR
000E55r 3                       ;
000E55r 3                       ; Based on the Forth code
000E55r 3                       ;  : .R  >R DUP ABS 0 <# #S ROT SIGN #> R> OVER - SPACES TYPE ;
000E55r 3                       ; """
000E55r 3               
000E55r 3               xt_dot_r:
000E55r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
000E58r 3               
000E58r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_r
000E5Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
000E5Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_abs
000E61r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero
000E64r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_less_number_sign
000E67r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_s
000E6Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_rot
000E6Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_sign
000E70r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_greater
000E73r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_from
000E76r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_over
000E79r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
000E7Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_spaces
000E7Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
000E82r 3               
000E82r 3  60           z_dot_r:        rts
000E83r 3               
000E83r 3               
000E83r 3               
000E83r 3               ; ## DOT_S ( -- ) "Print content of Data Stack"
000E83r 3               ; ## ".s"  tested  ANS tools
000E83r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/tools/DotS
000E83r 3                       ; Print content of Data Stack non-distructively. We follow the format
000E83r 3                       ; of Gforth and print the number of elements first in brackets,
