001328r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; Search order array is bytes, so
00132Ar 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; put a zero in the high byte.
00132Cr 3               
00132Cr 3                               ; See if that was the last one to process (first in the list).
00132Cr 3  A9 00                        lda #0
00132Er 3  C5 rr                        cmp tmp1
001330r 3  D0 EA                        bne @loop
001332r 3               
001332r 3               @done:
001332r 3                               ; Put the number of items on the stack.
001332r 3  CA                           dex
001333r 3  CA                           dex
001334r 3  A0 1E                        ldy #num_order_offset
001336r 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
001338r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00133Ar 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; We only support 8 wordlists.
00133Cr 3               
00133Cr 3  60           z_get_order:    rts
00133Dr 3               
00133Dr 3               
00133Dr 3               
00133Dr 3               ; ## GREATER_THAN ( n n -- f ) "See if NOS is greater than TOS"
00133Dr 3               ; ## ">"  auto  ANS core
00133Dr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/more"""
00133Dr 3               
00133Dr 3               xt_greater_than:
00133Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001340r 3               
001340r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0          ; default false
001342r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr compare_16bit
001345r 3               
001345r 3                               ; for signed numbers, NOS>TOS gives us Z=0 and N=1
001345r 3  F0 03                        beq @false
001347r 3  10 01                        bpl @false
001349r 3               
001349r 3                               ; true
001349r 3  88                           dey
00134Ar 3               @false:
00134Ar 3  98                           tya
00134Br 3               
00134Br 3  E8                           inx
00134Cr 3  E8                           inx
00134Dr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00134Fr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001351r 3               
001351r 3  60           z_greater_than: rts
001352r 3               
001352r 3               
001352r 3               
001352r 3               ; ## HERE ( -- addr ) "Put Compiler Pointer on Data Stack"
001352r 3               ; ## "here"  auto  ANS core
001352r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/HERE
001352r 3                       ; This code is also used by the assembler directive ARROW
001352r 3                       ; ("->") though as immediate"""
001352r 3               xt_here:
001352r 3               xt_asm_arrow:
001352r 3  CA                           dex
001353r 3  CA                           dex
001354r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
001356r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001358r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
00135Ar 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00135Cr 3               
00135Cr 3               z_asm_arrow:
00135Cr 3  60           z_here:         rts
00135Dr 3               
00135Dr 3               
00135Dr 3               ; ## HEX ( -- ) "Change base radix to hexadecimal"
00135Dr 3               ; ## "hex"  auto  ANS core ext
00135Dr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/HEX"""
00135Dr 3               xt_hex:
00135Dr 3  A9 10                        lda #16
00135Fr 3  85 rr                        sta base
001361r 3  64 rr                        stz base+1              ; paranoid
001363r 3               
001363r 3  60           z_hex:          rts
001364r 3               
001364r 3               
001364r 3               ; ## HEXSTORE ( addr1 u1 addr2 -- u2 ) "Store a list of numbers"
001364r 3               ; ## "hexstore"  auto  Tali
001364r 3                       ; """Given a string addr1 u1 with numbers in the current base seperated
001364r 3                       ; by spaces, store the numbers at the address addr2, returning the
001364r 3                       ; number of elements. Non-number elements are skipped, an zero-length
001364r 3                       ; string produces a zero output.
001364r 3                       ; """
001364r 3               
001364r 3               xt_hexstore:
001364r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_3
001367r 3               
001367r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup              ; Save copy of original address
00136Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_to_r         ; ( addr1 u1 ) ( R: addr2 addr2 )
00136Dr 3               
00136Dr 3               @loop:
00136Dr 3                               ; Loop until string is totally consumed
00136Dr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00136Fr 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
001371r 3  F0 36                        beq @done
001373r 3               
001373r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cleave           ; ( addr1 u1 addr3 u3 ) ( R: addr2 addr2 )
001376r 3               
001376r 3                               ; Prepare the conversion of the number.
001376r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_to_r
001379r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero
00137Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero
00137Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_r_from       ; ( addr1 u1 0 0 addr3 u3 ) ( R: addr2 addr2 )
001382r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_number        ; ( addr1 u1 n n addr4 u4 ) ( R: addr2 addr2 )
001385r 3               
001385r 3                               ; If u4 is not zero, we have leftover chars and have to do
001385r 3                               ; things differently
001385r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001387r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
001389r 3  D0 17                        bne @have_chars_left
00138Br 3               
00138Br 3                               ; Normal case, this number is all done
00138Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_drop         ; ( addr1 u1 n n ) ( R: addr2 addr2 )
00138Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_d_to_s           ; ( addr1 u1 n ) ( R: addr2 addr2 )
001391r 3               
001391r 3                               ; Store the new value
001391r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_fetch          ; ( addr1 u1 n addr2 ) ( R: addr2 addr2 )
001394r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_c_store          ; ( addr1 u1 ) ( R: addr2 addr2 )
001397r 3               
001397r 3                               ; Increase counter
001397r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_from           ; R>
00139Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus         ; 1+
00139Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_r             ; >R ( addr1 u1 ) ( R: addr2+1 addr2 )
0013A0r 3  80 CB                        bra @loop
0013A2r 3               
0013A2r 3               @have_chars_left:
0013A2r 3                               ; Pathological case: Drop the rest of this number off the stack
0013A2r 3                               ; and continue with the next word. Doesn't print a warning. We
0013A2r 3                               ; need to drop four cells, that is, eight bytes
0013A2r 3  8A                           txa
0013A3r 3  18                           clc
0013A4r 3  69 08                        adc #8
0013A6r 3  AA                           tax
0013A7r 3  80 C4                        bra @loop
0013A9r 3               
0013A9r 3               @done:
0013A9r 3                               ; Clean up return stack and calculate number of chars stored
0013A9r 3  E8                           inx
0013AAr 3  E8                           inx
0013ABr 3  E8                           inx
0013ACr 3  E8                           inx                     ; 2DROP
0013ADr 3               
0013ADr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_r_from       ; ( addr2+n addr2 )
0013B0r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
0013B3r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus            ; ( n )
0013B6r 3               
0013B6r 3  60           z_hexstore:     rts
0013B7r 3               
0013B7r 3               
0013B7r 3               
0013B7r 3               ; ## HOLD ( char -- ) "Insert character at current output"
0013B7r 3               ; ## "hold"  auto  ANS core
0013B7r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/HOLD
0013B7r 3                       ; Insert a character at the current position of a pictured numeric
0013B7r 3                       ; output string on
0013B7r 3                       ; https://github.com/philburk/pforth/blob/master/fth/numberio.fth
0013B7r 3                       ;
0013B7r 3                       ; Forth code is : HOLD  -1 HLD +!  HLD @ C! ;  We use the the internal
0013B7r 3                       ; variable tohold instead of HLD.
0013B7r 3                       ; """
0013B7r 3               xt_hold:
0013B7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0013BAr 3               
0013BAr 3  A5 rr                        lda tohold
0013BCr 3  D0 02                        bne @1
0013BEr 3  C6 rr                        dec tohold+1
0013C0r 3               @1:
0013C0r 3  C6 rr                        dec tohold
0013C2r 3               
0013C2r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0013C4r 3  92 rr                        sta (tohold)
0013C6r 3  E8                           inx
0013C7r 3  E8                           inx
0013C8r 3               
0013C8r 3  60           z_hold:         rts
0013C9r 3               
0013C9r 3               
0013C9r 3               ; ## I ( -- n )(R: n -- n)  "Copy loop counter to stack"
0013C9r 3               ; ## "i"  auto  ANS core
0013C9r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/I
0013C9r 3                       ; Note that this is not the same as R@ because we use a fudge
0013C9r 3                       ; factor for loop control; see the Control Flow section of the
0013C9r 3                       ; manual for details.
0013C9r 3                       ;
0013C9r 3                       ; We should make this native compile for speed.
0013C9r 3                       ; """
0013C9r 3               
0013C9r 3               xt_i:
0013C9r 3  CA                           dex
0013CAr 3  CA                           dex
0013CBr 3               
0013CBr 3                               ; Get the fudged index off of the top of the stack. It's
0013CBr 3                               ; easier to do math on the stack directly than to pop and
0013CBr 3                               ; push stuff around
0013CBr 3  86 rr                        stx tmpdsp
0013CDr 3  BA                           tsx
0013CEr 3               
0013CEr 3  38                           sec
0013CFr 3  BD 01 01                     lda $0101,x     ; LSB
0013D2r 3  FD 03 01                     sbc $0103,x
0013D5r 3  A8                           tay
0013D6r 3               
0013D6r 3  BD 02 01                     lda $0102,x     ; MSB
0013D9r 3  FD 04 01                     sbc $0104,x
0013DCr 3               
0013DCr 3  A6 rr                        ldx tmpdsp
0013DEr 3               
0013DEr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x         ; MSB of de-fudged index
0013E0r 3  94 00                        sty 0,x         ; LSB of de-fudged index
0013E2r 3               
0013E2r 3  60           z_i:            rts
0013E3r 3               
0013E3r 3               
0013E3r 3               
0013E3r 3               ; ## IF (C: -- orig) (flag -- ) "Conditional flow control"
0013E3r 3               ; ## "if"  auto  ANS core
0013E3r 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/IF"""
0013E3r 3               
0013E3r 3               xt_if:
0013E3r 3                               ; Compile a 0BRANCH
0013E3r 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>zero_branch_runtime
0013E5r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<zero_branch_runtime
0013E7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
0013EAr 3               
0013EAr 3                               ; Put the origination address on the stack for else/then
0013EAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_here
0013EDr 3               
0013EDr 3                               ; Stuff zero in for the branch address right now.
0013EDr 3                               ; THEN or ELSE will fix it later.
0013EDr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero
0013F0r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_comma
0013F3r 3  60           z_if:           rts
0013F4r 3               
0013F4r 3               
0013F4r 3               zero_branch_runtime:
0013F4r 3                       ; """In some Forths, this is called (0BRANCH). Tali Forth originally
0013F4r 3                       ; included 0BRANCH as a high-level word that inserted this code at
0013F4r 3                       ; runtime.
0013F4r 3                       ; """
0013F4r 3               
0013F4r 3                               ; We use the return value on the 65c02 stack to determine
0013F4r 3                               ; where we want to return to.
0013F4r 3  68                           pla
0013F5r 3  85 rr                        sta tmpbranch
0013F7r 3  68                           pla
0013F8r 3  85 rr                        sta tmpbranch+1
0013FAr 3               
0013FAr 3                               ; See if the flag is zero, which is the whole purpose of
0013FAr 3                               ; this all
0013FAr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0013FCr 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
0013FEr 3  F0 0F                        beq @zero
001400r 3               
001400r 3                               ; Flag is TRUE, so we skip over the next two bytes. This is
001400r 3                               ; the part between IF and THEN
001400r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmpbranch   ; LSB
001402r 3  18                           clc
001403r 3  69 02                        adc #2
001405r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
001407r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmpbranch+1 ; MSB
001409r 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; For carry
00140Br 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
00140Dr 3               
00140Dr 3  80 13                        bra @done
00140Fr 3               
00140Fr 3               @zero:
00140Fr 3                               ; Flag is FALSE (0) so we take the jump to the address given in
00140Fr 3                               ; the next two bytes. However, the address points to the last
00140Fr 3                               ; byte of the JSR instruction, not to the next byte afterwards
00140Fr 3  A0 01                        ldy #1
001411r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmpbranch),y
001413r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
001415r 3  C8                           iny
001416r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmpbranch),y
001418r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
00141Ar 3               
00141Ar 3                               ; Now we have to subtract one byte from the address
00141Ar 3                               ; given because of the way the 6502 calculates RTS
00141Ar 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
00141Cr 3  D0 02                        bne @1
00141Er 3  C6 rr                        dec tmp1+1
001420r 3               @1:
001420r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmp1
001422r 3               
001422r 3               @done:
001422r 3                               ; However we got here, tmp1 has the value we push to jump
001422r 3                               ; to
001422r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
001424r 3  48                           pha             ; MSB first
001425r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
001427r 3  48                           pha
001428r 3               
001428r 3                               ; clean up the stack and jump
001428r 3  E8                           inx
001429r 3  E8                           inx
00142Ar 3               
00142Ar 3  60                           rts
00142Br 3               
00142Br 3               
00142Br 3               
00142Br 3               ; ## IMMEDIATE ( -- ) "Mark most recent word as IMMEDIATE"
00142Br 3               ; ## "immediate"  auto  ANS core
00142Br 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/IMMEDIATE
00142Br 3                       ; Make sure the most recently defined word is immediate. Will only
00142Br 3                       ; affect the last word in the dictionary. Note that if the word is
00142Br 3                       ; defined in ROM, this will have no affect, but will not produce an
00142Br 3                       ; error message.
00142Br 3                       ; """
00142Br 3               xt_immediate:
00142Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr current_to_dp
00142Er 3  A0 01                        ldy #1          ; offset for status byte
001430r 3  B1 rr                        lda (dp),y
001432r 3  09 04                        ora #IM        ; make sure bit 7 is set
001434r 3  91 rr                        sta (dp),y
001436r 3               
001436r 3  60           z_immediate:    rts
001437r 3               
001437r 3               
001437r 3               ; ## INPUT ( -- addr ) "Return address of input vector"
001437r 3               ; ## "input" tested Tali Forth
001437r 3               
001437r 3               xt_input:
001437r 3  CA                           dex
001438r 3  CA                           dex
001439r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<input
00143Br 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00143Dr 3  A9 rr                        lda #>input
00143Fr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001441r 3               
001441r 3  60           z_input:        rts
001442r 3               
001442r 3               
001442r 3               
001442r 3               ; ## INPUT_TO_R ( -- ) ( R: -- n n n n ) "Save input state to the Return Stack"
001442r 3               ; ## "input>r"  tested  Tali Forth
001442r 3                  	; """Save the current input state as defined by insrc, cib, ciblen, and
001442r 3                       ; toin to the Return Stack. Used by EVALUTE.
001442r 3                       ;
001442r 3                       ; The naive way of doing
001442r 3                       ; this is to push each two-byte variable to the stack in the form of
001442r 3                       ;
001442r 3                       ;       lda insrc
001442r 3                       ;       pha
001442r 3                       ;       lda insrc+1
001442r 3                       ;       pha
001442r 3                       ;
001442r 3                       ; for a total of 24 byte of instruction in one direction and later
001442r 3                       ; a further 24 bytes to reverse the process. We shorten this at the
001442r 3                       ; cost of some speed by assuming the four variables are grouped
001442r 3                       ; together on the Zero Page and start with insrc (see definitions.asm
001442r 3                       ; for details). The reverse operation is r_to_input. These words must
001442r 3                       ; be flagged as Never Native. Uses tmp1
001442r 3                       ; """
001442r 3               
001442r 3               xt_input_to_r:
001442r 3                               ; We arrive here with the return address on the top of the
001442r 3                               ; 65c02's stack. We need to move it out of the way first
001442r 3  68                           pla
001443r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
001445r 3  68                           pla
001446r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
001448r 3               
001448r 3                               ; This assumes that insrc is the first of eight bytes and
001448r 3                               ; toin+1 the last in the sequence we want to save from the Zero
001448r 3                               ; Page.
001448r 3  A0 07                        ldy #7
00144Ar 3               @loop:
00144Ar 3  B9 rr rr                     lda insrc,y     ; insrc+7 is toin+1
00144Dr 3  48                           pha
00144Er 3  88                           dey
00144Fr 3  10 F9                        bpl @loop
001451r 3               
001451r 3                               ; Restore address for return jump
001451r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
001453r 3  48                           pha
001454r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
001456r 3  48                           pha
001457r 3               
001457r 3  60           z_input_to_r: 	rts
001458r 3               
001458r 3               
001458r 3               
001458r 3               ; ## INT_TO_NAME ( xt -- nt ) "Get name token from execution token"
001458r 3               ; ## "int>name"  auto  Tali Forth
001458r 3                       ; """www.complang.tuwien.ac.at/forth/gforth/Docs-html/Name-token.html
001458r 3                       ; This is called >NAME in Gforth, but we change it to
001458r 3                       ; INT>NAME to match NAME>INT
001458r 3                       ; """
001458r 3               
001458r 3               xt_int_to_name:
001458r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
00145Br 3               
00145Br 3                               ; Unfortunately, to find the header, we have to walk through
00145Br 3                               ; all of the wordlists. We are running out of tmp variables.
00145Br 3                               ; (I'm assuming there is a reason this is avoiding tmp1) so
00145Br 3                               ; hold the current wordlist on the data stack. This searches
00145Br 3                               ; all of the wordlists in id order.
00145Br 3  CA                           dex
00145Cr 3  CA                           dex
00145Dr 3  74 00                        stz 0,x
00145Fr 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
001461r 3               
001461r 3               @wordlist_loop:
001461r 3                               ; A needs to have the current wordlist id in it at
001461r 3                               ; the top of this loop.
001461r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x                 ; Get the current wordlist.
001463r 3               
001463r 3                               ; Get the DP for that wordlist.
001463r 3  0A                           asl                     ; Turn offset into cells offset.
001464r 3  18                           clc
001465r 3  69 06                        adc #wordlists_offset
001467r 3  A8                           tay
001468r 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y              ; Save the DP for this wordlist
00146Ar 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2                ; into tmp2
00146Cr 3  C8                           iny
00146Dr 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
00146Fr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
001471r 3               
001471r 3                               ; Check for an empty wordlist (DP will be 0)
001471r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2
001473r 3  05 rr                        ora tmp2+1
001475r 3  F0 38                        beq @next_wordlist
001477r 3               
001477r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; Target xt is now behind wordlist id.
001479r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3        ; Save target xt in tmp3
00147Br 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
00147Dr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3+1
00147Fr 3               
00147Fr 3               @loop:
00147Fr 3  A0 04                        ldy #4          ; xt is four bytes down
001481r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; LSB of xt of current nt
001483r 3  C5 rr                        cmp tmp3
001485r 3  D0 07                        bne @no_match
001487r 3               
001487r 3                               ; LSB is the same, now check MSB
001487r 3  C8                           iny
001488r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; MSB of xt of current nt
00148Ar 3  C5 rr                        cmp tmp3+1
00148Cr 3  F0 32                        beq @match
00148Er 3               
00148Er 3               @no_match:
00148Er 3                               ; no match, so we need to get the next word. Next nt is two
00148Er 3                               ; bytes down
00148Er 3  18                           clc
00148Fr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2
001491r 3  69 02                        adc #2
001493r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2
001495r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2+1
001497r 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; only care about carry
001499r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
00149Br 3               
00149Br 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
00149Dr 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y
00149Fr 3  48                           pha
0014A0r 3  C8                           iny
0014A1r 3  11 rr                        ora (tmp2),y
0014A3r 3  F0 09                        beq @zero
0014A5r 3               
0014A5r 3                               ; Not zero continue
0014A5r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y
0014A7r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
0014A9r 3  68                           pla
0014AAr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2
0014ACr 3  80 D1                        bra @loop
0014AEr 3               
0014AEr 3               @zero:
0014AEr 3                               ; if next word is zero, the xt has no nt in this wordlist
0014AEr 3  68                           pla             ; Leftover from above loop
0014AFr 3               
0014AFr 3               @next_wordlist:
0014AFr 3                               ; Move on to the next wordlist.
0014AFr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0014B1r 3  1A                           inc
0014B2r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0014B4r 3  C9 0C                        cmp #max_wordlists
0014B6r 3  D0 A9                        bne @wordlist_loop
0014B8r 3               
0014B8r 3                               ; We didn't find it in any of the wordlists.
0014B8r 3                               ; Remove the wordlist id from the stack.
0014B8r 3  E8                           inx
0014B9r 3  E8                           inx
0014BAr 3               
0014BAr 3                               ; We return a zero to indicate that we didn't find it.
0014BAr 3  74 00                        stz 0,x
0014BCr 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
0014BEr 3  80 0A                        bra z_int_to_name
0014C0r 3               
0014C0r 3               @match:
0014C0r 3                               ; We found it. Remove wordlist id from stack.
0014C0r 3  E8                           inx
0014C1r 3  E8                           inx
0014C2r 3               
0014C2r 3                               ; It's a match! Replace TOS with nt
0014C2r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2
0014C4r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0014C6r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2+1
0014C8r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0014CAr 3               
0014CAr 3  60           z_int_to_name:  rts
0014CBr 3               
0014CBr 3               
0014CBr 3               
0014CBr 3               ; ## INVERT ( n -- n ) "Complement of TOS"
0014CBr 3               ; ## "invert"  auto  ANS core
0014CBr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/INVERT"""
0014CBr 3               xt_invert:
0014CBr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0014CEr 3               
0014CEr 3  A9 FF                        lda #$FF
0014D0r 3  55 00                        eor 0,x         ; LSB
0014D2r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0014D4r 3               
0014D4r 3  A9 FF                        lda #$FF
0014D6r 3  55 01                        eor 1,x         ; MSB
0014D8r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0014DAr 3               
0014DAr 3  60           z_invert:       rts
0014DBr 3               
0014DBr 3               
0014DBr 3               ; ## IS ( xt "name" -- ) "Set named word to execute xt"
0014DBr 3               ; ## "is"  auto  ANS core ext
0014DBr 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/IS"""
0014DBr 3               
0014DBr 3               xt_is:
0014DBr 3                               ; This is a state aware word with differet behavior
0014DBr 3                               ; when used while compiling vs interpreting.
0014DBr 3                               ; Check STATE
0014DBr 3  A5 rr                        lda state
0014DDr 3  05 rr                        ora state+1
0014DFr 3  F0 0C                        beq @interpreting
0014E1r 3               
0014E1r 3               @compiling:
0014E1r 3                               ; Run ['] to compile the xt of the next word as a literal.
0014E1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_bracket_tick
0014E4r 3               
0014E4r 3                               ; Postpone DEFER! by compiling a JSR to it.
0014E4r 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>xt_defer_store
0014E6r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<xt_defer_store
0014E8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
0014EBr 3               
0014EBr 3  80 06                        bra @done
0014EDr 3               
0014EDr 3               @interpreting:
0014EDr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_tick
0014F0r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_defer_store
0014F3r 3               @done:
0014F3r 3  60           z_is:           rts
0014F4r 3               
0014F4r 3               
0014F4r 3               
0014F4r 3               ; ## J ( -- n ) (R: n -- n ) "Copy second loop counter to stack"
0014F4r 3               ; ## "j"  auto  ANS core
0014F4r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/J
0014F4r 3                       ; Copy second loop counter from Return Stack to stack. Note we use
0014F4r 3                       ; a fudge factor for loop control; see the Control Flow section of
0014F4r 3                       ; the manual for more details.
0014F4r 3                       ; At this point, we have the "I" counter/limit and the LEAVE address
0014F4r 3                       ; on the stack above this (three entries), whereas the ideal Forth
0014F4r 3                       ; implementation would just have two.
0014F4r 3                       ;
0014F4r 3                       ; Make this native compiled for speed
0014F4r 3                       ; """
0014F4r 3               
0014F4r 3               xt_j:
0014F4r 3  CA                           dex
0014F5r 3  CA                           dex
0014F6r 3               
0014F6r 3                               ; Get the fudged index off from the stack. It's easier to
0014F6r 3                               ; do math on the stack directly than to pop and push stuff
0014F6r 3                               ; around
0014F6r 3  86 rr                        stx tmpdsp
0014F8r 3  BA                           tsx
0014F9r 3               
0014F9r 3  38                           sec
0014FAr 3  BD 07 01                     lda $0107,x     ; LSB
0014FDr 3  FD 09 01                     sbc $0109,x
001500r 3  A8                           tay
001501r 3               
001501r 3  BD 08 01                     lda $0108,x     ; MSB
001504r 3  FD 0A 01                     sbc $010A,x
001507r 3               
001507r 3  A6 rr                        ldx tmpdsp
001509r 3               
001509r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x         ; MSB of de-fudged index
00150Br 3  94 00                        sty 0,x         ; LSB of de-fudged index
00150Dr 3               
00150Dr 3  60           z_j:            rts
00150Er 3               
00150Er 3               
00150Er 3               
00150Er 3               ; ## KEY ( -- char ) "Get one character from the input"
00150Er 3               ; ## "key"  tested  ANS core
00150Er 3               xt_key:
00150Er 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/KEY
00150Er 3                       ; Get a single character of input from the vectored
00150Er 3                       ; input without echoing.
00150Er 3                       ; """
00150Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr key_a               ; returns char in A
001511r 3               
001511r 3  CA                           dex
001512r 3  CA                           dex
001513r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001515r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
001517r 3               
001517r 3  60           z_key:          rts
001518r 3               
001518r 3               key_a:
001518r 3                       ; The 65c02 doesn't have a JSR (ADDR,X) instruction like the
001518r 3                       ; 65816, so we have to fake the indirect jump to vector it.
001518r 3                       ; This is depressingly slow. We use this routine internally
001518r 3                       ; to avoid manipulating the Data Stack when we just want a
001518r 3                       ; character
001518r 3  6C rr rr                     jmp (input)             ; JSR/RTS
00151Br 3               
00151Br 3               
00151Br 3               ; ## LATESTNT ( -- nt ) "Push most recent nt to the stack"
00151Br 3               ; ## "latestnt"  auto  Tali Forth
00151Br 3                       ; """www.complang.tuwien.ac.at/forth/gforth/Docs-html/Name-token.html
00151Br 3                       ; The Gforth version of this word is called LATEST
00151Br 3                       ; """
00151Br 3               xt_latestnt:
00151Br 3  CA                           dex
00151Cr 3  CA                           dex
00151Dr 3               
00151Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr current_to_dp
001520r 3               
001520r 3  A5 rr                        lda dp
001522r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001524r 3  A5 rr                        lda dp+1
001526r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001528r 3               
001528r 3  60           z_latestnt:     rts
001529r 3               
001529r 3               
001529r 3               ; ## LATESTXT ( -- xt ) "Push most recent xt to the stack"
001529r 3               ; ## "latestxt"  auto  Gforth
001529r 3                       ; """http://www.complang.tuwien.ac.at/forth/gforth/Docs-html/Anonymous-Definitions.html"""
001529r 3               xt_latestxt:
001529r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_latestnt         ; ( nt )
00152Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_name_to_int      ; ( xt )
00152Fr 3               
00152Fr 3  60           z_latestxt:     rts
001530r 3               
001530r 3               
001530r 3               ; ## LEAVE ( -- ) "Leave DO/LOOP construct"
001530r 3               ; ## "leave"  auto  ANS core
001530r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/LEAVE
001530r 3                       ; Note that this does not work with anything but a DO/LOOP in
001530r 3                       ; contrast to other versions such as discussed at
001530r 3                       ; http://blogs.msdn.com/b/ashleyf/archive/2011/02/06/loopty-do-i-loop.aspx
001530r 3                       ;
001530r 3                       ;       : LEAVE POSTPONE BRANCH HERE SWAP 0 , ; IMMEDIATE COMPILE-ONLY
001530r 3                       ; See the Control Flow section in the manual for details of how this works.
001530r 3                       ; This must be native compile and not IMMEDIATE
001530r 3                       ; """
001530r 3               
001530r 3               xt_leave:
001530r 3                               ; We dump the limit/start entries off the Return Stack
001530r 3                               ; (four bytes)
001530r 3  68                           pla
001531r 3  68                           pla
001532r 3  68                           pla
001533r 3  68                           pla
001534r 3               
001534r 3  60                           rts             ; this must be compiled, so keep before z_leave
001535r 3               z_leave:                        ; not reached, not compiled
001535r 3               
001535r 3               
001535r 3               
001535r 3               ; ## LEFT_BRACKET ( -- ) "Enter interpretation state"
001535r 3               ; ## "["  auto  ANS core
001535r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Bracket
001535r 3                       ; This is an immediate and compile-only word
001535r 3                       ; """
001535r 3               xt_left_bracket:
001535r 3  64 rr                        stz state
001537r 3  64 rr                        stz state+1
001539r 3               
001539r 3  60           z_left_bracket: rts
00153Ar 3               
00153Ar 3               
00153Ar 3               ; ## LESS_NUMBER_SIGN ( -- ) "Start number conversion"
00153Ar 3               ; ## "<#"  auto  ANS core
00153Ar 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/num-start
00153Ar 3                       ; Start the process to create pictured numeric output.
00153Ar 3                       ;
00153Ar 3                       ; The new
00153Ar 3                       ; string is constructed from back to front, saving the new character
00153Ar 3                       ; at the beginning of the output string. Since we use PAD as a
00153Ar 3                       ; starting address and work backward (!), the string is constructed
00153Ar 3                       ; in the space between the end of the Dictionary (as defined by CP)
00153Ar 3                       ; and the PAD. This allows us to satisfy the ANS Forth condition that
00153Ar 3                       ; programs don't fool around with the PAD but still use its address.
00153Ar 3                       ; Based on pForth
00153Ar 3                       ; http://pforth.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/fth/numberio.fth
00153Ar 3                       ; pForth is in the pubic domain. Forth is : <# PAD HLD ! ; we use the
00153Ar 3                       ; internal variable tohold instead of HLD.
00153Ar 3                       ; """
00153Ar 3               xt_less_number_sign:
00153Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_pad      ; ( addr )
00153Dr 3               
00153Dr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00153Fr 3  85 rr                        sta tohold
001541r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
001543r 3  85 rr                        sta tohold+1
001545r 3               
001545r 3  E8                           inx
001546r 3  E8                           inx
001547r 3               
001547r 3               z_less_number_sign:
001547r 3  60                           rts
001548r 3               
001548r 3               ; ## LESS_THAN ( n m -- f ) "Return true if NOS < TOS"
001548r 3               ; ## "<"  auto  ANS core
001548r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/less"""
001548r 3               
001548r 3               xt_less_than:
001548r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
00154Br 3               
00154Br 3  A0 00                        ldy #0          ; default false
00154Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr compare_16bit
001550r 3               
001550r 3                               ; for signed numbers, NOS < TOS if Z=0 and N=0
001550r 3  F0 03                        beq @false
001552r 3  30 01                        bmi @false
001554r 3               
001554r 3                               ; true
001554r 3  88                           dey
001555r 3               @false:
001555r 3  98                           tya
001556r 3               
001556r 3  E8                           inx
001557r 3  E8                           inx
001558r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00155Ar 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00155Cr 3               
00155Cr 3  60           z_less_than:    rts
00155Dr 3               
00155Dr 3               
00155Dr 3               
00155Dr 3               ; ## LIST ( scr# -- ) "List the given screen"
00155Dr 3               ; ## "list"  tested  ANS block ext
00155Dr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/block/LIST"""
00155Dr 3               
00155Dr 3               xt_list:
00155Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
001560r 3               
001560r 3                               ; Save the screen number in SCR
001560r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_scr
001563r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_store
001566r 3               
001566r 3                               ; Use L from the editor-wordlist to display the screen.
001566r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_editor_l
001569r 3               
001569r 3  60           z_list:         rts
00156Ar 3               
00156Ar 3               
00156Ar 3               
00156Ar 3               ; ## LITERAL ( n -- ) "Store TOS to be push on stack during runtime"
00156Ar 3               ; ## "literal"  auto  ANS core
00156Ar 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/LITERAL
00156Ar 3                       ; Compile-only word to store TOS so that it is pushed on stack
00156Ar 3                       ; during runtime. This is a immediate, compile-only word. At runtime,
00156Ar 3                       ; it works by calling literal_runtime by compling JSR LITERAL_RT.
00156Ar 3                       ;
00156Ar 3                       ; Note the cmpl_ routines use TMPTOS
00156Ar 3                       ; """
00156Ar 3               xt_literal:
00156Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
00156Dr 3               
00156Dr 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>literal_runtime
00156Fr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<literal_runtime
001571r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
001574r 3               
001574r 3                               ; Compile the value that is to be pushed on the Stack during
001574r 3                               ; runtime
001574r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_comma
001577r 3               
001577r 3  60           z_literal:      rts
001578r 3               
001578r 3               literal_runtime:
001578r 3               
001578r 3                               ; During runtime, we push the value following this word back
001578r 3                               ; on the Data Stack. The subroutine jump that brought us
001578r 3                               ; here put the address to return to on the Return Stack -
001578r 3                               ; this points to the data we need to get. This routine is
001578r 3                               ; also called (LITERAL) in some Forths
001578r 3  CA                           dex
001579r 3  CA                           dex
00157Ar 3               
00157Ar 3                           	; The 65c02 stores <RETURN-ADDRESS>-1 on the Return Stack,
00157Ar 3                               ; so we are actually popping the address-1 of the literal
00157Ar 3  68                           pla             ; LSB
00157Br 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
00157Dr 3  68                           pla             ; MSB
00157Er 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
001580r 3               
001580r 3                               ; Fetch the actual literal value and push it on Data stack
001580r 3  A0 01                        ldy #1
001582r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y    ; LSB
001584r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001586r 3  C8                           iny
001587r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y    ; MSB
001589r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00158Br 3               
00158Br 3                               ; Adjust return address and push back on the Return Stack
00158Br 3  98                           tya
00158Cr 3  18                           clc
00158Dr 3  65 rr                        adc tmp1
00158Fr 3  A8                           tay
001590r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
001592r 3  69 00                        adc #0
001594r 3  48                           pha
001595r 3  5A                           phy
001596r 3               
001596r 3  60                           rts
001597r 3               
001597r 3               
001597r 3               
001597r 3               ; ## LOAD ( scr# -- ) "Load the Forth code in a screen/block"
001597r 3               ; ## "load"  auto  ANS block
001597r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/block/LOAD
001597r 3                       ;
001597r 3                       ; Note: LOAD current works because there is only one buffer.
001597r 3                       ; If/when multiple buffers are supported, we'll have to deal
001597r 3                       ; with the fact that it might re-load the old block into a
001597r 3                       ; different buffer.
001597r 3                       ; """
001597r 3               
001597r 3               xt_load:
001597r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
00159Ar 3               
00159Ar 3                               ; Save the current value of BLK on the return stack.
00159Ar 3  A0 01                        ldy #blk_offset+1
00159Cr 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
00159Er 3  48                           pha
00159Fr 3  88                           dey
0015A0r 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
0015A2r 3  48                           pha
0015A3r 3               
0015A3r 3                               ; Set BLK to the given block/screen number.
0015A3r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0015A5r 3  91 rr                        sta (up),y
0015A7r 3  C8                           iny
0015A8r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
0015AAr 3  91 rr                        sta (up),y
0015ACr 3               
0015ACr 3                               ; Load that block into a buffer
0015ACr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_block
0015AFr 3               
0015AFr 3                               ; Put 1024 on the stack for the screen length.
0015AFr 3  CA                           dex
0015B0r 3  CA                           dex
0015B1r 3  A9 04                        lda #4
0015B3r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0015B5r 3  74 00                        stz 0,x
0015B7r 3               
0015B7r 3                               ; Jump to a special evluate target. This bypasses the underflow
0015B7r 3                               ; check and skips the zeroing of BLK.
0015B7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr load_evaluate
0015BAr 3               
0015BAr 3                               ; Restore the value of BLK from before the LOAD command.
0015BAr 3  A0 00                        ldy #blk_offset
0015BCr 3  68                           pla
0015BDr 3  91 rr                        sta (up),y
0015BFr 3  C8                           iny
0015C0r 3  68                           pla
0015C1r 3  91 rr                        sta (up),y
0015C3r 3               
0015C3r 3                               ; If BLK is not zero, read it back into the buffer.
0015C3r 3                               ; A still has MSB
0015C3r 3  88                           dey
0015C4r 3  11 rr                        ora (up),y
0015C6r 3  F0 12                        beq @done
0015C8r 3               
0015C8r 3                               ; The block needs to be read back into the buffer.
0015C8r 3  CA                           dex
0015C9r 3  CA                           dex
0015CAr 3  A0 00                        ldy #blk_offset
0015CCr 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
0015CEr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0015D0r 3  C8                           iny
0015D1r 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
0015D3r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0015D5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_block
0015D8r 3               
0015D8r 3                               ; Drop the buffer address.
0015D8r 3  E8                           inx
0015D9r 3  E8                           inx
0015DAr 3               
0015DAr 3               @done:
0015DAr 3  60           z_load:         rts
0015DBr 3               
0015DBr 3               
0015DBr 3               
0015DBr 3               ; ## LOOP ( -- ) "Finish loop construct"
0015DBr 3               ; ## "loop"  auto  ANS core
0015DBr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/LOOP
0015DBr 3                       ; Compile-time part of LOOP. This does nothing more but push 1 on
0015DBr 3                       ; the stack and then call +LOOP.
0015DBr 3                       ;
0015DBr 3                       ; In Forth, this is
0015DBr 3                       ;       : LOOP  POSTPONE 1 POSTPONE (+LOOP) , POSTPONE UNLOOP ;
0015DBr 3                       ;       IMMEDIATE ; COMPILE-ONLY
0015DBr 3                       ; """
0015DBr 3               xt_loop:
0015DBr 3                               ; Have the finished word push 1 on the stack
0015DBr 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>xt_one
0015DDr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<xt_one
0015DFr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine     ; drop through to +LOOP
0015E2r 3               
0015E2r 3               
0015E2r 3               ; ## PLUS_LOOP ( -- ) "Finish loop construct"
0015E2r 3               ; ## "+loop"  auto  ANS core
0015E2r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/PlusLOOP
0015E2r 3                       ;
0015E2r 3                       ; Compile-time part of +LOOP, also used for LOOP. Is usually
0015E2r 3                       ;       : +LOOP POSTPONE (+LOOP) , POSTPONE UNLOOP ; IMMEDIATE
0015E2r 3                       ;       COMPILE-ONLY
0015E2r 3                       ; in Forth. LOOP uses this routine as well. We jump here with the
0015E2r 3                       ; address for looping as TOS and the address for aborting the loop
0015E2r 3                       ; (LEAVE) as the second double-byte entry on the Return Stack (see
0015E2r 3                       ; DO and the Control Flow section of the manual for details).
0015E2r 3                       ; """
0015E2r 3               
0015E2r 3               xt_plus_loop:
0015E2r 3                               ; Compile the run-time part. We do this with a short loop
0015E2r 3                               ; and not a call to COMPILE, because it has to be natively
0015E2r 3                               ; coded anyway.
0015E2r 3  A0 11                        ldy #plus_loop_runtime_end-plus_loop_runtime
0015E4r 3  5A                           phy             ; save counter to adjust CP
0015E5r 3               @1:
0015E5r 3  B9 rr rr                     lda plus_loop_runtime,y
0015E8r 3  91 rr                        sta (cp),y
0015EAr 3  88                           dey
0015EBr 3  10 F8                        bpl @1
0015EDr 3               
0015EDr 3                               ; Adjust CP
0015EDr 3  68                           pla
0015EEr 3  18                           clc
0015EFr 3  65 rr                        adc cp
0015F1r 3  85 rr                        sta cp
0015F3r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
0015F5r 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; only need carry
0015F7r 3  85 rr                        sta cp+1
0015F9r 3               
0015F9r 3                               ; The address we need to loop back to is TOS. Store it so
0015F9r 3                               ; the runtime part of +LOOP jumps back up there
0015F9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_comma
0015FCr 3               
0015FCr 3                               ; Compile an UNLOOP for when we're all done. This is a series
0015FCr 3                               ; of six PLA, so we just do it here instead jumping around
0015FCr 3                               ; all over the place
0015FCr 3  A9 68                        lda #$68                ; opcode for PLA
0015FEr 3  A0 06                        ldy #6
001600r 3               @2:
001600r 3  91 rr                        sta (cp),y
001602r 3  88                           dey
001603r 3  10 FB                        bpl @2
001605r 3               
001605r 3                               ; Adjust CP
001605r 3  A9 06                        lda #6
001607r 3  18                           clc
001608r 3  65 rr                        adc cp
00160Ar 3  85 rr                        sta cp
00160Cr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
00160Er 3  69 00                        adc #0                  ; only need carry
001610r 3  85 rr                        sta cp+1
001612r 3               
001612r 3                               ; Complete compile of DO/?DO by replacing the six
001612r 3                               ; dummy bytes by PHA instructions. The address where
001612r 3                               ; they are located is on the Data Stack
001612r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001614r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
001616r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
001618r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
00161Ar 3  E8                           inx
00161Br 3  E8                           inx
00161Cr 3               
00161Cr 3                               ; Because of the way that CP works, we don't have to save
00161Cr 3                               ; CP, but CP-1
00161Cr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
00161Er 3  38                           sec
00161Fr 3  E9 01                        sbc #1
001621r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2
001623r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
001625r 3  E9 00                        sbc #0
001627r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
001629r 3               
001629r 3                               ; now compile this in the DO/?DO routine
001629r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
00162Br 3               
00162Br 3  A9 A9                        lda #$A9        ; opcode for LDA immediate
00162Dr 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
00162Fr 3  C8                           iny
001630r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2+1      ; MSB
001632r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
001634r 3  C8                           iny
001635r 3  A9 48                        lda #$48        ; Opcode for PHA
001637r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
001639r 3  C8                           iny
00163Ar 3               
00163Ar 3  A9 A9                        lda #$A9        ; opcode for LDA immediate
00163Cr 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
00163Er 3  C8                           iny
00163Fr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2        ; LSB
001641r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
001643r 3  C8                           iny
001644r 3  A9 48                        lda #$48        ; Opcode for PHA
001646r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
001648r 3               z_loop:
001648r 3  60           z_plus_loop:    rts
001649r 3               
001649r 3               
001649r 3               plus_loop_runtime:
001649r 3                       ; """Runtime compile for loop control. This is used for both +LOOP and
001649r 3                       ; LOOP which are defined at high level. Note we use a fudge factor for
001649r 3                       ; loop control so we can test with the Overflow Flag. See
001649r 3                       ; the Control Flow section of the manual for details.
001649r 3                       ; The step value is TOS in the loop. This
001649r 3                       ; must always be native compiled. In some Forths, this is a separate
001649r 3                       ; word called (+LOOP) or (LOOP)
001649r 3                       ; """
001649r 3               
001649r 3  18                           clc
00164Ar 3  68                           pla             ; LSB of index
00164Br 3  75 00                        adc 0,x         ; LSB of step
00164Dr 3  A8                           tay             ; temporary storage of LSB
00164Er 3               
00164Er 3  B8                           clv
00164Fr 3  68                           pla             ; MSB of index
001650r 3  75 01                        adc 1,x         ; MSB of step
001652r 3  48                           pha             ; put MSB of index back on stack
001653r 3               
001653r 3  98                           tya             ; put LSB of index back on stack
001654r 3  48                           pha
001655r 3               
001655r 3  E8                           inx             ; dump step from TOS
001656r 3  E8                           inx
001657r 3               
001657r 3                               ; If V flag is set, we're done looping and continue
001657r 3                               ; after the +LOOP instruction
001657r 3  70 03                        bvs @hack+3     ; skip over JMP instruction
001659r 3               
001659r 3               @hack:          ; This is why this routine must be natively compiled: We
001659r 3                               ; compile the opcode for JMP here without an address to
001659r 3                               ; go to, which is added by the next next instruction of
001659r 3                               ; LOOP/+LOOP during compile time
001659r 3  4C                           .byte $4C
00165Ar 3               
00165Ar 3               plus_loop_runtime_end:
00165Ar 3               
00165Ar 3               
00165Ar 3               ; ## LSHIFT ( x u -- u ) "Shift TOS left"
00165Ar 3               ; ## "lshift"  auto  ANS core
00165Ar 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/LSHIFT"""
00165Ar 3               
00165Ar 3               xt_lshift:
00165Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
00165Dr 3               
00165Dr 3                               ; max shift 16 times
00165Dr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00165Fr 3  29 0F                        and #%00001111
001661r 3  F0 08                        beq @done
001663r 3               
001663r 3  A8                           tay
001664r 3               
001664r 3               @loop:
001664r 3  16 02                        asl 2,x
001666r 3  36 03                        rol 3,x
001668r 3  88                           dey
001669r 3  D0 F9                        bne @loop
00166Br 3               
00166Br 3               @done:
00166Br 3  E8                           inx
00166Cr 3  E8                           inx
00166Dr 3               
00166Dr 3  60           z_lshift:       rts
00166Er 3               
00166Er 3               
00166Er 3               
00166Er 3               ; ## M_STAR ( n n -- d ) "16 * 16 --> 32"
00166Er 3               ; ## "m*"  auto  ANS core
00166Er 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/MTimes
00166Er 3                       ; Multiply two 16 bit numbers, producing a 32 bit result. All
00166Er 3                       ; values are signed. Adapted from FIG Forth for Tali Forth.
00166Er 3                       ;
00166Er 3                       ; The original Forth is : M* OVER OVER XOR >R ABS SWAP ABS UM* R> D+- ;
00166Er 3                       ; with  : D+- O< IF DNEGATE THEN ;
00166Er 3                       ; """
00166Er 3               
00166Er 3               xt_m_star:
00166Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001671r 3               
001671r 3                               ; figure out the sign
001671r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB of n1
001673r 3  55 03                        eor 3,x         ; MSB of n2
001675r 3               
001675r 3                               ; UM* uses all kinds of temporary variables so we don't
001675r 3                               ; risk a conflict but just take the cycle hit and push
001675r 3                               ; this to the stack
001675r 3  48                           pha
001676r 3               
001676r 3                               ; get the absolute value of both numbers so we can feed
001676r 3                               ; them to UM*, which does the real work
001676r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_abs
001679r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
00167Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_abs
00167Fr 3               
00167Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_um_star          ; ( d )
001682r 3               
001682r 3                               ; handle the sign
001682r 3  68                           pla
001683r 3  10 03                        bpl @done
001685r 3               
001685r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dnegate
001688r 3               @done:
001688r 3  60           z_m_star:       rts
001689r 3               
001689r 3               
001689r 3               
001689r 3               ; ## MARKER ( "name" -- ) "Create a deletion boundry"
001689r 3               ; ## "marker"  auto  ANS core ext
001689r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/MARKER
001689r 3                       ; This word replaces FORGET in earlier Forths. Old entries are not
001689r 3                       ; actually deleted, but merely overwritten by restoring CP and DP.
001689r 3                       ; Run the named word at a later time to restore all of the wordlists
001689r 3                       ; to their state when the word was created with marker.  Any words
001689r 3                       ; created after the marker (including the marker) will be forgotten.
001689r 3                       ;
001689r 3                       ; To do this, we want to end up with something that jumps to a
001689r 3                       ; run-time component with a link to the original CP and DP values:
001689r 3                       ;
001689r 3                       ;       jsr marker_runtime
001689r 3                       ;       <Original CP MSB>
001689r 3                       ;       <Original CP LSB>
001689r 3                       ;       <Original DP MSB> ( for CURRENT wordlist )
001689r 3                       ;       <Original DP LSB>
001689r 3                       ;       < USER variables from offset 4 to 39 >
001689r 3                       ;
001689r 3                       ;       The user variables include:
001689r 3                       ;       CURRENT (byte variable)
001689r 3                       ;       <All wordlists> (currently 12) (cell array)
001689r 3                       ;       <#ORDER> (byte variable)
001689r 3                       ;       <All search order> (currently 9) (byte array)
001689r 3                       ;
001689r 3                       ; This code uses tmp1 and tmp2
001689r 3                       ; """
001689r 3               
001689r 3               xt_marker:
001689r 3                               ; Before we do anything, we need to save CP, which
001689r 3                               ; after all is the whole point of this operation. CREATE
001689r 3                               ; uses tmp1 and tmp2, so we take the speed hit and push stuff
001689r 3                               ; to the stack
001689r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr current_to_dp
00168Cr 3               
00168Cr 3  A5 rr                        lda dp
00168Er 3  48                           pha
00168Fr 3  A5 rr                        lda dp+1
001691r 3  48                           pha
001692r 3               
001692r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
001694r 3  48                           pha
001695r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
001697r 3  48                           pha
001698r 3               
001698r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_create
00169Br 3               
00169Br 3                               ; By default, CREATE installs a subroutine jump to DOVAR, which
00169Br 3                               ; we have to replace by a jump to marker_runtime. We back up
00169Br 3                               ; two bytes and then overwrite the address
00169Br 3  A5 rr                        lda cp          ; LSB
00169Dr 3  38                           sec
00169Er 3  E9 02                        sbc #2
0016A0r 3  85 rr                        sta cp
0016A2r 3               
0016A2r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1        ; MSB
0016A4r 3  E9 00                        sbc #0          ; we only care about the borrow
0016A6r 3  85 rr                        sta cp+1
0016A8r 3               
0016A8r 3                               ; Add the address of the runtime component
0016A8r 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>marker_runtime
0016AAr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<marker_runtime
0016ACr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
0016AFr 3               
0016AFr 3                               ; Add original CP as payload
0016AFr 3  7A                           ply                     ; MSB
0016B0r 3  68                           pla                     ; LSB
0016B1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
0016B4r 3               
0016B4r 3                               ; Add original DP as payload
0016B4r 3  7A                           ply                     ; MSB
0016B5r 3  68                           pla                     ; LSB
0016B6r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
0016B9r 3               
0016B9r 3                               ; Add the user variables for the wordlists and search order.
0016B9r 3                               ; We're compiling them in byte order.
0016B9r 3  A0 04                        ldy #4                  ; Start at CURRENT
0016BBr 3               @marker_loop:
0016BBr 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
0016BDr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a
0016C0r 3  C8                           iny
0016C1r 3  98                           tya
0016C2r 3  C9 28                        cmp #40                 ; One past the end of the search order.
0016C4r 3  D0 F5                        bne @marker_loop
0016C6r 3               
0016C6r 3  60           z_marker:       rts
0016C7r 3               
0016C7r 3               
0016C7r 3               
0016C7r 3               marker_runtime:
0016C7r 3                       ; """Restore Dictionary and memory (DP and CP) to where the were
0016C7r 3                       ; when this marker was defined. We arrive here with the return
0016C7r 3                       ; address on the Return Stack in the usual 65c02 format
0016C7r 3                       ; """
0016C7r 3               
0016C7r 3                               ; Get the address of the string address off the stack and
0016C7r 3                               ; increase by one because of the RTS mechanics
0016C7r 3  68                           pla
0016C8r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1        ; LSB of address
0016CAr 3  68                           pla
0016CBr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1      ; MSB of address
0016CDr 3               
0016CDr 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1
0016CFr 3  D0 02                        bne @1
0016D1r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1+1
0016D3r 3               @1:
0016D3r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
0016D5r 3               
0016D5r 3                               ; CP was stored first
0016D5r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
0016D7r 3  85 rr                        sta cp
0016D9r 3  C8                           iny
0016DAr 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
0016DCr 3  85 rr                        sta cp+1
0016DEr 3               
0016DEr 3                               ; Next was DP
0016DEr 3  C8                           iny
0016DFr 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
0016E1r 3  85 rr                        sta dp
0016E3r 3  C8                           iny
0016E4r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
0016E6r 3  85 rr                        sta dp+1
0016E8r 3               
0016E8r 3                               ; Conveniently, the offset into both tmp1 and UP is 4
0016E8r 3                               ; to start restoring the wordlists and search order.
0016E8r 3  A0 04                        ldy #4
0016EAr 3               
0016EAr 3               @marker_restore_loop:
0016EAr 3                               ; Copy from the dictionary back on top of the wordlists
0016EAr 3                               ; and search order.
0016EAr 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1), y
0016ECr 3  91 rr                        sta (up), y
0016EEr 3  C8                           iny
0016EFr 3  98                           tya
0016F0r 3  C9 28                        cmp #40                 ; One past the end of the search order.
0016F2r 3  D0 F6                        bne @marker_restore_loop
0016F4r 3               
0016F4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr dp_to_current       ; Move the CURRENT DP back.
0016F7r 3               
0016F7r 3                               ; The return instruction takes us back to the original caller
0016F7r 3  60                           rts
0016F8r 3               
0016F8r 3               
0016F8r 3               
0016F8r 3               ; ## MAX ( n n -- n ) "Keep larger of two numbers"
0016F8r 3               ; ## "max"  auto  ANS core
0016F8r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/MAX
0016F8r 3                       ; Compare TOS and NOS and keep which one is larger. Adapted from
0016F8r 3                       ; Lance A. Leventhal "6502 Assembly Language Subroutines". Negative
0016F8r 3                       ; Flag indicates which number is larger. See also
0016F8r 3                       ; http://6502.org/tutorials/compare_instructions.html and
0016F8r 3                       ; http://www.righto.com/2012/12/the-6502-overflow-flag-explained.html
0016F8r 3                       ; """
0016F8r 3               
0016F8r 3               xt_max:
0016F8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
0016FBr 3               
0016FBr 3                               ; Compare LSB. We do this first to set the carry flag
0016FBr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB of TOS
0016FDr 3  D5 02                        cmp 2,x         ; LSB of NOS, this sets the carry
0016FFr 3               
0016FFr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB of TOS
001701r 3  F5 03                        sbc 3,x         ; MSB of NOS
001703r 3  50 02                        bvc @no_overflow
001705r 3               
001705r 3                               ; handle overflow, because we use signed numbers
001705r 3  49 80                        eor #$80        ; complement negative flag
001707r 3               
001707r 3               @no_overflow:
001707r 3                               ; if negative, NOS is larger and needs to be kept
001707r 3  30 08                        bmi @keep_nos
001709r 3               
001709r 3                               ; move TOS to NOS
001709r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00170Br 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
00170Dr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
00170Fr 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
001711r 3               
001711r 3               @keep_nos:
001711r 3  E8                           inx
001712r 3  E8                           inx
001713r 3               
001713r 3  60           z_max:          rts
001714r 3               
001714r 3               
001714r 3               
001714r 3               ; ## MIN ( n n -- n ) "Keep smaller of two numbers"
001714r 3               ; ## "min"  auto  ANS core
001714r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/MIN
001714r 3                       ; Adapted from Lance A. Leventhal "6502 Assembly Language
001714r 3                       ; Subroutines." Negative Flag indicateds which number is larger. See
001714r 3                       ; http://www.righto.com/2012/12/the-6502-overflow-flag-explained.html
001714r 3                       ; """
001714r 3               
001714r 3               xt_min:
001714r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001717r 3               
001717r 3                               ; compare LSB. We do this first to set the carry flag
001717r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB of TOS
001719r 3  D5 02                        cmp 2,x         ; LSB of NOS, this sets carry
00171Br 3               
00171Br 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB of TOS
00171Dr 3  F5 03                        sbc 3,x         ; MSB of NOS
00171Fr 3  50 02                        bvc @no_overflow
001721r 3               
001721r 3                               ; handle overflow because we use signed numbers
001721r 3  49 80                        eor #$80
001723r 3               
001723r 3               @no_overflow:
001723r 3                               ; if negative, NOS is larger and needs to be dumped
001723r 3  10 08                        bpl @keep_nos
001725r 3               
001725r 3                               ; move TOS to NOS
001725r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001727r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
001729r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
00172Br 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
00172Dr 3               
00172Dr 3               @keep_nos:
00172Dr 3  E8                           inx
00172Er 3  E8                           inx
00172Fr 3               
00172Fr 3  60           z_min:          rts
001730r 3               
001730r 3               
001730r 3               
001730r 3               ; ## MINUS ( n n -- n ) "Subtract TOS from NOS"
001730r 3               ; ## "-"  auto  ANS core
001730r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Minus"""
001730r 3               xt_minus:
001730r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001733r 3               
001733r 3  38                           sec
001734r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; LSB
001736r 3  F5 00                        sbc 0,x
001738r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
00173Ar 3               
00173Ar 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x         ; MSB
00173Cr 3  F5 01                        sbc 1,x
00173Er 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
001740r 3               
001740r 3  E8                           inx
001741r 3  E8                           inx
001742r 3               
001742r 3  60           z_minus:        rts
001743r 3               
001743r 3               
001743r 3               ; ## MINUS_LEADING ( addr1 u1 -- addr2 u2 ) "Remove leading spaces"
001743r 3               ; ## "-leading"  auto  Tali String
001743r 3                       ; """Remove leading whitespace. This is the reverse of -TRAILING
001743r 3                       ; """
001743r 3               
001743r 3               xt_minus_leading:
001743r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001746r 3               
001746r 3               @loop:
001746r 3                               ; Quit if we were given an empty string. This also terminates
001746r 3                               ; the main loop
001746r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001748r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
00174Ar 3  F0 0F                        beq @done
00174Cr 3               
00174Cr 3  A1 02                        lda (2,x)               ; get first character
00174Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr is_whitespace
001751r 3  90 08                        bcc @done
001753r 3               
001753r 3                               ; It's whitespace, move one down
001753r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one              ; ( addr u 1 )
001756r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_slash_string     ; ( addr+ u-1 )
001759r 3               
001759r 3  80 EB                        bra @loop
00175Br 3               @done:
00175Br 3               z_minus_leading:
00175Br 3  60                           rts
00175Cr 3               
00175Cr 3               
00175Cr 3               
00175Cr 3               ; ## MINUS_TRAILING ( addr u1 -- addr u2 ) "Remove trailing spaces"
00175Cr 3               ; ## "-trailing"  auto  ANS string
00175Cr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/string/MinusTRAILING
00175Cr 3                       ; Remove trailing spaces
00175Cr 3                       ; """
00175Cr 3               
00175Cr 3               xt_minus_trailing:
00175Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
00175Fr 3               
00175Fr 3                               ; if length entry is zero, return a zero and leave the
00175Fr 3                               ; address part untouched
00175Fr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB of n
001761r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x         ; MSB of n
001763r 3  F0 33                        beq @done
001765r 3               
001765r 3                               ; Compute address of last char in tmp1 as
001765r 3                               ; addr + u1 - 1
001765r 3               
001765r 3                               ; addr + u1
001765r 3  18                           clc
001766r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; LSB of addr
001768r 3  75 00                        adc 0,x
00176Ar 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
00176Cr 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x         ; MSB of addr
00176Er 3  75 01                        adc 1,x
001770r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
001772r 3               
001772r 3                               ; - 1
001772r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
001774r 3  D0 02                        bne @1
001776r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmp1+1
001778r 3               @1:
001778r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmp1
00177Ar 3               
00177Ar 3               @loop:
00177Ar 3                               ; While spaces are found, move tmp1 backwards and
00177Ar 3                               ; decrease the count on the data stack.
00177Ar 3  B2 rr                        lda (tmp1)
00177Cr 3  C9 20                        cmp #AscSP
00177Er 3  D0 18                        bne @done
001780r 3               
001780r 3                               ; Move back one address.
001780r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
001782r 3  D0 02                        bne @2
001784r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmp1+1
001786r 3               @2:
001786r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmp1
001788r 3               
001788r 3                               ; Decrement count by one.
001788r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00178Ar 3  D0 02                        bne @3
00178Cr 3  D6 01                        dec 1,x
00178Er 3               @3:
00178Er 3  D6 00                        dec 0,x
001790r 3               
001790r 3                               ; Check if there are any characters left.
001790r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001792r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
001794r 3  F0 02                        beq @done       ; Count has reached zero - we're done!
001796r 3               
001796r 3  80 E2                        bra @loop
001798r 3               
001798r 3               @done:
001798r 3               z_minus_trailing:
001798r 3  60                           rts
001799r 3               
001799r 3               
001799r 3               
001799r 3               ; ## MOD ( n1 n2 -- n ) "Divide NOS by TOS and return the remainder"
001799r 3               ; ## "mod"  auto  ANS core
001799r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/MOD
001799r 3                       ;
001799r 3                       ; The Forth definition of this word is  : MOD /MOD DROP ;
001799r 3                       ; so we just jump to xt_slash_mod and dump the actual result.
001799r 3                       ; """
001799r 3               xt_mod:
001799r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
00179Cr 3               
00179Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_slash_mod
00179Fr 3               
00179Fr 3  E8                           inx             ; DROP
0017A0r 3  E8                           inx
0017A1r 3               z_mod:
0017A1r 3  60                           rts
0017A2r 3               
0017A2r 3               
0017A2r 3               ; ## MOVE ( addr1 addr2 u -- ) "Copy bytes"
0017A2r 3               ; ## "move"  auto  ANS core
