0017A2r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/MOVE
0017A2r 3                       ; Copy u "address units" from addr1 to addr2. Since our address
0017A2r 3                       ; units are bytes, this is just a front-end for CMOVE and CMOVE>. This
0017A2r 3                       ; is actually the only one of these three words that is in the CORE
0017A2r 3                       ; set.
0017A2r 3                       ;
0017A2r 3                       ; This word must not be natively compiled.
0017A2r 3                       ; """
0017A2r 3               
0017A2r 3               xt_move:
0017A2r 3                               ; We let CMOVE and CMOVE> check if there is underflow or
0017A2r 3                               ; we've been told to copy zero bytes
0017A2r 3               
0017A2r 3                               ; compare MSB first
0017A2r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x                 ; MSB of addr2
0017A4r 3  D5 05                        cmp 5,x                 ; MSB of addr1
0017A6r 3  F0 05                        beq @lsb                ; wasn't helpful, move to LSB
0017A8r 3  B0 0E                        bcs @to_move_up         ; we want CMOVE>
0017AAr 3               
0017AAr 3  4C rr rr                     jmp xt_cmove            ; JSR/RTS
0017ADr 3               
0017ADr 3               @lsb:
0017ADr 3                               ; MSB were equal, so do the whole thing over with LSB
0017ADr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x                 ; LSB of addr2
0017AFr 3  D5 04                        cmp 4,x                 ; LSB of addr1
0017B1r 3  F0 08                        beq @equal              ; LSB is equal as well
0017B3r 3  B0 03                        bcs @to_move_up         ; we want CMOVE>
0017B5r 3               
0017B5r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp xt_cmove            ; JSR/RTS
0017B8r 3               
0017B8r 3               @to_move_up:
0017B8r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp xt_cmove_up         ; JSR/RTS
0017BBr 3               @equal:
0017BBr 3                               ; drop three entries from Data Stack
0017BBr 3  8A                           txa
0017BCr 3  18                           clc
0017BDr 3  69 06                        adc #6
0017BFr 3  AA                           tax
0017C0r 3               
0017C0r 3  60           z_move:         rts
0017C1r 3               
0017C1r 3               
0017C1r 3               
0017C1r 3               ; ## NAME_TO_INT ( nt -- xt ) "Convert Name Token to Execute Token"
0017C1r 3               ; ## "name>int"  tested  Gforth
0017C1r 3                       ; """See
0017C1r 3                       ; https://www.complang.tuwien.ac.at/forth/gforth/Docs-html/Name-token.html
0017C1r 3                       ; """
0017C1r 3               
0017C1r 3               xt_name_to_int:
0017C1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0017C4r 3               
0017C4r 3                               ; The xt starts four bytes down from the nt
0017C4r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0017C6r 3  18                           clc
0017C7r 3  69 04                        adc #4
0017C9r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3
0017CBr 3               
0017CBr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
0017CDr 3  90 01                        bcc @done
0017CFr 3  1A                           inc
0017D0r 3               @done:
0017D0r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3+1
0017D2r 3               
0017D2r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
0017D4r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp3),y
0017D6r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0017D8r 3  C8                           iny
0017D9r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp3),y
0017DBr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0017DDr 3               
0017DDr 3  60           z_name_to_int:  rts
0017DEr 3               
0017DEr 3               
0017DEr 3               
0017DEr 3               ; ## NAME_TO_STRING ( nt -- addr u ) "Given a name token, return string of word"
0017DEr 3               ; ## "name>string"  tested  Gforth
0017DEr 3                       ; """http://www.complang.tuwien.ac.at/forth/gforth/Docs-html/Name-token.html"""
0017DEr 3               
0017DEr 3               xt_name_to_string:
0017DEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0017E1r 3               
0017E1r 3  CA                           dex
0017E2r 3  CA                           dex
0017E3r 3               
0017E3r 3                               ; the length of the string is the first byte of the
0017E3r 3                               ; header pointed to by nt
0017E3r 3  A1 02                        lda (2,x)
0017E5r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0017E7r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
0017E9r 3               
0017E9r 3                               ; the string itself always starts eight bytes down
0017E9r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; LSB
0017EBr 3  18                           clc
0017ECr 3  69 08                        adc #8
0017EEr 3  A8                           tay
0017EFr 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x         ; MSB
0017F1r 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; just need carry
0017F3r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
0017F5r 3  94 02                        sty 2,x
0017F7r 3               
0017F7r 3               z_name_to_string:
0017F7r 3  60                           rts
0017F8r 3               
0017F8r 3               
0017F8r 3               ; ## NC_LIMIT ( -- addr ) "Return address where NC-LIMIT value is kept"
0017F8r 3               ; ## "nc-limit"  tested  Tali Forth
0017F8r 3               
0017F8r 3               xt_nc_limit:
0017F8r 3  CA                           dex
0017F9r 3  CA                           dex
0017FAr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<nc_limit
0017FCr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0017FEr 3  A9 rr                        lda #>nc_limit
001800r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001802r 3               
001802r 3  60           z_nc_limit:     rts
001803r 3               
001803r 3               
001803r 3               
001803r 3               ; ## NEGATE ( n -- n ) "Two's complement"
001803r 3               ; ## "negate"  auto  ANS core
001803r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/NEGATE"""
001803r 3               xt_negate:
001803r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
001806r 3               
001806r 3  A9 00                	lda #0
001808r 3  38                           sec
001809r 3  F5 00                        sbc 0,x         ; LSB
00180Br 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00180Dr 3               
00180Dr 3  A9 00                        lda #0
00180Fr 3  F5 01                        sbc 1,x         ; MSB
001811r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001813r 3               
001813r 3  60           z_negate:       rts
001814r 3               
001814r 3               
001814r 3               ; ## NEVER_NATIVE ( -- ) "Flag last word as never natively compiled"
001814r 3               ; ## "never-native"  auto  Tali Forth
001814r 3               xt_never_native:
001814r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr current_to_dp
001817r 3  A0 01                        ldy #1          ; offset for status byte
001819r 3  B1 rr                        lda (dp),y
00181Br 3  09 08                        ora #NN         ; Make sure NN flag is set
00181Dr 3  29 FD                        and #$ff-AN     ; and AN flag is clear.
00181Fr 3  91 rr                        sta (dp),y
001821r 3               z_never_native:
001821r 3  60                           rts
001822r 3               
001822r 3               
001822r 3               ; ## NIP ( b a -- a ) "Delete NOS"
001822r 3               ; ## "nip"  auto  ANS core ext
001822r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/NIP"""
001822r 3               xt_nip:
001822r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001825r 3               
001825r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB
001827r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
001829r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB
00182Br 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
00182Dr 3               
00182Dr 3  E8                           inx
00182Er 3  E8                           inx
00182Fr 3               
00182Fr 3  60           z_nip:          rts
001830r 3               
001830r 3               
001830r 3               ; ## NOT_EQUALS ( n m -- f ) "Return a true flag if TOS != NOS"
001830r 3               ; ## "<>"  auto  ANS core ext
001830r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/ne
001830r 3                       ;
001830r 3                       ; This is just a variant of EQUAL, we code it separately
001830r 3                       ; for speed.
001830r 3                       ; """
001830r 3               
001830r 3               xt_not_equals:
001830r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001833r 3               
001833r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0                  ; default is true
001835r 3               
001835r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x                 ; LSB
001837r 3  D5 02                        cmp 2,x
001839r 3  D0 0A                        bne @not_equal
00183Br 3               
00183Br 3                               ; LSB is equal
00183Br 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x                 ; MSB
00183Dr 3  D5 03                        cmp 3,x
00183Fr 3  D0 04                        bne @not_equal
001841r 3               
001841r 3  A9 FF                        lda #$FF
001843r 3  80 01                        bra @done
001845r 3               
001845r 3               @not_equal:
001845r 3  88                           dey                     ; drop thru to done
001846r 3               
001846r 3               @done:
001846r 3  98                           tya
001847r 3  E8                           inx
001848r 3  E8                           inx
001849r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00184Br 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00184Dr 3               
00184Dr 3  60           z_not_equals:   rts
00184Er 3               
00184Er 3               
00184Er 3               
00184Er 3               ; ## NOT_ROTE ( a b c -- c a b ) "Rotate upwards"
00184Er 3               ; ## "-rot"  auto  Gforth
00184Er 3                       ; """http://www.complang.tuwien.ac.at/forth/gforth/Docs-html/Data-stack.html"""
00184Er 3               
00184Er 3               xt_not_rote:
00184Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_3
001851r 3               
001851r 3  B4 01                        ldy 1,x         ; MSB first
001853r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
001855r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001857r 3               
001857r 3  B5 05                        lda 5,x
001859r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
00185Br 3  94 05                        sty 5,x
00185Dr 3               
00185Dr 3  B4 00                        ldy 0,x         ; LSB second
00185Fr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
001861r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001863r 3               
001863r 3  B5 04                        lda 4,x
001865r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
001867r 3  94 04                        sty 4,x
001869r 3               
001869r 3  60           z_not_rote:     rts
00186Ar 3               
00186Ar 3               
00186Ar 3               
00186Ar 3               ; ## NUMBER ( addr u -- u | d ) "Convert a number string"
00186Ar 3               ; ## "number"  auto  Tali Forth
00186Ar 3                       ; """Convert a number string to a double or single cell number. This
00186Ar 3                       ; is a wrapper for >NUMBER and follows the convention set out in the
00186Ar 3                       ; "Forth Programmer's Handbook" (Conklin & Rather) 3rd edition p. 87.
00186Ar 3                       ; Based in part on the "Starting Forth" code
00186Ar 3                       ; https://www.forth.com/starting-forth/10-input-output-operators/
00186Ar 3                       ; Gforth uses S>NUMBER? and S>UNUMBER? which return numbers and a flag
00186Ar 3                       ; https://www.complang.tuwien.ac.at/forth/gforth/Docs-html/Number-Conversion.html
00186Ar 3                       ; Another difference to Gforth is that we follow ANS Forth that the
00186Ar 3                       ; dot to signal a double cell number is required to be the last
00186Ar 3                       ; character of the string.
00186Ar 3                       ;
00186Ar 3                       ; Number calls >NUMBER which in turn calls UM*,
00186Ar 3                       ; which uses tmp1, tmp2, and tmp3, so we can't use them here, which is
00186Ar 3                       ; a pain.
00186Ar 3                       ;"""
00186Ar 3               
00186Ar 3               xt_number:
00186Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
00186Dr 3               
00186Dr 3                               ; we keep the flags for sign and double in tmpdsp because
00186Dr 3                               ; we've run out of temporary variables
00186Dr 3  64 rr                        stz tmpdsp      ; flag for double
00186Fr 3  64 rr                        stz tmpdsp+1    ; flag for minus
001871r 3               
001871r 3                               ; If the first character is a minus, strip it off and set
001871r 3                               ; the flag
001871r 3  A1 02                        lda (2,x)
001873r 3  C9 2D                        cmp #$2D        ; ASCII for "-"
001875r 3  D0 0A                        bne @check_dot
001877r 3               
001877r 3                               ; It's a minus
001877r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmpdsp+1
001879r 3  F6 02                        inc 2,x         ; start one character later
00187Br 3  D0 02                        bne @1
00187Dr 3  F6 03                        inc 3,x
00187Fr 3               @1:
00187Fr 3  D6 00                        dec 0,x         ; decrease string length by one
001881r 3               
001881r 3               @check_dot:
001881r 3                               ; If the last character is a dot, strip it off and set a
001881r 3                               ; flag. We can use tmptos as a temporary variable
001881r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; LSB of address
001883r 3  18                           clc
001884r 3  75 00                        adc 0,x         ; length of string
001886r 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos
001888r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
00188Ar 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; only need carry
00188Cr 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos+1
00188Er 3               
00188Er 3                               ; tmptos now points to the first character after the string,
00188Er 3                               ; but we need the last character
00188Er 3  A5 rr                        lda tmptos
001890r 3  D0 02                        bne @2
001892r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmptos+1
001894r 3               @2:
001894r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmptos
001896r 3               
001896r 3  B2 rr                        lda (tmptos)
001898r 3  C9 2E                        cmp #'.'
00189Ar 3  D0 04                        bne @main
00189Cr 3               
00189Cr 3                               ; We have a dot, which means this is a double number. Flag
00189Cr 3                               ; the fact and reduce string length by one
00189Cr 3  C6 rr                        dec tmpdsp
00189Er 3  D6 00                        dec 0,x
0018A0r 3               
0018A0r 3               @main:
0018A0r 3                               ; Set up stack for subroutine jump to >NUMBER, which means
0018A0r 3                               ; we have to go ( addr u --> ud addr u )
0018A0r 3  CA                           dex
0018A1r 3  CA                           dex
0018A2r 3  CA                           dex
0018A3r 3  CA                           dex
0018A4r 3               
0018A4r 3  B5 04                        lda 4,x         ; LSB of length
0018A6r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0018A8r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; MSB, max length 255 chars
0018AAr 3               
0018AAr 3  B5 06                        lda 6,x         ; LSB of address
0018ACr 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
0018AEr 3  B5 07                        lda 7,x         ; MSB of address
0018B0r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
0018B2r 3               
0018B2r 3  74 04                        stz 4,x         ; clear space for ud
0018B4r 3  74 05                        stz 5,x
0018B6r 3  74 06                        stz 6,x
0018B8r 3  74 07                        stz 7,x
0018BAr 3               
0018BAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_number        ; (ud addr u -- ud addr u )
0018BDr 3               
0018BDr 3                               ; test length of returned string, which should be zero
0018BDr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0018BFr 3  F0 15                        beq @all_converted
0018C1r 3               
0018C1r 3                               ; Something went wrong, we still have characters left over,
0018C1r 3                               ; so we print an error and abort. If the NUMBER was called
0018C1r 3                               ; by INTERPRET, we've already checked for Forth words, so
0018C1r 3                               ; we're in deep trouble one way or another
0018C1r 3  A9 3E                        lda #$3E        ; ASCII for ">"
0018C3r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0018C6r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
0018C9r 3  A9 3C                        lda #$3C        ; ASCII for "<"
0018CBr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0018CEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
0018D1r 3               
0018D1r 3  A9 08                        lda #err_syntax
0018D3r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp error
0018D6r 3               
0018D6r 3               @all_converted:
0018D6r 3                               ; We can drop the string info
0018D6r 3  E8                           inx
0018D7r 3  E8                           inx
0018D8r 3  E8                           inx
0018D9r 3  E8                           inx
0018DAr 3               
0018DAr 3                               ; We have a double-cell number on the Data Stack that might
0018DAr 3                               ; actually have a minus and might actually be single-cell
0018DAr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmpdsp      ; flag for double
0018DCr 3  F0 0D                        beq @single
0018DEr 3               
0018DEr 3                               ; Set status bit 5 to indicate this is a double number
0018DEr 3  A9 20                        lda #%00100000
0018E0r 3  04 rr                        tsb status
0018E2r 3               
0018E2r 3                               ; This is a double cell number. If it had a minus, we'll have
0018E2r 3                               ; to negate it
0018E2r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmpdsp+1
0018E4r 3  F0 12                        beq @done       ; no minus, all done
0018E6r 3               
0018E6r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dnegate
0018E9r 3               
0018E9r 3  80 0D                        bra @done
0018EBr 3               
0018EBr 3               @single:
0018EBr 3                               ; This is a single number, so we just drop the top cell
0018EBr 3  E8                           inx
0018ECr 3  E8                           inx
0018EDr 3               
0018EDr 3                               ; Clear status bit 5 to indicate this is a single number
0018EDr 3  A9 20                        lda #%00100000
0018EFr 3  14 rr                        trb status
0018F1r 3               
0018F1r 3                               ; If we had a minus, we'll have to negate it
0018F1r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmpdsp+1
0018F3r 3  F0 03                        beq @done       ; no minus, all done
0018F5r 3               
0018F5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_negate
0018F8r 3               @done:
0018F8r 3  60           z_number:       rts
0018F9r 3               
0018F9r 3               
0018F9r 3               
0018F9r 3               ; ## NUMBER_SIGN ( ud -- ud ) "Add character to pictured output string"
0018F9r 3               ; ## "#"  auto  ANS core
0018F9r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/num
0018F9r 3                       ; Add one char to the beginning of the pictured output string.
0018F9r 3                       ;
0018F9r 3                       ; Based on
0018F9r 3                       ; https://github.com/philburk/pforth/blob/master/fth/numberio.fth
0018F9r 3                       ; Forth code  BASE @ UD/MOD ROT 9 OVER < IF 7 + THEN [CHAR] 0 + HOLD ;
0018F9r 3                       ; """
0018F9r 3               xt_number_sign:
0018F9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2         ; double number
0018FCr 3               
0018FCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_base
0018FFr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch            ; ( ud1 base )
001902r 3               
001902r 3                               ; The following code is the ancient Forth word UD/MOD, which in
001902r 3                               ; various Forths (including Gforth) lives on under the hood,
001902r 3                               ; even though it's not an ANS standard word, it doesn't appear
001902r 3                               ; in the docs, it's only used here, and there are no tests for
001902r 3                               ; it. This is why we got rid of it. We'll be converting this
001902r 3                               ; mess to something more sane in the long run.
001902r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_r             ; >r
001905r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero             ; 0
001908r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_fetch          ; r@
00190Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_um_slash_mod     ; um/mod
00190Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_rot              ; rot
001911r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_rot              ; rot
001914r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_from           ; r>
001917r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_um_slash_mod     ; um/mod
00191Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_rot              ; rot
00191Dr 3                               ; end of UD/MOD ( rem ud )
00191Dr 3               
00191Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_rot              ; ( ud rem )
001920r 3               
001920r 3                               ; Convert the number that is left over to an ASCII character. We
001920r 3                               ; use a string lookup for speed. Use either abc_str_lower for
001920r 3                               ; lower case or abc_str_upper for upper case (prefered)
001920r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001922r 3  A8                           tay
001923r 3  B9 rr rr                     lda s_abc_upper,y
001926r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001928r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x                 ; paranoid; now ( ud char )
00192Ar 3               
00192Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_hold
00192Dr 3               
00192Dr 3               z_number_sign:
00192Dr 3  60                           rts
00192Er 3               
00192Er 3               
00192Er 3               ; ## NUMBER_SIGN_GREATER ( d -- addr u ) "Finish pictured number conversion"
00192Er 3               ; ## "#>"  auto  ANS core
00192Er 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/num-end
00192Er 3                       ; Finish conversion of pictured number string, putting address and
00192Er 3                       ; length on the Data Stack.
00192Er 3                       ;
00192Er 3                       ; Original Fort is  2DROP HLD @ PAD OVER -
00192Er 3                       ; Based on
00192Er 3                       ; https://github.com/philburk/pforth/blob/master/fth/numberio.fth
00192Er 3                       ; """
00192Er 3               xt_number_sign_greater:
00192Er 3               
00192Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2         ; double number
001931r 3               
001931r 3                               ; The start address lives in tohold
001931r 3  A5 rr                        lda tohold
001933r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; LSB of tohold
001935r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
001937r 3  A5 rr                        lda tohold+1
001939r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x         ; MSB of addr
00193Br 3  95 03                        sta 3,x         ; ( addr addr )
00193Dr 3               
00193Dr 3                               ; The length of the string is pad - addr
00193Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_pad      ; ( addr addr pad )
001940r 3               
001940r 3  38                           sec
001941r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB of pad address
001943r 3  F5 02                        sbc 2,x
001945r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
001947r 3               
001947r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB, which should always be zero
001949r 3  F5 03                        sbc 3,x
00194Br 3  95 03                        sta 3,x         ; ( addr u pad )
00194Dr 3               
00194Dr 3  E8                           inx
00194Er 3  E8                           inx
00194Fr 3               
00194Fr 3               z_number_sign_greater:
00194Fr 3  60                           rts
001950r 3               
001950r 3               
001950r 3               ; ## NUMBER_SIGN_S ( d -- addr u ) "Completely convert pictured output"
001950r 3               ; ## "#s"  auto  ANS core
001950r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/numS
001950r 3                       ; Completely convert number for pictured numerical output.
001950r 3                       ;
001950r 3                       ; Based on
001950r 3                       ; https://github.com/philburk/pforth/blob/master/fth/system.fth
001950r 3                       ; Original Forth code  BEGIN # 2DUP OR 0= UNTIL
001950r 3                       ; """
001950r 3               
001950r 3               xt_number_sign_s:
001950r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001953r 3               @loop:
001953r 3                               ; convert a single number ("#")
001953r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign
001956r 3               
001956r 3                               ; stop when double-celled number in TOS is zero:
001956r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001958r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
00195Ar 3  15 02                        ora 2,x
00195Cr 3  15 03                        ora 3,x
00195Er 3  D0 F3                        bne @loop
001960r 3               
001960r 3               z_number_sign_s:
001960r 3  60                           rts
001961r 3               
001961r 3               
001961r 3               
001961r 3               ; ## OF (C: -- of-sys) (x1 x2 -- |x1) "Conditional flow control"
001961r 3               ; ## "of"  auto  ANS core ext
001961r 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/OF"""
001961r 3               
001961r 3               xt_of:
001961r 3                               ; Check if value is equal to this case.
001961r 3                               ; Postpone over (eg. compile a jsr to it)
001961r 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>xt_over
001963r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<xt_over
001965r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
001968r 3               
001968r 3                               ; Postpone = (EQUAL), that is, compile a jsr to it
001968r 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>xt_equal
00196Ar 3  A9 rr                        lda #<xt_equal
00196Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
00196Fr 3               
00196Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_if
001972r 3               
001972r 3                               ; If it's true, consume the original value.
001972r 3                               ; Postpone DROP (eg. compile a jsr to it)
001972r 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>xt_drop
001974r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<xt_drop
001976r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
001979r 3               
001979r 3  60           z_of:           rts
00197Ar 3               
00197Ar 3               
00197Ar 3               
00197Ar 3               ; ## ONE ( -- n ) "Push the number 1 to the Data Stack"
00197Ar 3               ; ## "1"  auto  Tali Forth
00197Ar 3                       ; """This is also the code for EDITOR-WORDLIST"""
00197Ar 3               xt_editor_wordlist:
00197Ar 3               xt_one:
00197Ar 3  CA                           dex
00197Br 3  CA                           dex
00197Cr 3  A9 01                        lda #1
00197Er 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001980r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
001982r 3               
001982r 3               z_editor_wordlist:
001982r 3               z_one:
001982r 3  60                           rts
001983r 3               
001983r 3               
001983r 3               ; ## ONE_MINUS ( u -- u-1 ) "Decrease TOS by one"
001983r 3               ; ## "1-"  auto  ANS core
001983r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/OneMinus"""
001983r 3               
001983r 3               xt_one_minus:
001983r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
001986r 3               
001986r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001988r 3  D0 02                        bne @1
00198Ar 3  D6 01                        dec 1,x
00198Cr 3               @1:
00198Cr 3  D6 00                        dec 0,x
00198Er 3               
00198Er 3  60           z_one_minus:    rts
00198Fr 3               
00198Fr 3               
00198Fr 3               
00198Fr 3               ; ## ONE_PLUS ( u -- u+1 ) "Increase TOS by one"
00198Fr 3               ; ## "1+"  auto  ANS core
00198Fr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/OnePlus
00198Fr 3                       ;
00198Fr 3                       ; Code is shared with CHAR-PLUS
00198Fr 3                       ; """
00198Fr 3               
00198Fr 3               xt_char_plus:
00198Fr 3               xt_one_plus:
00198Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
001992r 3               
001992r 3  F6 00                        inc 0,x
001994r 3  D0 02                        bne @done
001996r 3  F6 01                        inc 1,x
001998r 3               
001998r 3               @done:
001998r 3               z_char_plus:
001998r 3  60           z_one_plus:     rts
001999r 3               
001999r 3               
001999r 3               
001999r 3               ; ## ONLY ( -- ) "Set earch order to minimum wordlist"
001999r 3               ; ## "only"  auto  ANS search ext
001999r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/search/ONLY"""
001999r 3               
001999r 3               xt_only:
001999r 3                               ; Put -1 on data stack.
001999r 3  CA                           dex
00199Ar 3  CA                           dex
00199Br 3  A9 FF                        lda #$FF
00199Dr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00199Fr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0019A1r 3               
0019A1r 3                               ; Invoke set-order to set the minimum search order.
0019A1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_set_order
0019A4r 3               
0019A4r 3  60           z_only:         rts
0019A5r 3               
0019A5r 3               
0019A5r 3               
0019A5r 3               ; ## OR ( m n -- n ) "Logically OR TOS and NOS"
0019A5r 3               ; ## "or"  auto  ANS core
0019A5r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/OR"
0019A5r 3               xt_or:
0019A5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
0019A8r 3               
0019A8r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0019AAr 3  15 02                        ora 2,x
0019ACr 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
0019AEr 3               
0019AEr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
0019B0r 3  15 03                        ora 3,x
0019B2r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
0019B4r 3               
0019B4r 3  E8                           inx
0019B5r 3  E8                           inx
0019B6r 3               
0019B6r 3  60           z_or:           rts
0019B7r 3               
0019B7r 3               
0019B7r 3               ; ## ORDER ( -- ) "Print current word order list and current WID"
0019B7r 3               ; ## "order"  auto  ANS core
0019B7r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/search/ORDER
0019B7r 3                       ; Note the search order is displayed from first search to last
0019B7r 3                       ; searched and is therefore exactly the reverse of the order in which
0019B7r 3                       ; Forth stacks are displayed.
0019B7r 3                       ;
0019B7r 3                       ; A Forth implementation of this word is:
0019B7r 3                       ;
0019B7r 3                       ; 	: .wid ( wid -- )
0019B7r 3                       ; 	dup 0=  if ." Forth "  drop    else
0019B7r 3                       ; 	dup 1 = if ." Editor " drop    else
0019B7r 3                       ; 	dup 2 = if ." Assembler " drop else
0019B7r 3                       ; 	dup 3 = if ." Root " drop      else
0019B7r 3                       ; 	           . ( just print the number )
0019B7r 3                       ; 	then then then then ;
0019B7r 3                       ;
0019B7r 3                       ; : ORDER ( -- )
0019B7r 3                       ; 	cr get-order 0 ?do .wid loop
0019B7r 3                       ; 	space space get-current .wid ;
0019B7r 3                       ;
0019B7r 3                       ; This is an interactive program, so speed
0019B7r 3                       ; is not as important as size. We assume we do not have more than 255
0019B7r 3                       ; wordlists.
0019B7r 3                       ; """
0019B7r 3               
0019B7r 3               xt_order:
0019B7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
0019BAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_get_order        ; ( wid_n ... wid_1 n )
0019BDr 3               
0019BDr 3                               ; Paranoid: Check if there are no wordlists, a rather
0019BDr 3                               ; pathological case. this would mean ( 0 ) on the stack. In
0019BDr 3                               ; that case, we just drop n and run
0019BDr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x                 ; assumes no more than 255 wordlists
0019BFr 3  F0 1E                        beq @drop_done
0019C1r 3               
0019C1r 3               @have_wordlists:
0019C1r 3                               ; We arrive here with the LSB of TOS in A, the number of WIDs
0019C1r 3                               ; on the stack
0019C1r 3  A8                           tay
0019C2r 3               @loop:
0019C2r 3  E8                           inx
0019C3r 3  E8                           inx                     ; DROP, now ( wid_n ... wid_1 )
0019C4r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0019C6r 3               
0019C6r 3  5A                           phy
0019C7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr _print_wid_string   ; internal helper function
0019CAr 3  7A                           ply
0019CBr 3               
0019CBr 3  88                           dey
0019CCr 3  D0 F4                        bne @loop
0019CEr 3               
0019CEr 3                               ; We've printed the wordlists, now we add the current wordlist.
0019CEr 3                               ; This follows the convention of Gforth
0019CEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
0019D1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
0019D4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_get_current      ; ( wid )
0019D7r 3               
0019D7r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0019D9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr _print_wid_string
0019DCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
0019DFr 3               
0019DFr 3               @drop_done:
0019DFr 3  E8                           inx
0019E0r 3  E8                           inx
0019E1r 3               z_order:
0019E1r 3  60                           rts
0019E2r 3               
0019E2r 3               _print_wid_string:
0019E2r 3                       ; """Helper function for ORDER: Given a WID in A, print the
0019E2r 3                       ; corresponding string. If there is no such word list defined, just
0019E2r 3                       ; print the number. Assumes we will not have more than 256 WIDs; also
0019E2r 3                       ; assumes we have just loaded A so Z reflects status of byte.  In
0019E2r 3                       ; theory, we could speed this up by having the WID be the same as the
0019E2r 3                       ; number of the strings. However, ORDER is used rather infrequently and
0019E2r 3                       ; this would make changes to the strings.asm file very dangerous, so we
0019E2r 3                       ; follow the slightly more complicated route with a translation table.
0019E2r 3                       ; """
0019E2r 3                               ; If the WID is larger than 3, we have no string avaliable and
0019E2r 3                               ; just print the number.
0019E2r 3                               ; See http://6502.org/tutorials/compare_instructions.html
0019E2r 3                               ; for details
0019E2r 3  C9 04                        cmp #4
0019E4r 3  90 09                        bcc @output_string      ; less than 4, print a real string
0019E6r 3               
0019E6r 3                               ; Our WID is not less than 4, that is, 4 or larger. We just
0019E6r 3                               ; print the number
0019E6r 3  CA                           dex
0019E7r 3  CA                           dex
0019E8r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0019EAr 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
0019ECr 3  4C rr rr                     jmp xt_u_dot            ; JSR/RTS as this routine is not compiled
0019EFr 3               
0019EFr 3               @output_string:
0019EFr 3                               ; Get the string number based on WID 0 to 3
0019EFr 3  A8                           tay
0019F0r 3  B9 rr rr                     lda @wid_data,y
0019F3r 3               
0019F3r 3                               ; Print without a line feed
0019F3r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp print_string_no_lf  ; JSR/RTS as this routine is not compiled
0019F6r 3               
0019F6r 3               @wid_data:
0019F6r 3                       ; Table of string numbers (see strings.asm) indexed by the WID if
0019F6r 3                       ; less than 4.
0019F6r 3  03                   .byte str_wid_forth            ; WID 0: "Forth"
0019F7r 3  06                   .byte str_wid_editor           ; WID 1: "Editor"
0019F8r 3  07                   .byte str_wid_assembler        ; WID 2: "Assembler"
0019F9r 3  08                   .byte str_wid_root             ; WID 3: "Root"
0019FAr 3               
0019FAr 3               
0019FAr 3               
0019FAr 3               ; ## OUTPUT ( -- addr ) "Return the address of the EMIT vector address"
0019FAr 3               ; ## "output"  tested  Tali Forth
0019FAr 3               xt_output:
0019FAr 3                       ; """Return the address where the jump target for EMIT is stored (but
0019FAr 3                       ; not the vector itself). By default, this will hold the value of
0019FAr 3                       ; kernel_putc routine, but this can be changed by the user, hence this
0019FAr 3                       ; routine.
0019FAr 3                       ; """
0019FAr 3  CA                           dex
0019FBr 3  CA                           dex
0019FCr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<output
0019FEr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001A00r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>output
001A02r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001A04r 3               
001A04r 3  60           z_output:       rts
001A05r 3               
001A05r 3               
001A05r 3               ; ## OVER ( b a -- b a b ) "Copy NOS to TOS"
001A05r 3               ; ## "over"  auto  ANS core
001A05r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/OVER"""
001A05r 3               xt_over:
001A05r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001A08r 3               
001A08r 3  CA                           dex
001A09r 3  CA                           dex
001A0Ar 3               
001A0Ar 3  B5 04                        lda 4,x         ; LSB
001A0Cr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001A0Er 3  B5 05                        lda 5,x         ; MSB
001A10r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001A12r 3               
001A12r 3  60           z_over:         rts
001A13r 3               
001A13r 3               
001A13r 3               ; ## PAD ( -- addr ) "Return address of user scratchpad"
001A13r 3               ; ## "pad"  auto  ANS core ext
001A13r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/PAD
001A13r 3                       ; Return address to a temporary area in free memory for user. Must
001A13r 3                       ; be at least 84 bytes in size (says ANS). It is located relative to
001A13r 3                       ; the compile area pointer (CP) and therefore varies in position.
001A13r 3                       ; This area is reserved for the user and not used by the system
001A13r 3                       ; """
001A13r 3               xt_pad:
001A13r 3  CA                           dex
001A14r 3  CA                           dex
001A15r 3               
001A15r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
001A17r 3  18                           clc
001A18r 3  69 FF                        adc #padoffset  ; assumes padoffset one byte in size
001A1Ar 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001A1Cr 3               
001A1Cr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
001A1Er 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; only need carry
001A20r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001A22r 3               
001A22r 3  60           z_pad:          rts
001A23r 3               
001A23r 3               
001A23r 3               ; ## PAGE ( -- ) "Clear the screen"
001A23r 3               ; ## "page"  tested  ANS facility
001A23r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/facility/PAGE
001A23r 3                       ; Clears a page if supported by ANS terminal codes. This is
001A23r 3                       ; Clear Screen ("ESC[2J") plus moving the cursor to the top
001A23r 3                       ; left of the screen
001A23r 3                       ; """
001A23r 3               xt_page:
001A23r 3  A9 1B                        lda #AscESC
001A25r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
001A28r 3  A9 5B                        lda #$5B        ; ASCII for "["
001A2Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
001A2Dr 3  A9 32                        lda #'2'
001A2Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
001A32r 3  A9 4A                        lda #'J'
001A34r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
001A37r 3               
001A37r 3                               ; move cursor to top left of screen
001A37r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero
001A3Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero
001A3Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_at_xy
001A40r 3               
001A40r 3  60           z_page:         rts
001A41r 3               
001A41r 3               
001A41r 3               ; ## PAREN ( -- ) "Discard input up to close paren ( comment )"
001A41r 3               ; ## "("  auto  ANS core
001A41r 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/p"""
001A41r 3               
001A41r 3               xt_paren:
001A41r 3                               ; Put a right paren on the stack.
001A41r 3  CA                           dex
001A42r 3  CA                           dex
001A43r 3  A9 29                        lda #41     ; Right parenthesis
001A45r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001A47r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
001A49r 3               
001A49r 3                               ; Call parse.
001A49r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_parse
001A4Cr 3               
001A4Cr 3                               ; Throw away the result.
001A4Cr 3  E8                           inx
001A4Dr 3  E8                           inx
001A4Er 3  E8                           inx
001A4Fr 3  E8                           inx
001A50r 3               
001A50r 3  60           z_paren:        rts
001A51r 3               
001A51r 3               
001A51r 3               
001A51r 3               ; ## PARSE_NAME ( "name" -- addr u ) "Parse the input"
001A51r 3               ; ## "parse-name"  auto  ANS core ext
001A51r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/PARSE-NAME
001A51r 3                       ; Find next word in input string, skipping leading whitespace. This is
001A51r 3                       ; a special form of PARSE and drops through to that word. See PARSE
001A51r 3                       ; for more detail. We use this word internally for the interpreter
001A51r 3                       ; because it is a lot easier to use. Reference implementations at
001A51r 3                       ; http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/PARSE-NAME and
001A51r 3                       ; http://www.forth200x.org/reference-implementations/parse-name.fs
001A51r 3                       ; Roughly, the word is comparable to BL WORD COUNT. -- Note that
001A51r 3                       ; though the ANS standard talks about skipping "spaces", whitespace
001A51r 3                       ; is actually perfectly legal (see for example
001A51r 3                       ; http://forth-standard.org/standard/usage#subsubsection.3.4.1.1).
001A51r 3                       ; Otherwise, PARSE-NAME chokes on tabs.
001A51r 3                       ; """
001A51r 3               
001A51r 3               xt_parse_name:
001A51r 3                               ; To enable the compilation of the high-level Forth words
001A51r 3                               ; in forth-words.asm and user-words.asm at boot time,
001A51r 3                               ; PARSE-NAME and PARSE must be able to deal with 16-bit string
001A51r 3                               ; lengths. This is a pain on an 8-bit machine. The pointer
001A51r 3                               ; to the current location is in toin (>IN). We need to check,
001A51r 3                               ; worst case, the characters from cib+toin to cib+ciblen, and
001A51r 3                               ; we can't just use Y as an index.
001A51r 3               
001A51r 3                               ; The counter is CIBLEN-TOIN and stored in tmp1
001A51r 3  A5 rr                        lda ciblen              ; LSB of counter
001A53r 3  38                           sec
001A54r 3  E5 rr                        sbc toin
001A56r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
001A58r 3  A5 rr                        lda ciblen+1            ; MSB
001A5Ar 3  E5 rr                        sbc toin+1
001A5Cr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
001A5Er 3               
001A5Er 3                               ; Check the result for zero (TOIN is equal to CIBLEN)
001A5Er 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
001A60r 3  05 rr                        ora tmp1+1
001A62r 3  F0 28                        beq @empty_line
001A64r 3               
001A64r 3                               ; We walk through the characters starting at CIB+TOIN, so we
001A64r 3                               ; save a temp version of that in tmp2
001A64r 3  A5 rr                        lda cib
001A66r 3  18                           clc
001A67r 3  65 rr                        adc toin
001A69r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2                ; LSB of first character
001A6Br 3  A5 rr                        lda cib+1
001A6Dr 3  65 rr                        adc toin+1
001A6Fr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1              ; MSB
001A71r 3               
001A71r 3               @skip_loop:
001A71r 3  B2 rr                        lda (tmp2)              ; work copy of cib
001A73r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr is_whitespace
001A76r 3  90 1F                        bcc @char_found
001A78r 3               
001A78r 3                               ; Char is still whitespace, continue
001A78r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp2
001A7Ar 3  D0 02                        bne @2
001A7Cr 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp2+1
001A7Er 3               @2:
001A7Er 3                               ; Adjust counter
001A7Er 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
001A80r 3  D0 02                        bne @3
001A82r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmp1+1
001A84r 3               @3:
001A84r 3  C6 rr                        dec tmp1
001A86r 3               
001A86r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
001A88r 3  05 rr                        ora tmp1+1
001A8Ar 3  D0 E5                        bne @skip_loop          ; fall through if empty line
001A8Cr 3               
001A8Cr 3               @empty_line:
001A8Cr 3                               ; Neither the ANS Forth nor the Gforth documentation say
001A8Cr 3                               ; what to return as an address if a string with only
001A8Cr 3                               ; spaces is given. For speed reasons, we just return junk
001A8Cr 3                               ; NOS, with the TOS zero as per standard
001A8Cr 3  CA                           dex
001A8Dr 3  CA                           dex
001A8Er 3  CA                           dex
001A8Fr 3  CA                           dex
001A90r 3               
001A90r 3  74 00                        stz 0,x                 ; TOS is zero
001A92r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
001A94r 3               
001A94r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp z_parse_name        ; skip over PARSE
001A97r 3               
001A97r 3               @char_found:
001A97r 3                               ; We arrive here with tmp2 pointing to the first non-space
001A97r 3                               ; character. This is where the word really starts, so
001A97r 3                               ; we use it to calculate the new >IN by subtracting
001A97r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2
001A99r 3  38                           sec
001A9Ar 3  E5 rr                        sbc cib
001A9Cr 3  85 rr                        sta toin
001A9Er 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2+1
001AA0r 3  E5 rr                        sbc cib+1
001AA2r 3  85 rr                        sta toin+1
001AA4r 3               
001AA4r 3                               ; prepare Data Stack for PARSE by adding space
001AA4r 3                               ; as the delimiter
001AA4r 3  CA                           dex
001AA5r 3  CA                           dex
001AA6r 3               
001AA6r 3  A9 20                        lda #AscSP
001AA8r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001AAAr 3  74 01                        stz 1,x                 ; paranoid, now ( "name" c )
001AACr 3               
001AACr 3               
001AACr 3               ; ## PARSE ( "name" c -- addr u ) "Parse input with delimiter character"
001AACr 3               ; ## "parse"  tested  ANS core ext
001AACr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/PARSE
001AACr 3                       ; Find word in input string delimited by character given. Do not
001AACr 3                       ; skip leading delimiters -- this is the main difference to PARSE-NAME.
001AACr 3                       ; PARSE and PARSE-NAME replace WORD in modern systems. ANS discussion
001AACr 3                       ; http://www.forth200x.org/documents/html3/rationale.html#rat:core:PARSE
001AACr 3                       ;
001AACr 3                       ;
001AACr 3                       ;     cib  cib+toin   cib+ciblen
001AACr 3                       ;      v      v            v
001AACr 3                       ;     |###################|
001AACr 3                       ;
001AACr 3                       ;     |------>|  toin (>IN)
001AACr 3                       ;     |------------------->|  ciblen
001AACr 3                       ;
001AACr 3                       ; The input string is stored starting at the address in the Current
001AACr 3                       ; Input Buffer (CIB), the length of which is in CIBLEN. While searching
001AACr 3                       ; for the delimiter, TOIN (>IN) points to the where we currently are.
001AACr 3                       ; Since PARSE does not skip leading delimiters, we assume we are on a
001AACr 3                       ; useful string if there are any characters at all. As with
001AACr 3                       ; PARSE-NAME, we must be able to handle strings with a length of
001AACr 3                       ; 16-bit for EVALUTE, which is a pain on an 8-bit machine.
001AACr 3                       ; """
001AACr 3               
001AACr 3               xt_parse:
001AACr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
001AAFr 3               
001AAFr 3                               ; If the input buffer is empty, we just return
001AAFr 3  A5 rr                        lda ciblen
001AB1r 3  05 rr                        ora ciblen+1
001AB3r 3  F0 0C                        beq @abort_parse
001AB5r 3               
001AB5r 3                               ; If the pointer >IN is larger or equal to the length of
001AB5r 3                               ; the input buffer (CIBLEN), the line is done. Put
001AB5r 3                               ; differently, we only continue if >IN is smaller than
001AB5r 3                               ; CIBLEN
001AB5r 3  A5 rr                        lda toin+1              ; MSB
001AB7r 3  C5 rr                        cmp ciblen+1
001AB9r 3  90 0E                        bcc @go_parse           ; unsigned comparison
001ABBr 3               
001ABBr 3  A5 rr                        lda toin                ; LSB
001ABDr 3  C5 rr                        cmp ciblen
001ABFr 3  90 08                        bcc @go_parse
001AC1r 3               
001AC1r 3               @abort_parse:
001AC1r 3                               ; Sorry, this line is over
001AC1r 3  CA                           dex
001AC2r 3  CA                           dex
001AC3r 3  74 00                        stz 0,x
001AC5r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
001AC7r 3               
001AC7r 3  80 7A                        bra @done
001AC9r 3               @go_parse:
001AC9r 3                               ; We actually have work to do. Save the delimiter in
001AC9r 3                               ; tmptos.
001AC9r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001ACBr 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos
001ACDr 3               
001ACDr 3                               ; We can now prepare the Data Stack for the return value
001ACDr 3  CA                           dex
001ACEr 3  CA                           dex
001ACFr 3               
001ACFr 3                               ; tmp1 is CIB+TOIN, the beginning of the current string
001ACFr 3                               ; tmp2 is initially the same as tmp1, then the work index
001ACFr 3                               ; tmp3 is CIB+CIBLEN, one char past the end of the string
001ACFr 3               
001ACFr 3                               ; Calculate the beginning of the string, which is also the
001ACFr 3                               ; address to return
001ACFr 3  A5 rr                        lda cib
001AD1r 3  18                           clc
001AD2r 3  65 rr                        adc toin        ; LSB
001AD4r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
001AD6r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2
001AD8r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
001ADAr 3               
001ADAr 3  A5 rr                        lda cib+1
001ADCr 3  65 rr                        adc toin+1      ; MSB
001ADEr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
001AE0r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
001AE2r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
001AE4r 3               
001AE4r 3                               ; Calculate the address where the input buffer ends plus 1, so
001AE4r 3                               ; we can compare it with TOIN, which is an index
001AE4r 3  A5 rr                        lda cib
001AE6r 3  18                           clc
001AE7r 3  65 rr                        adc ciblen
001AE9r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3
001AEBr 3  A5 rr                        lda cib+1
001AEDr 3  65 rr                        adc ciblen+1
001AEFr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp3+1
001AF1r 3               
001AF1r 3                               ; Initialize the offset we use to adjust EOL or found delimiter
001AF1r 3  64 rr                        stz tmptos+1
001AF3r 3               @loop:
001AF3r 3                               ; If we are at the end of the string, quit
001AF3r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2
001AF5r 3  C5 rr                        cmp tmp3
001AF7r 3  D0 06                        bne @not_empty
001AF9r 3               
001AF9r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2+1
001AFBr 3  C5 rr                        cmp tmp3+1
001AFDr 3  F0 1D                        beq @eol
001AFFr 3               @not_empty:
001AFFr 3                               ; We have to do this the hard way. In fact, it's really
001AFFr 3                               ; hard since if we are dealing with a SPACE, the standard
001AFFr 3                               ; wants us to skip all whitespace, not just spaces. Otherwise,
001AFFr 3                               ; Tali would choke on tabs between words. For details, see
001AFFr 3                               ; http://forth-standard.org/standard/file#subsection.11.3.5
001AFFr 3                               ; In theory, we could make this faster by defining a delimiter
001AFFr 3                               ; that is 00 as the sign that we skip all whitespace, thereby
001AFFr 3                               ; avoiding having to test every time. However, somebody,
001AFFr 3                               ; somewhere might want to parse a zero-delimited list. Since
001AFFr 3                               ; any byte value could be chosen for that, we just test for
001AFFr 3                               ; a space every single time for the moment.
001AFFr 3  B2 rr                        lda (tmp2)
001B01r 3               
001B01r 3  A4 rr                        ldy tmptos
001B03r 3  C0 20                        cpy #AscSP
001B05r 3  D0 07                        bne @not_whitespace
001B07r 3               
001B07r 3                               ; The delimiter is a space, so we're looking for all
001B07r 3                               ; whitespace
001B07r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr is_whitespace
001B0Ar 3  90 02                        bcc @not_whitespace
001B0Cr 3  80 0C                        bra @found_delimiter
001B0Er 3               
001B0Er 3               @not_whitespace:
001B0Er 3                               ; The delimiter is not a space, so we're looking for
001B0Er 3                               ; whatever it is
001B0Er 3  C5 rr                        cmp tmptos
001B10r 3  F0 08                        beq @found_delimiter
001B12r 3               
001B12r 3                               ; Not a delimiter, next character
001B12r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp2
001B14r 3  D0 DD                        bne @loop
001B16r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp2+1
001B18r 3  80 D9                        bra @loop
001B1Ar 3               
001B1Ar 3               @found_delimiter:
001B1Ar 3                               ; Increase the offset: If we've found a delimiter, we want
001B1Ar 3                               ; TOIN to point to the character after it, not the delimiter
001B1Ar 3                               ; itself
001B1Ar 3  E6 rr                        inc tmptos+1
001B1Cr 3               @eol:
001B1Cr 3                               ; The length of the new string is tmp2-tmp1
001B1Cr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2
001B1Er 3  38                           sec
001B1Fr 3  E5 rr                        sbc tmp1
001B21r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001B23r 3               
001B23r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2+1
001B25r 3  E5 rr                        sbc tmp1+1
001B27r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001B29r 3               
001B29r 3                               ; The new offset is tmp2-cib
001B29r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2
001B2Br 3  38                           sec
001B2Cr 3  E5 rr                        sbc cib
001B2Er 3  85 rr                        sta toin
001B30r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2+1
001B32r 3  E5 rr                        sbc cib+1
001B34r 3  85 rr                        sta toin+1
001B36r 3               
001B36r 3                               ; Add in the delimiter
001B36r 3  A5 rr                        lda toin
001B38r 3  18                           clc
001B39r 3  65 rr                        adc tmptos+1
001B3Br 3  85 rr                        sta toin
001B3Dr 3  A5 rr                        lda toin+1
001B3Fr 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; we only need the carry
001B41r 3  85 rr                        sta toin+1
001B43r 3               @done:
001B43r 3               z_parse_name:
001B43r 3  60           z_parse:        rts
001B44r 3               
001B44r 3               
001B44r 3               
001B44r 3               ; ## PICK ( n n u -- n n n ) "Move element u of the stack to TOS"
001B44r 3               ; ## "pick"  auto  ANS core ext
001B44r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/PICK
001B44r 3                       ; Take the u-th element out of the stack and put it on TOS,
001B44r 3                       ; overwriting the original TOS. 0 PICK is equivalent to DUP, 1 PICK to
001B44r 3                       ; OVER. Note that using PICK is considered poor coding form. Also note
001B44r 3                       ; that FIG Forth has a different behavior for PICK than ANS Forth.
001B44r 3                       ; """
001B44r 3               
001B44r 3               xt_pick:
001B44r 3                               ; Checking for underflow is difficult because it depends on
001B44r 3                               ; which element we want to grab. We could probably figure
001B44r 3                               ; something out, but it wouldn't work with underflow stripping
001B44r 3                               ; Since using PICK is considered poor form anyway, we just
001B44r 3                               ; leave it as it is
001B44r 3  16 00                        asl 0,x         ; we assume u < 128 (stack is small)
001B46r 3  8A                           txa
001B47r 3  75 00                        adc 0,x
001B49r 3  A8                           tay
001B4Ar 3               
001B4Ar 3  B9 02 00                     lda 0002,y
001B4Dr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001B4Fr 3  B9 03 00                     lda 0003,y
001B52r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001B54r 3               
001B54r 3  60           z_pick:         rts
001B55r 3               
001B55r 3               
001B55r 3               
001B55r 3               ; ## PLUS ( n n -- n ) "Add TOS and NOS"
001B55r 3               ; ## "+"  auto  ANS core
001B55r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Plus"""
001B55r 3               xt_plus:
001B55r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001B58r 3               
001B58r 3  18                           clc
001B59r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB
001B5Br 3  75 02                        adc 2,x
001B5Dr 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
001B5Fr 3               
001B5Fr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB. No CLC, conserve carry bit
001B61r 3  75 03                        adc 3,x
001B63r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
001B65r 3               
001B65r 3  E8                           inx
001B66r 3  E8                           inx
001B67r 3               
001B67r 3  60           z_plus:         rts
001B68r 3               
001B68r 3               
001B68r 3               ; ## PLUS_STORE ( n addr -- ) "Add number to value at given address"
001B68r 3               ; ## "+!"  auto  ANS core
001B68r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/PlusStore"""
001B68r 3               xt_plus_store:
001B68r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
001B6Br 3               
001B6Br 3                               ; move address to tmp1 so we can work with it
001B6Br 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001B6Dr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
001B6Fr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
001B71r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
001B73r 3               
001B73r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0          ; LSB
001B75r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
001B77r 3  18                           clc
001B78r 3  75 02                        adc 2,x
001B7Ar 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
001B7Cr 3               
001B7Cr 3  C8                           iny             ; MSB
001B7Dr 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
001B7Fr 3  75 03                        adc 3,x
001B81r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
001B83r 3               
001B83r 3  E8                           inx
001B84r 3  E8                           inx
001B85r 3  E8                           inx
001B86r 3  E8                           inx
001B87r 3               
001B87r 3  60           z_plus_store:   rts
001B88r 3               
001B88r 3               
001B88r 3               ; ## POSTPONE ( -- ) "Change IMMEDIATE status (it's complicated)"
001B88r 3               ; ## "postpone"  auto   ANS core
001B88r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/POSTPONE
001B88r 3                       ; Add the compilation behavior of a word to a new word at
001B88r 3                       ; compile time. If the word that follows it is immediate, include
001B88r 3                       ; it so that it will be compiled when the word being defined is
001B88r 3                       ; itself used for a new word. Tricky, but very useful.
001B88r 3                       ;
001B88r 3                       ; Because POSTPONE expects a word (not an xt) in the input stream (not
001B88r 3                       ; on the Data Stack). This means we cannot build words with
001B88r 3                       ; "jsr xt_postpone, jsr <word>" directly.
001B88r 3                       ; """
001B88r 3               
001B88r 3               xt_postpone:
001B88r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_parse_name               ; ( -- addr n )
001B8Br 3               
001B8Br 3                               ; if there was no word provided, complain and quit
001B8Br 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001B8Dr 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
001B8Fr 3  D0 05                        bne @1
001B91r 3               
001B91r 3  A9 05                        lda #err_noname
001B93r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp error
001B96r 3               @1:
001B96r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_find_name                ; ( -- nt | 0 )
001B99r 3               
001B99r 3                               ; if word not in Dictionary, complain and quit
001B99r 3  D0 05                        bne @2
001B9Br 3  A9 05                        lda #err_noname
001B9Dr 3  4C rr rr                     jmp error
001BA0r 3               
001BA0r 3               @2:
001BA0r 3                               ; keep a copy of nt for later
001BA0r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001BA2r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
001BA4r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
001BA6r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
001BA8r 3               
001BA8r 3                               ; We need the xt instead of the nt
001BA8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_name_to_int              ; ( nt -- xt )
001BABr 3               
001BABr 3                               ; See if this is an immediate word. This is easier
001BABr 3                               ; with nt than with xt. The status byte of the word
001BABr 3                               ; is nt+1
001BABr 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1
001BADr 3  D0 02                        bne @3
001BAFr 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1+1
001BB1r 3               @3:
001BB1r 3  B2 rr                        lda (tmp1)
001BB3r 3  29 04                        and #IM         ; mask all but Intermediate flag
001BB5r 3  F0 05                        beq @not_immediate
001BB7r 3               
001BB7r 3                               ; We're immediate, so instead of executing it right now, we
001BB7r 3                               ; compile it. xt is TOS, so this is easy. The RTS at the end
001BB7r 3                               ; takes us back to the original caller
001BB7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_compile_comma
001BBAr 3  80 0A                        bra @done
001BBCr 3               
001BBCr 3               @not_immediate:
001BBCr 3                               ; This is not an immediate word, so we enact "deferred
001BBCr 3                               ; compilation" by including ' <NAME> COMPILE, which we do by
001BBCr 3                               ; compiling the run-time routine of LITERAL, the xt itself, and
001BBCr 3                               ; a subroutine jump to COMPILE,
001BBCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_literal
001BBFr 3               
001BBFr 3                               ; Last, compile COMPILE,
001BBFr 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>xt_compile_comma
001BC1r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<xt_compile_comma
001BC3r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
001BC6r 3               @done:
001BC6r 3  60           z_postpone:     rts
001BC7r 3               
001BC7r 3               
001BC7r 3               
001BC7r 3               ; ## PREVIOUS ( -- ) "Remove the first wordlist in the search order"
001BC7r 3               ; ## "previous"  auto  ANS search ext
001BC7r 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/search/PREVIOUS"""
001BC7r 3               
001BC7r 3               xt_previous:
001BC7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_get_order
001BCAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_nip
001BCDr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus
001BD0r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_set_order
001BD3r 3               
001BD3r 3  60           z_previous:     rts
001BD4r 3               
001BD4r 3               
001BD4r 3               
001BD4r 3               ; ## QUESTION ( addr -- ) "Print content of a variable"
001BD4r 3               ; ## "?"  tested  ANS tools
001BD4r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/tools/q
001BD4r 3                       ;
001BD4r 3                       ; Only used interactively. Since humans are so slow, we
001BD4r 3                       ; save size and just go for the subroutine jumps
001BD4r 3                       ; """
001BD4r 3               xt_question:
001BD4r 3                               ; FETCH takes care of underflow check
001BD4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch
001BD7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dot
001BDAr 3               
001BDAr 3  60           z_question:     rts
001BDBr 3               
001BDBr 3               
001BDBr 3               ; ## QUESTION_DUP ( n -- 0 | n n ) "Duplicate TOS non-zero"
001BDBr 3               ; ## "?dup"  auto  ANS core
001BDBr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/qDUP"""
001BDBr 3               
001BDBr 3               xt_question_dup:
001BDBr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
001BDEr 3               
001BDEr 3                               ; Check if TOS is zero
001BDEr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001BE0r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
001BE2r 3  F0 0A                        beq @done
001BE4r 3               
001BE4r 3                               ; not zero, duplicate
001BE4r 3  CA                           dex
001BE5r 3  CA                           dex
001BE6r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
001BE8r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001BEAr 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
001BECr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001BEEr 3               @done:
001BEEr 3  60           z_question_dup: rts
001BEFr 3               
001BEFr 3               
001BEFr 3               
001BEFr 3               ; ## R_FETCH ( -- n ) "Get copy of top of Return Stack"
001BEFr 3               ; ## "r@"  auto  ANS core
001BEFr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/RFetch
001BEFr 3                       ; This word is Compile Only in Tali Forth, though Gforth has it
001BEFr 3                       ; work normally as well
001BEFr 3                       ;
001BEFr 3                       ; An alternative way to write this word
001BEFr 3                       ; would be to access the elements on the stack directly like 2R@
001BEFr 3                       ; does, these versions should be compared at some point.
001BEFr 3                       ; """
001BEFr 3               xt_r_fetch:
001BEFr 3                               ; get the return address
001BEFr 3  7A                           ply             ; LSB
001BF0r 3  84 rr                        sty tmp1
001BF2r 3  7A                           ply             ; MSB
001BF3r 3               
001BF3r 3                               ; --- CUT FOR NATIVE COMPILE ---
001BF3r 3               
001BF3r 3                               ; get the actual top of Return Stack
001BF3r 3  CA                           dex
001BF4r 3  CA                           dex
001BF5r 3               
001BF5r 3  68                           pla             ; LSB
001BF6r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001BF8r 3  68                           pla             ; MSB
001BF9r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001BFBr 3               
001BFBr 3                               ; now we have to put that value back
001BFBr 3  48                           pha
001BFCr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
001BFEr 3  48                           pha
001BFFr 3               
001BFFr 3                               ; --- CUT FOR NATIVE COMPILE ---
001BFFr 3               
001BFFr 3                               ; restore return value
001BFFr 3  5A                           phy             ; MSB
001C00r 3  A4 rr                        ldy tmp1
001C02r 3  5A                           phy             ; LSB
001C03r 3               
001C03r 3  60           z_r_fetch:      rts
001C04r 3               
001C04r 3               
001C04r 3               ; ## R_FROM ( -- n )(R: n --) "Move top of Return Stack to TOS"
001C04r 3               ; ## "r>"  auto  ANS core
001C04r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Rfrom
001C04r 3                       ; Move Top of Return Stack to Top of Data Stack.
001C04r 3                       ;
001C04r 3                       ; We have to move
001C04r 3                       ; the RTS address out of the way first. This word is handled
001C04r 3                       ; differently for native and and subroutine compilation, see COMPILE,
001C04r 3                       ; This is a compile-only word
001C04r 3                       ; """
001C04r 3               
001C04r 3               xt_r_from:
001C04r 3                               ; Rescue the address of the return jump that is currently
001C04r 3                               ; on top of the Return Stack. If this word is natively
001C04r 3                               ; compiled, this is a total waste of time
001C04r 3  68                           pla             ; LSB
001C05r 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos
001C07r 3  7A                           ply             ; MSB
001C08r 3               
001C08r 3                               ; --- CUT FOR NATIVE CODING ---
001C08r 3               
001C08r 3  CA                           dex
001C09r 3  CA                           dex
001C0Ar 3               
001C0Ar 3                               ; now we can access the actual data
001C0Ar 3               
001C0Ar 3  68                           pla             ; LSB
001C0Br 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
001C0Dr 3  68                           pla             ; MSB
001C0Er 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
001C10r 3               
001C10r 3                               ; --- CUT FOR NATIVE CODING ---
001C10r 3               
001C10r 3                               ; restore the return address
001C10r 3  5A                           phy             ; MSB
001C11r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmptos
001C13r 3  48                           pha             ; LSB
001C14r 3               
001C14r 3  60           z_r_from:       rts
001C15r 3               
001C15r 3               
001C15r 3               ; ## R_TO_INPUT ( -- ) ( R: n n n n -- ) "Restore input state from Return Stack"
001C15r 3               ; ## "r>input"  tested  Tali Forth
001C15r 3                       ; """Restore the current input state as defined by insrc, cib, ciblen,
001C15r 3                       ; and toin from the Return Stack.
001C15r 3                       ;
001C15r 3                       ; See INPUT_TO_R for a discussion of this word. Uses tmp1
001C15r 3                       ; """
001C15r 3               
001C15r 3               xt_r_to_input:
001C15r 3               
001C15r 3                               ; We arrive here with the return address on the top of the
001C15r 3                               ; 65c02's stack. We need to move it out of the way first
001C15r 3  68                           pla
001C16r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
001C18r 3  68                           pla
001C19r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
001C1Br 3               
001C1Br 3                               ; This assumes that insrc is the first of eight bytes and
001C1Br 3                               ; toin+1 the last in the sequence we want to save from the Zero
001C1Br 3                               ; Page. Since we went in reverse order, insrc is now on the top
001C1Br 3                               ; of the Return Stack.
001C1Br 3  A0 00                        ldy #0
001C1Dr 3               @loop:
001C1Dr 3  68                           pla
001C1Er 3  99 rr rr                     sta insrc,y
001C21r 3  C8                           iny
001C22r 3  C0 08                        cpy #8
001C24r 3  D0 F7                        bne @loop
001C26r 3               
001C26r 3                               ; Restore address for return jump
001C26r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
001C28r 3  48                           pha
001C29r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
001C2Br 3  48                           pha
001C2Cr 3               
001C2Cr 3  60           z_r_to_input: 	rts
001C2Dr 3               
001C2Dr 3               
001C2Dr 3               
001C2Dr 3               ; ## RECURSE ( -- ) "Copy recursive call to word being defined"
001C2Dr 3               ; ## "recurse"  auto  ANS core
001C2Dr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/RECURSE
001C2Dr 3                       ;
