002166r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; overwrite TOS
002168r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; paranoid
00216Ar 3               
00216Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_hold
00216Dr 3               @done:
00216Dr 3  60           z_sign:         rts
00216Er 3               
00216Er 3               
00216Er 3               
00216Er 3               ; ## SLASH ( n1 n2 -- n ) "Divide NOS by TOS"
00216Er 3               ; ## "/"  auto  ANS core
00216Er 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Div
00216Er 3                       ;
00216Er 3                       ; Forth code is either  >R S>D R> FM/MOD SWAP DROP
00216Er 3                       ; or >R S>D R> SM/REM SWAP DROP -- we use SM/REM in Tali Forth.
00216Er 3                       ; This code is currently unoptimized. This code without the SLASH
00216Er 3                       ; DROP at the end is /MOD, so we share the code as far as possible.
00216Er 3                       ; """
00216Er 3               
00216Er 3               xt_slash:
00216Er 3                               ; With all the multiplication going on, it would be hard to
00216Er 3                               ; make sure that one of our temporary variables is not
00216Er 3                               ; overwritten. We make sure that doesn't happen by taking the
00216Er 3                               ; hit of pushing the flag to the 65c02's stack
00216Er 3  A9 00                        lda #0
002170r 3  48                           pha
002171r 3  80 03                        bra _common
002173r 3               
002173r 3               xt_slash_mod:
002173r 3                               ; Note that /MOD accesses this code
002173r 3  A9 FF                        lda #$FF
002175r 3  48                           pha             ; falls through to _common
002176r 3               
002176r 3               _common:
002176r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_r             ; >R
002179r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_s_to_d           ; S>D
00217Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_from           ; R>
00217Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_sm_slash_rem     ; SM/REM
002182r 3               
002182r 3                               ; Get the flag back from the 65c02's stack. Zero is SLASH,
002182r 3                               ; $FF is SLASH MOD
002182r 3  68                           pla
002183r 3  D0 05                        bne @done
002185r 3               
002185r 3                               ; The following code is for SLASH only
002185r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
002188r 3  E8                           inx             ; DROP
002189r 3  E8                           inx
00218Ar 3               @done:
00218Ar 3               z_slash_mod:
00218Ar 3  60           z_slash:        rts
00218Br 3               
00218Br 3               
00218Br 3               
00218Br 3               ; ## SLASH_MOD ( n1 n2 -- n3 n4 ) "Divide NOS by TOS with a remainder"
00218Br 3               ; ## "/mod"  auto  ANS core
00218Br 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/DivMOD
00218Br 3                       ;
00218Br 3                       ; This is a dummy entry, the actual code is shared with SLASH
00218Br 3                       ; """
00218Br 3               
00218Br 3               
00218Br 3               ; ## SLASH_STRING ( addr u n -- addr u ) "Shorten string by n"
00218Br 3               ; ## "/string"  auto  ANS string
00218Br 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/string/DivSTRING
00218Br 3                       ;
00218Br 3                       ; Forth code is
00218Br 3                       ; : /STRING ( ADDR U N -- ADDR U ) ROT OVER + ROT ROT - ;
00218Br 3                       ; Put differently, we need to add TOS and 3OS, and subtract
00218Br 3                       ; TOS from NOS, and then drop TOS
00218Br 3                       ; """
00218Br 3               
00218Br 3               xt_slash_string:
00218Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_3
00218Er 3               
00218Er 3  18                           clc             ; 3OS+TOS
00218Fr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002191r 3  75 04                        adc 4,x
002193r 3  95 04                        sta 4,x
002195r 3               
002195r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
002197r 3  75 05                        adc 5,x
002199r 3  95 05                        sta 5,x
00219Br 3               
00219Br 3  38                           sec             ; NOS-TOS
00219Cr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
00219Er 3  F5 00                        sbc 0,x
0021A0r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
0021A2r 3               
0021A2r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
0021A4r 3  F5 01                        sbc 1,x
0021A6r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
0021A8r 3               
0021A8r 3  E8                           inx
0021A9r 3  E8                           inx
0021AAr 3               
0021AAr 3  60           z_slash_string: rts
0021ABr 3               
0021ABr 3               
0021ABr 3               
0021ABr 3               ; ## SLITERAL ( addr u -- )( -- addr u ) "Compile a string for runtime"
0021ABr 3               ; ## "sliteral" auto  ANS string
0021ABr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/string/SLITERAL
0021ABr 3                       ; Add the runtime for an existing string.
0021ABr 3                       ; """
0021ABr 3               
0021ABr 3               xt_sliteral:
0021ABr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
0021AEr 3               
0021AEr 3                               ; We can't assume that ( addr u ) of the current string is in
0021AEr 3                               ; a stable area (eg. already in the dictionary.) Copy the
0021AEr 3                               ; string data into the dictionary using move.
0021AEr 3               
0021AEr 3                               ; Put a jmp over the string data with address to be filled
0021AEr 3                               ; in later.
0021AEr 3  A9 4C                        lda #$4C
0021B0r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a
0021B3r 3               
0021B3r 3                               ; Address to be filled in later.
0021B3r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a
0021B6r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a
0021B9r 3               
0021B9r 3                               ; Turn the data stack from ( addr u ) into
0021B9r 3                               ; ( here u addr here u ) so move can be called with
0021B9r 3                               ; the remaining items on the stack ready for processing.
0021B9r 3                               ; Reserve three extra words on the stack.
0021B9r 3  8A                           txa
0021BAr 3  38                           sec
0021BBr 3  E9 06                        sbc #6
0021BDr 3  AA                           tax
0021BEr 3               
0021BEr 3                               ; Move addr down from TOS-4 to TOS-2
0021BEr 3  B5 08                        lda 8,x
0021C0r 3  95 04                        sta 4,x
0021C2r 3  B5 09                        lda 9,x
0021C4r 3  95 05                        sta 5,x
0021C6r 3               
0021C6r 3                               ; Copy u from TOS-3 to TOS
0021C6r 3  B5 06                        lda 6,x
0021C8r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0021CAr 3  B5 07                        lda 7,x
0021CCr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0021CEr 3               
0021CEr 3                               ; Put HERE into TOS-1 and TOS-4
0021CEr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
0021D0r 3  95 08                        sta 8,x
0021D2r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
0021D4r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
0021D6r 3  95 09                        sta 9,x
0021D8r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
0021DAr 3               
0021DAr 3                               ; Copy the string into the dictionary.
0021DAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_move
0021DDr 3               
0021DDr 3                               ; Update cp.
0021DDr 3  18                           clc
0021DEr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
0021E0r 3  75 00                        adc 0,x
0021E2r 3  85 rr                        sta cp
0021E4r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
0021E6r 3  75 01                        adc 1,x
0021E8r 3  85 rr                        sta cp+1
0021EAr 3               
0021EAr 3                               ; Update the address of the jump-over jmp instruction.
0021EAr 3                               ; First determine location of jmp instructions address.
0021EAr 3                               ; It should be 2 bytes before the start of the string.
0021EAr 3               
0021EAr 3                               ; Compute it into tmp1, which is no longer being used.
0021EAr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
0021ECr 3  38                           sec
0021EDr 3  E9 02                        sbc #2
0021EFr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
0021F1r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
0021F3r 3  E9 00                        sbc #0          ; Propagate borrow
0021F5r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
0021F7r 3               
0021F7r 3                               ; Update the address of the jump to HERE.
0021F7r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
0021F9r 3  92 rr                        sta (tmp1)
0021FBr 3  A0 01                        ldy #1
0021FDr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
0021FFr 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
002201r 3               
002201r 3                               ; Stack is now ( addr2 u ) where addr2 is the new
002201r 3                               ; location in the dictionary.
002201r 3               
002201r 3               sliteral_const_str:
002201r 3                               ; Compile a subroutine jump to the runtime of SLITERAL that
002201r 3                               ; pushes the new ( addr u ) pair to the Data Stack.
002201r 3                               ; When we're done, the code will look like this:
002201r 3               
002201r 3                               ; xt -->    jmp a
002201r 3                               ;           <string data bytes>
002201r 3                               ;  a -->    jsr sliteral_runtime
002201r 3                               ;           <string address>
002201r 3                               ;           <string length>
002201r 3                               ; rts -->
002201r 3               
002201r 3                               ; This means we'll have to adjust the return address for two
002201r 3                               ; cells, not just one
002201r 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>sliteral_runtime
002203r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<sliteral_runtime
002205r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
002208r 3               
002208r 3                               ; We want to have the address end up as NOS and the length
002208r 3                               ; as TOS, so we store the address first
002208r 3  B4 03                        ldy 3,x                ; address MSB
00220Ar 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x                ; address LSB
00220Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
00220Fr 3               
00220Fr 3  B4 01                        ldy 1,x                ; length MSB
002211r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x                ; length LSB
002213r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
002216r 3               
002216r 3                               ; clean up and leave
002216r 3  E8                           inx
002217r 3  E8                           inx
002218r 3  E8                           inx
002219r 3  E8                           inx
00221Ar 3               
00221Ar 3  60           z_sliteral:     rts
00221Br 3               
00221Br 3               
00221Br 3               sliteral_runtime:
00221Br 3               
00221Br 3                       ; """Run time behaviour of SLITERAL: Push ( addr u ) of string to
00221Br 3                       ; the Data Stack. We arrive here with the return address as the
00221Br 3                       ; top of Return Stack, which points to the address of the string
00221Br 3                       ; """
00221Br 3  CA                           dex
00221Cr 3  CA                           dex
00221Dr 3  CA                           dex
00221Er 3  CA                           dex
00221Fr 3               
00221Fr 3                               ; Get the address of the string address off the stack and
00221Fr 3                               ; increase by one because of the RTS mechanics
00221Fr 3  68                           pla
002220r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1        ; LSB of address
002222r 3  68                           pla
002223r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1      ; MSB of address
002225r 3               
002225r 3                               ; Walk through both and save them
002225r 3  A0 01                        ldy #1          ; adjust for JSR/RTS mechanics on 65c02
002227r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
002229r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x         ; LSB of address
00222Br 3  C8                           iny
00222Cr 3               
00222Cr 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
00222Er 3  95 03                        sta 3,x         ; MSB of address
002230r 3  C8                           iny
002231r 3               
002231r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
002233r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; LSB of length
002235r 3  C8                           iny
002236r 3               
002236r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
002238r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x         ; MSB of length
00223Ar 3               
00223Ar 3                               ; restore return address
00223Ar 3  18                           clc
00223Br 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
00223Dr 3  69 04                        adc #4
00223Fr 3  A8                           tay             ; LSB
002240r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
002242r 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; we only need carry
002244r 3  48                           pha             ; MSB
002245r 3  5A                           phy
002246r 3               
002246r 3  60                           rts
002247r 3               
002247r 3               
002247r 3               
002247r 3               ; ## SM_SLASH_REM ( d n1 -- n2 n3 ) "Symmetic signed division"
002247r 3               ; ## "sm/rem"  auto  ANS core
002247r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/SMDivREM
002247r 3                       ; Symmetic signed division. Compare FM/MOD. Based on F-PC 3.6
002247r 3                       ; by Ulrich Hoffmann. See http://www.xlerb.de/uho/ansi.seq
002247r 3                       ;
002247r 3                       ; Forth:
002247r 3                       ; OVER >R 2DUP XOR 0< >R ABS >R DABS R> UM/MOD R> ?NEGATE SWAP
002247r 3                       ; R> ?NEGATE SWAP
002247r 3                       ; """
002247r 3               
002247r 3               xt_sm_slash_rem:
002247r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_3 ; contains double number
00224Ar 3               
00224Ar 3                               ; push MSB of high cell of d to Data Stack so we can check
00224Ar 3                               ; its sign later
00224Ar 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
00224Cr 3  48                           pha
00224Dr 3               
00224Dr 3                               ; XOR the MSB of the high cell of d and n1 so we figure out
00224Dr 3                               ; its sign later as well
00224Dr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
00224Fr 3  55 03                        eor 3,x
002251r 3  48                           pha
002252r 3               
002252r 3                               ; Prepare division by getting absolute of n1 and d
002252r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_abs
002255r 3  E8                           inx             ; pretend we pushed n1 to R
002256r 3  E8                           inx
002257r 3               
002257r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dabs
00225Ar 3  CA                           dex
00225Br 3  CA                           dex
00225Cr 3               
00225Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_um_slash_mod     ; UM/MOD
00225Fr 3               
00225Fr 3                               ; if the XOR compiled above is negative, negate the
00225Fr 3                               ; quotient (n3)
00225Fr 3  68                           pla
002260r 3  10 03                        bpl @1
002262r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_negate
002265r 3               @1:
002265r 3                               ; if d was negative, negate the remainder (n2)
002265r 3  68                           pla
002266r 3  10 07                        bpl @done
002268r 3               
002268r 3  E8                           inx             ; pretend we pushed quotient to R
002269r 3  E8                           inx
00226Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_negate
00226Dr 3  CA                           dex
00226Er 3  CA                           dex
00226Fr 3               
00226Fr 3               @done:
00226Fr 3  60           z_sm_slash_rem: rts
002270r 3               
002270r 3               
002270r 3               
002270r 3               ; ## SOURCE ( -- addr u ) "Return location and size of input buffer""
002270r 3               ; ## "source"  auto  ANS core
002270r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/SOURCE"""
002270r 3               xt_source:
002270r 3                               ; add address
002270r 3  CA                           dex
002271r 3  CA                           dex
002272r 3  A5 rr                        lda cib
002274r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002276r 3  A5 rr                        lda cib+1
002278r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00227Ar 3               
00227Ar 3                               ; add size
00227Ar 3  CA                           dex
00227Br 3  CA                           dex
00227Cr 3  A5 rr                        lda ciblen
00227Er 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002280r 3  A5 rr                        lda ciblen+1
002282r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002284r 3               
002284r 3  60           z_source:       rts
002285r 3               
002285r 3               
002285r 3               ; ## SOURCE_ID ( -- n ) "Return source identifier"
002285r 3               ; ## "source-id"  tested  ANS core ext
002285r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/SOURCE-ID Identify the
002285r 3                       ; input source unless it is a block (s. Conklin & Rather p. 156). This
002285r 3                       ; will give the input source: 0 is keyboard, -1 ($FFFF) is character
002285r 3                       ; string, and a text file gives the fileid.
002285r 3                       ; """
002285r 3               xt_source_id:
002285r 3  CA                           dex
002286r 3  CA                           dex
002287r 3               
002287r 3  A5 rr                        lda insrc
002289r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00228Br 3  A5 rr                        lda insrc+1
00228Dr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00228Fr 3               
00228Fr 3  60           z_source_id:    rts
002290r 3               
002290r 3               
002290r 3               ; ## SPACE ( -- ) "Print a single space"
002290r 3               ; ## "space"  auto  ANS core
002290r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/SPACE"""
002290r 3               xt_space:
002290r 3  A9 20                        lda #AscSP
002292r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
002295r 3               
002295r 3  60           z_space:        rts
002296r 3               
002296r 3               
002296r 3               ; ## SPACES ( u -- ) "Print a number of spaces"
002296r 3               ; ## "spaces"  auto  ANS core
002296r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/SPACES"""
002296r 3               
002296r 3               xt_spaces:
002296r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
002299r 3               
002299r 3                               ; catch any zero in TOS fast
002299r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00229Br 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
00229Dr 3  F0 2A                        beq @done
00229Fr 3               
00229Fr 3                               ; Usually we're only going to print far less than 256 spaces,
00229Fr 3                               ; so we create a quick loop for that. Short loop could be realized
00229Fr 3                               ; as a separate subroutine, but unless we're really pressed for
00229Fr 3                               ; memory at some point, this is faster
00229Fr 3  B4 01                        ldy 1,x
0022A1r 3  D0 0C                        bne @lots_of_spaces
0022A3r 3               
0022A3r 3  B4 00                        ldy 0,x
0022A5r 3               @quick_loop:
0022A5r 3                               ; we reach here knowing that there must be a number that is not
0022A5r 3                               ; zero in the TOS
0022A5r 3  A9 20                        lda #AscSP
0022A7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0022AAr 3  88                           dey
0022ABr 3  F0 1C                        beq @done
0022ADr 3  80 F6                        bra @quick_loop
0022AFr 3               
0022AFr 3               @lots_of_spaces:
0022AFr 3                               ; We go through the first loop once to get rid of the lower
0022AFr 3                               ; counter byte. This could be zero
0022AFr 3  B4 00                        ldy 0,x
0022B1r 3               
0022B1r 3               @first_slow_loop:
0022B1r 3  F0 08                        beq @slow_outer_loop
0022B3r 3  A9 20                        lda #AscSP
0022B5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0022B8r 3  88                           dey
0022B9r 3  80 F6                        bra @first_slow_loop
0022BBr 3               
0022BBr 3               @slow_outer_loop:
0022BBr 3                               ; we arrive here knowing that the MSB of TOS cannot be a zero
0022BBr 3  A0 00                        ldy #00
0022BDr 3               
0022BDr 3               @slow_inner_loop:
0022BDr 3  A9 20                        lda #AscSP
0022BFr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0022C2r 3  88                           dey
0022C3r 3  D0 F8                        bne @slow_inner_loop
0022C5r 3               
0022C5r 3  D6 01                        dec 1,x
0022C7r 3  D0 F2                        bne @slow_outer_loop
0022C9r 3               
0022C9r 3               @done:
0022C9r 3  E8                           inx             ; drop
0022CAr 3  E8                           inx
0022CBr 3               
0022CBr 3  60           z_spaces:       rts
0022CCr 3               
0022CCr 3               
0022CCr 3               
0022CCr 3               ; ## STAR ( n n -- n ) "16*16 --> 16 "
0022CCr 3               ; ## "*"  auto  ANS core
0022CCr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Times
0022CCr 3                       ; Multiply two signed 16 bit numbers, returning a 16 bit result.
0022CCr 3                       ;
0022CCr 3                       ; This is nothing  more than UM* DROP
0022CCr 3                       ; """
0022CCr 3               
0022CCr 3               xt_star:
0022CCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
0022CFr 3               
0022CFr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_um_star
0022D2r 3  E8                           inx
0022D3r 3  E8                           inx
0022D4r 3               
0022D4r 3  60           z_star:         rts
0022D5r 3               
0022D5r 3               
0022D5r 3               
0022D5r 3               ; ## STAR_SLASH  ( n1 n2 n3 -- n4 ) "n1 * n2 / n3 -->  n"
0022D5r 3               ; ## "*/"  auto  ANS core
0022D5r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TimesDiv
0022D5r 3                       ; Multiply n1 by n2 and divide by n3, returning the result
0022D5r 3                       ; without a remainder. This is */MOD without the mod.
0022D5r 3                       ;
0022D5r 3                       ; This word
0022D5r 3                       ; can be defined in Forth as : */  */MOD SWAP DROP ; which is
0022D5r 3                       ; pretty much what we do here
0022D5r 3                       ; """
0022D5r 3               xt_star_slash:
0022D5r 3                               ; We let */MOD check for underflow
0022D5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_star_slash_mod
0022D8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
0022DBr 3  E8                           inx
0022DCr 3  E8                           inx
0022DDr 3               z_star_slash:
0022DDr 3  60                           rts
0022DEr 3               
0022DEr 3               
0022DEr 3               ; ## STAR_SLASH_MOD  ( n1 n2 n3 -- n4 n5 ) "n1 * n2 / n3 --> n-mod n"
0022DEr 3               ; ## "*/mod"  auto  ANS core
0022DEr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TimesDivMOD
0022DEr 3                       ; Multiply n1 by n2 producing the intermediate double-cell result d.
0022DEr 3                       ; Divide d by n3 producing the single-cell remainder n4 and the
0022DEr 3                       ; single-cell quotient n5.
0022DEr 3                       ;
0022DEr 3                       ; In Forth, this is
0022DEr 3                       ; : */MOD  >R M* >R SM/REM ;  Note that */ accesses this routine.
0022DEr 3                       ; """
0022DEr 3               xt_star_slash_mod:
0022DEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_3
0022E1r 3               
0022E1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_r
0022E4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_m_star
0022E7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_from
0022EAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_sm_slash_rem
0022EDr 3               
0022EDr 3               z_star_slash_mod:
0022EDr 3  60                           rts
0022EEr 3               
0022EEr 3               
0022EEr 3               ; ## STATE ( -- addr ) "Return the address of compilation state flag"
0022EEr 3               ; ## "state"  auto  ANS core
0022EEr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/STATE
0022EEr 3                       ; STATE is true when in compilation state, false otherwise. Note
0022EEr 3                       ; we do not return the state itself, but only the address where
0022EEr 3                       ; it lives. The state should not be changed directly by the user; see
0022EEr 3                       ; http://forth.sourceforge.net/standard/dpans/dpans6.htm#6.1.2250
0022EEr 3                       ; """
0022EEr 3               xt_state:
0022EEr 3  CA                           dex
0022EFr 3  CA                           dex
0022F0r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<state
0022F2r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0022F4r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>state
0022F6r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0022F8r 3               
0022F8r 3  60           z_state:        rts
0022F9r 3               
0022F9r 3               
0022F9r 3               ; ## STORE ( n addr -- ) "Store TOS in memory"
0022F9r 3               ; ## "!"  auto  ANS core
0022F9r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Store"""
0022F9r 3               xt_store:
0022F9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
0022FCr 3               
0022FCr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; LSB
0022FEr 3  81 00                        sta (0,x)
002300r 3               
002300r 3  F6 00                        inc 0,x
002302r 3  D0 02                        bne @1
002304r 3  F6 01                        inc 1,x
002306r 3               @1:
002306r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x         ; MSB
002308r 3  81 00                        sta (0,x)
00230Ar 3               
00230Ar 3  E8                           inx             ; 2DROP
00230Br 3  E8                           inx
00230Cr 3  E8                           inx
00230Dr 3  E8                           inx
00230Er 3               
00230Er 3  60           z_store:        rts
00230Fr 3               
00230Fr 3               
00230Fr 3               ; ## STRIP_UNDERFLOW ( -- addr ) "Return address where underflow status is kept"
00230Fr 3               ; ## "strip-underflow"  tested  Tali Forth
00230Fr 3                       ; """`STRIP-UNDERFLOW` is a flag variable that determines if underflow
00230Fr 3                       ; checking should be removed during the compilation of new words.
00230Fr 3                       ; Default is false.
00230Fr 3                       ; """
00230Fr 3               xt_strip_underflow:
00230Fr 3  CA                           dex
002310r 3  CA                           dex
002311r 3               
002311r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<uf_strip
002313r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002315r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>uf_strip
002317r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002319r 3               
002319r 3               z_strip_underflow:
002319r 3  60                           rts
00231Ar 3               
00231Ar 3               
00231Ar 3               ; ## SWAP ( b a -- a b ) "Exchange TOS and NOS"
00231Ar 3               ; ## "swap"  auto  ANS core
00231Ar 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/SWAP"""
00231Ar 3               xt_swap:
00231Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
00231Dr 3               
00231Dr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB
00231Fr 3  B4 02                        ldy 2,x
002321r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
002323r 3  94 00                        sty 0,x
002325r 3               
002325r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB
002327r 3  B4 03                        ldy 3,x
002329r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
00232Br 3  94 01                        sty 1,x
00232Dr 3               
00232Dr 3  60           z_swap:         rts
00232Er 3               
00232Er 3               
00232Er 3               ; ## THEN (C: orig -- ) ( -- ) "Conditional flow control"
00232Er 3               ; ## "then"  auto  ANS core
00232Er 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/THEN"""
00232Er 3               xt_then:
00232Er 3                               ; Get the address to jump to.
00232Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_here
002331r 3               
002331r 3                               ; Stuff HERE in for the branch address back
002331r 3                               ; at the IF or ELSE (origination address is on stack).
002331r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
002334r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_store
002337r 3               
002337r 3  60           z_then:         rts
002338r 3               
002338r 3               
002338r 3               ; ## THRU ( scr# scr# -- ) "Load screens in the given range"
002338r 3               ; ## "thru"  tested  ANS block ext
002338r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/block/THRU"""
002338r 3               
002338r 3               xt_thru:
002338r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
00233Br 3               
00233Br 3                               ; We need to loop here, and can't use the data stack
00233Br 3                               ; because the LOADed screens might use it.  We'll
00233Br 3                               ; need to use the same trick that DO loops use, holding
00233Br 3                               ; the limit and current index on the return stack.
00233Br 3               
00233Br 3                               ; Put the ending screen number on the return stack
00233Br 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
00233Dr 3  48                           pha
00233Er 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002340r 3  48                           pha
002341r 3  E8                           inx
002342r 3  E8                           inx
002343r 3               @thru_loop:
002343r 3                               ; Put the starting screen number on the stack,
002343r 3                               ; but keep a copy
002343r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
002345r 3  48                           pha
002346r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002348r 3  48                           pha
002349r 3               
002349r 3                               ; Load this screen.
002349r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_load
00234Cr 3               
00234Cr 3                               ; Get the number and limit back off the stack.  Rather than
00234Cr 3                               ; waste time making room on the stack, just use tmp1 and tmp2.
00234Cr 3               
00234Cr 3                               ; Get the screen we just loaded.
00234Cr 3  68                           pla
00234Dr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
00234Fr 3  68                           pla
002350r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
002352r 3               
002352r 3                               ; Get the ending screen.
002352r 3  68                           pla
002353r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2
002355r 3  68                           pla
002356r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
002358r 3               
002358r 3                               ; See if we just loaded the last screen.
002358r 3                               ; A already has the MSB of the last screen in it.
002358r 3  C5 rr                        cmp tmp1+1
00235Ar 3  D0 08                        bne @next_screen
00235Cr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2        ; Compare the LSB
00235Er 3  C5 rr                        cmp tmp1
002360r 3  D0 02                        bne @next_screen
002362r 3  80 18                        bra @done       ; We just did the last screen.
002364r 3               
002364r 3               @next_screen:
002364r 3                               ; Put the ending screen back on the data stack.
002364r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2+1
002366r 3  48                           pha
002367r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp2
002369r 3  48                           pha
00236Ar 3               
00236Ar 3                               ; Increment the current screen.
00236Ar 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1
00236Cr 3  D0 02                        bne @1
00236Er 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1+1
002370r 3               @1:
002370r 3                               ; Put the current screen on the stack to prepare for
002370r 3                               ; the next loop.
002370r 3  CA                           dex
002371r 3  CA                           dex
002372r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
002374r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002376r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
002378r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00237Ar 3  80 C7                        bra @thru_loop
00237Cr 3               @done:
00237Cr 3  60           z_thru:         rts
00237Dr 3               
00237Dr 3               
00237Dr 3               
00237Dr 3               ; ## TICK ( "name" -- xt ) "Return a word's execution token (xt)"
00237Dr 3               ; ## "'"  auto  ANS core
00237Dr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Tick"""
00237Dr 3               
00237Dr 3               xt_tick:
00237Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_parse_name       ; ( -- addr u )
002380r 3               
002380r 3                               ; if we got a zero, there was a problem getting the
002380r 3                               ; name of the word
002380r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002382r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
002384r 3  D0 05                        bne @1
002386r 3               
002386r 3  A9 05                        lda #err_noname
002388r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp error
00238Br 3               @1:
00238Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_find_name        ; ( addr u -- nt )
00238Er 3               
00238Er 3                               ; If we didn't find the word in the Dictionary, abort
00238Er 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002390r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
002392r 3  D0 05                        bne @2
002394r 3               
002394r 3  A9 08                        lda #err_syntax
002396r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp error
002399r 3               @2:
002399r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_name_to_int      ; ( nt -- xt )
00239Cr 3               
00239Cr 3  60           z_tick:         rts
00239Dr 3               
00239Dr 3               
00239Dr 3               
00239Dr 3               ; ## TO ( n "name" -- ) or ( "name") "Change a value"
00239Dr 3               ; ## "to"  auto  ANS core ext
00239Dr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TO
00239Dr 3                       ; Gives a new value to a, uh, VALUE.
00239Dr 3                       ;
00239Dr 3                       ; One possible Forth
00239Dr 3                       ; implementation is  ' >BODY !  but given the problems we have
00239Dr 3                       ; with >BODY on STC Forths, we do this the hard way. Since
00239Dr 3                       ; Tali Forth uses the same code for CONSTANTs and VALUEs, you
00239Dr 3                       ; could use this to redefine a CONSTANT, but that is a no-no.
00239Dr 3                       ;
00239Dr 3                       ; Note that the standard has different behaviors for TO depending
00239Dr 3                       ; on the state (https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TO).
00239Dr 3                       ; This makes TO state-dependent (which is bad) and also rather
00239Dr 3                       ; complex (see the Gforth implementation for comparison). This
00239Dr 3                       ; word may not be natively compiled and must be immediate. Frankly,
00239Dr 3                       ; it would have made more sense to have two words for this.
00239Dr 3                       ; """
00239Dr 3               
00239Dr 3               xt_to:
00239Dr 3                               ; One way or the other, we need the xt of the word after this
00239Dr 3                               ; one. At this point, we don't know if we are interpreted or
00239Dr 3                               ; compile, so we don't know if there is a value n on the stack,
00239Dr 3                               ; so we can't do an underflow check yet
00239Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_tick             ; ( [n] xt )
0023A0r 3               
0023A0r 3                               ; The PFA (DFA in this case) is three bytes down,
0023A0r 3                               ; after the jump to DOCONST
0023A0r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x                 ; LSB
0023A2r 3  18                           clc
0023A3r 3  69 03                        adc #3
0023A5r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
0023A7r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x                 ; MSB
0023A9r 3  69 00                        adc #0                  ; we just want the carry
0023ABr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
0023ADr 3               
0023ADr 3  E8                           inx
0023AEr 3  E8                           inx                     ; ( [n] )
0023AFr 3               
0023AFr 3                               ; Now it gets ugly. See which state we are in
0023AFr 3  A5 rr                        lda state
0023B1r 3  05 rr                        ora state+1
0023B3r 3  F0 34                        beq @interpret
0023B5r 3               
0023B5r 3                               ; Well, we're compiling. We want to end up with simple
0023B5r 3                               ; code that just takes the number that is TOS and saves
0023B5r 3                               ; it in the address of the xt we were just given. So we
0023B5r 3                               ; want to compile this routine:
0023B5r 3                               ;
0023B5r 3                               ;       lda 0,x                 - B5 00
0023B5r 3                               ;       sta <ADDR_LSB>          - 8D LSB MSB
0023B5r 3                               ;       lda 1,x                 - B5 01
0023B5r 3                               ;       sta <ADDR_LSB>          - 8D LSB MSB
0023B5r 3                               ;       inx                     - E8
0023B5r 3                               ;       inx                     - E8
0023B5r 3                               ;
0023B5r 3                               ; which at least is nice and short. Other than that, we pretty
0023B5r 3                               ; much have to do this the hard and long way, because with the
0023B5r 3                               ; LSBs and MSBs, we can't really put the numbers in a data
0023B5r 3                               ; range and store them with a loop. Sigh.
0023B5r 3               
0023B5r 3  A0 00                        ldy #$00                ; Code for LDA 0,X
0023B7r 3  A9 B5                        lda #$B5
0023B9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
0023BCr 3               
0023BCr 3  A9 8D                        lda #$8D                ; Code for STA abs
0023BEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a
0023C1r 3               
0023C1r 3  A4 rr                        ldy tmp1+1              ; MSB goes in Y
0023C3r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
0023C5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
0023C8r 3               
0023C8r 3  A0 01                        ldy #$01                ; Code for LDA 1,X
0023CAr 3  A9 B5                        lda #$B5
0023CCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
0023CFr 3               
0023CFr 3  A9 8D                        lda #$8D                ; Code for STA abs
0023D1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a
0023D4r 3               
0023D4r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1                ; Calculate MSB
0023D6r 3  D0 02                        bne @1
0023D8r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1+1
0023DAr 3               @1:
0023DAr 3  A4 rr                        ldy tmp1+1              ; MSB goes in Y
0023DCr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
0023DEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
0023E1r 3               
0023E1r 3  A0 E8                        ldy #$E8                ; Code for INX
0023E3r 3  98                           tya
0023E4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_word
0023E7r 3               
0023E7r 3  80 0F                        bra @done
0023E9r 3               
0023E9r 3               @interpret:
0023E9r 3                               ; We're interpreting, so we arrive here with n
0023E9r 3                               ; on the stack. This is an annoying place to put
0023E9r 3                               ; the underflow check because we can't
0023E9r 3                               ; automatically strip it out
0023E9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0023ECr 3               
0023ECr 3                               ; We skip over the jump to DOCONST and store the number
0023ECr 3                               ; in the Program Field Area (PDF, in this case more a
0023ECr 3                               ; Data Field Area
0023ECr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0023EEr 3  92 rr                        sta (tmp1)              ; LSB
0023F0r 3               
0023F0r 3  A0 01                        ldy #1
0023F2r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x                 ; MSB
0023F4r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y            ; fall through to common
0023F6r 3               
0023F6r 3  E8                           inx                     ; DROP
0023F7r 3  E8                           inx
0023F8r 3               @done:
0023F8r 3  60           z_to:           rts
0023F9r 3               
0023F9r 3               
0023F9r 3               
0023F9r 3               ; ## TO_BODY ( xt -- addr ) "Return a word's Code Field Area (CFA)"
0023F9r 3               ; ## ">body"  auto  ANS core
0023F9r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/toBODY
0023F9r 3                       ; Given a word's execution token (xt), return the address of the
0023F9r 3                       ; start of that word's parameter field (PFA). This is defined as the
0023F9r 3                       ; address that HERE would return right after CREATE.
0023F9r 3                       ;
0023F9r 3                       ; This is a
0023F9r 3                       ; difficult word for STC Forths, because most words don't actually
0023F9r 3                       ; have a Code Field Area (CFA) to skip. We solve this by having CREATE
0023F9r 3                       ; add a flag, "has CFA" (HC), in the header so >BODY know to skip
0023F9r 3                       ; the subroutine jumps to DOVAR, DOCONST, or DODOES
0023F9r 3                       ; """
0023F9r 3               
0023F9r 3               xt_to_body:
0023F9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0023FCr 3               
0023FCr 3                               ; Ideally, xt already points to the CFA. We just need to check
0023FCr 3                               ; the HC flag for special cases
0023FCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup              ; ( xt xt )
0023FFr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_int_to_name      ; ( xt nt )
002402r 3               
002402r 3                               ; The status byte is nt+1
002402r 3  F6 00                        inc 0,x
002404r 3  D0 02                        bne @1
002406r 3  F6 01                        inc 1,x
002408r 3               @1:
002408r 3  A1 00                        lda (0,x)               ; get status byte
00240Ar 3  29 20                        and #HC
00240Cr 3  F0 0D                        beq @no_cfa
00240Er 3               
00240Er 3                               ; We've got a DOVAR, DOCONST, DODEFER, DODOES or whatever,
00240Er 3                               ; so we add three to xt, which is NOS
00240Er 3  18                           clc
00240Fr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; LSB
002411r 3  69 03                        adc #3
002413r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
002415r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x         ; MSB
002417r 3  69 00                        adc #0          ; we conly care about the carry
002419r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x         ; Fall through to @no_cfa
00241Br 3               @no_cfa:
00241Br 3  E8                           inx             ; get rid of the nt
00241Cr 3  E8                           inx
00241Dr 3               @done:
00241Dr 3  60           z_to_body:      rts
00241Er 3               
00241Er 3               
00241Er 3               
00241Er 3               ; ## TO_IN ( -- addr ) "Return address of the input pointer"
00241Er 3               ; ## ">in"  auto  ANS core
00241Er 3               xt_to_in:
00241Er 3  CA                           dex
00241Fr 3  CA                           dex
002420r 3               
002420r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<toin
002422r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002424r 3  A9 rr                        lda #>toin      ; paranoid, should be zero
002426r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002428r 3               
002428r 3  60           z_to_in:        rts
002429r 3               
002429r 3               
002429r 3               ; ## TO_NUMBER ( ud addr u -- ud addr u ) "Convert a number"
002429r 3               ; ## ">number"  auto  ANS core
002429r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/toNUMBER
002429r 3                       ; Convert a string to a double number. Logic here is based on the
002429r 3                       ; routine by Phil Burk of the same name in pForth, see
002429r 3                       ; https://github.com/philburk/pforth/blob/master/fth/numberio.fth
002429r 3                       ; for the original Forth code. We arrive here from NUMBER which has
002429r 3                       ; made sure that we don't have to deal with a sign and we don't have
002429r 3                       ; to deal with a dot as a last character that signalizes double -
002429r 3                       ; this should be a pure number string.
002429r 3                       ;
002429r 3                       ; This routine calles UM*, which uses tmp1, tmp2 and tmp3, so we
002429r 3                       ; cannot access any of those.
002429r 3                       ;
002429r 3                       ; For the math routine, we move the inputs to the scratchpad to
002429r 3                       ; avoid having to fool around with the Data Stack.
002429r 3                       ;
002429r 3                       ;     +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+
002429r 3                       ;     |   UD-LO   |   UD-HI   |     N     | UD-HI-LO  |
002429r 3                       ;     |           |           |           |           |
002429r 3                       ;     |  S    S+1 | S+2   S+3 | S+4   S+5 | S+6   S+7 |
002429r 3                       ;     +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+
002429r 3                       ;
002429r 3                       ; The math routine works by converting one character to its
002429r 3                       ; numerical value (N) via DIGIT? and storing it in S+4 for
002429r 3                       ; the moment. We then multiply the UD-HI value with the radix
002429r 3                       ; (from BASE) using UM*, which returns a double-cell result. We
002429r 3                       ; discard the high cell of that result (UD-HI-HI) and store the
002429r 3                       ; low cell (UD-HI-LO) in S+6 for now. -- The second part is
002429r 3                       ; multiplying UD-LO with the radix. The high cell (UD-LO-HI)
002429r 3                       ; gets put in S+2, the low cell (HD-LO-LO) in S. We then use
002429r 3                       ; a version of D+ to add ( S S+2 ) and ( S+4 S+6) together,
002429r 3                       ; storing the result back in S and S+2, before we start another
002429r 3                       ; round with it as the new UD-LO and UD-HI.
002429r 3                       ; """
002429r 3               
002429r 3               
002429r 3               xt_to_number:
002429r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_4
00242Cr 3               
00242Cr 3                               ; Fill the scratchpad. We arrive with ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u ).
00242Cr 3                               ; After this step, the original ud-lo and ud-hi will still be on
00242Cr 3                               ; the Data Stack, but will be ignored and later overwritten
00242Cr 3                               ; If >NUMBER is called by NUMBER, these should be all zeros
00242Cr 3  B5 06                        lda 6,x         ; ud-lo LSB
00242Er 3  85 rr                        sta scratch
002430r 3  B5 07                        lda 7,x         ; ud-lo MSB
002432r 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+1
002434r 3               
002434r 3  B5 04                        lda 4,x         ; ud-hi LSB
002436r 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+2
002438r 3  B5 05                        lda 5,x         ; ud-hi MSB
00243Ar 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+3
00243Cr 3               
00243Cr 3                               ; Push down one on the Data Stack to use TOS for character
00243Cr 3                               ; conversion ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u x )
00243Cr 3  CA                           dex
00243Dr 3  CA                           dex
00243Er 3               
00243Er 3               @loop:
00243Er 3                               ; Get one character based on address
00243Er 3  A1 04                        lda (4,x)
002440r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x                 ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u char )
002442r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x                 ; paranoid
002444r 3               
002444r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_digit_question   ; ( char -- n -1 | char 0 )
002447r 3               
002447r 3                               ; This gives us ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u char f | n f ), so we
002447r 3                               ; check the flag. If it is zero, we return what we have and
002447r 3                               ; let the caller (usually NUMBER) complain
002447r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002449r 3  D0 04                        bne @digit_ok
00244Br 3               
00244Br 3  E8                           inx
00244Cr 3  E8                           inx
00244Dr 3  80 67                        bra @done       ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u char )
00244Fr 3               
00244Fr 3               @digit_ok:
00244Fr 3                               ; Conversion was successful. We arrive here with
00244Fr 3                               ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u n -1 ) and can start the
00244Fr 3                               ; math routine
00244Fr 3               
00244Fr 3                               ; Save n so we don't have to fool around with the
00244Fr 3                               ; Data Stack
00244Fr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
002451r 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+4
002453r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
002455r 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+5
002457r 3               
002457r 3                               ; Now multiply ud-hi (the one in the scratchpad, not the
002457r 3                               ; original one on the Data Stack) with the radix from BASE.
002457r 3                               ; We can clobber TOS and NOS because we saved n
002457r 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
002459r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x         ; NOS
00245Br 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch+3
00245Dr 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
00245Fr 3               
00245Fr 3  A5 rr                        lda base
002461r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; TOS
002463r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; now ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u ud-hi base)
002465r 3               
002465r 3                               ; UM* returns a double-celled number
002465r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_um_star  ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u ud-hi-lo ud-hi-hi )
002468r 3               
002468r 3                               ; Move ud-hi-lo to safety
002468r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; ud-hi-lo
00246Ar 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+6
00246Cr 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
00246Er 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+7
002470r 3               
002470r 3                               ; Now we multiply ud-lo, overwriting the stack entries
002470r 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch
002472r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
002474r 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
002476r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x         ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u ud-lo ud-hi-hi )
002478r 3               
002478r 3  A5 rr                        lda base
00247Ar 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00247Cr 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u ud-lo base )
00247Er 3               
00247Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_um_star  ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u ud-lo-lo ud-lo-hi )
002481r 3               
002481r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002483r 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+2
002485r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
002487r 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+3
002489r 3               
002489r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
00248Br 3  85 rr                        sta scratch
00248Dr 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
00248Fr 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+1
002491r 3               
002491r 3                               ; We add ud-lo and n, as well as ud-hi and ud-hi-lo,
002491r 3                               ; both in the scratch pad
002491r 3  18                           clc
002492r 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch     ; ud-lo LSB
002494r 3  65 rr                        adc scratch+4   ; n LSB
002496r 3  85 rr                        sta scratch     ; this is the new ud-lo
002498r 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1   ; ud-lo MSB
00249Ar 3  65 rr                        adc scratch+5   ; n MSB
00249Cr 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+1
00249Er 3               
00249Er 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2   ; LSB
0024A0r 3  65 rr                        adc scratch+6
0024A2r 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+2   ; this is the new ud-hi
0024A4r 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch+3   ; MSB
0024A6r 3  65 rr                        adc scratch+7
0024A8r 3  85 rr                        sta scratch+3
0024AAr 3               
0024AAr 3                               ; Clean up: Get rid of one of the two top elements on
0024AAr 3                               ; the Data Stack. We don't really care which one
0024AAr 3  E8                           inx
0024ABr 3  E8                           inx             ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u ud-lo-lo )
0024ACr 3               
0024ACr 3                               ; One character down. Move address up
0024ACr 3  F6 04                        inc 4,x
0024AEr 3  D0 02                        bne @1
0024B0r 3  F6 05                        inc 5,x
0024B2r 3               @1:
0024B2r 3                               ; Decrease counter
0024B2r 3  D6 02                        dec 2,x
0024B4r 3  D0 88                        bne @loop
0024B6r 3               
0024B6r 3               @done:
0024B6r 3                               ; Counter has reached zero or we have an error. In both
0024B6r 3                               ; cases, we clean up the Data Stack and return. Error gives
0024B6r 3                               ; us ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u char ), regular end is
0024B6r 3                               ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u ud-lo )
0024B6r 3  E8                           inx
0024B7r 3  E8                           inx             ; ( ud-lo ud-hi addr u )
0024B8r 3               
0024B8r 3                               ; The new ud-lo and ud-hi are still on the scratch pad
0024B8r 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch     ; new ud-lo
0024BAr 3  95 06                        sta 6,x
0024BCr 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
0024BEr 3  95 07                        sta 7,x
0024C0r 3               
0024C0r 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
0024C2r 3  95 04                        sta 4,x
0024C4r 3  A5 rr                        lda scratch+3
0024C6r 3  95 05                        sta 5,x
0024C8r 3               
0024C8r 3  60           z_to_number:    rts
0024C9r 3               
0024C9r 3               
0024C9r 3               
0024C9r 3               ; ## TO_ORDER ( wid -- ) "Add wordlist at beginning of search order"
0024C9r 3               ; ## ">order"  tested  Gforth search
0024C9r 3                       ; """https://www.complang.tuwien.ac.at/forth/gforth/Docs-html/Word-Lists.html"""
0024C9r 3               
0024C9r 3               xt_to_order:
0024C9r 3                               ; Put the wid on the return stack for now.
0024C9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_r
0024CCr 3               
0024CCr 3                               ; Get the current search order.
0024CCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_get_order
0024CFr 3               
0024CFr 3                               ; Get back the wid and add it to the list.
0024CFr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_from
0024D2r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
0024D5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus
0024D8r 3               
0024D8r 3                               ; Set the search order with the new list.
0024D8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_set_order
0024DBr 3               
0024DBr 3  60           z_to_order:     rts
0024DCr 3               
0024DCr 3               
0024DCr 3               
0024DCr 3               ; ## TO_R ( n -- )(R: -- n) "Push TOS to the Return Stack"
0024DCr 3               ; ## ">r"  auto  ANS core
0024DCr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/toR
0024DCr 3                       ; This word is handled differently for native and for
0024DCr 3                       ; subroutine coding, see `COMPILE,`. This is a complile-only
0024DCr 3                       ; word.
0024DCr 3                       ; """
0024DCr 3               xt_to_r:
0024DCr 3                               ; Save the return address. If this word is natively
0024DCr 3                               ; coded, this is a complete waste of cycles, but
0024DCr 3                               ; required for subroutine coding
0024DCr 3  68                           pla             ; LSB
0024DDr 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos
0024DFr 3  7A                           ply             ; MSB
0024E0r 3               
0024E0r 3                               ; --- CUT HERE FOR NATIVE CODING ---
0024E0r 3               
0024E0r 3                               ; We check for underflow in the second step, so we can
0024E0r 3                               ; strip off the stack thrashing for native compiling first
0024E0r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0024E3r 3               
0024E3r 3                               ; now we can do the actual work
0024E3r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB
0024E5r 3  48                           pha
0024E6r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB
0024E8r 3  48                           pha
0024E9r 3               
0024E9r 3  E8                           inx
0024EAr 3  E8                           inx
0024EBr 3               
0024EBr 3                               ; --- CUT HERE FOR NATIVE CODING ---
0024EBr 3               
0024EBr 3                               ; restore return address
0024EBr 3  5A                           phy             ; MSB
0024ECr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmptos
0024EEr 3  48                           pha             ; LSB
0024EFr 3               
0024EFr 3  60           z_to_r:         rts
0024F0r 3               
0024F0r 3               
0024F0r 3               ; ## TRUE ( -- f ) "Push TRUE flag to Data Stack"
0024F0r 3               ; ## "true"  auto  ANS core ext
0024F0r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TRUE"""
0024F0r 3               xt_true:
0024F0r 3  CA                           dex
0024F1r 3  CA                           dex
0024F2r 3  A9 FF                        lda #$FF
0024F4r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0024F6r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0024F8r 3               
0024F8r 3  60           z_true:         rts
0024F9r 3               
0024F9r 3               
0024F9r 3               ; ## TUCK ( b a -- a b a ) "Copy TOS below NOS"
0024F9r 3               ; ## "tuck"  auto  ANS core ext
0024F9r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TUCK"""
0024F9r 3               xt_tuck:
0024F9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
0024FCr 3               
0024FCr 3  CA                           dex
0024FDr 3  CA                           dex
0024FEr 3               
0024FEr 3  B4 04                        ldy 4,x         ; LSB
002500r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
002502r 3  95 04                        sta 4,x
002504r 3  94 02                        sty 2,x
002506r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002508r 3               
002508r 3  B4 05                        ldy 5,x         ; MSB
00250Ar 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
00250Cr 3  95 05                        sta 5,x
00250Er 3  94 03                        sty 3,x         ; bba
002510r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x         ; baa
002512r 3               
002512r 3  60           z_tuck:         rts
002513r 3               
002513r 3               
002513r 3               ; ## TWO ( -- u ) "Push the number 2 to stack"
002513r 3               ; ## "2"  auto  Tali Forth
002513r 3                       ;
002513r 3                       ; This code is shared with ASSEMBLER-WORDLIST
002513r 3               xt_assembler_wordlist:
002513r 3               xt_two:
002513r 3  CA                           dex
002514r 3  CA                           dex
002515r 3  A9 02                        lda #2
002517r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002519r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
00251Br 3               
00251Br 3               z_assembler_wordlist:
00251Br 3  60           z_two:          rts
00251Cr 3               
00251Cr 3               
00251Cr 3               ; ## TWO_DROP ( n n -- ) "Drop TOS and NOS"
00251Cr 3               ; ## "2drop"  auto  ANS core
00251Cr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoDROP"""
00251Cr 3               xt_two_drop:
00251Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
00251Fr 3               
00251Fr 3  E8                           inx
002520r 3  E8                           inx
002521r 3  E8                           inx
002522r 3  E8                           inx
002523r 3               
002523r 3  60           z_two_drop:     rts
002524r 3               
002524r 3               
002524r 3               ; ## TWO_DUP ( a b -- a b a b ) "Duplicate first two stack elements"
002524r 3               ; ## "2dup"  auto  ANS core
002524r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoDUP"""
002524r 3               xt_two_dup:
002524r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
002527r 3               
002527r 3  CA                           dex
002528r 3  CA                           dex
002529r 3  CA                           dex
00252Ar 3  CA                           dex
00252Br 3               
00252Br 3  B5 04                        lda 4,x         ; TOS
00252Dr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00252Fr 3  B5 05                        lda 5,x
002531r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002533r 3               
002533r 3  B5 06                        lda 6,x         ; NOS
002535r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
002537r 3  B5 07                        lda 7,x
002539r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
00253Br 3               
00253Br 3  60           z_two_dup:      rts
00253Cr 3               
00253Cr 3               
00253Cr 3               ; ## TWO_FETCH ( addr -- n1 n2 ) "Fetch the cell pair n1 n2 stored at addr"
00253Cr 3               ; ## "2@"  auto  ANS core
00253Cr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoFetch
00253Cr 3                       ; Note n2 stored at addr and n1 in the next cell -- in our case,
00253Cr 3                       ; the next two bytes. This is equvalent to  `DUP CELL+ @ SWAP @`
00253Cr 3                       ; """
00253Cr 3               xt_two_fetch:
00253Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
00253Fr 3               
00253Fr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002541r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
002543r 3  B4 01                        ldy 1,x
002545r 3  84 rr                        sty tmp1+1
002547r 3               
002547r 3  CA                           dex             ; reuse one stack element
002548r 3  CA                           dex
002549r 3               
002549r 3  B2 rr                        lda (tmp1)      ; copy LSB
00254Br 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00254Dr 3  A0 01                        ldy #1          ; copy next
00254Fr 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
002551r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002553r 3  C8                           iny             ; copy next
002554r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
002556r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
002558r 3  C8                           iny             ; copy next
002559r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y
00255Br 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
00255Dr 3               
00255Dr 3  60           z_two_fetch:    rts
00255Er 3               
00255Er 3               ; ## TWO_OVER ( d1 d2 -- d1 d2 d1 ) "Copy double word NOS to TOS"
00255Er 3               ; ## "2over"  auto  ANS core
00255Er 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoOVER"""
00255Er 3               xt_two_over:
00255Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_4
002561r 3               
002561r 3  CA                           dex
002562r 3  CA                           dex
002563r 3  CA                           dex
002564r 3  CA                           dex
002565r 3               
002565r 3  B5 08                        lda 8,x
002567r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002569r 3               
002569r 3  B5 09                        lda 9,x
00256Br 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00256Dr 3               
00256Dr 3  B5 0A                        lda 10,x
00256Fr 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
002571r 3               
002571r 3  B5 0B                        lda 11,x
002573r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
002575r 3               
002575r 3  60           z_two_over:     rts
002576r 3               
002576r 3               
002576r 3               ; ## TWO_R_FETCH ( -- n n ) "Copy top two entries from Return Stack"
002576r 3               ; ## "2r@"  auto  ANS core ext
002576r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoRFetch
002576r 3                       ;
002576r 3                       ; This is R> R> 2DUP >R >R SWAP but we can do it a lot faster in
002576r 3                       ; assembler. We use trickery to access the elements on the Return
002576r 3                       ; Stack instead of pulling the return address first and storing
002576r 3                       ; it somewhere else like for 2R> and 2>R. In this version, we leave
002576r 3                       ; it as Never Native; at some point, we should compare versions to
002576r 3                       ; see if an Always Native version would be better
002576r 3                       ; """
002576r 3               xt_two_r_fetch:
002576r 3               		; make room on the Data Stack
002576r 3  CA                           dex
002577r 3  CA                           dex
002578r 3  CA                           dex
002579r 3  CA                           dex
00257Ar 3               
00257Ar 3                               ; Get four bytes off of Return Stack. This assumes that
00257Ar 3                               ; we took a subroutine jump here so the first two entries
00257Ar 3                               ; are the return address
00257Ar 3  8A                           txa
00257Br 3  BA                           tsx
00257Cr 3  DA                           phx             ; 65c02 has no TXY, so do it the hard way
00257Dr 3  7A                           ply
00257Er 3  AA                           tax
00257Fr 3               
00257Fr 3                               ; The Return Stack addreses $0101 and $0102 are occupied by
00257Fr 3                               ; the return address for this word. This is a whole lot
00257Fr 3                               ; easier on the 65816
00257Fr 3  B9 03 01                     lda $0103,y     ; LSB of top entry
002582r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002584r 3  B9 04 01                     lda $0104,y     ; MSB of top entry
002587r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002589r 3  B9 05 01                     lda $0105,y     ; LSB of bottom entry
00258Cr 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
00258Er 3  B9 06 01                     lda $0106,y     ; MSB of top entry
002591r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
002593r 3               
002593r 3  60           z_two_r_fetch:  rts
002594r 3               
002594r 3               
002594r 3               ; ## TWO_R_FROM ( -- n1 n2 ) (R: n1 n2 -- ) "Pull two cells from Return Stack"
002594r 3               ; ## "2r>"  auto  ANS core ext
002594r 3               	    ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoRfrom
002594r 3                       ; Pull top two entries from Return Stack.
002594r 3                       ;
002594r 3                       ; Is the same as
002594r 3                       ; R> R> SWAP. As with R>, the problem with the is word is that
002594r 3                       ; the top value on the ReturnStack for a STC Forth is the
002594r 3                       ; return address, which we need to get out of the way first.
002594r 3                       ; Native compile needs to be handled as a special case.
002594r 3                       ; """
002594r 3               xt_two_r_from:
002594r 3                               ; save the return address
002594r 3  68                           pla                     ; LSB
002595r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
002597r 3  68                           pla                     ; MSB
002598r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
00259Ar 3               
00259Ar 3                               ; --- CUT HERE FOR NATIVE CODING ---
00259Ar 3               
00259Ar 3               		; make room on stack
00259Ar 3  CA                           dex
00259Br 3  CA                           dex
00259Cr 3  CA                           dex
00259Dr 3  CA                           dex
00259Er 3               
00259Er 3                               ; In theory, we should test for underflow on the Return
00259Er 3                               ; Stack. However, given the traffic there with an STC
00259Er 3                               ; Forth, that's probably not really useful
00259Er 3               
00259Er 3                               ; now we can access the data
00259Er 3  68                           pla                     ; LSB
00259Fr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0025A1r 3  68                           pla                     ; MSB
0025A2r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0025A4r 3               
0025A4r 3  68                           pla                     ; LSB
0025A5r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
0025A7r 3  68                           pla                     ; MSB
0025A8r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
0025AAr 3               
0025AAr 3                               ; --- CUT HERE FOR NATIVE CODING ---
0025AAr 3               
0025AAr 3                               ; restore return address
0025AAr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1              ; MSB
0025ACr 3  48                           pha
0025ADr 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1                ; LSB
0025AFr 3  48                           pha
0025B0r 3               
0025B0r 3  60           z_two_r_from:   rts
0025B1r 3               
0025B1r 3               
0025B1r 3               ; ## TWO_SLASH ( n -- n ) "Divide TOS by two"
0025B1r 3               ; ## "2/"  auto  ANS core
0025B1r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoDiv"""
0025B1r 3               xt_two_slash:
0025B1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0025B4r 3               
0025B4r 3                               ; We can't just LSR the LSB and ROR the MSB because that
0025B4r 3                               ; would do bad things to the sign
0025B4r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
0025B6r 3  0A                           asl                     ; save the sign
0025B7r 3  76 01                        ror 1,x
0025B9r 3  76 00                        ror 0,x
0025BBr 3               
0025BBr 3  60           z_two_slash:    rts
0025BCr 3               
0025BCr 3               
0025BCr 3               ; ## TWO_STAR ( n -- n ) "Multiply TOS by two"
0025BCr 3               ; ## "2*"  auto  ANS core
0025BCr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoTimes
0025BCr 3                       ;
0025BCr 3                       ; Also used for CELLS
0025BCr 3                       ; """
0025BCr 3               xt_two_star:
0025BCr 3               xt_cells:
0025BCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0025BFr 3               
0025BFr 3  16 00                        asl 0,x
0025C1r 3  36 01                        rol 1,x
0025C3r 3               z_cells:
0025C3r 3  60           z_two_star:     rts
0025C4r 3               
0025C4r 3               
0025C4r 3               ; ## TWO_STORE ( n1 n2 addr -- ) "Store two numbers at given address"
0025C4r 3               ; ## "2!"  auto  ANS core
0025C4r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoStore
0025C4r 3                       ; Stores so n2 goes to addr and n1 to the next consecutive cell.
0025C4r 3                       ; Is equivalent to  `SWAP OVER ! CELL+ !`
0025C4r 3                       ; """
0025C4r 3               xt_two_store:
0025C4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_3
0025C7r 3               
0025C7r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0025C9r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
0025CBr 3  B4 01                        ldy 1,x
0025CDr 3  84 rr                        sty tmp1+1
0025CFr 3               
0025CFr 3  E8                           inx
0025D0r 3  E8                           inx
0025D1r 3               
0025D1r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; copy MSB
0025D3r 3  92 rr                        sta (tmp1)
0025D5r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; copy next
0025D7r 3  A0 01                        ldy #1
0025D9r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
0025DBr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; copy next
0025DDr 3  C8                           iny
0025DEr 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
0025E0r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x         ; copy MSB
0025E2r 3  C8                           iny
0025E3r 3  91 rr                        sta (tmp1),y
0025E5r 3               
0025E5r 3  E8                           inx             ; 2DROP
0025E6r 3  E8                           inx
0025E7r 3  E8                           inx
0025E8r 3  E8                           inx
0025E9r 3               
0025E9r 3  60           z_two_store:    rts
0025EAr 3               
0025EAr 3               
0025EAr 3               ; ## TWO_SWAP ( n1 n2 n3 n4 -- n3 n4 n1 n1 ) "Exchange two double words"
0025EAr 3               ; ## "2swap"  auto  ANS core
0025EAr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwoSWAP"""
0025EAr 3               xt_two_swap:
0025EAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_4
0025EDr 3               
0025EDr 3                               ; 0 <-> 4
0025EDr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0025EFr 3  B4 04                        ldy 4,x
0025F1r 3  95 04                        sta 4,x
0025F3r 3  94 00                        sty 0,x
0025F5r 3               
0025F5r 3                               ; 1 <-> 5
0025F5r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
0025F7r 3  B4 05                        ldy 5,x
0025F9r 3  95 05                        sta 5,x
0025FBr 3  94 01                        sty 1,x
0025FDr 3               
0025FDr 3                               ; 2 <-> 6
0025FDr 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
0025FFr 3  B4 06                        ldy 6,x
002601r 3  95 06                        sta 6,x
002603r 3  94 02                        sty 2,x
002605r 3               
002605r 3                               ; 3 <-> 7
002605r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
