002607r 3  B4 07                        ldy 7,x
002609r 3  95 07                        sta 7,x
00260Br 3  94 03                        sty 3,x
00260Dr 3               
00260Dr 3  60           z_two_swap:     rts
00260Er 3               
00260Er 3               
00260Er 3               ; ## TWO_TO_R ( n1 n2 -- )(R: -- n1 n2 "Push top two entries to Return Stack"
00260Er 3               ; ## "2>r"  auto  ANS core ext
00260Er 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TwotoR
00260Er 3                       ; Push top two entries to Return Stack.
00260Er 3                       ;
00260Er 3                       ; The same as SWAP >R >R
00260Er 3                       ; except that if we jumped here, the return address will be in the
00260Er 3                       ; way. May not be natively compiled unless we're clever and use
00260Er 3                       ; special routines.
00260Er 3                       ; """
00260Er 3               xt_two_to_r:
00260Er 3                               ; save the return address
00260Er 3  68                           pla             ; LSB
00260Fr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
002611r 3  68                           pla             ; MSB
002612r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
002614r 3               
002614r 3                               ; --- CUT HERE FOR NATIVE CODING ---
002614r 3               
002614r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
002617r 3               
002617r 3                               ; now we can move the data
002617r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x         ; MSB
002619r 3  48                           pha
00261Ar 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x         ; LSB
00261Cr 3  48                           pha
00261Dr 3               
00261Dr 3                               ; now we can move the data
00261Dr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB
00261Fr 3  48                           pha
002620r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; LSB
002622r 3  48                           pha
002623r 3               
002623r 3  E8                           inx
002624r 3  E8                           inx
002625r 3  E8                           inx
002626r 3  E8                           inx
002627r 3               
002627r 3                               ; --- CUT HERE FOR NATIVE CODING ---
002627r 3               
002627r 3                               ; restore return address
002627r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1      ; MSB
002629r 3  48                           pha
00262Ar 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1        ; LSB
00262Cr 3  48                           pha
00262Dr 3               
00262Dr 3  60           z_two_to_r:     rts
00262Er 3               
00262Er 3               
00262Er 3               ; ## TWO_CONSTANT (C: d "name" -- ) ( -- d) "Create a constant for a double word"
00262Er 3               ; ## "2constant"  auto  ANS double
00262Er 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/double/TwoCONSTANT
00262Er 3                       ;
00262Er 3                       ; Based on the Forth code
00262Er 3                       ; : 2CONSTANT ( D -- )  CREATE SWAP , , DOES> DUP @ SWAP CELL+ @ ;
00262Er 3                       ; """
00262Er 3               xt_two_constant:
00262Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
002631r 3               
002631r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_create
002634r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
002637r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_comma
00263Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_comma
00263Dr 3               
00263Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr does_runtime    ; does> turns into these two routines.
002640r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr dodoes
002643r 3               
002643r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
002646r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch
002649r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
00264Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cell_plus
00264Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch
002652r 3               
002652r 3  60           z_two_constant: rts
002653r 3               
002653r 3               
002653r 3               ; ## TWO_LITERAL (C: d -- ) ( -- d) "Compile a literal double word"
002653r 3               ; ## "2literal"  auto  ANS double
002653r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/double/TwoLITERAL"""
002653r 3                       ; Based on the Forth code
002653r 3                       ; : 2LITERAL ( D -- ) SWAP POSTPONE LITERAL POSTPONE LITERAL ; IMMEDIATE
002653r 3                       ; """
002653r 3               xt_two_literal:
002653r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2 ; double number
002656r 3               
002656r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
002659r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_literal
00265Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_literal
00265Fr 3               
00265Fr 3  60           z_two_literal:  rts
002660r 3               
002660r 3               
002660r 3               ; ## TWO_VARIABLE ( "name" -- ) "Create a variable for a double word"
002660r 3               ; ## "2variable"  auto  ANS double
002660r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/double/TwoVARIABLE
002660r 3                       ; The variable is not initialized to zero.
002660r 3                       ;
002660r 3                       ; This can be realized in Forth as either
002660r 3                       ; CREATE 2 CELLS ALLOT  or just  CREATE 0 , 0 ,
002660r 3                       ; """
002660r 3               xt_two_variable:
002660r 3                               ; We just let CRATE and ALLOT do the heavy lifting
002660r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_create
002663r 3               
002663r 3  CA                           dex
002664r 3  CA                           dex
002665r 3  A9 04                        lda #4
002667r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002669r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
00266Br 3               
00266Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_allot
00266Er 3               
00266Er 3  60           z_two_variable: rts
00266Fr 3               
00266Fr 3               
00266Fr 3               ; ## TYPE ( addr u -- ) "Print string"
00266Fr 3               ; ## "type"  auto  ANS core
00266Fr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/TYPE
00266Fr 3                       ; Works through EMIT to allow OUTPUT revectoring.
00266Fr 3                       ; """
00266Fr 3               
00266Fr 3               xt_type:
00266Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
002672r 3               
002672r 3                               ; Save the starting address into tmp1
002672r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
002674r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
002676r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
002678r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
00267Ar 3               @loop:
00267Ar 3                               ; done if length is zero
00267Ar 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00267Cr 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
00267Er 3  F0 15                        beq @done
002680r 3               
002680r 3                               ; Send the current character
002680r 3  B2 rr                        lda (tmp1)
002682r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a      ; avoids stack foolery
002685r 3               
002685r 3                               ; Move the address along (in tmp1)
002685r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1
002687r 3  D0 02                        bne @1
002689r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1+1
00268Br 3               @1:
00268Br 3                               ; Reduce the count (on the data stack)
00268Br 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00268Dr 3  D0 02                        bne @2
00268Fr 3  D6 01                        dec 1,x
002691r 3               @2:
002691r 3  D6 00                        dec 0,x
002693r 3               
002693r 3  80 E5                        bra @loop
002695r 3               @done:
002695r 3  E8                           inx
002696r 3  E8                           inx
002697r 3  E8                           inx
002698r 3  E8                           inx
002699r 3               
002699r 3  60           z_type:         rts
00269Ar 3               
00269Ar 3               
00269Ar 3               
00269Ar 3               ; ## U_DOT ( u -- ) "Print TOS as unsigned number"
00269Ar 3               ; ## "u."  tested  ANS core
00269Ar 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Ud
00269Ar 3                       ;
00269Ar 3                       ; This is : U. 0 <# #S #> TYPE SPACE ; in Forth
00269Ar 3                       ; We use the internal assembler function print_u followed
00269Ar 3                       ; by a single space
00269Ar 3                       ; """
00269Ar 3               xt_u_dot:
00269Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
00269Dr 3               
00269Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr print_u
0026A0r 3  A9 20                        lda #AscSP
0026A2r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0026A5r 3               
0026A5r 3  60           z_u_dot:        rts
0026A6r 3               
0026A6r 3               
0026A6r 3               ; ## U_DOT_R ( u u -- ) "Print NOS as unsigned number right-justified with TOS width"
0026A6r 3               ; ## "u.r"  tested  ANS core ext
0026A6r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/UDotR"""
0026A6r 3               xt_u_dot_r:
0026A6r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
0026A9r 3               
0026A9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_r
0026ACr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero
0026AFr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_less_number_sign
0026B2r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_s
0026B5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_greater
0026B8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_from
0026BBr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_over
0026BEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
0026C1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_spaces
0026C4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
0026C7r 3               
0026C7r 3  60           z_u_dot_r:      rts
0026C8r 3               
0026C8r 3               
0026C8r 3               ; ## U_GREATER_THAN ( n m -- f ) "Return true if NOS > TOS (unsigned)"
0026C8r 3               ; ## "u>"  auto  ANS core ext
0026C8r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Umore"""
0026C8r 3               xt_u_greater_than:
0026C8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
0026CBr 3               
0026CBr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0026CDr 3  D5 02                        cmp 2,x
0026CFr 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
0026D1r 3  F5 03                        sbc 3,x
0026D3r 3  E8                           inx
0026D4r 3  E8                           inx
0026D5r 3               
0026D5r 3  A9 00                        lda #0
0026D7r 3  69 FF                        adc #$ff
0026D9r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; store flag
0026DBr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0026DDr 3               
0026DDr 3  60           z_u_greater_than:    rts
0026DEr 3               
0026DEr 3               ; ## U_LESS_THAN ( n m -- f ) "Return true if NOS < TOS (unsigned)"
0026DEr 3               ; ## "u<"  auto  ANS core
0026DEr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Uless"""
0026DEr 3               xt_u_less_than:
0026DEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
0026E1r 3               
0026E1r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
0026E3r 3  D5 00                        cmp 0,x
0026E5r 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
0026E7r 3  F5 01                        sbc 1,x
0026E9r 3  E8                           inx
0026EAr 3  E8                           inx
0026EBr 3               
0026EBr 3  A9 00                        lda #0
0026EDr 3  69 FF                        adc #$ff
0026EFr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; store flag
0026F1r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0026F3r 3               
0026F3r 3  60           z_u_less_than:    rts
0026F4r 3               
0026F4r 3               
0026F4r 3               ; ## UD_DOT ( d -- ) "Print double as unsigned"
0026F4r 3               ; ## "ud."  auto  Tali double
0026F4r 3                       ;
0026F4r 3                       ; """Based on the Forth code  : UD. <# #S #> TYPE SPACE ;
0026F4r 3                       ; """
0026F4r 3               xt_ud_dot:
0026F4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2 ; double number
0026F7r 3               
0026F7r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_less_number_sign
0026FAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_s
0026FDr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_greater
002700r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
002703r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
002706r 3               
002706r 3  60           z_ud_dot:        rts
002707r 3               
002707r 3               
002707r 3               ; ## UD_DOT_R ( d u -- ) "Print unsigned double right-justified u wide"
002707r 3               ; ## "ud.r"  auto  Tali double
002707r 3                       ;
002707r 3                       ; """Based on the Forth code : UD.R  >R <# #S #> R> OVER - SPACES TYPE ;
002707r 3                       ; """
002707r 3               xt_ud_dot_r:
002707r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_3
00270Ar 3               
00270Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_r
00270Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_less_number_sign
002710r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_s
002713r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_number_sign_greater
002716r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_from
002719r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_over
00271Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
00271Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_spaces
002722r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
002725r 3               
002725r 3  60           z_ud_dot_r:      rts
002726r 3               
002726r 3               
002726r 3               ; ## UM_SLASH_MOD ( ud u -- ur u ) "32/16 -> 16 division"
002726r 3               ; ## "um/mod"  auto  ANS core
002726r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/UMDivMOD
002726r 3                       ; Divide double cell number by single cell number, returning the
002726r 3                       ; quotient as TOS and any remainder as NOS. All numbers are unsigned.
002726r 3                       ; This is the basic division operation all others use. Based on FIG
002726r 3                       ; Forth code, modified by Garth Wilson, see
002726r 3                       ; http://6502.org/source/integers/ummodfix/ummodfix.htm
002726r 3                       ;
002726r 3                       ; This uses tmp1, tmp1+1, and tmptos
002726r 3                       ; """
002726r 3               
002726r 3               xt_um_slash_mod:
002726r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_3
002729r 3               
002729r 3                               ; catch division by zero
002729r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00272Br 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
00272Dr 3  D0 05                        bne @not_zero
00272Fr 3               
00272Fr 3  A9 04                        lda #err_divzero
002731r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp error
002734r 3               
002734r 3               @not_zero:
002734r 3                               ; We loop 17 times
002734r 3  A9 11                        lda #17
002736r 3  85 rr                        sta tmptos
002738r 3               
002738r 3               @loop:
002738r 3                               ; rotate low cell of dividend one bit left (LSB)
002738r 3  36 04                        rol 4,x
00273Ar 3  36 05                        rol 5,x
00273Cr 3               
00273Cr 3                               ; loop control
00273Cr 3  C6 rr                        dec tmptos
00273Er 3  F0 22                        beq @done
002740r 3               
002740r 3                               ; rotate high cell of dividend one bit left (MSB)
002740r 3  36 02                        rol 2,x
002742r 3  36 03                        rol 3,x
002744r 3               
002744r 3  64 rr                        stz tmp1        ; store the bit we got from hi cell (MSB)
002746r 3  26 rr                        rol tmp1
002748r 3               
002748r 3                               ; subtract dividend hi cell minus divisor
002748r 3  38                           sec
002749r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
00274Br 3  F5 00                        sbc 0,x
00274Dr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
00274Fr 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
002751r 3  F5 01                        sbc 1,x
002753r 3               
002753r 3  A8                           tay
002754r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
002756r 3  E9 00                        sbc #0
002758r 3  90 DE                        bcc @loop
00275Ar 3               
00275Ar 3                               ; make result new dividend high cell
00275Ar 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
00275Cr 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
00275Er 3  94 03                        sty 3,x         ; used as temp storage
002760r 3               
002760r 3  80 D6                        bra @loop
002762r 3               @done:
002762r 3  E8                           inx
002763r 3  E8                           inx
002764r 3               
002764r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
002767r 3               
002767r 3  60           z_um_slash_mod: rts
002768r 3               
002768r 3               
002768r 3               
002768r 3               ; ## UM_STAR ( u u -- ud ) "Multiply 16 x 16 -> 32"
002768r 3               ; ## "um*"  auto  ANS core
002768r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/UMTimes
002768r 3                       ; Multiply two unsigned 16 bit numbers, producing a 32 bit result.
002768r 3                       ; Old Forth versions such as FIG Forth call this U*
002768r 3                       ;
002768r 3                       ; This is based on modified FIG Forth code by Dr. Jefyll, see
002768r 3                       ; http://forum.6502.org/viewtopic.php?f=9&t=689 for a detailed
002768r 3                       ; discussion.
002768r 3                       ;
002768r 3                       ; We don't use the system scratch pad (SYSPAD) for temp
002768r 3                       ; storage because >NUMBER uses it as well, but instead tmp1 to
002768r 3                       ; tmp3 (tmp1 is N in the original code, tmp1+1 is N+1, etc).
002768r 3                       ;
002768r 3                       ; Consider switching to a table-supported version based on
002768r 3                       ; http://codebase64.org/doku.php?id=base:seriously_fast_multiplication
002768r 3                       ; http://codebase64.org/doku.php?id=magazines:chacking16#d_graphics_for_the_masseslib3d>
002768r 3                       ; http://forum.6502.org/viewtopic.php?p=205#p205
002768r 3                       ; http://forum.6502.org/viewtopic.php?f=9&t=689
002768r 3                       ; """
002768r 3               
002768r 3               xt_um_star:
002768r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
00276Br 3               
00276Br 3                               ; to eliminate clc inside the loop, the value at
00276Br 3                               ; tmp1 is reduced by 1 in advance
00276Br 3  18                           clc
00276Cr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x         ; copy TOS to tmp2
00276Er 3  E9 00                        sbc #0
002770r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2
002772r 3               
002772r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
002774r 3  E9 00                        sbc #0
002776r 3  90 31                        bcc @zero       ; is TOS zero?
002778r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
00277Ar 3               
00277Ar 3  A9 00                        lda #0
00277Cr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
00277Er 3  86 rr                        stx tmp3        ; tested for exit from outer loop
002780r 3  CA                           dex
002781r 3  CA                           dex
002782r 3               
002782r 3               @outer_loop:
002782r 3  A0 08                        ldy #8          ; counter inner loop
002784r 3  56 04                        lsr 4,x         ; think "2,x" then later "3,x"
002786r 3               
002786r 3               @inner_loop:
002786r 3  90 0C                        bcc @no_add
002788r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1      ; save time, don't CLC
00278Ar 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
00278Cr 3  65 rr                        adc tmp2
00278Er 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
002790r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1+1
002792r 3  65 rr                        adc tmp2+1
002794r 3               
002794r 3               @no_add:
002794r 3  6A                           ror
002795r 3  66 rr                        ror tmp1
002797r 3  76 04                        ror 4,x         ; think "2,x" then later "3,x"
002799r 3               
002799r 3  88                           dey
00279Ar 3  D0 EA                        bne @inner_loop ; go back for one more shift?
00279Cr 3               
00279Cr 3  E8                           inx
00279Dr 3  E4 rr                        cpx tmp3
00279Fr 3  D0 E1                        bne @outer_loop ; go back for eight more shifts?
0027A1r 3               
0027A1r 3                               ; all done, store high word of result
0027A1r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0027A3r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp1
0027A5r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0027A7r 3  80 04                        bra @done
0027A9r 3               
0027A9r 3               @zero:
0027A9r 3  74 02                        stz 2,x
0027ABr 3  74 03                        stz 3,x
0027ADr 3               @done:
0027ADr 3  60           z_um_star:      rts
0027AEr 3               
0027AEr 3               
0027AEr 3               
0027AEr 3               ; ## UNLOOP ( -- )(R: n1 n2 n3 ---) "Drop loop control from Return stack"
0027AEr 3               ; ## "unloop"  auto  ANS core
0027AEr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/UNLOOP
0027AEr 3                       ;
0027AEr 3                       ; Note that 6xPLA uses just as many bytes as a loop would
0027AEr 3                       ; """
0027AEr 3               xt_unloop:
0027AEr 3                               ; Drop fudge number (limit/start from DO/?DO off the
0027AEr 3                               ; return stack
0027AEr 3  68                           pla
0027AFr 3  68                           pla
0027B0r 3  68                           pla
0027B1r 3  68                           pla
0027B2r 3               
0027B2r 3                               ; Now drop the LEAVE address that was below them off
0027B2r 3                               ; the Return Stack as well
0027B2r 3  68                           pla
0027B3r 3  68                           pla
0027B4r 3               
0027B4r 3  60           z_unloop:       rts
0027B5r 3               
0027B5r 3               
0027B5r 3               ; ## UNTIL (C: dest -- ) ( -- ) "Loop flow control"
0027B5r 3               ; ## "until"  auto  ANS core
0027B5r 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/UNTIL"""
0027B5r 3               xt_until:
0027B5r 3                               ; Compile a 0BRANCH
0027B5r 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>zero_branch_runtime
0027B7r 3  A9 rr                        lda #<zero_branch_runtime
0027B9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
0027BCr 3               
0027BCr 3                               ; The address to loop back to is on the stack.
0027BCr 3                               ; Just compile it as the destination for the
0027BCr 3                               ; 0branch.
0027BCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_comma
0027BFr 3               
0027BFr 3  60           z_until:        rts
0027C0r 3               
0027C0r 3               
0027C0r 3               ; ## UNUSED ( -- u ) "Return size of space available to Dictionary"
0027C0r 3               ; ## "unused"  auto  ANS core ext
0027C0r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/UNUSED
0027C0r 3                       ; UNUSED does not include the ACCEPT history buffers. Total RAM
0027C0r 3                       ; should be HERE + UNUSED + <history buffer size>, the last of which
0027C0r 3                       ; defaults to $400
0027C0r 3                       ; """
0027C0r 3               xt_unused:
0027C0r 3  CA                           dex
0027C1r 3  CA                           dex
0027C2r 3               
0027C2r 3  A9 FF                        lda #<cp_end
0027C4r 3  38                           sec
0027C5r 3  E5 rr                        sbc cp
0027C7r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0027C9r 3               
0027C9r 3  A9 7F                        lda #>cp_end
0027CBr 3  E5 rr                        sbc cp+1
0027CDr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0027CFr 3               
0027CFr 3  60           z_unused:       rts
0027D0r 3               
0027D0r 3               
0027D0r 3               ; ## UPDATE ( -- ) "Mark current block as dirty"
0027D0r 3               ; ## "update"  auto  ANS block
0027D0r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/block/UPDATE"""
0027D0r 3               xt_update:
0027D0r 3                               ; Turn on the dirty bit. We can't use TSB here because it only
0027D0r 3                               ; has Absolute and Direct Pages addressing modes
0027D0r 3  A0 2C                        ldy #buffstatus_offset
0027D2r 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
0027D4r 3  09 02                        ora #2          ; Turn on dirty flag (bit 2)
0027D6r 3  91 rr                        sta (up),y
0027D8r 3               
0027D8r 3  60           z_update:       rts
0027D9r 3               
0027D9r 3               
0027D9r 3               ; ## USERADDR ( -- addr ) "Push address of base address of user variables"
0027D9r 3               ; ## "useraddr"  tested  Tali Forth
0027D9r 3               xt_useraddr:
0027D9r 3  CA                           dex
0027DAr 3  CA                           dex
0027DBr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<up
0027DDr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0027DFr 3  A9 rr                        lda #>up
0027E1r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0027E3r 3               
0027E3r 3  60           z_useraddr:     rts
0027E4r 3               
0027E4r 3               
0027E4r 3               ; ## VALUE ( n "name" -- ) "Define a value"
0027E4r 3               ; ## "value"  auto  ANS core
0027E4r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/VALUE
0027E4r 3                       ;
0027E4r 3                       ; This is a dummy header for the WORDLIST. The actual code is
0027E4r 3                       ; identical to that of CONSTANT
0027E4r 3                       ; """
0027E4r 3               
0027E4r 3               
0027E4r 3               ; ## VARIABLE ( "name" -- ) "Define a variable"
0027E4r 3               ; ## "variable"  auto  ANS core
0027E4r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/VARIABLE
0027E4r 3                       ; There are various Forth definitions for this word, such as
0027E4r 3                       ; `CREATE 1 CELLS ALLOT`  or  `CREATE 0 ,`  We use a variant of the
0027E4r 3                       ; second one so the variable is initialized to zero
0027E4r 3                       ; """
0027E4r 3               xt_variable:
0027E4r 3                               ; we let CREATE do the heavy lifting
0027E4r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_create
0027E7r 3               
0027E7r 3                               ; there is no "STZ (CP)" so we have to do this the hard
0027E7r 3                               ; way
0027E7r 3  A9 00                        lda #0
0027E9r 3               
0027E9r 3  92 rr                        sta (cp)
0027EBr 3  E6 rr                        inc cp
0027EDr 3  D0 02                        bne @1
0027EFr 3  E6 rr                        inc cp+1
0027F1r 3               @1:
0027F1r 3  92 rr                        sta (cp)
0027F3r 3  E6 rr                        inc cp
0027F5r 3  D0 02                        bne @2
0027F7r 3  E6 rr                        inc cp+1
0027F9r 3               @2:
0027F9r 3                               ; Now we need to adjust the length of the complete word by two
0027F9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr adjust_z
0027FCr 3               
0027FCr 3  60           z_variable:     rts
0027FDr 3               
0027FDr 3               
0027FDr 3               ; ## WHILE ( C: dest -- orig dest ) ( x -- ) "Loop flow control"
0027FDr 3               ; ## "while"  auto  ANS core
0027FDr 3                       ; """http://forth-standard.org/standard/core/WHILE"""
0027FDr 3               xt_while:
0027FDr 3                               ; Compile a 0branch
0027FDr 3  A0 rr                        ldy #>zero_branch_runtime
0027FFr 3  A9 rr                        lda #<zero_branch_runtime
002801r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_subroutine
002804r 3               
002804r 3                               ; Put the address (here) where the destination
002804r 3                               ; address needs to go so it can be put there later.
002804r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_here
002807r 3               
002807r 3                               ; Fill in the destination address with 0 for now.
002807r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero
00280Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_comma
00280Dr 3               
00280Dr 3                               ; Swap the two addresses on the stack.
00280Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
002810r 3               
002810r 3  60           z_while:        rts
002811r 3               
002811r 3               
002811r 3               ; ## WITHIN ( n1 n2 n3 -- ) "See if within a range"
002811r 3               ; ## "within"  auto  ANS core ext
002811r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/WITHIN
002811r 3                       ;
002811r 3                       ; This an assembler version of the ANS Forth implementation
002811r 3                       ; at https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/WITHIN which is
002811r 3                       ; OVER - >R - R> U<  note there is an alternative high-level version
002811r 3                       ; ROT TUCK > -ROT > INVERT AND
002811r 3                       ; """"
002811r 3               xt_within:
002811r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_3
002814r 3               
002814r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_over
002817r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
00281Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_to_r
00281Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
002820r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_r_from
002823r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_less_than
002826r 3               
002826r 3  60           z_within:       rts
002827r 3               
002827r 3               
002827r 3               ; ## WORD ( char "name " -- caddr ) "Parse input stream"
002827r 3               ; ## "word"  auto  ANS core
002827r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/WORD
002827r 3                       ; Obsolete parsing word included for backwards compatibility only.
002827r 3                       ; Do not use this, use `PARSE` or `PARSE-NAME`. Skips leading delimiters
002827r 3                       ; and copies word to storage area for a maximum size of 255 bytes.
002827r 3                       ; Returns the result as a counted string (requires COUNT to convert
002827r 3                       ; to modern format), and inserts a space after the string. See "Forth
002827r 3                       ; Programmer's Handbook" 3rd edition p. 159 and
002827r 3                       ; http://www.forth200x.org/documents/html/rationale.html#rat:core:PARSE
002827r 3                       ; for discussions of why you shouldn't be using WORD anymore.
002827r 3                       ;
002827r 3                       ; Forth
002827r 3                       ; would be   PARSE DUP BUFFER1 C! OUTPUT 1+ SWAP MOVE BUFFER1
002827r 3                       ; We only allow input of 255 chars. Seriously, use PARSE-NAME.
002827r 3                       ; """
002827r 3               
002827r 3               xt_word:
002827r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
00282Ar 3               
00282Ar 3                               ; Skip over leading delimiters - this is like PARSE-NAME,
00282Ar 3                               ; but unlike PARSE
00282Ar 3  A4 rr                        ldy toin                ; >IN
00282Cr 3               @loop:
00282Cr 3  C4 rr                        cpy ciblen              ; quit if end of input
00282Er 3  F0 09                        beq @found_char
002830r 3  B1 rr                        lda (cib),y
002832r 3  D5 00                        cmp 0,x                 ; ASCII of delimiter
002834r 3  D0 03                        bne @found_char
002836r 3               
002836r 3  C8                           iny
002837r 3  80 F3                        bra @loop
002839r 3               @found_char:
002839r 3                               ; Save index of where word starts
002839r 3  84 rr                        sty toin
00283Br 3               
00283Br 3                               ; The real work is done by parse
00283Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_parse            ; Returns ( addr u )
00283Er 3               
00283Er 3                               ; Convert the modern ( addr u ) string format to obsolete
00283Er 3                               ; ( caddr ) format. We just do this in the Dictionary
00283Er 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002840r 3  92 rr                        sta (cp)                ; Save length of string
002842r 3  48                           pha                     ; Keep copy of length for later
002843r 3               
002843r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup              ; ( addr u u )
002846r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
002848r 3  18                           clc
002849r 3  69 01                        adc #1
00284Br 3  95 02                        sta 2,x                 ; LSB of CP
00284Dr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
00284Fr 3  69 00                        adc #0
002851r 3  95 03                        sta 3,x                 ; ( addr cp+1 u )
002853r 3               
002853r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_move
002856r 3               
002856r 3                               ; Return caddr
002856r 3  CA                           dex
002857r 3  CA                           dex
002858r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp
00285Ar 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00285Cr 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
00285Er 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002860r 3               
002860r 3                               ; Adjust CP
002860r 3  68                           pla                     ; length of string
002861r 3  18                           clc
002862r 3  65 rr                        adc cp
002864r 3  85 rr                        sta cp
002866r 3  A5 rr                        lda cp+1
002868r 3  69 00                        adc #0                  ; we only need the carry
00286Ar 3  85 rr                        sta cp+1
00286Cr 3  60           z_word:         rts
00286Dr 3               
00286Dr 3               
00286Dr 3               ; ## WORDLIST ( -- wid ) "Create new wordlist (from pool of 8)"
00286Dr 3               ; ## "wordlist" auto ANS search
00286Dr 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/search/WORDLIST
00286Dr 3                       ; See the tutorial on Wordlists and the Search Order for
00286Dr 3                       ; more information.
00286Dr 3                       ; """
00286Dr 3               
00286Dr 3               xt_wordlist:
00286Dr 3                               ; Get the current number of wordlists
00286Dr 3  A0 05                        ldy #num_wordlists_offset
00286Fr 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y      ; This is a byte variable, so only
002871r 3                                               ; the LSB needs to be checked.
002871r 3               
002871r 3                               ; See if we are already at the max.
002871r 3  C9 0C                        cmp #max_wordlists
002873r 3  D0 05                        bne @ok
002875r 3               
002875r 3                               ; Print an error message if all wordlists used.
002875r 3  A9 0B                        lda #err_wordlist
002877r 3  4C rr rr                     jmp error
00287Ar 3               
00287Ar 3               @ok:
00287Ar 3  1A                           inc             ; Increment the wordlist#
00287Br 3  91 rr                        sta (up),y      ; Save it into byte variable #wordlists
00287Dr 3  CA                           dex             ; and put it on the stack.
00287Er 3  CA                           dex
00287Fr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002881r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x         ; 12 is the max, so upper byte is always zero.
002883r 3               
002883r 3  60           z_wordlist:     rts
002884r 3               
002884r 3               
002884r 3               
002884r 3               ; ## WORDS ( -- ) "Print known words from Dictionary"
002884r 3               ; ## "words"  tested  ANS tools
002884r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/tools/WORDS
002884r 3                       ; This is pretty much only used at the command line so we can
002884r 3                       ; be slow and try to save space.
002884r 3                       ; """
002884r 3               
002884r 3               xt_words:
002884r 3                               ; we follow Gforth by starting on the next
002884r 3                               ; line
002884r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
002887r 3               
002887r 3                               ; We pretty-format the output by inserting a line break
002887r 3                               ; before the end of the line. We can get away with pushing
002887r 3                               ; the counter to the stack because this is usually an
002887r 3                               ; interactive word and speed is not that important
002887r 3  A9 00                        lda #0
002889r 3  48                           pha
00288Ar 3               
00288Ar 3                               ; Set up for traversing the wordlist search order.
00288Ar 3  CA                           dex                     ; Make room on the stack for
00288Br 3  CA                           dex                     ; a dictionary pointer.
00288Cr 3  64 rr                        stz tmp3                ; Start at the beginning of
00288Er 3                                                       ; the search order.
00288Er 3               @wordlist_loop:
00288Er 3  A0 1E                        ldy #num_order_offset   ; Check against byte variable #ORDER.
002890r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp3
002892r 3  D1 rr                        cmp (up),y              ; See if we are done.
002894r 3  D0 02                        bne @have_wordlist
002896r 3               
002896r 3                               ; We ran out of wordlists to search.
002896r 3  80 44                        bra @words_done
002898r 3               
002898r 3               @have_wordlist:
002898r 3                               ; start with last word in Dictionary
002898r 3                               ; Get the current wordlist id
002898r 3  18                           clc                     ; Index into byte array SEARCH-ORDER.
002899r 3  69 1F                        adc #search_order_offset
00289Br 3  A8                           tay
00289Cr 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y              ; Get the index into array WORDLISTS
00289Er 3               
00289Er 3                               ; Get the DP for that wordlist.
00289Er 3  0A                           asl                     ; Turn offset into cells offset.
00289Fr 3  18                           clc
0028A0r 3  69 06                        adc #wordlists_offset
0028A2r 3  A8                           tay
0028A3r 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y              ; Save the DP for this wordlist
0028A5r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x                 ; on the stack. ( nt )
0028A7r 3  C8                           iny
0028A8r 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
0028AAr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0028ACr 3               
0028ACr 3               @loop:
0028ACr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup              ; ( nt nt )
0028AFr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_name_to_string   ; ( nt addr u )
0028B2r 3               
0028B2r 3                               ; Insert line break if we're about to go past the end of the
0028B2r 3                               ; line
0028B2r 3  68                           pla
0028B3r 3  18                           clc
0028B4r 3  75 00                        adc 0,x
0028B6r 3  1A                           inc                     ; don't forget the space between words
0028B7r 3  C9 4F                        cmp #MAX_LINE_LENGTH    ; usually 79
0028B9r 3  90 05                        bcc @1
0028BBr 3               
0028BBr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
0028BEr 3  A9 00                        lda #0
0028C0r 3               @1:
0028C0r 3  48                           pha
0028C1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type             ; ( nt )
0028C4r 3               
0028C4r 3  A9 20                        lda #AscSP
0028C6r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
0028C9r 3               
0028C9r 3                               ; get next word, which begins two down
0028C9r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus         ; 1+
0028CCr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus         ; 1+
0028CFr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch            ; @ ( nt+1 )
0028D2r 3               
0028D2r 3                               ; if next address is zero, we're done
0028D2r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0028D4r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
0028D6r 3  D0 D4                        bne @loop
0028D8r 3               
0028D8r 3                               ; Move on to the next wordlist in the search order.
0028D8r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp3
0028DAr 3  80 B2                        bra @wordlist_loop
0028DCr 3               
0028DCr 3               @words_done:
0028DCr 3  68                           pla                     ; dump counter
0028DDr 3               
0028DDr 3  E8                           inx
0028DEr 3  E8                           inx
0028DFr 3               
0028DFr 3  60           z_words:        rts
0028E0r 3               
0028E0r 3               
0028E0r 3               
0028E0r 3               ; ## WORDSIZE ( nt -- u ) "Get size of word in bytes"
0028E0r 3               ; ## "wordsize"  auto  Tali Forth
0028E0r 3                       ; """Given an word's name token (nt), return the size of the
0028E0r 3                       ; word's payload size in bytes (CFA plus PFA) in bytes. Does not
0028E0r 3                       ; count the final RTS.
0028E0r 3                       ; """
0028E0r 3               xt_wordsize:
0028E0r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
0028E3r 3               
0028E3r 3                               ; We get the start address of the word from its header entry
0028E3r 3                               ; for the start of the actual code (execution token, xt)
0028E3r 3                               ; which is four bytes down, and the pointer to the end of the
0028E3r 3                               ; code (z_word, six bytes down)
0028E3r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0028E5r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
0028E7r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
0028E9r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
0028EBr 3               
0028EBr 3  A0 06                        ldy #6
0028EDr 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y    ; LSB of z
0028EFr 3  88                           dey
0028F0r 3  88                           dey
0028F1r 3               
0028F1r 3  38                           sec
0028F2r 3  F1 rr                        sbc (tmp1),y    ; LSB of xt
0028F4r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0028F6r 3               
0028F6r 3  A0 07                        ldy #7
0028F8r 3  B1 rr                        lda (tmp1),y    ; MSB of z
0028FAr 3  88                           dey
0028FBr 3  88                           dey
0028FCr 3               
0028FCr 3  F1 rr                        sbc (tmp1),y    ; MSB of xt
0028FEr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002900r 3               
002900r 3  60           z_wordsize:     rts
002901r 3               
002901r 3               
002901r 3               ; ## XOR ( n n -- n ) "Logically XOR TOS and NOS"
002901r 3               ; ## "xor"  auto  ANS core
002901r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/XOR"""
002901r 3               xt_xor:
002901r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
002904r 3               
002904r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002906r 3  55 02                        eor 2,x
002908r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
00290Ar 3               
00290Ar 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
00290Cr 3  55 03                        eor 3,x
00290Er 3  95 03                        sta 3,x
002910r 3               
002910r 3  E8                           inx
002911r 3  E8                           inx
002912r 3               
002912r 3  60           z_xor:          rts
002913r 3               
002913r 3               
002913r 3               ; ## ZERO ( -- 0 ) "Push 0 to Data Stack"
002913r 3               ; ## "0"  auto  Tali Forth
002913r 3                       ; """The disassembler assumes that this routine does not use Y. Note
002913r 3                       ; that CASE and FORTH-WORDLIST use the same routine, as the WD for Forth
002913r 3                       ; is 0."""
002913r 3               xt_case:
002913r 3               xt_forth_wordlist:
002913r 3               xt_zero:
002913r 3  CA                           dex             ; push
002914r 3  CA                           dex
002915r 3  74 00                        stz 0,x
002917r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
002919r 3               z_case:
002919r 3               z_forth_wordlist:
002919r 3               z_zero:
002919r 3  60                           rts
00291Ar 3               
00291Ar 3               
00291Ar 3               ; ## ZERO_EQUAL ( n -- f ) "Check if TOS is zero"
00291Ar 3               ; ## "0="  auto  ANS core
00291Ar 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/ZeroEqual"""
00291Ar 3               
00291Ar 3               xt_zero_equal:
00291Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
00291Dr 3               
00291Dr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
00291Fr 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
002921r 3  F0 04                        beq @zero
002923r 3               
002923r 3                               ; not a zero, so we need a FALSE flag (0)
002923r 3  A9 00                        lda #0
002925r 3  80 02                        bra @store
002927r 3               @zero:
002927r 3                               ; We have a zero, so we need a TRUE flag (-1)
002927r 3  A9 FF                        lda #$ff
002929r 3               @store:
002929r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00292Br 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
00292Dr 3               
00292Dr 3  60           z_zero_equal:   rts
00292Er 3               
00292Er 3               
00292Er 3               
00292Er 3               ; ## ZERO_GREATER ( n -- f ) "Return a TRUE flag if TOS is positive"
00292Er 3               ; ## "0>"  auto  ANS core ext
00292Er 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Zeromore"""
00292Er 3               
00292Er 3               xt_zero_greater:
00292Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
002931r 3               
002931r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0          ; Default is FALSE (TOS is negative)
002933r 3               
002933r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB
002935r 3  30 05                        bmi @done       ; TOS is negative, keep FLASE
002937r 3  15 00                        ora 0,x
002939r 3  F0 01                        beq @done       ; TOS is zero, keep FALSE
00293Br 3               
00293Br 3  88                           dey             ; TOS is postive, make true
00293Cr 3               @done:
00293Cr 3  98                           tya
00293Dr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00293Fr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002941r 3               
002941r 3  60           z_zero_greater: rts
002942r 3               
002942r 3               
002942r 3               
002942r 3               ; ## ZERO_LESS ( n -- f ) "Return a TRUE flag if TOS negative"
002942r 3               ; ## "0<"  auto  ANS core
002942r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Zeroless"""
002942r 3               
002942r 3               xt_zero_less:
002942r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
002945r 3               
002945r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0          ; Default is FALSE (TOS positive)
002947r 3               
002947r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x         ; MSB
002949r 3  10 01                        bpl @done       ; TOS is positive, so keep FALSE
00294Br 3               
00294Br 3  88                           dey             ; TOS is negative, make TRUE
00294Cr 3               @done:
00294Cr 3  98                           tya
00294Dr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00294Fr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002951r 3               
002951r 3  60           z_zero_less:    rts
002952r 3               
002952r 3               
002952r 3               
002952r 3               ; ## ZERO_UNEQUAL ( m -- f ) "Return TRUE flag if not zero"
002952r 3               ; ## "0<>"  auto  ANS core ext
002952r 3                       ; """https://forth-standard.org/standard/core/Zerone"""
002952r 3               
002952r 3               xt_zero_unequal:
002952r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
002955r 3               
002955r 3  A0 00                        ldy #0          ; default false
002957r 3               
002957r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002959r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
00295Br 3  F0 01                        beq @got_zero
00295Dr 3               
00295Dr 3  88                           dey
00295Er 3               @got_zero:
00295Er 3  98                           tya
00295Fr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002961r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002963r 3               
002963r 3  60           z_zero_unequal: rts
002964r 3               
002964r 3               
002964r 3               
002964r 3               ; ==========================================================
002964r 3               ; EDITOR words
002964r 3               
002964r 3               ; This routine is used by both enter-screen and erase-screen
002964r 3               ; to get a buffer for the given screen number and set SCR to
002964r 3               ; the given screen number.  This word is not in the dictionary.
002964r 3               xt_editor_screen_helper:
002964r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
002967r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_scr
00296Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_store
00296Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_buffer
002970r 3               z_editor_screen_helper:
002970r 3  60                           rts
002971r 3               
002971r 3               
002971r 3               ; ## EDITOR_ENTER_SCREEN ( scr# -- ) "Enter all lines for given screen"
002971r 3               ; ## "enter-screen"  auto  Tali Editor
002971r 3               
002971r 3               xt_editor_enter_screen:
002971r 3                               ; Set the variable SCR and get a buffer for the
002971r 3                               ; given screen number.
002971r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_editor_screen_helper
002974r 3               
002974r 3                               ; Drop the buffer address.
002974r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_drop
002977r 3               
002977r 3                               ; Overwrite the lines one at a time.
002977r 3  64 rr                        stz editor1
002979r 3               @prompt_loop:
002979r 3                               ; Put the current line number on the stack.
002979r 3  CA                           dex
00297Ar 3  CA                           dex
00297Br 3  A5 rr                        lda editor1
00297Dr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
00297Fr 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
002981r 3               
002981r 3                               ; Use the O word to prompt for overwrite.
002981r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_editor_o
002984r 3               
002984r 3                               ; Move on to the next line.
002984r 3  E6 rr                        inc editor1
002986r 3  A9 10                        lda #16
002988r 3  C5 rr                        cmp editor1
00298Ar 3  D0 ED                        bne @prompt_loop
00298Cr 3               
00298Cr 3               z_editor_enter_screen:
00298Cr 3  60                           rts
00298Dr 3               
00298Dr 3               
00298Dr 3               
00298Dr 3               ; ## EDITOR_ERASE_SCREEN ( scr# -- ) "Erase all lines for given screen"
00298Dr 3               ; ## "erase-screen"  tested  Tali Editor
00298Dr 3               xt_editor_erase_screen:
00298Dr 3                               ; Set the variable SCR and get a buffer for the
00298Dr 3                               ; given screen number.
00298Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_editor_screen_helper
002990r 3               
002990r 3                               ; Put 1024 (chars/screen) on stack.
002990r 3  CA                           dex
002991r 3  CA                           dex
002992r 3  74 00                        stz 0,x
002994r 3  A9 04                        lda #4          ; 4 in MSB makes 1024 ($400).
002996r 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002998r 3               
002998r 3                               ; Erase the entire block (fill with spaces).
002998r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_blank
00299Br 3               
00299Br 3                               ; Mark buffer as updated.
00299Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_update
00299Er 3               
00299Er 3               z_editor_erase_screen:
00299Er 3  60                           rts
00299Fr 3               
00299Fr 3               
00299Fr 3               ; ## EDITOR_EL ( line# -- ) "Erase the given line number"
00299Fr 3               ; ## "el"  tested  Tali Editor
00299Fr 3               xt_editor_el:
00299Fr 3                               ; Turn the line number into buffer offset.
00299Fr 3                               ; This also loads the block into the buffer if it's
00299Fr 3                               ; not there for some reason.
00299Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_editor_line
0029A2r 3               
0029A2r 3                               ; Put 64 (# of chars/line) on the stack.
0029A2r 3  CA                           dex
0029A3r 3  CA                           dex
0029A4r 3  A9 40                        lda #64
0029A6r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0029A8r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
0029AAr 3               
0029AAr 3                               ; Fill with spaces.
0029AAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_blank
0029ADr 3               
0029ADr 3                               ; Mark buffer as updated.
0029ADr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_update
0029B0r 3               
0029B0r 3  60           z_editor_el:    rts
0029B1r 3               
0029B1r 3               
0029B1r 3               ; ## EDITOR_L ( -- ) "List the current screen"
0029B1r 3               ; ## "l"  tested  Tali Editor
0029B1r 3               
0029B1r 3               xt_editor_l:
0029B1r 3                               ; Load the current screen
0029B1r 3  CA                           dex             ; Put SCR on the stack.
0029B2r 3  CA                           dex
0029B3r 3  A0 02                        ldy #scr_offset
0029B5r 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
0029B7r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0029B9r 3  C8                           iny
0029BAr 3  B1 rr                        lda (up),y
0029BCr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
0029BEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_block    ; Get the current screen.
0029C1r 3               
0029C1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
0029C4r 3               
0029C4r 3                               ; Print the screen number.
0029C4r 3                               ; We're using sliteral, so we need to set up the
0029C4r 3                               ; appropriate data structure (see sliteral)
0029C4r 3  80 08                        bra @after_screen_msg
0029C6r 3               
0029C6r 3               @screen_msg:
0029C6r 3  53 63 72 65                  .byte "Screen #"
0029CAr 3  65 6E 20 23  
0029CEr 3               
0029CEr 3               @after_screen_msg:
0029CEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr sliteral_runtime
0029D1r 3  rr rr 08 00                  .word @screen_msg, @after_screen_msg-@screen_msg
0029D5r 3               
0029D5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
0029D8r 3               
0029D8r 3                               ; Put the screen number and printed size for u.r on the stack.
0029D8r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_scr
0029DBr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch
0029DEr 3  CA                           dex
0029DFr 3  CA                           dex
0029E0r 3  A9 04                        lda #4          ; four spaces
0029E2r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0029E4r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
0029E6r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_dot_r
0029E9r 3               
0029E9r 3                               ; The address of the buffer is currently on the stack.
0029E9r 3                               ; Print 64 chars at a time. TYPE uses tmp1, so we'll
0029E9r 3                               ; keep track of the line number in tmp3.
0029E9r 3  64 rr                        stz tmp3
0029EBr 3               
0029EBr 3               @line_loop:
0029EBr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
0029EEr 3               
0029EEr 3                               ; Print the line number (2-space fixed width)
0029EEr 3  CA                           dex
0029EFr 3  CA                           dex
0029F0r 3  CA                           dex
0029F1r 3  CA                           dex
0029F2r 3  74 03                        stz 3,x
0029F4r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp3
0029F6r 3  95 02                        sta 2,x
0029F8r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
0029FAr 3  A9 02                        lda #2
0029FCr 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
0029FEr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_dot_r
002A01r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
002A04r 3               
002A04r 3                               ; Print one line using the address on the stack.
002A04r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
002A07r 3  CA                           dex
002A08r 3  CA                           dex
002A09r 3  A9 40                        lda #64
002A0Br 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002A0Dr 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
002A0Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
002A12r 3               
002A12r 3                               ; Add 64 to the address on the stack to move to the next line.
002A12r 3  18                           clc
002A13r 3  A9 40                        lda #64
002A15r 3  75 00                        adc 0,x
002A17r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002A19r 3  B5 01                        lda 1,x
002A1Br 3  69 00                        adc #0      ; Add carry
002A1Dr 3  95 01                        sta 1,x
002A1Fr 3               
002A1Fr 3                               ; Increment the line number (held in tmp3)
002A1Fr 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp3
002A21r 3               
002A21r 3                               ; See if we are done.
002A21r 3  A5 rr                        lda tmp3
002A23r 3  C9 10                        cmp #16
002A25r 3  D0 C4                        bne @line_loop
002A27r 3               
002A27r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
002A2Ar 3                               ; Drop the address on the stack.
002A2Ar 3  E8                           inx
002A2Br 3  E8                           inx
002A2Cr 3               
002A2Cr 3  60           z_editor_l:            rts
002A2Dr 3               
002A2Dr 3               
002A2Dr 3               
002A2Dr 3               ; ## EDITOR_LINE ( line# -- c-addr ) "Turn a line number into address in current screen"
002A2Dr 3               ; ## "line"  tested  Tali Editor
002A2Dr 3               
002A2Dr 3               xt_editor_line:
002A2Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
002A30r 3               
002A30r 3                               ; Multiply the TOS by 64 (chars/line) to compute offset.
002A30r 3  A0 06                        ldy #6          ; *64 is same as left shift 6 times.
002A32r 3               @shift_tos_left:
002A32r 3  16 00                        asl 0,x         ; Shift TOS to the left
002A34r 3  36 01                        rol 1,x         ; ROL brings MSb from lower byte.
002A36r 3  88                           dey
002A37r 3  D0 F9                        bne @shift_tos_left
002A39r 3                               ; Load the current screen into a buffer
002A39r 3                               ; and get the buffer address
002A39r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_scr
002A3Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch
002A3Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_block
002A42r 3               
002A42r 3                               ; Add the offset to the buffer base address.
002A42r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_plus
002A45r 3               
002A45r 3  60           z_editor_line:  rts
002A46r 3               
002A46r 3               
002A46r 3               
002A46r 3               ; ## EDITOR_O ( line# -- ) "Overwrite the given line"
002A46r 3               ; ## "o"  tested  Tali Editor
002A46r 3               xt_editor_o:
002A46r 3                               ; Print prompt
002A46r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
002A49r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
002A4Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two
002A4Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_dot_r
002A52r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
002A55r 3  A9 2A                        lda #42         ; ASCII for *
002A57r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a
002A5Ar 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
002A5Dr 3               
002A5Dr 3                               ; Accept new input (directly into the buffer)
002A5Dr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_editor_line
002A60r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup      ; Save a copy of the line address for later.
002A63r 3  CA                           dex
002A64r 3  CA                           dex
002A65r 3  A9 40                        lda #64         ; chars/line
002A67r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002A69r 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
002A6Br 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_accept
002A6Er 3               
002A6Er 3                               ; Fill the rest with spaces.
002A6Er 3                               ; Stack is currently ( line_address numchars_from_accept )
002A6Er 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
002A71r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_not_rote ; -rot
002A74r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_plus
002A77r 3  CA                           dex
002A78r 3  CA                           dex
002A79r 3  A9 40                        lda #64         ; chars/line
002A7Br 3  95 00                        sta 0,x
002A7Dr 3  74 01                        stz 1,x
002A7Fr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_rot
002A82r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
002A85r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_blank
002A88r 3               
002A88r 3                               ; Mark buffer as updated.
002A88r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_update
002A8Br 3               
002A8Br 3  60           z_editor_o:     rts
002A8Cr 3               
002A8Cr 3               ; ## LCDPUT ( s -- ) "Print single character to LCD"
002A8Cr 3               ; ## "lcdput" coded Custom
002A8Cr 3               xt_lcdput:
002A8Cr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
002A8Fr 3               
002A8Fr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002A91r 3                       .ifdef lcd_print
002A91r 3                               jsr lcd_print
002A91r 3                       .endif
002A91r 3  E8                           inx
002A92r 3  E8                           inx
002A93r 3  60           z_lcdput: rts
002A94r 3               
002A94r 3               
002A94r 3               ; ## LCDPRINT ( addr u -- ) "Print string to LCD"
002A94r 3               ; ## "lcdprint"  coded Custom
002A94r 3               
002A94r 3               xt_lcdprint:
002A94r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_2
002A97r 3               
002A97r 3                               ; Save the starting address into tmp1
002A97r 3  B5 02                        lda 2,x
002A99r 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1
002A9Br 3  B5 03                        lda 3,x
002A9Dr 3  85 rr                        sta tmp1+1
002A9Fr 3               @loop:
002A9Fr 3                               ; done if length is zero
002A9Fr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002AA1r 3  15 01                        ora 1,x
002AA3r 3  F0 12                        beq @done
002AA5r 3               
002AA5r 3                               ; Send the current character
002AA5r 3  B2 rr                        lda (tmp1)
002AA7r 3                       .ifdef lcd_print
002AA7r 3                               jsr lcd_print      ; avoids stack foolery
002AA7r 3                       .endif
002AA7r 3                               ; Move the address along (in tmp1)
002AA7r 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1
002AA9r 3  D0 02                        bne @1
002AABr 3  E6 rr                        inc tmp1+1
002AADr 3               @1:
002AADr 3                               ; Reduce the count (on the data stack)
002AADr 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002AAFr 3  D0 02                        bne @2
002AB1r 3  D6 01                        dec 1,x
002AB3r 3               @2:
002AB3r 3  D6 00                        dec 0,x
002AB5r 3               
002AB5r 3  80 E8                        bra @loop
002AB7r 3               @done:
002AB7r 3  E8                           inx
002AB8r 3  E8                           inx
002AB9r 3  E8                           inx
002ABAr 3  E8                           inx
002ABBr 3               
002ABBr 3  60           z_lcdprint:         rts
002ABCr 3               
002ABCr 3               
002ABCr 3               
002ABCr 3               ; ## CLS ( -- ) "clea VGA screen"
002ABCr 3               ; ## "cls" coded Custom
002ABCr 3               xt_cls:
002ABCr 3                       .ifdef vga_clear
002ABCr 3                               jsr vga_clear
002ABCr 3                       .endif
002ABCr 3               
002ABCr 3  60           z_cls: rts
002ABDr 3               
002ABDr 3               
002ABDr 3               ; ## SPI_INIT ( -- ) "Init SPI system"
002ABDr 3               ; ## "spi_init" coded Custom
002ABDr 3               xt_spi_init:
002ABDr 3               .ifdef VIA1_BASE
002ABDr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr spi_init
002AC0r 3               .endif
002AC0r 3  60           z_spi_init: rts
002AC1r 3               
002AC1r 3               
002AC1r 3               ; ## SPI_CLK_TOGGLE ( -- ) "Toggle SPI clock"
002AC1r 3               ; ## "spi_clk_toggle" coded Custom
002AC1r 3               xt_spi_clk_toggle:
002AC1r 3               .ifdef VIA1_BASE
002AC1r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr spi_clk_toggle
002AC4r 3               .endif
002AC4r 3  60           z_spi_clk_toggle: rts
002AC5r 3               
002AC5r 3               ; ## SPI_SELECT ( s -- ) "Select SPI slave"
002AC5r 3               ; ## "spi_select" coded Custom
002AC5r 3               xt_spi_select:
002AC5r 3               .ifdef VIA1_BASE
002AC5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
002AC8r 3               
002AC8r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002ACAr 3               
002ACAr 3  20 rr rr                     jsr spi_select
002ACDr 3               
002ACDr 3  E8                           inx
002ACEr 3  E8                           inx
002ACFr 3               .endif
002ACFr 3  60           z_spi_select: rts
002AD0r 3               
002AD0r 3               ; ## SPI_TRANSCEIVE ( s -- u ) "Send and receive spi data"
002AD0r 3               ; ## "spi_transceive" coded Custom
002AD0r 3               xt_spi_transceive:
002AD0r 3               .ifdef VIA1_BASE
002AD0r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
002AD3r 3               
002AD3r 3  B5 00                        lda 0,x
002AD5r 3               
002AD5r 3  20 rr rr                     jsr spi_transceive
002AD8r 3               
002AD8r 3  95 00                        sta 0,x         ; put return value in TOS
002ADAr 3  74 01                        stz 1,X         ;reset value there
002ADCr 3               .endif
002ADCr 3  60           z_spi_transceive: rts
002ADDr 3               
002ADDr 3               ; ## SD_INIT ( s -- u ) "Send and receive spi data"
002ADDr 3               ; ## "sd_init" coded Custom
002ADDr 3               xt_sd_init:
002ADDr 3               .ifdef SD
002ADDr 3                               jsr underflow_1
002ADDr 3               
002ADDr 3                               lda 0,x
002ADDr 3                               jsr sd_init
002ADDr 3                               beq @ok
002ADDr 3                               pha
002ADDr 3                               printascii sd_init_error_message
002ADDr 3                               pla
002ADDr 3               @ok:
002ADDr 3                               sta 0,x         ; put return value in TOS
002ADDr 3                               stz 1,X         ;reset value there
002ADDr 3               .endif
002ADDr 3  60           z_sd_init: rts
002ADEr 3               
002ADEr 3               ; ## SD_READSECTOR ( addr d -- u ) "Read SD sector"
002ADEr 3               ; ## "sd_readsector" coded Custom
002ADEr 3               xt_sd_readsector:
002ADEr 3               
002ADEr 3               .ifdef SD
002ADEr 3                               jsr underflow_2
002ADEr 3                               ; get and save sector number (32 bit number, double)
002ADEr 3                               ; most significant part is TOS
002ADEr 3                               lda 0, x
002ADEr 3                               sta IO_SECTOR + 2
002ADEr 3                               lda 1, x
002ADEr 3                               sta IO_SECTOR + 3
002ADEr 3                               ; least significant part is NOS
002ADEr 3                               lda 2, x
002ADEr 3                               sta IO_SECTOR + 0
002ADEr 3                               lda 3, x
002ADEr 3                               sta IO_SECTOR + 1
002ADEr 3                               lda #1
002ADEr 3                               sta SD_CRC
002ADEr 3               
002ADEr 3                               jsr sd_readsector
002ADEr 3                               sta 0,x         ; put return value in TOS
002ADEr 3                               stz 1,X         ;reset value there
002ADEr 3               
002ADEr 3                               inx
002ADEr 3                               inx
002ADEr 3               .endif
002ADEr 3  60           z_sd_readsector: rts
002ADFr 3               
002ADFr 3               
002ADFr 3               ; ## time ( -- addr ) "get time storage address"
002ADFr 3               ; ## "time" coded Custom
002ADFr 3               xt_time:
002ADFr 3                       .ifdef time
002ADFr 3  A9 rr                lda #time
002AE1r 3                       .else
002AE1r 3                       lda #0
002AE1r 3                       .endif
002AE1r 3  CA                   dex
002AE2r 3  CA                   dex
002AE3r 3  95 00                sta 0,x
002AE5r 3  74 01                stz 1,x
002AE7r 3               
002AE7r 3               
002AE7r 3  60           z_time: rts
002AE8r 3               
002AE8r 3               
002AE8r 3               xt_cf_info:
002AE8r 3               .ifdef CF_ADDRESS
002AE8r 3  20 rr rr             jsr cf_info
002AEBr 3  20 rr rr             jsr xt_cr
002AEEr 3  20 rr rr             jsr cf_print_id
002AF1r 3  20 rr rr             jsr cf_print_capacity
002AF4r 3               .endif
002AF4r 3               z_cf_info:
002AF4r 3  60                   rts
002AF5r 3               
002AF5r 3               cf_info:
002AF5r 3               ;     jsr cf_init
002AF5r 3               ;     jsr cf_wait
002AF5r 3               ;     lda #$EC
002AF5r 3               ;     sta CF_ADDRESS + 7
002AF5r 3               ;     lda #<IO_BUFFER
002AF5r 3               ;     sta io_buffer_ptr
002AF5r 3               ;     lda #>IO_BUFFER
002AF5r 3               ;     sta io_buffer_ptr + 1
002AF5r 3               ;     jsr cf_read
002AF5r 3  60               rts
002AF6r 3               
002AF6r 3               cf_print_capacity:
002AF6r 3               .ifdef CF_ADDRESS
002AF6r 3  5A               phy
002AF7r 3               
002AF7r 3  20 rr rr         jsr xt_cr
002AFAr 3               
002AFAr 3  A0 78            ldy #120
002AFCr 3                   ; print lba size
002AFCr 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002AFEr 3  8D rr rr         sta LBA_SIZE
002B01r 3  C8               iny
002B02r 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002B04r 3  8D rr rr         sta LBA_SIZE + 1
002B07r 3               
002B07r 3  C8               iny
002B08r 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002B0Ar 3  8D rr rr         sta LBA_SIZE + 2
002B0Dr 3               
002B0Dr 3  C8               iny
002B0Er 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002B10r 3  8D rr rr         sta LBA_SIZE + 3
002B13r 3               
002B13r 3  A0 09            ldy #9
002B15r 3               @loop:
002B15r 3  0E rr rr 2E      asl32 LBA_SIZE
002B19r 3  rr rr 2E rr  
002B1Dr 3  rr 2E rr rr  
002B21r 3  88               dey
002B22r 3  D0 F1            bne @loop
002B24r 3               
002B24r 3  CA               dex
002B25r 3  CA               dex
002B26r 3  CA               dex
002B27r 3  CA               dex
002B28r 3               
002B28r 3  AD rr rr         lda LBA_SIZE
002B2Br 3  95 02            sta 2, x
002B2Dr 3  AD rr rr         lda LBA_SIZE + 1
002B30r 3  95 03            sta 3, x
002B32r 3  AD rr rr         lda LBA_SIZE + 2
002B35r 3  95 00            sta 0, x
002B37r 3  AD rr rr         lda LBA_SIZE + 3
002B3Ar 3  95 01            sta 1, x
002B3Cr 3               
002B3Cr 3  20 rr rr         jsr xt_ud_dot
002B3Fr 3               
002B3Fr 3  CA               dex
002B40r 3  CA               dex
002B41r 3  CA               dex
002B42r 3  CA               dex
002B43r 3  A9 06            lda #6
002B45r 3  95 00            sta 0, x
002B47r 3  74 01            stz 1, x
002B49r 3  A9 rr            lda #<bytes_msg
002B4Br 3  95 02            sta 2, x
002B4Dr 3  A9 rr            lda #>bytes_msg
002B4Fr 3  95 03            sta 3, x
002B51r 3  20 rr rr         jsr xt_type
002B54r 3  20 rr rr         jsr xt_cr
002B57r 3  7A               ply
002B58r 3               .endif
002B58r 3  60               rts
002B59r 3               
002B59r 3               
002B59r 3               
002B59r 3               
002B59r 3               cf_print_id:
002B59r 3                   ; print model number
002B59r 3  5A               phy
002B5Ar 3  A0 37            ldy #55
002B5Cr 3               @loop:
002B5Cr 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002B5Er 3  20 rr rr         jsr kernel_putc
002B61r 3  88               dey
002B62r 3  B1 rr            lda (io_buffer_ptr), y
002B64r 3  20 rr rr         jsr kernel_putc
002B67r 3  C8               iny
002B68r 3  C8               iny
002B69r 3  C8               iny
002B6Ar 3  C0 5F            cpy #(40+55)
002B6Cr 3  90 EE            bcc @loop
002B6Er 3  7A               ply
002B6Fr 3  60               rts
002B70r 3               
002B70r 3               
002B70r 3               xt_io_readblock:
002B70r 3               .ifdef io_read_sector_address
002B70r 3                       ; block-read ( addr blk# -- )
002B70r 3  B5 02                lda 2, x
002B72r 3  85 rr                sta io_buffer_ptr
002B74r 3  B5 03                lda 3, x
002B76r 3  85 rr                sta io_buffer_ptr + 1
002B78r 3  B5 00                lda 0, x
002B7Ar 3  8D rr rr             sta IO_SECTOR
002B7Dr 3  B5 01                lda 1, x
002B7Fr 3  8D rr rr             sta IO_SECTOR + 1
002B82r 3  9C rr rr             stz IO_SECTOR + 2
002B85r 3  9C rr rr             stz IO_SECTOR + 3
002B88r 3               
002B88r 3  0E rr rr             asl IO_SECTOR                   ; multiply by two to get first sector number
002B8Br 3  2E rr rr             rol IO_SECTOR + 1
002B8Er 3  2E rr rr             rol IO_SECTOR + 2
002B91r 3               
002B91r 3                       ; lda io_buffer_ptr
002B91r 3                       ; sta 0, x
002B91r 3                       ; lda io_buffer_ptr + 1
002B91r 3                       ; sta 1, x
002B91r 3                       ; jsr xt_dot
002B91r 3               
002B91r 3  20 rr rr             jsr io_read_sector
002B94r 3  EE rr rr D0          inc32 IO_SECTOR
002B98r 3  0D EE rr rr  
002B9Cr 3  D0 08 EE rr  
002BA6r 3  E6 rr                inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
002BA8r 3  E6 rr                inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
002BAAr 3  20 rr rr             jsr io_read_sector
002BADr 3                       ; lda io_buffer_ptr
002BADr 3                       ; sta 0, x
002BADr 3                       ; lda io_buffer_ptr + 1
002BADr 3                       ; sta 1, x
002BADr 3                       ; jsr xt_dot
002BADr 3               
002BADr 3  E8                   inx
002BAEr 3  E8                   inx
002BAFr 3               
002BAFr 3               .endif
002BAFr 3               z_io_readblock:
002BAFr 3  60                   rts
002BB0r 3               
002BB0r 3               xt_io_writeblock:
002BB0r 3               .ifdef io_read_sector_address
002BB0r 3                       ; block-write ( addr blk# -- )
002BB0r 3  B5 02                lda 2, x
002BB2r 3  85 rr                sta io_buffer_ptr
002BB4r 3  B5 03                lda 3, x
002BB6r 3  85 rr                sta io_buffer_ptr + 1
002BB8r 3  B5 00                lda 0, x
002BBAr 3  8D rr rr             sta IO_SECTOR
