0052DFr 2  A9 14                        lda #$14
0052E1r 2  80 18                        bra asm_common
0052E3r 2               z_asm_trb_z:
0052E3r 2               
0052E3r 2               xt_asm_tsb:     ; tsb \ TSB nnnn
0052E3r 2  A9 0C                        lda #$0C
0052E5r 2  80 14                        bra asm_common
0052E7r 2               z_asm_tsb:
0052E7r 2               
0052E7r 2               xt_asm_tsb_z:   ; tsb.z \ TSB nn
0052E7r 2  A9 04                        lda #$04
0052E9r 2  80 10                        bra asm_common
0052EBr 2               z_asm_tsb_z:
0052EBr 2               
0052EBr 2               xt_asm_tsx:     ; tsx \ TSX
0052EBr 2  A9 BA                        lda #$BA
0052EDr 2  80 0C                        bra asm_common
0052EFr 2               z_asm_tsx:
0052EFr 2               
0052EFr 2               xt_asm_txa:     ; txa \ TXA
0052EFr 2  A9 8A                        lda #$8A
0052F1r 2  80 08                        bra asm_common
0052F3r 2               z_asm_txa:
0052F3r 2               
0052F3r 2               xt_asm_txs:     ; txs \ TXS
0052F3r 2  A9 9A                        lda #$9A
0052F5r 2  80 04                        bra asm_common
0052F7r 2               z_asm_txs:
0052F7r 2               
0052F7r 2               xt_asm_tya:     ; tya \ TYA
0052F7r 2  A9 98                        lda #$98
0052F9r 2  80 00                        bra asm_common
0052FBr 2               z_asm_tya:
0052FBr 2               
0052FBr 2               
0052FBr 2               ; ==========================================================
0052FBr 2               ; ASSEMBLER HELPER FUNCTIONS
0052FBr 2               
0052FBr 2               asm_common:
0052FBr 2               
0052FBr 2                       ; """Common routine for all opcodes. We arrive here with the opcode in
0052FBr 2                       ; A. We do not need to check for the correct values because we are
0052FBr 2                       ; coming from the assembler Dictionary and trust our external test
0052FBr 2                       ; suite.
0052FBr 2                       ; """
0052FBr 2                               ; Compile opcode. Note cmpl_a does not use Y
0052FBr 2  A8                           tay
0052FCr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a
0052FFr 2               
0052FFr 2                               ; We get the length of the opcode from the table included in
0052FFr 2                               ; the disassembler. We use the opcode value as the offset in
0052FFr 2                               ; the oc_index_table. We have 256 entries, each two bytes
0052FFr 2                               ; long, so we can't just use an index with Y. We use tmp2 for
0052FFr 2                               ; this.
0052FFr 2  A9 rr                        lda #<oc_index_table
005301r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp2
005303r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>oc_index_table
005305r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
005307r 2               
005307r 2  98                           tya             ; retrieve opcode
005308r 2  0A                           asl             ; times two for offset
005309r 2  90 02                        bcc @m
00530Br 2  E6 rr                        inc tmp2+1
00530Dr 2               @m:
00530Dr 2  A8                           tay             ; use Y as the index
00530Er 2               
00530Er 2                               ; Get address of the entry in the opcode table. We put it in
00530Er 2                               ; tmp3 and push a copy of it to the stack to be able to print
00530Er 2                               ; the opcode later
00530Er 2  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; LSB
005310r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp3
005312r 2  C8                           iny
005313r 2  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; MSB
005315r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp3+1
005317r 2               
005317r 2  B2 rr                        lda (tmp3)      ; get "lengths byte"
005319r 2               
005319r 2                               ; The length of the instruction is stored in bits 7 and 6.
005319r 2                               ; Rotate them through the carry flag and mask the rest
005319r 2  2A                           rol
00531Ar 2  2A                           rol
00531Br 2  2A                           rol             ; Three times because we go through Carry
00531Cr 2  29 03                        and #%00000011
00531Er 2  A8                           tay
00531Fr 2               
00531Fr 2                               ; One byte means no operand, we're done. Use DEY as CPY #1
00531Fr 2  88                           dey
005320r 2  F0 12                        beq @done
005322r 2               
005322r 2                               ; We have an operand which must be TOS
005322r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr underflow_1
005325r 2               
005325r 2                               ; We compile the LSB of TOS as the operand we definitely have
005325r 2                               ; before we even test if this is a two- or three-byte
005325r 2                               ; instruction. Little endian CPU means we store this byte first
005325r 2  B5 00                        lda 0,x
005327r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a      ; does not use Y
00532Ar 2               
00532Ar 2                               ; If this is a two-byte instruction, we're done. If we landed
00532Ar 2                               ; here, we've already decremented Y by one, so this is
00532Ar 2                               ; the equivalent to CPY #2
00532Ar 2  88                           dey
00532Br 2  F0 05                        beq @done_drop
00532Dr 2               
00532Dr 2                               ; This must be a three-byte instruction, get the MSB.
00532Dr 2  B5 01                        lda 1,x
00532Fr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a      ; Fall through to _done_drop
005332r 2               
005332r 2               @done_drop:
005332r 2  E8                           inx
005333r 2  E8                           inx             ; Fall through to _done
005334r 2               @done:
005334r 2  60                           rts             ; Returns to original caller
005335r 2               
005335r 2               
005335r 2               ; ==========================================================
005335r 2               ; PSEUDO-INSTRUCTIONS AND MACROS
005335r 2               
005335r 2               xt_asm_push_a:
005335r 2                       ; """push-a puts the content of the 65c02 Accumulator on the Forth
005335r 2                       ; data stack as the TOS. This is a convience routine that encodes the
005335r 2                       ; instructions  DEX  DEX  STA 0,X  STZ 1,X
005335r 2                       ; """
005335r 2  A0 00                        ldy #0
005337r 2               _loop:
005337r 2  B9 rr rr                     lda asm_push_a_data,y
00533Ar 2  C9 FF                        cmp #$FF
00533Cr 2  F0 06                        beq @done
00533Er 2               
00533Er 2  20 rr rr                     jsr cmpl_a      ; does not change Y
005341r 2  C8                           iny
005342r 2  80 F3                        bra _loop
005344r 2               @done:
005344r 2               z_asm_push_a:
005344r 2  60                           rts
005345r 2               asm_push_a_data:
005345r 2                       ; We can't use 00 as a terminator because STA 0,X assembles to 95 00
005345r 2  CA CA 95 00          .byte $CA, $CA, $95, 00, $74, $01
005349r 2  74 01        
00534Br 2  FF                   .byte $FF               ; terminator
00534Cr 2               
00534Cr 2               
00534Cr 2               
00534Cr 2               ; ==========================================================
00534Cr 2               ; DIRECTIVES
00534Cr 2               
00534Cr 2               ; The "<J" directive (back jump) is a dummy instruction (syntactic sugar) to
00534Cr 2               ; make clear that the JMP or JSR instructions are using the address that had
00534Cr 2               ; been placed on the stack by "-->" (the "arrow" directive).
00534Cr 2               xt_asm_back_jump:
00534Cr 2               z_asm_back_jump:
00534Cr 2  60                           rts
00534Dr 2               
00534Dr 2               ; The "<B" directive (back branch) takes an address that was placed on the Data
00534Dr 2               ; Stack by the anonymous label directive "-->" (the "arrow") and the current
00534Dr 2               ; address (via HERE) to calculate a backward branch offset. This is then stored
00534Dr 2               ; by a following branch instruction.
00534Dr 2               xt_asm_back_branch:
00534Dr 2                               ; We arrive here with ( addr-l ) of the label on the stack and
00534Dr 2                               ; then subtract the current address
00534Dr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_here             ; ( addr-l addr-h )
005350r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus            ; ( offset )
005353r 2               
005353r 2                               ; We subtract two more because of the branch instruction itself
005353r 2  3A                           dea
005354r 2  3A                           dea
005355r 2               
005355r 2               z_asm_back_branch:
005355r 2  60                           rts
005356r 2               .endif
005356r 2               assembler_end:
005356r 2               
005356r 2               ; END
005356r 2               
005356r 1               .include "../../disassembler.s"
005356r 2               ; Disassembler for Tali Forth 2
005356r 2               ; Scot W. Stevenson <scot.stevenson@gmail.com>
005356r 2               ; Updated by Sam Colwell
005356r 2               ; First version: 28. Apr 2018
005356r 2               ; This version: 31. Dec 2022
005356r 2               
005356r 2               ; This is the default disassembler for Tali Forth 2. Use by passing
005356r 2               ; the address and length of the block of memory to be disassembled:
005356r 2               ;
005356r 2               ;       disasm ( addr x -- )
005356r 2               
005356r 2               ; The underflow checking is handled by the word's stub in native_words.asm, see
005356r 2               ; there for more information.
005356r 2               
005356r 2               ; The code is disassembled in Simpler Assembler Notation (SAN), because that
005356r 2               ; is, uh, simpler. See the documentation and https://github.com/scotws/SAN for
005356r 2               ; more information. Because disassemblers are used interactively with slow
005356r 2               ; humans, we don't care that much about speed and put the emphasis at being
005356r 2               ; small.
005356r 2               
005356r 2               ; Uses: tmp3, tmp2, tmp1 (xt_u_dot_r uses xt_type which uses tmp1)
005356r 2               ;       scratch (used for handling literals and JSRs)
005356r 2               
005356r 2               disassembler:
005356r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr       ; ( addr u )
005359r 2               _byte_loop:
005359r 2                               ; Print address at start of the line. Note we use whatever
005359r 2                               ; number base the user has
005359r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_over     ; ( addr u addr )
00535Cr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_dot    ; ( addr u )
00535Fr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
005362r 2               
005362r 2                               ; We use the opcode value as the offset in the oc_index_table.
005362r 2                               ; We have 256 entries, each two bytes long, so we can't just
005362r 2                               ; use an index with Y. We use tmp2 for this.
005362r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<oc_index_table
005364r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp2
005366r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>oc_index_table
005368r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp2+1
00536Ar 2               
00536Ar 2  A1 02                        lda (2,x)       ; get opcode that addr points to
00536Cr 2  85 rr                        sta scratch     ; Save opcode
00536Er 2               
00536Er 2  0A                           asl             ; multiply by two for offset
00536Fr 2  90 02                        bcc @ok
005371r 2  E6 rr                        inc tmp2+1      ; we're on second page
005373r 2               @ok:
005373r 2  A8                           tay             ; use Y as the index
005374r 2               
005374r 2                               ; Get address of the entry in the opcode table. We put it
005374r 2                               ; in tmp3 and push a copy of it to the stack to be able to
005374r 2                               ; print the opcode later
005374r 2  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; LSB
005376r 2  85 rr                        sta tmp3
005378r 2  48                           pha
005379r 2               
005379r 2  C8                           iny
00537Ar 2               
00537Ar 2  B1 rr                        lda (tmp2),y    ; MSB
00537Cr 2  85 rr                        sta tmp3+1
00537Er 2  48                           pha
00537Fr 2               
00537Fr 2                               ; The first byte is the "lengths byte" which is coded so
00537Fr 2                               ; that bits 7 to 6 are the length of the instruction (1 to
00537Fr 2                               ; 3 bytes) and 2 to 0 are the length of the mnemonic.
00537Fr 2  B2 rr                        lda (tmp3)
005381r 2  A8                           tay                     ; save copy of lengths byte
005382r 2               
005382r 2                               ; Since this is Simpler Assembler Notation (SAN) in a Forth
005382r 2                               ; system, we want to print any operand before we print the
005382r 2                               ; mnemonic ('1000 sta' instead of 'sta 1000'). This allows us
005382r 2                               ; to copy and paste directly from the disassembler to the
005382r 2                               ; assembler.
005382r 2               
005382r 2                               ; What happens next depends on the length of the instruction in
005382r 2                               ; bytes:
005382r 2               
005382r 2                               ;   1 byte:  OPC          -->          OPC  bit sequence: %01
005382r 2                               ;   2 bytes: OPC LSB      -->    0 LSB OPC  bit sequence: %10
005382r 2                               ;   3 bytes: OPC LSB MSB  -->  MSB LSB OPC  bit sequence: %11
005382r 2               
005382r 2                               ; We can distinguish between the first case, where there is
005382r 2                               ; only the mnemonic, and the second and third cases, where we
005382r 2                               ; have an operand. We do this by use of the bit sequence in
005382r 2                               ; bits 7 and 6.
005382r 2  10 3C                        bpl _no_operand         ; bit 7 clear, single-byte instruction
005384r 2               
005384r 2                               ; We have an operand. Prepare the Data Stack
005384r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_zero             ; ( addr u 0 ) ZERO does not use Y
005387r 2               
005387r 2                               ; Because of the glory of a little endian CPU, we can start
005387r 2                               ; with the next byte regardless if this is a one or two byte
005387r 2                               ; operand, because we'll need the LSB one way or the other.
005387r 2                               ; We have a copy of the opcode on the stack, so we can now move
005387r 2                               ; to the next byte
005387r 2  F6 04                        inc 4,x
005389r 2  D0 02                        bne @l1
00538Br 2  F6 05                        inc 5,x                 ; ( addr+1 u 0 )
00538Dr 2               @l1:
00538Dr 2  B5 02                        lda 2,x
00538Fr 2  D0 02                        bne @l2
005391r 2  D6 03                        dec 3,x
005393r 2               @l2:
005393r 2  D6 02                        dec 2,x                 ; ( addr+1 u-1 0 )
005395r 2               
005395r 2  A1 04                        lda (4,x)
005397r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x                 ; LSB of operand ( addr+1 u-1 LSB )
005399r 2  85 rr                        sta scratch+1           ; Save a copy in the scratch buffer
00539Br 2               
00539Br 2                               ; We still have a copy of the lengths byte in Y, which we use
00539Br 2                               ; to see if we have a one-byte operand (and are done already)
00539Br 2                               ; or a two-byte operand
00539Br 2  98                           tya                     ; retrieve copy of lengths byte
00539Cr 2  2A                           rol                     ; shift bit 6 to bit 7
00539Dr 2  10 14                        bpl _print_operand
00539Fr 2               
00539Fr 2                               ; We have a three-byte instruction, so we need to get the MSB
00539Fr 2                               ; of the operand. Move to the next byte
00539Fr 2  F6 04                        inc 4,x
0053A1r 2  D0 02                        bne @l3
0053A3r 2  F6 05                        inc 5,x                 ; ( addr+2 u-1 LSB )
0053A5r 2               @l3:
0053A5r 2  B5 02                        lda 2,x
0053A7r 2  D0 02                        bne @l4
0053A9r 2  D6 03                        dec 3,x
0053ABr 2               @l4:
0053ABr 2  D6 02                        dec 2,x                 ; ( addr+2 u-2 LSB )
0053ADr 2               
0053ADr 2  A1 04                        lda (4,x)
0053AFr 2  95 01                        sta 1,x                 ; MSB of operand ( addr+2 u-2 opr )
0053B1r 2  85 rr                        sta scratch+2           ; Save a copy in the scratch buffer
0053B3r 2               
0053B3r 2                               ; fall through to _print_operand
0053B3r 2               
0053B3r 2               _print_operand:
0053B3r 2               
0053B3r 2                               ; We arrive here with the lengths byte in Y, the address of the
0053B3r 2                               ; opcode table entry for the instruction on the stack ( addr+n
0053B3r 2                               ; u-n opr). We want the output to be nicely formatted in
0053B3r 2                               ; columns, so we use U.R. The maximal width of the number in
0053B3r 2                               ; decimal on an 16-bit addressed machine is five characters
0053B3r 2  CA                           dex
0053B4r 2  CA                           dex
0053B5r 2  A9 05                        lda #5
0053B7r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0053B9r 2  74 01                        stz 1,x                 ; ( addr+n u-n opr 5 )
0053BBr 2               
0053BBr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_dot_r          ; U.R ( addr+n u-n )
0053BEr 2               
0053BEr 2  80 0B                        bra _print_mnemonic
0053C0r 2               
0053C0r 2               _no_operand:
0053C0r 2                               ; We arrive here with the opcode table address on the stack,
0053C0r 2                               ; the lengths byte in Y and ( addr u ). Since we want to have
0053C0r 2                               ; a nicely formatted output, we need to indent the mnemonic by
0053C0r 2                               ; five spaces.
0053C0r 2  CA                           dex
0053C1r 2  CA                           dex
0053C2r 2  A9 05                        lda #5
0053C4r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0053C6r 2  74 01                        stz 1,x                 ; ( addr u 5 )
0053C8r 2               
0053C8r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_spaces           ; ( addr u )
0053CBr 2               
0053CBr 2                               ; fall through to _print_mnemonic
0053CBr 2               
0053CBr 2               _print_mnemonic:
0053CBr 2                               ; We arrive here with the opcode table address on the stack and
0053CBr 2                               ; ( addr u | addr+n u-n ). Time to print the mnemonic.
0053CBr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_space
0053CEr 2               
0053CEr 2  CA                           dex
0053CFr 2  CA                           dex                     ; ( addr u ? )
0053D0r 2  68                           pla                     ; MSB
0053D1r 2  95 01                        sta 1,x                 ; ( addr u MSB )
0053D3r 2  68                           pla                     ; LSB
0053D4r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x                 ; ( addr u addr-o )
0053D6r 2               
0053D6r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_count            ; ( addr u addr-o u-o )
0053D9r 2               
0053D9r 2                               ; The length of the mnemnonic string is in bits 2 to 0
0053D9r 2  74 01                        stz 1,x                 ; paranoid
0053DBr 2  B5 00                        lda 0,x
0053DDr 2  29 07                        and #%00000111          ; ( addr u addr-o u-o )
0053DFr 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0053E1r 2               
0053E1r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type             ; ( addr u )
0053E4r 2               
0053E4r 2                               ; Handle JSR by printing name of function, if available.
0053E4r 2                               ; scratch has opcode ($20 for JSR)
0053E4r 2                               ; scratch+1 and scratch+2 have address if it's a JSR.
0053E4r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch
0053E6r 2  C9 20                        cmp #$20
0053E8r 2  D0 59                        bne _not_jsr
0053EAr 2               
0053EAr 2                               ; It's a JSR.  Print 5 spaces as an offset.
0053EAr 2  CA                           dex
0053EBr 2  CA                           dex
0053ECr 2  A9 05                        lda #5
0053EEr 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0053F0r 2  74 01                        stz 1,x
0053F2r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_spaces
0053F5r 2               
0053F5r 2               ; Special handlers
0053F5r 2                               ; Handle literals specially.
0053F5r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<literal_runtime
0053F7r 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+1
0053F9r 2  D0 0C                        bne _not_literal
0053FBr 2  A9 rr                        lda #>literal_runtime
0053FDr 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+2
0053FFr 2  D0 06                        bne _not_literal
005401r 2                               ; It's a literal.
005401r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_literal
005404r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
005407r 2               
005407r 2               _not_literal:
005407r 2                               ; Handle string literals specially.
005407r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<sliteral_runtime
005409r 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+1
00540Br 2  D0 0C                        bne _not_sliteral
00540Dr 2  A9 rr                        lda #>sliteral_runtime
00540Fr 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+2
005411r 2  D0 06                        bne _not_sliteral
005413r 2                               ; It's a literal.
005413r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_sliteral
005416r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
005419r 2               _not_sliteral:
005419r 2                               ; Handle 0branch
005419r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<zero_branch_runtime
00541Br 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+1
00541Dr 2  D0 0C                        bne _not_0branch
00541Fr 2  A9 rr                        lda #>zero_branch_runtime
005421r 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+2
005423r 2  D0 06                        bne _not_0branch
005425r 2                               ; It's a 0branch.
005425r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_0branch
005428r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
00542Br 2               _not_0branch:
00542Br 2                               ; Handle branch
00542Br 2  A9 rr                        lda #<branch_runtime
00542Dr 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+1
00542Fr 2  D0 0C                        bne _not_branch
005431r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>branch_runtime
005433r 2  C5 rr                        cmp scratch+2
005435r 2  D0 06                        bne _not_branch
005437r 2                               ; It's a branch.
005437r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_branch
00543Ar 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
00543Dr 2               _not_branch:
00543Dr 2                               ; Try the generic JSR handler, which will use the target of the
00543Dr 2                               ; JSR as an XT and print the name if it exists.
00543Dr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_jsr
005440r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _printing_done
005443r 2               
005443r 2               _not_jsr:
005443r 2                               ; See if the instruction is a jump (instruction still in A)
005443r 2                               ; (Strings start with a jump over the data.)
005443r 2  C9 4C                        cmp #$4C
005445r 2  D0 29                        bne _printing_done
005447r 2               
005447r 2                               ; We have a branch.  See if it's a string by looking for
005447r 2                               ; a JSR sliteral_runtime at the jump target address.
005447r 2                               ; The target address is in scratch+1 and scratch+2
005447r 2                               ; Use scratch+3 and scratch+4 here as we need to move
005447r 2                               ; the pointer.
005447r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1   ; Copy the pointer.
005449r 2  85 rr                        sta scratch+3
00544Br 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
00544Dr 2  85 rr                        sta scratch+4
00544Fr 2               
00544Fr 2                               ; Get the first byte at the jmp target address.
00544Fr 2  B2 rr                        lda (scratch+3)
005451r 2               
005451r 2  C9 20                        cmp #$20 ; check for JSR
005453r 2  D0 1B                        bne _printing_done
005455r 2                               ; Next byte
005455r 2  E6 rr                        inc scratch+3
005457r 2  D0 02                        bne @l1
005459r 2  E6 rr                        inc scratch+4
00545Br 2               @l1:
00545Br 2                               ; Check for string literal runtime
00545Br 2  B2 rr                        lda (scratch+3)
00545Dr 2               
00545Dr 2  C9 rr                        cmp #<sliteral_runtime
00545Fr 2  D0 0F                        bne _printing_done
005461r 2                               ; Next byte
005461r 2  E6 rr                        inc scratch+3
005463r 2  D0 02                        bne @l2
005465r 2  E6 rr                        inc scratch+4
005467r 2               @l2:
005467r 2  B2 rr                        lda (scratch+3)
005469r 2               
005469r 2  C9 rr                        cmp #>sliteral_runtime
00546Br 2  D0 03                        bne _printing_done
00546Dr 2               
00546Dr 2                               ; It's a string literal jump.
00546Dr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr disasm_sliteral_jump
005470r 2               _printing_done:
005470r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_cr
005473r 2               
005473r 2                               ; Housekeeping: Next byte
005473r 2  F6 02                        inc 2,x
005475r 2  D0 02                        bne @l3
005477r 2  F6 03                        inc 3,x                 ; ( addr+1 u )
005479r 2               @l3:
005479r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus        ; ( addr+1 u-1 )
00547Cr 2               
00547Cr 2  B5 00                        lda 0,x                 ; All done?
00547Er 2  15 01                        ora 1,x
005480r 2  F0 07                        beq @done
005482r 2               
005482r 2  B5 01                        lda 1,x                 ; Catch mid-instruction ranges
005484r 2  30 03                        bmi @done
005486r 2               
005486r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp _byte_loop          ; out of range for BRA
005489r 2               @done:
005489r 2                               ; Clean up and leave
005489r 2  4C rr rr                     jmp xt_two_drop         ; JSR/RTS
00548Cr 2               
00548Cr 2               ; Handlers for various special disassembled instructions:
00548Cr 2               ; String literal handler (both for inline strings and sliteral)
00548Cr 2               disasm_sliteral_jump:
00548Cr 2                               ; If we get here, we are at the jump for a constant string.
00548Cr 2                               ; Strings are compiled into the dictionary like so:
00548Cr 2                               ;           jmp a
00548Cr 2                               ;           <string data bytes>
00548Cr 2                               ;  a -->    jsr sliteral_runtime
00548Cr 2                               ;           <string address>
00548Cr 2                               ;           <string length>
00548Cr 2                               ;
00548Cr 2                               ; We have ( addr n ) on the stack where addr is the last
00548Cr 2                               ; byte of the address a in the above jmp instruction.
00548Cr 2                               ; Address a is in scratch+1 scratch+2.
00548Cr 2               
00548Cr 2                               ; Determine the distance of the jump so we end on the byte
00548Cr 2                               ; just before the JSR (sets us up for SLITERAL on next loop)
00548Cr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
00548Fr 2  CA                           dex
005490r 2  CA                           dex
005491r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
005493r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
005495r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
005497r 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
005499r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap
00549Cr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
00549Fr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus
0054A2r 2                               ; (n jump_distance)
0054A2r 2                               ; Subtract the jump distance from the bytes left.
0054A2r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus
0054A5r 2                               ; ( new_n )
0054A5r 2                               ; Move to one byte before the target address
0054A5r 2  CA                           dex
0054A6r 2  CA                           dex
0054A7r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
0054A9r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0054ABr 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
0054ADr 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
0054AFr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus
0054B2r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap ; ( new_addr new_n )
0054B5r 2  60                           rts
0054B6r 2               
0054B6r 2               ; String literal handler
0054B6r 2               disasm_sliteral:
0054B6r 2  A9 53                        lda #'S'
0054B8r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a ; Print S before LITERAL so it becomes SLITERAL
0054BBr 2  A9 0D                        lda #str_disasm_lit     ; "LITERAL "
0054BDr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string_no_lf
0054C0r 2               
0054C0r 2                               ; ( addr u ) address of last byte of JSR address and bytes left on the stack.
0054C0r 2                               ; We need to print the two values just after addr and move along two bytes
0054C0r 2                               ; for each value.
0054C0r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap             ; switch to (u addr)
0054C3r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus
0054C6r 2               
0054C6r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
0054C9r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_fetch
0054CCr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_u_dot            ; Print the address of the string
0054CFr 2                               ; Move along two bytes (already moved address one) to skip over the constant.
0054CFr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two
0054D2r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_plus
0054D5r 2               
0054D5r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
0054D8r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_question         ; Print the length of the string
0054DBr 2                               ; Move along to the very last byte of the data.
0054DBr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus
0054DEr 2               
0054DEr 2                               ; ( u addr+4 )
0054DEr 2                               ; Fix up the number of bytes left.
0054DEr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap            ; ( addr+4 u )
0054E1r 2  CA                           dex
0054E2r 2  CA                           dex
0054E3r 2  A9 04                        lda #4
0054E5r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
0054E7r 2  74 01                        stz 1,x
0054E9r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_minus            ; ( addr+4 u-4 )
0054ECr 2  60                           rts
0054EDr 2               
0054EDr 2               
0054EDr 2               ; 0BRANCH handler
0054EDr 2               disasm_0branch:
0054EDr 2  A9 30                        lda #'0'
0054EFr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr emit_a ; Print 0 before BRANCH so it becomes 0BRANCH
0054F2r 2                               ; All other processing is identical, so fall into BRANCH handler
0054F2r 2               ; BRANCH handler
0054F2r 2               disasm_branch:
0054F2r 2  A9 0F                        lda #str_disasm_bra
0054F4r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string_no_lf ; "BRANCH "
0054F7r 2                               ; The address after the 0BRANCH is handled the same as a literal.
0054F7r 2  80 05                        bra disasm_print_literal
0054F9r 2               
0054F9r 2               ; Literal handler
0054F9r 2               disasm_literal:
0054F9r 2  A9 0D                        lda #str_disasm_lit
0054FBr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string_no_lf ; "LITERAL "
0054FEr 2               disasm_print_literal:
0054FEr 2                               ; ( addr u ) address of last byte of JSR and bytes left on the stack.
0054FEr 2                               ; We need to print the value just after the address and move along two bytes.
0054FEr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap ; switch to (u addr)
005501r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus
005504r 2               
005504r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_dup
005507r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_question ; Print the value at the adress
00550Ar 2                               ; Move along two bytes (already moved address one) to skip over the constant.
00550Ar 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_plus
00550Dr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_swap ; (addr+2 u)
005510r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus
005513r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_one_minus ; (addr+2 u-2)
005516r 2  60                           rts
005517r 2               
005517r 2               ; JSR handler
005517r 2               disasm_jsr:
005517r 2                               ; The address of the JSR is in scratch+1 and scratch+2.
005517r 2                               ; The current stack is already ( addr u ) where addr is the address of the last byte of
005517r 2                               ; the JSR target address, and we want to leave it like that so moving on to the next byte
005517r 2                               ; works properly.
005517r 2                               ; Put the target address on the stack and see if it's an XT.
005517r 2  CA                           dex
005518r 2  CA                           dex
005519r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
00551Br 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
00551Dr 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
00551Fr 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
005521r 2                               ; ( xt )
005521r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_int_to_name
005524r 2                               ; int>name returns zero if we just don't know.
005524r 2  B5 00                        lda 0,x
005526r 2  15 01                        ora 1,x
005528r 2  F0 07                        beq _disasm_no_nt
00552Ar 2                               ; We now have a name token ( nt ) on the stack.
00552Ar 2                               ; Change it into the name and print it.
00552Ar 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_name_to_string
00552Dr 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_type
005530r 2  60                           rts
005531r 2               
005531r 2               _disasm_no_nt:
005531r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_drop ; the 0 indicating no name token
005534r 2                               ; See if the address is between underflow_1 and underflow_4,
005534r 2                               ; inclusive.
005534r 2  CA                           dex
005535r 2  CA                           dex
005536r 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+1
005538r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
00553Ar 2  A5 rr                        lda scratch+2
00553Cr 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
00553Er 2                               ; ( jsr_address )
00553Er 2                               ; Compare to lower underflow address
00553Er 2  CA                           dex
00553Fr 2  CA                           dex
005540r 2  A9 rr                        lda #<underflow_1
005542r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
005544r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>underflow_1
005546r 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
005548r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr compare_16bit
00554Br 2  F0 02                        beq _disasm_jsr_uflow_check_upper
00554Dr 2  B0 14                        bcs _disasm_jsr_unknown
00554Fr 2               _disasm_jsr_uflow_check_upper:
00554Fr 2                               ; Compare to upper underflow addresses
00554Fr 2  A9 rr                        lda #<underflow_4
005551r 2  95 00                        sta 0,x
005553r 2  A9 rr                        lda #>underflow_4
005555r 2  95 01                        sta 1,x
005557r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr compare_16bit
00555Ar 2  F0 02                        beq _disasm_jsr_soc
00555Cr 2  90 05                        bcc _disasm_jsr_unknown
00555Er 2               _disasm_jsr_soc:
00555Er 2                               ; It's an underflow check.
00555Er 2  A9 0E                        lda #str_disasm_sdc
005560r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr print_string_no_lf  ; "STACK DEPTH CHECK"
005563r 2               _disasm_jsr_unknown:
005563r 2  20 rr rr                     jsr xt_two_drop
005566r 2  60                           rts
005567r 2               
005567r 2               
005567r 2               ; =========================================================
005567r 2               oc_index_table:
005567r 2                       ; Lookup table for the instruction data (length of instruction in
005567r 2                       ; bytes, length of mnemonic in bytes, mnemonic string). This is used by
005567r 2                       ; the assembler as well.
005567r 2               
005567r 2                       ; Opcodes 00-0F
005567r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc00, oc01, oc__, oc__, oc04, oc05, oc06, oc__
00556Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00556Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005577r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc08, oc09, oc0a, oc__, oc0c, oc0d, oc0e, oc0f
00557Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00557Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005587r 2               
005587r 2                       ; Opcodes 10-1F
005587r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc10, oc11, oc12, oc__, oc14, oc15, oc16, oc17
00558Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00558Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005597r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc18, oc19, oc1a, oc__, oc1c, oc1d, oc__, oc1f
00559Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00559Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055A7r 2               
0055A7r 2                       ; Opcodes 20-2F
0055A7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc20, oc21, oc__, oc__, oc24, oc25, oc26, oc27
0055ABr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055AFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055B7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc28, oc29, oc2a, oc__, oc2c, oc2d, oc2e, oc2f
0055BBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055BFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055C7r 2               
0055C7r 2                       ; Opcodes 30-3F
0055C7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc30, oc31, oc32, oc__, oc34, oc35, oc36, oc37
0055CBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055CFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055D7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc38, oc39, oc3a, oc__, oc3c, oc3d, oc3e, oc0f
0055DBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055DFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055E7r 2               
0055E7r 2                       ; Opcodes 40-4F
0055E7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc40, oc41, oc__, oc__, oc__, oc45, oc46, oc47
0055EBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055EFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055F7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc48, oc49, oc4a, oc__, oc4c, oc4d, oc4e, oc4f
0055FBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0055FFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005607r 2               
005607r 2                       ; Opcodes 50-5F
005607r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc50, oc51, oc52, oc__, oc__, oc55, oc56, oc57
00560Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00560Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005617r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc58, oc59, oc5a, oc__, oc__, oc__, oc5e, oc5f
00561Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00561Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005627r 2               
005627r 2                       ; Opcodes 60-6F
005627r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc60, oc61, oc__, oc__, oc64, oc65, oc66, oc67
00562Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00562Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005637r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc68, oc69, oc6a, oc__, oc6c, oc6d, oc6e, oc6f
00563Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00563Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005647r 2               
005647r 2                       ; Opcodes 70-7F
005647r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc70, oc71, oc72, oc__, oc74, oc75, oc76, oc77
00564Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00564Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005657r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc78, oc79, oc7a, oc__, oc7c, oc7d, oc7e, oc7f
00565Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00565Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005667r 2               
005667r 2                       ; Opcodes 80-8F
005667r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc80, oc81, oc__, oc__, oc84, oc85, oc86, oc__
00566Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00566Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005677r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc88, oc89, oc8a, oc__, oc8c, oc8d, oc8e, oc8f
00567Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00567Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005687r 2               
005687r 2                       ; Opcodes 90-9F
005687r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc90, oc91, oc92, oc__, oc94, oc95, oc96, oc97
00568Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00568Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005697r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oc98, oc99, oc9a, oc__, oc9c, oc9d, oc9e, oc9f
00569Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00569Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056A7r 2               
0056A7r 2                       ; Opcodes A0-AF
0056A7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oca0, oca1, oca2, oc__, oca4, oca5, oca6, oca7
0056ABr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056AFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056B7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oca8, oca9, ocaa, oc__, ocac, ocad, ocae, ocaf
0056BBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056BFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056C7r 2               
0056C7r 2                       ; Opcodes B0-BF
0056C7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word ocb0, ocb1, ocb2, oc__, ocb4, ocb5, ocb6, ocb7
0056CBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056CFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056D7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word ocb8, ocb9, ocba, oc__, ocbc, ocbd, ocbe, ocbf
0056DBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056DFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056E7r 2               
0056E7r 2                       ; Opcodes C0-CF
0056E7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word occ0, occ1, oc__, oc__, occ4, occ5, occ6, occ7
0056EBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056EFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056F7r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word occ8, occ9, occa, oc__, occc, occd, occe, occf
0056FBr 2  rr rr rr rr  
0056FFr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005707r 2               
005707r 2                       ; Opcodes D0-DF
005707r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word ocd0, ocd1, ocd2, oc__, oc__, ocd5, ocd6, ocd7
00570Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00570Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005717r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word ocd8, ocd9, ocda, oc__, oc__, ocdd, ocde, ocdf
00571Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00571Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005727r 2               
005727r 2                       ; Opcodes E0-EF
005727r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oce0, oce1, oc__, oc__, oce4, oce5, oce6, oce7
00572Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00572Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005737r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word oce8, oce9, ocea, oc__, ocec, oced, ocee, ocef
00573Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00573Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005747r 2               
005747r 2                       ; Opcodes F0-FF
005747r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word ocf0, ocf1, ocf2, oc__, oc__, ocf5, ocf6, ocf7
00574Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00574Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005757r 2  rr rr rr rr          .word ocf8, ocf9, ocfa, oc__, oc__, ocfd, ocfe, ocff
00575Br 2  rr rr rr rr  
00575Fr 2  rr rr rr rr  
005767r 2               
005767r 2               
005767r 2               ; =========================================================
005767r 2               oc_table:
005767r 2                       ; Opcode data table for the disassember, which is also used by the
005767r 2                       ; assembler. Each entry starts with a "lengths byte":
005767r 2               
005767r 2                       ;       bit 7-6:  Length of instruction in bytes (1 to 3 for the 65c02)
005767r 2                       ;       bit 5-3:  unused
005767r 2                       ;       bit 2-0:  Length of mnemonic in chars (3 to 7)
005767r 2               
005767r 2                       ; To convert a line in this table to a Forth string of the mnemonic,
005767r 2                       ; use the COUNT word on the address of the lengths byte to get
005767r 2                       ; ( addr u ) and then mask all but the bits 2-0 of the TOS.
005767r 2               
005767r 2                       ; To make debugging easier, we keep the raw numbers for the lengths of
005767r 2                       ; the instruction and mnemonicis and let the assembler do the math
005767r 2                       ; required to shift and add. The actual mnemonic string follows after
005767r 2                       ; and is not zero terminated because we have the length in bits 2 to 0.
005767r 2               
005767r 2  83 62 72 6B  	oc00:	.byte 2*64+3, "brk"              ; enforce the signature byte
00576Br 2  87 6F 72 61  	oc01:	.byte 2*64+7, "ora.zxi"
00576Fr 2  2E 7A 78 69  
005773r 2               ;      (oc02)
005773r 2               ;      (oc03)
005773r 2  85 74 73 62          oc04:   .byte 2*64+5, "tsb.z"
005777r 2  2E 7A        
005779r 2  85 6F 72 61  	oc05:	.byte 2*64+5, "ora.z"
00577Dr 2  2E 7A        
00577Fr 2  85 61 73 6C  	oc06:	.byte 2*64+5, "asl.z"
005783r 2  2E 7A        
005785r 2               ;      (oc07)
005785r 2  43 70 68 70  	oc08:	.byte 1*64+3, "php"
005789r 2  85 6F 72 61  	oc09:	.byte 2*64+5, "ora.#"
00578Dr 2  2E 23        
00578Fr 2  45 61 73 6C  	oc0a:	.byte 1*64+5, "asl.a"
005793r 2  2E 61        
005795r 2               ;      (oc0b)
005795r 2  C3 74 73 62  	oc0c:	.byte 3*64+3, "tsb"
005799r 2  C3 6F 72 61  	oc0d:	.byte 3*64+3, "ora"
00579Dr 2  C3 61 73 6C  	oc0e:	.byte 3*64+3, "asl"
0057A1r 2  C4 62 62 72  	oc0f:	.byte 3*64+4, "bbr0"
0057A5r 2  30           
0057A6r 2               
0057A6r 2  83 62 70 6C  	oc10:	.byte 2*64+3, "bpl"
0057AAr 2  87 6F 72 61  	oc11:	.byte 2*64+7, "ora.ziy"
0057AEr 2  2E 7A 69 79  
0057B2r 2  86 6F 72 61  	oc12:	.byte 2*64+6, "ora.zi"
0057B6r 2  2E 7A 69     
0057B9r 2               ;      (oc13:)
0057B9r 2  85 74 72 62  	oc14:	.byte 2*64+5, "trb.z"
0057BDr 2  2E 7A        
0057BFr 2  86 6F 72 61  	oc15:	.byte 2*64+6, "ora.zx"
0057C3r 2  2E 7A 78     
0057C6r 2  86 61 73 6C  	oc16:	.byte 2*64+6, "asl.zx"
0057CAr 2  2E 7A 78     
0057CDr 2  86 72 6D 62  	oc17:	.byte 2*64+6, "rmb1.z"
0057D1r 2  31 2E 7A     
0057D4r 2  43 63 6C 63  	oc18:	.byte 1*64+3, "clc"
0057D8r 2  C5 6F 72 61  	oc19:	.byte 3*64+5, "ora.y"
0057DCr 2  2E 79        
0057DEr 2  45 69 6E 63  	oc1a:	.byte 1*64+5, "inc.a"
0057E2r 2  2E 61        
0057E4r 2               ;      (oc1b:)
0057E4r 2  C3 74 72 62  	oc1c:	.byte 3*64+3, "trb"
0057E8r 2  C5 6F 72 61  	oc1d:	.byte 3*64+5, "ora.x"
0057ECr 2  2E 78        
0057EEr 2               ;      (oc1e:)
0057EEr 2  C5 61 73 6C  	oc1f:	.byte 3*64+5, "asl.x"
0057F2r 2  2E 78        
0057F4r 2               
0057F4r 2  C3 6A 73 72  	oc20:	.byte 3*64+3, "jsr"
0057F8r 2  87 61 6E 64  	oc21:	.byte 2*64+7, "and.zxi"
0057FCr 2  2E 7A 78 69  
005800r 2               ;      (oc22:)
005800r 2               ;      (oc23:)
005800r 2  85 62 69 74  	oc24:	.byte 2*64+5, "bit.z"
005804r 2  2E 7A        
005806r 2  85 61 6E 64  	oc25:	.byte 2*64+5, "and.z"
00580Ar 2  2E 7A        
00580Cr 2  85 72 6F 6C  	oc26:	.byte 2*64+5, "rol.z"
005810r 2  2E 7A        
005812r 2  86 72 6D 62  	oc27:	.byte 2*64+6, "rmb2.z"
005816r 2  32 2E 7A     
005819r 2  43 70 6C 70  	oc28:	.byte 1*64+3, "plp"
00581Dr 2  85 61 6E 64  	oc29:	.byte 2*64+5, "and.#"
005821r 2  2E 23        
005823r 2  45 72 6F 6C  	oc2a:	.byte 1*64+5, "rol.a"
005827r 2  2E 61        
005829r 2               ;      (oc2b:)
005829r 2  C3 62 69 74  	oc2c:	.byte 3*64+3, "bit"
00582Dr 2  C4 61 6E 64  	oc2d:	.byte 3*64+4, "and."
005831r 2  2E           
005832r 2  C3 72 6F 6C  	oc2e:	.byte 3*64+3, "rol"
005836r 2  C4 62 62 72  	oc2f:	.byte 3*64+4, "bbr2"
00583Ar 2  32           
00583Br 2               
00583Br 2  83 62 6D 69  	oc30:	.byte 2*64+3, "bmi"
00583Fr 2  87 61 6E 64  	oc31:	.byte 2*64+7, "and.ziy"
005843r 2  2E 7A 69 79  
005847r 2  86 61 6E 64  	oc32:	.byte 2*64+6, "and.zi"
00584Br 2  2E 7A 69     
00584Er 2               ;      (oc33:)
00584Er 2  87 62 69 74  	oc34:	.byte 2*64+7, "bit.zxi"
005852r 2  2E 7A 78 69  
005856r 2  86 61 6E 64  	oc35:	.byte 2*64+6, "and.zx"
00585Ar 2  2E 7A 78     
00585Dr 2  86 72 6F 6C  	oc36:	.byte 2*64+6, "rol.zx"
005861r 2  2E 7A 78     
005864r 2  86 72 6D 62  	oc37:	.byte 2*64+6, "rmb3.z"
005868r 2  33 2E 7A     
00586Br 2  43 73 65 63  	oc38:	.byte 1*64+3, "sec"
00586Fr 2  C5 61 6E 64  	oc39:	.byte 3*64+5, "and.y"
005873r 2  2E 79        
005875r 2  45 64 65 63  	oc3a:	.byte 1*64+5, "dec.a"
005879r 2  2E 61        
00587Br 2               ;      (oc3b:)
00587Br 2  C5 62 69 74  	oc3c:	.byte 3*64+5, "bit.x"
00587Fr 2  2E 78        
005881r 2  C5 61 6E 64  	oc3d:	.byte 3*64+5, "and.x"
005885r 2  2E 78

00588Br 2  2E 78        
00588Dr 2  C4 62 62 72  	oc3f:	.byte 3*64+4, "bbr3"
005891r 2  33           
005892r 2               
005892r 2  43 72 74 69  	oc40:	.byte 1*64+3, "rti"

005C01r 2

005C01r 2               disassembler_end:
005C01r 2               
005C01r 1               .endif
005C01r 1               .ifdef CF_ADDRESS
005C01r 1               cf_boot:
005C01r 1  20 rr rr         jsr print_message
005C04r 1  42 6F 6F 74      .byte "Booting from CF card", AscCR, AscLF, 0
005C08r 1  69 6E 67 20  
005C0Cr 1  66 72 6F 6D  
005C1Br 1  20 rr rr         jsr cf_init
005C1Er 1  9C rr rr         stz IO_SECTOR
005C21r 1  9C rr rr         stz IO_SECTOR + 1
005C24r 1  9C rr rr         stz IO_SECTOR + 2
005C27r 1  9C rr rr         stz IO_SECTOR + 3
005C2Ar 1  A9 00            lda #<CODE_START
005C2Cr 1  85 rr            sta io_buffer_ptr
005C2Er 1  A9 02            lda #>CODE_START
005C30r 1  85 rr            sta io_buffer_ptr + 1
005C32r 1  A2 3E            ldx #(((ram_end-CODE_START)/$200)-1)                 ; number of sectors to read
005C34r 1               @loop:
005C34r 1  20 rr rr         jsr io_read_sector
005C37r 1  E6 rr            inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
005C39r 1  E6 rr            inc io_buffer_ptr + 1
005C3Br 1  EE rr rr         inc IO_SECTOR
005C3Er 1  CA               dex
005C3Fr 1  D0 F3            bne @loop
005C41r 1               
005C41r 1  4C 00 02         jmp CODE_START          ; jump to start of code
005C44r 1               .endif
005C44r 1               
005C44r 1               platform_bye:
005C44r 1               kernel_init:
005C44r 1               .ifdef VIA1_BASE
005C44r 1  A9 FF            lda #$FF
005C46r 1  8D 82 FF         sta DDRB
005C49r 1  8D 83 FF         sta DDRA
005C4Cr 1  A9 01            lda #1
005C4Er 1  8D 80 FF         sta PORTB
005C51r 1  9C 81 FF         stz PORTA
005C54r 1               .endif

005C5Ar 1               .endif

005C91r 1               @boot_loop:
005C91r 1  20 rr rr         jsr Get_Char
005C94r 1  B0 3C            bcs cf_boot_jump
005C96r 1  20 rr rr         jsr delay_short
005C99r 1  CA               dex
005C9Ar 1  D0 F5            bne @boot_loop
005C9Cr 1  88               dey
005C9Dr 1  D0 F0            bne @bl2
005C9Fr 1               
005C9Fr 1               .endif
005C9Fr 1               @no_cf_card:
005C9Fr 1  DA A2 00 BD      printascii welcome_message
005CA3r 1  rr rr F0 06  
005CA7r 1  20 rr rr E8  
005CAEr 1               
005CAEr 1  A9 rr            lda #<dictionary
005CB0r 1  85 rr            sta util_tmp
005CB2r 1  A9 rr            lda #>dictionary
005CB4r 1  85 rr            sta util_tmp + 1
005CB6r 1               
005CB6r 1  20 rr rr         jsr calculate_free_mem
005CB9r 1  A5 rr            lda tmp_var + 1
005CBBr 1  A6 rr            ldx tmp_var
005CBDr 1  20 rr rr         jsr print16
005CC0r 1               
005CC0r 1  DA A2 00 BD      printascii free_message
005CC4r 1  rr rr F0 06  
005CC8r 1  20 rr rr E8  
005CCFr 1               
005CCFr 1               
005CCFr 1  4C rr rr         jmp forth
005CD2r 1               
005CD2r 1               cf_boot_jump:
005CD2r 1  4C rr rr         jmp cf_boot
005CD5r 1               
005CD5r 1               v_nmi:
005CD5r 1               
005CD5r 1                   ; jsr calculate_free_mem
005CD5r 1                   ; lda tmp_var + 1
005CD5r 1                   ; ldx tmp_var
005CD5r 1                   ; jsr print16
005CD5r 1               
005CD5r 1                   ; printascii free_message
005CD5r 1  DA A2 00 BD      printascii ready_message
005CD9r 1  rr rr F0 06  
005CDDr 1  20 rr rr E8  
005CE4r 1               
005CE4r 1  4C rr rr         jmp xt_abort
005CE7r 1               
005CE7r 1               
005CE7r 1               
005CE7r 1               
005CE7r 1               io_read_sector:
005CE7r 1  4C rr rr         jmp io_read_sector_address        ; jump to read sector routine
005CEAr 1               
005CEAr 1               io_write_sector:
005CEAr 1  4C rr rr         jmp io_write_sector_address        ; jump to read sector routine
005CEDr 1               
005CEDr 1               
005CEDr 1               
005CEDr 1               kernel_putc:
005CEDr 1                   ; """Print a single character to the console. """
005CEDr 1                   ;; Send_Char - send character in A out serial port.
005CEDr 1                   ;; Uses: A (original value restored)
005CEDr 1               send_char:
005CEDr 1  48               pha
005CEEr 1                   .ifdef char_out
005CEEr 1                   jsr char_out
005CEEr 1                   .endif
005CEEr 1                   .ifdef acia_out
005CEEr 1  20 rr rr         jsr acia_out
005CF1r 1                   .endif
005CF1r 1               send_char_exit:
005CF1r 1               .ifdef lcd_print
005CF1r 1                   ; jsr lcd_print
005CF1r 1               .endif
005CF1r 1  68               pla
005CF2r 1  60               rts
005CF3r 1               
005CF3r 1               
005CF3r 1                       ;; Get_Char - get a character from the serial port into A.
005CF3r 1                       ;; Set the carry flag if char is valid.
005CF3r 1                       ;; Return immediately with carry flag clear if no char available.
005CF3r 1                       ;; Uses: A (return value)
005CF3r 1               
005CF3r 1               Get_Char:
005CF3r 1  20 rr rr         jsr acia_getc
005CF6r 1  90 02            bcc get_ps2_char                ; check keyboard buffer if nothing from ACIA
005CF8r 1  38               sec                             ; Set Carry to show we got a character
005CF9r 1  60               rts                             ; Return
005CFAr 1               
005CFAr 1               get_ps2_char:                       ; no ACIA char available, try to get from KB buffer
005CFAr 1               .ifdef ps2_get_char
005CFAr 1                   jsr ps2_get_char
005CFAr 1               
005CFAr 1                   bcc get_kb_char
005CFAr 1                   sec
005CFAr 1               .endif
005CFAr 1  60               rts
005CFBr 1               get_kb_char:
005CFBr 1                   .ifdef kb_get_char
005CFBr 1               
005CFBr 1                   ; ldy #5
005CFBr 1                   ; jsr delay_short
005CFBr 1                   ; ply
005CFBr 1                       jsr kb_get_char
005CFBr 1                       bcc exit
005CFBr 1                       sec
005CFBr 1                   .endif
005CFBr 1               exit:                         ; Indicate no char available.
005CFBr 1  60               rts                             ; return
005CFCr 1               
005CFCr 1               kernel_getc:
005CFCr 1                   ; """Get a single character from the keyboard (waits for key).
005CFCr 1                   ; """
005CFCr 1                   ;; Get_Char_Wait - same as Get_Char only blocking.
005CFCr 1                   ;; Uses: A (return value)
005CFCr 1               Get_Char_Wait:
005CFCr 1  20 rr rr         jsr Get_Char
005CFFr 1  90 FB            bcc Get_Char_Wait
005D01r 1  60               rts
005D02r 1               
005D02r 1               
005D02r 1               v_irq:                          ; IRQ handler
005D02r 1  48                   pha
005D03r 1  5A                   phy
005D04r 1                       ; lda #'.'
005D04r 1                       ; jsr kernel_putc
005D04r 1                       ; check if bit 7 of IFR is set
005D04r 1               .ifdef IFR
005D04r 1  AD 8D FF             lda IFR
005D07r 1  10 0B                bpl irq_not_from_via  ; Interrupt not from VIA, exit
005D09r 1               
005D09r 1  29 08                and #$08        ; ps2 has priority
005D0Br 1  D0 07                bne v_irq_ps2
005D0Dr 1  AD 8D FF             lda IFR
005D10r 1  29 40                and #$40
005D12r 1  D0 02                bne v_irq_timer
005D14r 1               irq_not_from_via:
005D14r 1               .endif
005D14r 1               .ifdef KB_IFR
005D14r 1               v_kb_irq:
005D14r 1                       lda KB_IFR
005D14r 1                       bpl v_irq_exit
005D14r 1                       and #$40
005D14r 1                       bne v_kb_irq_timer
005D14r 1                       bra v_irq_exit
005D14r 1               .endif
005D14r 1               
005D14r 1               v_irq_ps2:
005D14r 1                   .ifdef ps2_irq
005D14r 1                       lda time
005D14r 1                       sta last_ps2_time
005D14r 1                       lda time+1
005D14r 1                       sta last_ps2_time+1
005D14r 1                       lda time+2
005D14r 1                       sta last_ps2_time+2
005D14r 1                       lda time+3
005D14r 1                       sta last_ps2_time+3
005D14r 1               
005D14r 1                       jsr ps2_irq
005D14r 1               
005D14r 1                   .endif
005D14r 1  80 27                bra v_irq_exit
005D16r 1               
005D16r 1               .ifdef T1CL
005D16r 1               v_irq_timer:
005D16r 1  AD 84 FF             lda T1CL
005D19r 1                       ; clear timer interrupt
005D19r 1                   .ifdef timer_irq
005D19r 1  20 rr rr             jsr timer_irq
005D1Cr 1                   .endif
005D1Cr 1  20 rr rr             jsr Get_Char ; Check if a char is waiting to be able to break on CTRL-C
005D1Fr 1                       ; check if there is a char waiting to be printed to the lcd
005D1Fr 1                       ; lda lcd_char
005D1Fr 1                       ; beq v_exit
005D1Fr 1                       ; jsr lcd_print
005D1Fr 1                       ; stz lcd_char
005D1Fr 1               
005D1Fr 1               
005D1Fr 1  90 1C                bcc v_irq_exit      ; no character waiting, exit normally
005D21r 1  C9 03                cmp #$03            ; check if CTRL-C
005D23r 1  D0 18                bne v_irq_exit      ; not CTRL-C, exit normally
005D25r 1  DA A2 00 BD          printascii abort_message    ; was a CTRL_C
005D29r 1  rr rr F0 06  
005D2Dr 1  20 rr rr E8  
005D34r 1  7A                   ply                         ; pull what the ISR pushed
005D35r 1  68                   pla
005D36r 1  28                   plp                         ; pull status register
005D37r 1  68                   pla                         ; pull return address
005D38r 1  68                   pla
005D39r 1               
005D39r 1  58                   cli                         ; clear interrupt diabled bit
005D3Ar 1  4C rr rr             jmp xt_abort
005D3Dr 1               
005D3Dr 1               .endif
005D3Dr 1               v_kb_irq_timer:
005D3Dr 1               .ifdef kb_time
005D3Dr 1                   lda KB_T1CL ; clear timer interrupt
005D3Dr 1                   inc kb_time
005D3Dr 1                   bne v_irq_exit
005D3Dr 1               .endif
005D3Dr 1                   ;jsr kb_scan
005D3Dr 1               v_irq_exit:
005D3Dr 1  7A               ply
005D3Er 1  68               pla
005D3Fr 1  40               rti
005D40r 1               
005D40r 1  20 62 79 74  free_message: .byte " bytes free", $0D, 0
005D44r 1  65 73 20 66  
005D48r 1  72 65 65 0D  
005D4Dr 1  52 65 61 64  ready_message: .byte "Ready", $0D, 0
005D51r 1  79 0D 00     
005D54r 1  57 65 6C 63  welcome_message: .byte "Welcome to Planck 6502", $0D, "Type 'words' for available words", $0D, 0
005D58r 1  6F 6D 65 20  
005D5Cr 1  74 6F 20 50  
005D8Dr 1  0D 0A 00     abort_message: .byte AscCR, AscLF, 0
005D90r 1               
005D90r 1               .segment "VECTORS"
000000r 1               
000000r 1  rr rr        .word v_nmi
000002r 1  rr rr        .word v_reset
000004r 1  rr rr        .word v_irq
000004r 1
